data:
The background for the project is to strengthen the international dimension at our school. To upgrade the qualifications of our English teachers and to continue a development of the subject English at all levels. 

We hope to send 5 teachers to a course at ADC College. All 5 are English teachers by education. The participants will have to arrange, communicate, apply and structure the 14 day course stay themselves, but will recieve suppeort from school management (vice principal and headmaster). The participants own interest, motivation and drive must be put into the project.

The participants must constructe a form of goals, expectations and evaluation plans before the course (SMTTE). After the course it is expected that the participants write a report and plan lessons for the use of inspiration and idea to the rest of the staff. Evaluation is expected to take place through talks and work with vice principal and headmaster.

The purpose of the project is professional development of the foreign language teachers who teach in the general education program Gimnazija. The main objective of professional teacher training is aimed at providing foreign language teachers with a greater range of modern methods for their classroom work. In an increasingly international and multicultural Europe, the project - in addition to exploring new methodology - aims at extending the teachers' knowledge of cultures, since teaching a foreign language involves teaching  a target country's culture as well. The aims and objectives of professional teacher training are short-term, middle-term and long-term ones.

Short-term objectives:
- providing foreign language teachers with a greater range of the latest methods, techniques and tools that they can employ in the classroom,
- exploring techniques and activities to inspire students and raise their motivation,
- exchanging teaching experience with colleagues from other European countries,
- establishing new partnerships in the wider European area,

Middle-term objectives:
- employing new methods in the classroom when working with students of mixed abilities and different levels of motivation,
- starting the implementation of the projects in the virtual environment eTwining,
- planning with the partners and other collaborating teachers the implementation of the project that will be solving common problems.

Long-term objectives:
- internationalisation with longer mobilities within the program Gimnazija.

There are four foreign language teachers who will participate in the mobility project: a Spanish teacher, a German teacher and two English teachers (as English is our first foreign language with the largest number of learners). Although all of the participants have some international experience, they require permanent professional development to meet the demands of new generations in a fast changing world. In their everday practice they are faced with numerous challenges, such as teaching in mixed ability classes, dealing with different levels of motivation and a variety of the studets' needs. Having the opportunity to participate in mobility programmes and exchange teaching experience on an international level, the participants will develop professionally and personally, gaining new knowledge, tools and ideas for improved classroom work, as well as personal motivation and enthusiasm for teaching and motivating their students more effectively.

Before going on international mobility, the teachers will participate in preparations which will include their expectations, obligations and the objectives of the project. Preparations will also help them with practical and logistic matters. After finishing their mobility programmes, the participants will make presentations for other colleagues and transfer the gained  knowledge, improvements and novelties in teaching methodology to them, they will test  the novelties by employing them in their classroom practice, they will carry out the students' evaluation of the lessons and add their own evaluation of  their classroom experience in writing. In the whole process, new documents and forms will be made and published on the school website, being thus available to other linguists. The participants will be expected to share their new experiences as examples of good practice within their study groups.
The most important effects that are expected are, firstly, raising motivation of the teachers to cope with the numerous challenges of the time, brought by new generations of students, and secondly, transferring the gained knowledge about teaching methodology and target cultures to other colleagues. We also expect wider effects in terms of raising motivation of our students for language learning, establishing international partnerships and collaboration with colleagues from other European countries, either in virtual or real environments.
Verbesserung der Fähigkeiten zur pädagogischen IKT-Nutzung im fremdsprachlichen Unterricht, Förderung des CLIL und Internationalisierung

This two-year school education staff project aims at extending and improving our seven subject teachers' methodological knowledge by taking part in an in-service training course in England in order to develop their skills regarding pedagogical and didactic use of ICT during the lessons. An essential point of our project is the cultivation of a European cooperation and internationalisation. For this purpose we hope to find potential partners for future projects.
Finally we hope that our gained experience will motivate teachers and pupils alike to establish contacts in the whole of Europe.

The project focuses on improvement of teachers´ professional and managing competences, which will be visible in higher quality of educational process. If teachers want to give and educate others, they themselves need to receive. Our project will enable the participants to grow in their professional development. It will bear fruit also in the school community as only educated and professionally capable teachers using the latest methods can teach well. The chosen courses are preparation for internationalizing of education which is gradually being implemented into schools.
Managing and Developing Self and Others

Our action plan includes the cooperation of eight teachers of the Special Primary School for the Blind in Kallithea with the organization “ADC College” that promotes the exchange of best practices and development of better teaching methods and is recognized and certified by the largest institutions in the United Kingdom. The teachers of our school who have expressed their willingness to participate in the educational programs are all professionals in the field of special education with an interest to seek new and innovative educational ideas, activities, techniques and tools that will improve the quality of their lessons and will motivate their students . Hence, the modernization and internationalization of schools and systems of education will be promoted. 
During the stage of the preparation, there will be a meeting of the participants of our school (Internal workshop) in order to get informed, to answer a questionnaire which will assess the expectations and goals of the program with qualitative and quantitative criteria, to discuss issues of travel and transfer to the venue of the program, to allocate the responsibilities and to establish communication with the the organization. There will also be held workshops and meetings to empower the group of participants from the school before and after the implementation of the project. Furthermore, we will make a "SWOT"analysis (analysis of strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats) of our organization before, during and after the implementation of the program. The same analysis will be followed for specific cases of students (case studies) and we will present the results to the organization and the representatives of the other countries.
During the implementation of the program the cooperation and exchange of ideas through an open dialogue with participants of other countries will evolve. There will also be a presentation of our organization, its objectives, its actions, the way we work and we will share with the participants our experiences from similar past programs with common objectives. Finally, we will try to establish a constant communication with the partners involved in our project as well as other related agencies, with the support of new technologies, which will lead to further professional development for all of us. The communication will take place in both a face to face and a remote way with the help of social media, through creating a blog in English and in the different languages spoken by the partners. What is more, we will try to get the necessary expertise so that we can work through e-twinning. Moreover, we will search for technologies that will lead us to maintain communication and cooperation ("creating Brotherhood schools ") after the end of our common project.
After the completion of the program, we will organize a workshop where we will present to Special Education teachers the program material, the results and examples of application of the new methods, tools and programs. In addition, we will organize a theatrical performance given by blind students. Furthermore, we plan to organize an evening of artistic expression, in which children will create with the newly taught means and methods of the educational program. Finally , we will design an open day, on which we invite parents, students and professionals with an interest in the field of education to an alternative presentation of the most original and effective learning tools of the course.
The expected impact of the project on participants is the personal and professional development of teachers and measurable learning outcomes for students by cultivating the necessary skills and sharing innovative ideas - programs.
Dezvoltarea competentelor manageriale si de comunicare in contextul educatiei europene

Context / the project background ”The development of the management and communication skills in the context of European education”
" Nicolae Cartojan " High School customized the educational culture of Giurgiu County mainly through pedagogy and theorical profile of the high school , providing educational services to a number of 689 students. Curricular and extracurricular activities can be known through various channels : www.nicolaecartojan.ro website , in the school magazine "Attitudes NC "and  in the media.
 Given that a quality management at all levels will ensure the success and effectiveness of our school , we proposed a  project on mobility concerning the development of the management and communication skills in the context of European education .
1 ) Needs:
- The need for innovative teaching strategies in European practice
- The need to diversify school profiles , specializations , school curriculum
- The need to increase the quality management
- The need for developing effective communication skills
- The need for professional and personal development of staff about international courses
- The need for identifying new solutions development in order to strengthen school autonomy and to face the competitive environment
- The need for dissemination and multiplication of positive experiences from the organization by members of the European
- The need for a network of local and international partnerships with various institutions to co - sharing European values and principles and developing new projects.
2 ) Objectives :
• Improve management and communication skills at different organizational levels , in the context of European education
• Internationalization offer training to staff and the validation of professional competences to EU standards
• Increasing the quality of education through innovative teaching strategies and student centered inclusive practices promoted at European level
• Developing educational and vocational skills of students and their correlation with the labor market, a better social integration
• Opening of the school community to new educational resources through ICT integration
• Strengthening institutional partnerships by creating a network of European partners .
3) The number and profile of participants :
The project will provide training for 14 staff members with leadership roles and responsibilities at different levels of the organization, but also for those who want to get involved in school management in the future.
4 ) Description of activities:
Overall management of the project will cover the following main activities :
- Activities of selecting aparticipantilor mobility
- Language training activities , pedagogical , psychological and cultural
- Activities on practical and logistical project
- Training activities such staff training abroad , as follows :
a) The course " Team work as a Means for enhancing productivity " held in Limassol / Cyprus Dore Educational Institute ( a flow of 4 persons in October 2014 ) .
b ) The course "Leadership and communication in education" ( a flow of 6 people - February 2015) , held in Assen / Holland Quarter Mediation .
c ) The course " Managing and Developing self and others " held in London / UK ADC College ( a flow of 4 people July 2015)
- Dissemination .
- Activities to evaluate the results .
5 ) Methodology:
The methodology is based , primarily , on the principle : mininum theory + practice + feedback = maximum accelerated development .
Methods:
- presentations
- Individual and paired exercises
- Group activities
- Activities of reflection and self-reflection
- Brain -storming
- games
- Learn workshops and shops
- Hands- on approach and learning -by - doing ,
- Methods for developing language skills
- Use ICT
6 ) Results:
- Training of 14 members of the organization management and communication by improvement :
- competence management selfmanagement and others (groups, organizations)
competence for self - development and other
competence - learning to provide a European dimension
      - jurisdiction of organization of teaching and learning standards.
7) The long-term impact and benefits of the project are the organization , its members and the local community by:
- biggest opening of the school to the educational needs of students in a school offer more versatile labor market and quality educational services , integrating the skills acquired in the course.
- Development of the organization in the direction of an organization that teaches more adapted to the changes imposed by European and national educational policies .
- Development of institutional policies directed towards new sources of funding .
- Develop programs to promote a partnership ethos and open local and European values .
Managing & Developing Self & Others/ ADC College

The plan of our action includes the collaboration of two teachers of the Special Kindergarten for the Blind in Athens/ Greece,  with partner the “ADC College” that promotes the exchange of equitable practices and the growth of better methods of teaching and is recognized and certified from the bigger institutions in the United Kingdom. The personnel that corresponds in the Kindergarten is small in number and usually is not constant each year. In addition, the majority of the staff works with "available hours" of the co-location follows Primary Schools: The Special School for the Blind in Athens/ Greece and the Special School for the Deafblind in Athens/ Greece. For this reason and in that program have registered two people that are the basis of the Special Kindergarten for the Blind. They are professionals in the field of special education, struggling with love for progression of the early intervention in Greek society and maintain undiminished interest in finding new and innovative teaching ideas, activities, techniques and tools that will improve the quality of their lesson and will motivate their students. 

During the implementation of the program the cooperation and exchange of ideas through an open dialogue with participants of other countries will evolve. There will also be a presentation of our organization, its objectives, its actions, the way we work and we will share with the participants our experiences from similar past programs with common objectives. Finally, we will try to establish a constant communication with the partners involved in our project as well as other related agencies, with the support of new technologies, which will lead to further professional development for all of us. The communication will take place in both a face to face and a remote way with the help of social media, through creating a blog in English and in the different languages spoken by the partners. What is more, we will try to get the necessary expertise so that we can work through e-twinning. Moreover, we will search for technologies that will lead us to maintain communication and cooperation ("creating Brotherhood schools ") after the end of our common project.

After the completion of the program, we will organize a workshop where we will present to Special Education teachers the program material, the results and examples of application of the new methods, tools and programs. In addition, we will organize a theatrical performance given by students with visual impairments. Finally , we will design an open day, on which we invite parents, students and professionals with an interest in the field of education to an alternative presentation of the most original and effective learning tools of the course.

The expected impact of the project on participants is the personal and professional development of teachers and measurable learning outcomes for students by cultivating the necessary skills and sharing innovative ideas.
ΑΓΓΛΙΚΑ-ΠΛΗΡΟΦΟΡΙΚΗ:LINGUAE  FRANCAE  ΣΤΗ ΔΙΔΑΣΚΑΛΙΑ ΟΛΩΝ ΤΩΝ ΓΝΩΣΤΙΚΩΝ ΑΝΤΙΚΕΙΜΕΝΩΝ ΣΥΜΦΩΝΑ ΜΕ ΤΟ ΑΝΑΛΥΤΙΚΟ ΠΡΟΓΡΑΜΜΑ ΣΠΟΥΔΩΝ ΓΙΑ ΤΟ ΓΥΜΝΑΣΙΟ

The project we would like to develop and implement comprises of job shadowing and observation in cooperation with  ADC College in the United Kingdom. Our main objective is to improve the quality of the knowledge provided by our school staff to all our students ( both Greek and foreign ) with the use of English and ICT for the teaching of all school subjects according to the National Curriculum. We do hope our project will be successfully implemented and will be later used as a guide for the teaching of all school subjects by all the other teachers ( of several other subjects ). We believe that the success of this project will aid our school's contribution to the peaceful and harmonious coexistence of the various social, racial and religious groups .

In the project of  the I.E.S Serpis board for the period from 2013 to 2014, appears the subprocess of  the learning of foreign languages. One of the aims  is the development of  international projects in the Erasmus framework with at least two European schools. In the PAF ( Annual project of training) now in force, we set the following  relevant  guidelines for the formation and training of our school:

-The updating of the linguistic competence of the teachers and training in methodology ( AICLE) Comprehensive  learning of contents and Foreign language).We have elaborated a  multilingual linguistic project  with the introduction of  two non- linguistic fields of study in French and English, which will come into  force next  school year  2014/15.

-Training in the use of  ICTS (Information and Communication Technology studies) as an innovating and motivating tool, taking into account its application in our daily teaching and its integration in the curriculum.

-School organization and involvement , creating a new cultural  setting in our school aimed at a change , educational improvement and better management, encouraging collaborative work and the relationship between school members and parents.

In this context, we suggest two activities of mobility for  the learning  of two types:

-Observation in a partner school ; teachers who will start their teaching in French and English  in the next shool year 2014/2015will spend  some time in a partner schcool to improve teir linguistic competence  to get a specific lexic and share methodology and  good practice with the teachers of the schools where they are as guests. As well, the reprsentatives of  the school which sends their teachers to the host school,will pay them a visit to share  strategies of  school management and the standard of education. (Six mobilities during the application of the programme).

-Trainig in an organised course  for language teachers who apply for a refresher course in the pedagogical and linguistic competence through some innovating practice specifically ,ITCS  and teachers of non-linguistic fields of study, highly motivated to teach in English or French , who are entitled to do so because they have the B1 certificate of theMCER or they are willing to get  the B2/C1 certificates.(five mobilities during the application of the programme).

 The teachers involved in this project  will improve their command of at least one European language , will acquire flexibility in their  teaching  through the contact with other ways of  working and organization. This fact will affect positively their  teaching practice , of which the  final result  will be the improvement of the teaching-learning project and better results for our  students. We are determined to establish lasting bonds with our European partners so as to  achieve an icrease in the quality and number of the mobilities of our students , eligible   candidates for  training in an European school and in the medium term, establish  some relevant  strategical  relationship to develop classrroom projects. In the long term, our target is the increase in the number of multilingual  classes in the ESO , which could extend to the Bachillerato courses.

We will inform  students, teachers and parents of  IES Serpis that  this internatioal framework   is an essential part of the eduational  policy of our school. Our main objective is the development of  multilingual culture and collaborative work.
CLIL: Mejora de la competencia lingüística en lengua inglesa.

As a result of the evaluation made, the executive team of ZER Montsant determines in the Annual Report of last year the need to improve students' proficiency in English language. For this reason, it creates a medium term Strategic Plan in order to achieve this goal.

The Strategic Plan is based on the incorporation of the methodology CLIL in the classrooms. This plan disposes, among other actions, the need of teacher training in CLIL to provide teachers with elements to help to decide what content should be taught in a foreign language, how should this content be integrated in the curriculum, the relationship between linguistic and non-linguistic areas and how we can benefit from the use of ICT when teaching CLIL .

We believe that not only the participation of the English teacher is needed, but also two tutors have to take part in the training, too. The management team values the appropriateness of this course being conducted in English and, for this reason, after having considered several options, the CLIL course provided by the ADC College in London was selected. Moreover, the strategic plan states how to transmit the content of the course to the other teachers of the school.

This training is expected not only to provide the participating teachers with knowledge and skills in CLIL methodology or to increase their English language proficiency, but also, we believe that it will contribute to educational innovation, to the incorporation of ICTs and to increase multicultural skills among our students, offering the opportunity to link and share experiences with other European schools. In this way, we will get an impact on students’ motivation, we will encourage teachers to share knowledge and experiences and to innovate. Therefore, it will be an overall improvement in the teaching quality of our schools.

We can note that a lot of students don't give meaning to language learning, very often considered essentially as subjects and tests whereas we would like them to be more a means of communication and to reach forms of exchanges. We want to encourage  "total immersion",  through many plans listed within  the framework of the schoolproject.
However, although are teachers show great  willingness, they should be a period of training allowing european section teachers or for those wishing to be accredited to teach a foreign language in their discipline. For it to work we need tools and training given by native speakers, corresponding to our expectations, the objective being to reach language practice totally integrated included in class and more generally in the schoollife.

"European Education Philosophy 20" project proposal aims Karamürsel Anatolian High School to be internationalized and to develop the quality of education through European Strategy 2020. The European Development Plan, which was prepared through the analyses done by using quality management techniques at school to achieve the project aims, has revealed the areas are to be developed such as school management, education staff, teaching methodology, language teaching strategy and European dimention.



In this Mobility Project for School Education Staff , short term staff training activities to 3 European Countries have been planned. In order to achieve the aims of the project the participants must have English skills  at the level of 4 years of university or Master Degree. 12 of our teachers answering  these qualifications have beee devided into 3 teams named ICT Team, Strategy Team and Quality Team.

ICT Team will participate in a 5 days-course in Austria "Future learning with iPads and Tablets” course

Strategy Team will participate in a 5 days-course in the UK  "Managing & Developing Self & Others" course

Quality Team will participate in a job shadowing activity for a week in Denmark. The staff will have an oppotunity to develop their ICT and language skills preliminarly, which have been described as two of key competences through European 2020 Strategy by EC, and personal end careeer skills additionally during the mobilities abroad. Preperation activites before the mobilities will help the achievments the participants gained abroad, turn into high quality outcomes.They will experience how to entegrate the intercultural, formal, informal and non-formal education techniques firstly into each other, secondly into the education system at our school. They will establish the base to promote systematical reforms necessitated to integrate our school into European counterparts by implying international quality standarts of education at our school, by introducing our institution, teachers, students and graduates during structured courses and job shadowing avtivities abroad. The outcomes will be trasferred to the other staff at school, and also be entegrated into the areas are supposed to be developed in the School Strategy Plan next year and the quality of education will be improved. The impact of  dissemination activities, which will start as soon as the agreement is signed, will prove clearly that the project has been implied paralled to the Erasmus+ Program priorities.



EC recognised field of education as a way to overcome the socio-economic crisis, to support growth and jobs and to foster social equity and inclusion. When "European Education Philosophy 20" project is completed, the quality of education at our school will be reached European standart and the entegration period will be started. In the next decade we will grow generations, who have social entrepreneurship awareness, who can find innovative and creative solutions to social problems, who are ready to work at unknown job areas, who has the potantial to create new job areas with the awareness of social inclusion. So the project will also  support the wider European satrategy.

We are applying for financial support for two projects. One is for Cookery and Waitressing, the other is for English as a foreign Language.



We are in both our projects focusing on increasing the students intercultural understanding through vocational training and education.



The participants are picked independent of social and cultural background, but motivation for the project is vital for being picked.



The projects consists of work placements in Paris and London.



We are hoping these projects will give the students possibilities to increase their self conciouness both personally and professionally.

The proposed project is focused on the group of 15 students of the 2nd and 3rd year of study in the Secondary School of Commerce in Hlohovec (further referred to as "OA") and 2 accompanying persons (OA teachers). The project participants will have to successfully pass the selection procedure implemented by a selection committee consisting of the OA managers and teachers. Participants will have to meet not only educational, language and professional requirements, but also certain personal characteristics - they must be independent, flexible, adaptable, responsible, reliable, communicative and able to represent the school. On the basis of our previous experience with Leonardo da Vinci programme we have decided to participate in the mobility again by implementing a 2-week mobility in London, UK and to cooperate with the mediating organization ADC College.
This project will be implemented as a 2-week vocational training in companies in Great Britain - in London. Placement of participants will be arranged by ADC College. Selection of companies will be based on professional needs arising from the OA curriculum. Vocational training will be performed in the companies active in the area of administration and retail. An integral part of the project will be also language training. This vocational training will be accepted as part of the school curriculum results for the students.
The project will be aimed at the development of European dimension of education, acquiring new working skills and abilities in the European environment, development of language skills and key competencies, getting to know a new culture, getting European contacts, increasing the level of independence and ability to work in the international and intercultural environment. The aim of the project is also to develop and to support the cooperation between the world of education and the world of work as well as the importance of lifelong education. The gained experience will be included in the school curricullum.
The primary goal is to improve the starting position of the future graduates in the national and European labour market. The supporting goals are comparing the approaches in theoretical and practical education and training of students, gaining new abilities, competencies and skills, increasing the self-confidence of students, possible also for starting their own companies. The main added value is the direct experience from the vocational training abroad they can apply in their future employment. This will contribute to the development of European dimension of the educational process. Partners can initiate further cooperation in the future. What is more, participating teachers will share their experience with their colleagues. This project will be of a huge benefit also for the school - OA as it will increase its goodwill and credibility as well as the international character of the institution.
The vocational training will be implemented in London, Great Britain.
Zvyšovanie kvality odbornej praxe v mobilitných stážach

Sending organization provides training since 1967. Now in 3-year course of study completed vocational certificate : manicurist - podiatrist , hairdresser , 4-year study programs completed leaving examination : Cosmetics, beauty and make-up artist , fashion design , services in tourism , trade and business , the 2-year post-secondary study : hair care , hand care and foot . Total number of students the school is currently 351 and has 62 employees .

The project will be implemented in 2 trip: 
1 turnround, 14 days - United Kingdom, London, internships will attend 15 students and 2 accompanying persons, teachers sending organization,  the partner organization ADC Technology Training Ltd., Harrow, 
2 turnround, 14 days - Germany, Schkeuditz-Gut Welitz, internships will attend 11 students and 2 accompanying persons, teachers sending organization, the partner organization Vitalis GbmH, Schkeuditz-Gut Welitz. 

Mobility will be held in October 2014.

This project is part of a continuous projects implemented by school staff in the years 2011, 2012 , 2013 by the Leonardo da Vinci Mobility IVT in the Lifelong Learning Programme aimed at obtaining the first international professional experience of pupils . The project is aimed at enhancing the quality of professional practice in mobility placements as part of the preparation of students under the successive enlargements of the subject innovation of teaching practice experience for all learning and training courses in the Erasmus+ program.

Implementation of the project stems from three key objectives for the development of school:
1 constant innovation quality educational processes , and thus professional practice pupils
2 gradual expansion of international cooperation of our school vocational training ,
3 continuous improvement of the position of our school for the education market and thus improving the position of our graduates
    in the labor markets and the in their own self-employment , the expansion of small and medium enterprises in the region .

Mobility internships are a direct part of the subjects ' professional experience and is closely related to other groups of specialized subjects .
Internships in this project will be attended by participants from 26 studies and training : services in tourism , trade and business , fashion design , hairdresser , cosmetics and make-up artist , hair cosmetics .

With this project we want in particular:
- More effective procedures to coordinate with partners Vitale Germany and ADC College in the United Kingdom in more detail 
  embodiment applying ECVET elements : working closely together to define more clearly the learning outcomes for participants
  internships method to check entry that knowledge , work skills in the participants Mobility undertaken in this project .
- Extend the completion mobility placements for the first time for students study field services in tourism in the UK .

Through this project, we also want to address the needs of the proposed school educational programs :
- Obtained suggestions implementation of new approaches , techniques and technologies with which participants gather for    
  internships used in the development and innovation of new educational curricula , in particular, the professional experience ,
- Experiences and new skills from the implementation of new approaches , techniques and technologies with which participants
   meet internship may in the future be used in establishing and expanding their own businesses and self-
- Develop the professional skills of participants in placements should contribute to the development of innovation in fashion
   design, hairdressing ,cosmetics, visage services and in the retail and tourism services in the region , in Slovakia,
- Professional development of language and communication skills of participants should contribute to innovation and improvement
  of training school students at top European and world competitions of professional skills .
Learning-in-Action und audiovisuelle Dokumentation von Geschäftsprozessen

The Vocational College II in Coburg is about to develop in close cooperation with our partner organization ADC College London/Harrow a macro-didactic framework comprising of two training units abroad. These training units are supplemented by a so called blended-mentoring approach, i.e. a mix of personal assistance during the mobility stay as well as online communication via weblog at times when teacher staff is not personally available. The training units are a one week course inhouse-training honing speaking skills in standard business situations at ADC and a two weeks job placement at London-based companies in the field of business & administration (service industry), which will be arranged by ADC according to previous assessment of the participants. Standard business situations will touch on specific matters such as customer advisory service, welcoming visitors or presenting one’s company fluently. 

Furthermore, the students will be trained to reduce their inhibitions to talk in a foreign language. They will be placed into a position where they have to reflect their way of talking and the effect of non-verbal communication on their counterparts. During the internship, the students will be requested to work along in close contact with their new colleagues, especially to comprehend the successive steps of administrative tasks (job shadowing) and to deliberately accomplish basic routine work by themselves. Explorative questionnaires and interview guidelines previously set up by our team and the students will help them describe and visualize business processes in their host organization. 

Audio-visual material will eventually be selected, assessed, pooled and cut in order to generate teachers’ resources for future generations of business students (trainees at voc. college). Our aim is establish a pool of audio-visual material that can easily be retrieved from our school-based intranet and fruitfully implemented during language and business admin lessons. We feel confident that there will be a surplus in these efforts because there is a shortage of job-specific training video clips our students can genuinely identify with. 

The Vocational College II Coburg is the formal applicant for this Erasmus+ project that addresses students who are in the first period of their professional training. We assume the overall responsibility for project planning and coordination, legal and contractual management and evaluation of the project. Our partners and relevant stakeholders are well-established local companies where our students are training to become industrial assistants, wholesale assistants and assistants in the field of transport and logistics (HABA, Kaeser, Leise, Schenker etc.). These companies provide us with information about training needs to be addressed during the job placement. They are for the most part medium-sized companies in the Coburg region that have business relationships within Europe or worldwide. ADC College is our partner in London. It is a profit-oriented institute that organizes customized training courses promoting business-related communication skills and assigns foreign students to places of work at selected companies. 

After terminating the project, we expect the following results to materialize: creating a pool of audio-visual material as teachers’ resources, reflection on informal competences and documentation of informal competences in standard business situations, e. g. language proficiency in Business English, communication skills (welcoming customers, answering phone calls, sorting out complaints etc.), sociableness and self-confident behavior when moving in business circles. The expected effects on informal learning on the part of the students will be assessed by answering an explorative questionnaire and participating in a group discussion at the end of the mobility stay. Skills and competencies aquired during the placement will furthermore be assessed and validated according to a modified ECVET-grid reflecting basic job requirements in business administration. The results will be committed to paper with the help of portfolios describing a range of graded competencies.

The focus of our project is London. The host companies our students are assigned to are spread all over Greater London. Within two years’ time of project duration, two flows will be arranged for our students at our vocational college.
Meeting European Labour Market and Organization of Vocational Training in Europe

Teachers of Vocational subjects, masters of Vocational training and students of Secondary Vocational school of Trade and Services in Nova Bana, Slovakia and two partner organizations ADC College, Great Britain and CASA DA EDUCACAO, Portugal  will participate in the  project " Meeting European Labour Market and Organization of Vocational Training in Europe".  The main purpose of the project is to acquaint with the European labour market and organization of vocational training in Europe.  

Main aims of the projects are:
 - to improve the quality of vocational education at Secondary Vocational School of  Trade and Services  in Nova Bana through lifelong learning  programmes  for  teachers 
- to promote cooperation between partner organizations-   Secondary Vocational School of  Trade and Services in Nova Bana and ADC Colledge, United Kingdom and CASA DA EDUCACAO, Portugal  in quality assurance in all sectors of education and training graduates for international and national labour market
- to support the training of teachers and students  at Secondary Vocational School of  Trade and Services in Nova Bana
- to promote the study of English language skills and improve language skills of  project participants
- to support the development of innovations based on ICT  in education and lifelong learning of staff 
- to promote competition, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit of teachers and students of the school
- to increase  the attractiveness of vocational education and training at Secondary Vocational School of  Trade and Services in Nova Bana

The participiants of the project will be 6  teachers of Vocational subjects, masters of Vocational training and 12 students from departments  Business and Trade, Public Catering, Chef, Waiter/ waitress with 2 accompanying persons of Secondary Vocational school of Trade and Services in Nova Bana, Slovakia. The main criteria for choice will be motivation to learn and gain new experinces and skills, participation in after-school activities and projects of the school, for students - studying results and representation of the school in competitions and projects, for staff - interst in life - long learning education and cooperation on creation of  basic curricula of the school. 
 
The main activities for mobility of a staff in vocational education and training:
- vocational training in the United Kingdom, presentations and visit of educational institutions
- new forms and methods in teaching vocational subjects ( workshops)
- job- shadowing and vistis of  secondary schools, providing vocational education and training
- management and administration in secondary schools in the UK with focus on vocational education providers

The main activities for mobility of students in vocational education and training: 
- referring to preparing different dishes of Portugese cuisine
- referring to the placement being realized ( breakfast, lunch, dinner)
- to take and serve dishes and drinks 
- to professionally communicate with the customers in English
- teamwork in order to achive working tasks
- referring to the implementation of hygiene and labour protection standards
- referring to performing services in the Hallway, each floor and Room Service 
- to use and fill in specific documents of the hotel

The project “Transiti” is promoted by Ce.S.F.Or. that has already successfully realized IVT and PLM mobility projects within the framework of the Leonardo da Vinci Programme , in the tourism, hotel and catering field. 

The project Consortium is made of public and private organizations and covers the regions of Central and Southern Italy, in which  high rates of youth unemployment can be found .The project  supports the objectives of the "Europe 2020" strategy for growth and employment of European citizens, contributes to the mobility and employability of young people to support their entry into the labor market and supports the objectives of the Strategic Framework for European cooperation in the field education and Training (Educational training 2020). It promotes lifelong learning and mobility of young people in European Countries and  meets the needs of training and mobility of both young learners of the South Centre (Lazio, Campania, Calabria, Sicily) and of  newly  graduates (Lazio Region) that are attending or have attended training paths in the Tourism and catering field. 

"Transiti" has the following objectives: 

- integrate the course of study in the hospitality industry with a practical activity (internship), realizing 95 new mobility of learners and graduates in European companies in the sector; 

-strengthen  the personal and professional dimension of  young people involved in the project; 

- increase the capacity and European dimension of the  organizations active in the field of Education and Training 

- strengthen cooperation and synergies among  the organizations involved in European mobility and the companies

- increase  the use of national and European tools and implement procedures for the recognition of competences and skills 

- improve and strengthen the language skills of young learners 

- raise awareness of European citizenship and intercultural skills of the participants.

The project will last two years, from October 2014 to September 2016. The internships will last three weeks and will be carried out  with  companies of the sector, as identified by the project partners (Receiving organizations) in 7 European countries: UK, Ireland, Spain, Germany, France, Portugal and Poland. Will be realized:  95 mobility of young learners and 12 mobilities of accompayning  persons. The target group is represented by:

1) 85 young students included in the training programs of technical and professional institutes( tourism and hotel )/ vocational Training Centres partners in the project.

2) 10 graduates residing in the Lazio Region who graduated at Tourism Institutes or vocational training  Centres less than 12 months ago

The selection will be made among candidates attending training courses  which provide  the following professional  profiles: assistant chef, waiter, receptionist.

Ce.S.F.Or., Coordinator of the National VET Consortium, shared strategic objectives and tasks of the project with all the partners; the learning outcomes previously defined have been agreed and  the ECVET procedure for the recognition of credits  to the participants has been implemented. As for  mobility ,  the methodology and tools applied are the ones  already successfully used in other European projects (EuroCaThos, MasterMOB). For the implementation of the activities , has been choosen the methodology of  "matrixes of responsibility" that allows to identify for each partner, activities, tasks , timing, and professionals involved.

The expected outcomes for participants in the project are: the acquisition of new technical skills in the field of reference; the acquisition of transversal skills; the improvement of language skills and the acquisition of national and European certifications to be spent on the European labor market (Europass, ECVET ); a greater knowledge of  job opportunities in EU countries. The partner organizations of the project will:implement innovative procedures for the management of mobility; broaden their networks and contacts in Europe,  increase their range of activities and innovative programs (attractiveness of organizations) to  meet  the needs of young people interested in the experiences of European mobility in a better way.

Generally speaking, "Transiti" will have a positive long-term  effect on the organisations and their staff: tutor, project manager,training and mobility coordinators, administrative clerks.  Tools  and procedures to  guarantee certification and validation of  formative credits and tools for planning mobilities will be implemented. Furthermore, the companies of tourism, hotel and catering field on regional, national and  European level may benefit from more qualified and trained professional profiles.
"ALLE" Arbeiten, Lernen und Leben in Europa

Title: Working, learning and living in Europe



Parties involved: Participants (trainees to be management assistants in freight forwarding, industrial business management assistants, office administrators, automobile salesperson and retail sales person), their training companies, applicant organization – the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School, our partner organization – the ADC College London and selected companies in Greater London. 

Duration of the project: September 2014 – July 2016

Time of placement: May/June 2015, May/June 2016 (combination of working in companies and language course)



Summary:

Kirchheim unter Teck is situated in an area with many small and medium-sized companies which often operate as European enterprises. Therefore it is crucial that these companies have employees being able to act in an intercultural appropriate way and at the same having the much needed special skills and knowledge of their profession. 

On these grounds the aim of the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School is to prepare the students in the best way for the challenges they have to face in their future working life. By working in competitive markets it is necessary that students do not only enlarge their expertise, their social and personal skills but also to develop the ability to act as active European citizens.

In order to reach those goals the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School would like to give 30 students (15 participants in each year) in the following two years the chance to take part in the proposed project.

The aim of the project is to give selected students in their second year of training the possibility to work, learn and live for three weeks in one of the largest metropolis in Europe, more precisely, in London. All our students are based in Greater London and will do their placement in selected companies in the area of trade, office work, management and retail. The participants will stay in host families provided by the partner organization. During the first week out of the three the participants receive language lessons and an introductory course including organizational or cultural aspects e.g. how to behave in a foreign environment, in daily life as well as in business situations. This is provided by the ADC College London. Additionally, in the following two weeks the trainees gain practical experience in selected British companies in London. 

In terms of quality management it is crucial for a successful work experience in a foreign country to tackle the needs of the participants in the run up and to prepare them in preparatory meetings for their stay abroad. Therefore the participants are supported in several ways, e.g.  including the awareness and improvement of their cultural, language, social, personal and task-related competences. During their stay in London the participants will be monitored, accompanied and supported by a member of staff of the ADC College and teachers of the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School. After being back home the participants present their experience, impressions and their newly acquired skills and competences at school and at other selected events to other students, teachers and their companies as well as to other stakeholders and representatives involved in education and the local press. 

Hence by participating in this project the students become valuable employees for companies doing business within Europe. Besides the participants broaden their horizon, their professional way of acting and improve their language skills and thereby lay the foundation of a successful future. The participants’ newly acquired knowledge, skills and competences will be documented in the Europass. In addition the ultimate outcome of the project is not only to expand and ensure our quality in vocational education but also to contribute to the learning process and skills of our students in an intercultural and European way.

The project named Intercultural Vocational Training of Nursing Assistants is a project of mobilities focused on acquisition of vocational skills and on vocational training of nursing assistants which aims to provide its participants with as wide opportunities as possible for professional and personal growth via direct confrontation with the methods of nursing care in Great Britain. Hopefully, it will also satisfy their personal motivation in regard to the development of their language skills. Last but not least we hope that the trainig experience abroad will enhance the students' chances for future employment and allow them to be more flexible on the work market. The mobilities will be realized in different medical and nursing care facilities in North London within October or November 2014 and will last two weeks. There will be 15 students taking part in the training. The students who are expected to take part in the mobilities are currently in their first, second and third year of vocational training.
Studenti Vyšší odborné školy zdravotnické a Střední zdravotnické školy Trutnov  a učitel ošetřovatelství získávají zkušenosti na stáži v Londýnských zdravotnických zařízeních

Students and a teacher  of Vocational school for nurses from Trutnov [Czech Republic] will do their two-week working experience in 10 London's health  intitutions. Institutions were chosen by ADC College and by Vocational school on the basis of the school's demands. 16 students (9 of them study a field Nurse, 7 of them field Nursing Asistant)  and 1 teacher of nursing and medical english will participate. They will nurse the patients according to their competences. 

Aims, expected outcomes and longer term benefits:

1.Gaining professional knowledge, intergrating nursing techniques, creating new nursing standards, familiarization with new aids, instruments and medical equipment, improving knowledge and abilities in the area of treating decubituses and chronic wounds.

2.Improvement of medical English. Hospital in Trutnov, where our students do their work experience is thanks to mountains in an attractive area of Czech Republic and therefore a lot of foreign patients are treated there. Our nurses' and doctors' poor ability to communicate in English often leads to misunderstanding and embarrassing  situations. The subject "Medical English" that our students study is becoming one of the most important for successful practising the nursing profession. As Czech Registered Nurses are fully qualified within EU, it is essential their English reach required standard.

3.Gaining knowledge in the area of multicultural nursing. Nursing foreign patients with different culture and religion helps to develop empathy, to combat prejudice, reduces misunderstanding and it is a great lesson in the area of multicultural nursing.

4.Seeing the patient from a different point of view. Our students often witness  inappropriate behaviour of nurses and this behaviour is tolerated and regarded as normal. Working experience in chosen private and high-quality institutions in London should teach a lesson that the main aim of nurses is satisfaction of the patient. Patient satisfaction then attracts other clients and by this way institution is successful among competitors.

5.The project is also a recruiment campaign. Currently, there is a critical shortage of nurses not only in the Czech Republic but round EU as well. This way we are trying to attract people to the vocational education and nursing profession, show future nurses possibilities working abroad and encourage them to study languages. Last but not least we would like to show foreign employers quality of our nurses and increase their possibilities of employment abroad.

6. Improvement of nursing teaching and teaching of medical english.

7. Application of new methods and knowledge in teaching process. Gaining inspiration for better hospital training.
Stáž mladých zdravotníkov ako súčasť prípravy na výkon profesie

Mobility project „Young medical work placement as part of training for the profession” is going to be implemented by young people in their initial professional preparation - the students of the 3rd year of study of the study program medical assistant and masseur with the Slovak study language, of the Secondary Medical School in Nové Zámky, with the planned number of selected participants of 15 -  of whom the consequent part of the work placement will also be a monthly professional training in health service institutions in Slovakia (June 2015). Within the training students implement theoretical and practical knowledge acquired in professional subjects: basics of nursing and assistance, massage techniques, health and clinics of illnesses, administration and medical documentation, and photo-hydro-thermo-balneotherapy, where they can utilize, compare, and apply own knowledge and experience from the internship in abroad.
The project enables the participants to take part in current trends of multinational professional and technical education and young people preparation, bilateral cooperation, merge of education and the work of business. 
The aim of the project is to foster the European Dimension, qualitatively improve professional and language skills and capabilities by the exchange of experience. With the help of the project to continuously develop the abilities of students to work in specifically diversified environment of professional preparation and thus develop their professional and language competences. The foreign training should lead the students to the acquaintance of the system of health and social care in the partner country, lead them to independence, healthy confidence, skills and competences development, culture exploring, and help them with the integration into the business market also in the countries in the European Union. The students will work with bilingual working sheets, where they will document their insights, experience, results, problems, solutions and recommendations from their work placement, having a special independent space for self-evaluation and feedback sections. 
The foreign work placement will be held under the auspice of ADC College organization in London. 
It will be implemented as a two week work placement in health, social and rehab institutions within the scope of study program for 3rd year students of the mentioned courses of study, in the partner country.  The participants will thus have the opportunity to interlink theoretical and practical knowledge and skills applied in real working environment in abroad, and also the possibility to compare the differences in health documentation, in professional terminology and work organization in mother country and host country. 
The result of the work placement program will be utilized for innovation of school curricula and school educational program.
Expected result is represented by value added in the capability to work in foreign environment independently, in the ability to communicate in foreign language and in capability to utilize the observation and experience to innovate own work at difference comparison of health education.
The long-term benefit of the project in educational, regional and European context lies in: professional and language preparation, qualification improvement, skills and knowledge fostering, attractiveness of school for the public, in the innovation of professional education, international cooperation among organizations, and multicultural reinforcement.
Усъвършенстване на професионалните компетентности и умения на учениците в интеркултурна среда

The one-year reciprocal project „Taste of Europe“ (4 courses of two or three weeks) is designed for 32 apprentices and students of the Secondary School of Public Catering in Ostrava-Hrabůvka, a contributory organization. By means of the proposed project we intend to endorse the quality increase of the initial professional education and training in our school. We also wish to provide our students with the international dimension of professional education and so motivate them to improve their study performance, alternatively to reduce their premature withdrawal from the educational system. 
The educational stays will be held in Italy, Spain, United Kingdom and France starting from October 2014 up to June 2015. The stays will be attended by the 2nd – 4th grade (16-20 years) apprentices and students (16-20 years) of both study and apprentice courses for Cook, Waiter/waitress, Cook-Waiter, Confectioner, Management in gastronomy and Travel and Tourism services. The participants will be chosen on the basis of determined criteria. Their practical training, provided by our school’s partners, will be carried out in restaurants and hotels, accommodation facilities, travel agencies and in specialized workplaces of the partner’s school. The aims of the project are: to improve the professional abilities with the great emphasis on international cuisine (Italian, Spanish, English and Slovak) as well as on non-traditional food processing and service (fish and seafood); to familiarize the participants with new forms of work organization in a different working environment and to motivate them to the further education. The aim is also to extend participants´ skills significant for orientation on the labour market. The participants will be led and motivated to an active approach, flexibility, cooperation and they will cooperate with regular workforce in a foreign country. They will not only extend their practical and theoretical knowledge and innovative ways at meals preparing processes but also become familiar with the unique technological and organizational methods. The cooks and confectioners will obtain specific information on modern trends in European gastronomy, the waiters/waitresses will face and try new trends at guest service and communication with customers. The students of the Travel and Tourism services field will receive the practical experience in tourism services organization in the world-famous cities and popular tourist places. Except for the English language the participants will communicate also in the native language of the host country (Italian, Spanish and French). Among the participants there will be also the apprentices with specific learning deficiencies and apprentices from socially handicapped or single-parent families. All the participants will undergo special language, professional, psychological and cultural training before leaving for the educational stay. On the educational stay termination they will receive a certificate together with an evaluation of their performance. 
The school in cooperation with its partners will ensure the issue of the Europass-Mobility document. The school’s traditional welfare partners will be also involved in this project, as well as the partner schools, receiving organizations and the intermediary organizations. We suppose that our school will act as the receiving organization for the students of our partner schools from Italy and France, provided that their grant requests are approved. The projects will be under continuous evaluation and will be presented at official school events, on web sites as well as in the local press.
We see the long-term contribution of our project in the fact that our school is involved in the educational process of which the output is defined as a contented school-leaver with professional competence and a certain degree of key competences, a person with an international experience that is conscious of their own professional and human qualities. And this very school-leaver will be able to find an employment and successfully start their professional career (in spite of initial difficulties and with a necessity of further education).

In November 2013 the Head Teacher and staff of Bømlo vidaregåande skule visited ADC college in London.



The aim of the visit was to find out more about the possibilities for work experience abroad for our final year "Marketing, service and safety" and "Health" studies students.



The school has for some time been looking for a project that could increase recruitment to  vocational  study programmes.



The aim of the project is to increase students' competence in language,  cultural understanding and vocational practice. In addition the project will  contribute to a greater understanding amongst students of their own values and attitudes in relation to other cultures. The project consists of practical vocational training for our students.  ADC college will be responsible for finding vocational training placement and host families for our students. 



The project is made up of three parts:

1. Preliminary project (financed outside Erasmus+ resources).

2. Vocational work experience placement

3. Post placement project.



In the preliminary project students will be prepared mentally and in practice for what the European work market can mean for them. All final year students in the two vocational study programmes will take part in the preliminary project. 



In the vocational work experience placement, selected students will have three weeks of practical work experience placement abroad. 



During the post placement project students will evaluate what they have learned, what competency they have achieved and how they can share their experiences with others. In addition to student evaluation, teachers will also evaluate the project and spread the results in relevant forums. The post placement project will involve all final year students in the vocational programmes. 



Expected result: 

The project will contribute to strengthening students' practical vocational competency by giving them multi cultural experience that they cannot access locally.

The project will increase cooperation between students and staff in the vocational training programmes, which in turn will strengthen the vocational studies department at our school.  Furthermore the project can increase recruitment to the vocational studies programmes. 



Potential long term effect: it will always be an advantage for students to have taken part in vocational training abroad.



The project may lead to students pursuing further vocational training abroad as part of their craft certificate training. It may also strengthen the school's postion in the relevant study programmes.

Target group of the project "Work practice abroad" are the students of Business Academy in Levice. The project reacts to changing labour market needs and the movement of workforce in the united Europe.
Main objective of the project is to provide participants the possibility to go through vocational training in a foreign working environment, to strengthen their specialist knowledge and improve practical skills leading to better and easier employability at the European job market.  
24 students of our school will take part in the project in two flows - in autumn 2014 and in spring 2015. 
Partner organisation in Britain is ADC College in London.
Theoretical and practical knowledge of participants will be implemented into activities as: office work, work with office  and computer hardware, work with office and economic software, work with business correspondence, ICT work, e-communication, etc.
The project will support participants´  communication skills in English language, especially in the field of terminology, which will enable them to be competitive at the European job market.
Project participants will get to know the country and people´s lifestyle, their mentality and values. That will enrich their personalities and develop their interpersonal and intrapersonal competences.
The results of the project will be disseminated on local, regional and national level.

Hersleb Upper Secondary School is a new Secondary School opening in August 2014 with 750 pupils and 90 teachers. The school is situated in the centre of Oslo in a newly restored building dating from 1922. Our courses are GCSE A-level courses and vocational training programs. The school has signed a formal cooperation agreement with the University of Oslo, focusing on biology and geosciences. Learning methods will be practical with extensive activity outside the classroom.The teaching methods will be practical tuition with out-of-classroom activities. The school wants inquisitive learners who want to use their resources and complete education. The school's idea is to create new learning venues in and out of school.



Increased activity within the field "Internationalization" is an aim in our strategic plans. The object of the project is to recruit pupils to vocational training within health and social programs, to build up the school's reputation and to give the pupils an edge in the competition for a job. The project will create academic motivation and increase the scope of training. The pupils will be chosen according to specific selection criteria, which will have a positive effect regarding attendance and risk of dropping out. The project will give more attention and status to vocational training within health- and social programs in particular. The pupils will reflect on differences and similarities. They will become more independent and mature by having to make decisions and master new situations. They will learn to respect other countries' school systems and become aware of strengths within their own education. Meetings between participants in the project will create new networks where management, teachers and pupils gain new insights and professional expertise.



Hersleb will get teachers from Sofienberg/Sogn/Kuben Upper Secondary schools. Sofienberg has for several years had good experience with exchange programs with Finland (Nor-Plus) and Germany (Gjør det!). Teachers from Sogn/Kuben has participated in the Leonardo Mobility "Vocational Training in Europe". The participants in these projects have provided the school with competence and social outcomes, and created friendships and fellow community that is still ensured. 



The school management by the Head, has primary responsibility for the project application. Contact person is the department manager of health and social programs. She has had primary responsibility for internationalization for several years and participated in several courses organized by SIU. The Head and other members of the management have visited the projects. This network secures predictable projects of high quality.



The project will initially be about training in health and social care and the participants will primarily be selected from Vg2 health service and Vg3 dental assistant/medical secretary: 2-6 pupils and 1-2 teachers. The teachers will provide professional and social monitoring and ensure good quality. Hersleb has formal agreement with the following partners:

ADC College, an educational institution that offers a comprehensive plan with host families, language courses and work placements in day-care and senior centers. ADC College is a new project partner that will broaden our experience. 

Foundation Noruega Costa Blanca (FNCB) has extensive experience with international projects. The school is a vocational training office within Rogaland County Administration with apprentices in the program health and social care.

YA Vocational College of Ostrobothnia is a large professional arena where three boarding schools merged in 2009: Svenska yrkesinstitutet, Korsnäs Training Center and Vocana. The school has a range of vocational programs and broad cooperation with institutions in the area. The Norwegian students will participate in school lessons and have practical training in the institutions.



Hersleb Secondary School will use the experiences gained from the project in the marketing of the school, on the homepage and social media. Acquired knowledge will be spread to our partners and to other Oslo schools in relevant forums. Our pupils will participate in this work.

The school's future plans are to develop international projects in General Studies especially in language, history, natural sciences and biology. The goal is to create new networks for teachers, pupils, school management and business associations.

Background: To prevent dropout from vocational education and to generate interest and motivation among the students. Several of the students who choose vocational educations are students who have problems related to learning and/or motivation. This situation challenges us to teach them in a way they can relate to and give them a sense of achievement. We also acknowledge the need for improved knowledge of international issues in the multicultural society our students are living in. The vocational students will both at school and in their working life be a part of a society which includes many different cultures and languages.  This variety is mirrored in the nurseries and schools as well as patients and in the health service institutions where our students will work in the future. Multicultural societies and work places demand higher levels of competence from our students, and  an international work experience will give our students the opportunities to develop a competence to face these challenges which have become an integral part of our society. The activities and method used to reach our goals is a work experience exchange. We have chosen ADC College in London as our partner for this project because they have an extensive professional network in London and can guarantee our students work experience of a high quality during the 3 weeks they are doing their work experience. Our students will have their work placement in institutions relevant for their vocational education. The responsible partner for arranging work placements and communicating with the different institutions during our stay will be ADC College, while our school will prepare the students for the exchange and follow them up while they are working. The curriculum for the vocational educations states that students should aim to gain internationally subject specific knowledge. While doing this work exchange in London we will achieve this, and by this also fulfil a part of the curriculum. 



The objectives we have chosen for our project are the following:

A multicultural work experience with other standards and regulations than our domestic ones. Improve our language skills and prepare our students for a multicultural labour market back home in Norway. To learn how their future occupation is practised in another country and to observe how cultural similarities and differences influence how the work is practised. The students gain experience from a global labour market. This can broaden their experience and facilitate the possibility for studying or applying for jobs in the EEC in the future. To challenge themselves and develop personal traits and occupational competence as well as developing good skills in their vocational practise. Facilitate the possibilities for the students with special needs to improve their motivation, get to know themselves better and improve their self-image.

One of the most important objectives is to create motivation and interest for the different subjects involved in this project. A vocational exchange project like this will indicate that the school is seriously concentrating on this education. The number of students applying for these vocational programs is declining, and there is a major gap between the demand for workers and the number of students graduating. The lack of health care workers in Norway is a major problem for the society, by generating interest and showing that this vocational education is given high priority will we hopefully motivate more students to choose and complete this line of education. The work exchange shows the students the possibilities they have when it comes to doing part of their occupational training abroad, which can motivate some of the students who are tired of studying. Vocational students may have more motivational problems than other students and have a higher probability of dropout. We sincerely believe that generating motivation and interest for the subjects are vital to avoid this trend.



The results we would like to achieve by doing this international projects are:

Our students should improve their use of subject-related English in their line of work. Improve their knowledge of the British health care system. Reflect upon the differences between the Norwegian and the British welfare system. Gain insight in how a large health care institution is developed and run in a major city like London. Improve their ability to get around in a major city. To relate to people from other cultures both professionally and socially. Gain interdisciplinary experience by doing practical work in the institutions, for example through the topics of food, hygiene, communication, social and cultural aspects.



The long term advantages for our students, our staff and school as an organisation are: The school gains competence in vocational international exchanges. In order to expand this project in the future, is it important to implement and master this single project.
Sortland Upper Secondary School - Service and Transportation Vocational Intl.

The Vesteraalen region's businesses are increasingly becoming more international. Sortland Upper Secondary School is a key player in developing relevant regional professional and vocational competency. We now seek to enhance our student's language- and cultural competency by introducing relevant work placement practice periods in the UK.

Specific objectives:

1. Provide our students two weeks of relevant work placement practice in the UK. This is a vehicle for international vocational practice, including language- and multicultural training.

2. Provide information to regional business organisations about their opportunities the increase and supplement their international business-, language- and cultural competency level for their future vocational workforce. 

Activities and methodology:

Two weeks of work placement in relevant sales, office administration or IT type of businesses/trades. ADC College provides induction and mentoring, as well as relevant work placements companies. Sortland Upper Secondary School provides pre-travel training and follow-up evaluation and marketing of gained knowledge and possibilities for students, lecturers and regional businesses.

Results and impact: 

Provide regional businesses with vocational candidates with valuable competency in international business, culture and language.

Showcase the gained knowledge to regional businesses, fellow students and elementary schools, thus motivating for and strengthening further development of local international business-, language and multicultural competencies in the vocational workforce.

Longer term benefits:

By successfully allowing and implementing future vocational training with the described international competency, this will increase the value of international cooperation, commerce and understanding.
Klíčové kompetence v sociální práci II

21 students of Tertiary Professional Social School in Jihlava studying in the programme Social work field of study Social work and social pedagogy will participate in this project.
