Students will complete 2 weeks as a part of their professional placement in individual departments of social services in governmental and non-governmental organizations. They attend practical training in social care institutions for the elderly and the handicapped (hospitals, psychiatric hospitals, retirement homes and nursing homes). They work in the field in excluded localities and low-threshold centers. The program is interdisciplinary in nature, i.e. that individual disciplines integrate their content into the framework of theoretical and practical social work. Students are engaged in the study of the theory and methods of social work, law and social policy, case reports, supervision, minority issues, pedagogy etc. All these theoretical insights can be applied in practice in foreign companies and organizations.

The partner organizations ADC College and Vitalis GmbH will ensure and monitor future organizations and companies where students will be placed in accordance with their professional focus. The partner organizations will plan the content of the placement of each participant in organizations where students will attend their practical training, i.e. nursing homes, homes for the elderly, institutions for children, for people with physical or mental disabilities, such as Clarendon House or Sedra Nursing Home in London.

In the frame of the project students will complete two weeks of practical training in various departments of social services in February 2015. The project is aimed at gaining experience in the organizations and implementation of social services in EU countries. Except verifying their professional competence, students will test and improve their skills in English/German communication. Acquired knowledge and skills will help them in the future to get a job as an independent professional key worker in social services, specialized rehabilitation or independent worker, consultant in social services, senior lecturer in social services, nursing services coordinator or independent professional or social worker.

Main objectives:
Acquisition of new knowledge in the field of social services and social work.
Applying outcomes from the study of theory and methods of social work, law and social policy, case reports, supervision, minority issues, pedagogy, etc.
Improvement of practical skills in the field of work with a client or a group of clients.
Improvement in foreign language mainly in the field of social services and social work.
Familiarity with social policy in the field of care about the ill, the elderly or other socially disabled groups of people living in the EU.
Validation and comparison of different methods, rule of law and practice in social services in the Czech Republic and EU countries visited.
Developing skills better to set their own work schedule and make decisions in a given situation.
Developing communication skills with clients,staff and the boss.
Developing professional knowledge and values.
Knowledge of culture, life and traditions of the visited country.

Expected outcomes:
Creating photo and video documentation.
Writing an essay (in Czech and English/German).
Preparation of PP presentations of professional experience in English/German language, including photos and videos.
The essay and the presentation will focus on what students' new experience enriched them with, what knowledge, abilities and skills can they compare with their knowledge from the study, improve in the foreign language, communication in the workplace, a better overview of the methods, law, standards and practice in social services in the EU, etc.
Processing of professional vocabulary to Mini Dictionary of Social English/German. 
Publicizing the project to the public in media.
Publicizing the project at school web and Facebook pages.
Organizing a workshop about the placement in the host country for other students.
Rozvíjanie profesionálnych zručností v beauty službách

The  3rd and 4th year students in the study field of beautician, hairdresser-make-up artist and body cosmetics and the  3rd  year  students in  the study field  of  hairdresser  and manicurist-pedicurist  will take  part  in  the  mobility  project  called  "The development of professional skills in beauty services" in the school year 2014/2015.The group travelling to England will consist of 15 students, the group travelling to Germany will consist of 14 students and finally the group travelling to the Czech Republic will consist of 12 students. The  project will be  focused  on hair treatment, hair care, skin care and nail care by using  the  newest  products,  materials,  technologies  and  appliances.  In  the study field  of  hairdresser and hairdresser- make-up artist, the aim is to acquire new  knowledge  and  skills  focused  on  fashionable  haircuts,  colours,  techniques  in  cutting  and  dyeing,  hair treatment, hair extension  and  hair  thickening  and  also  to use the  eco-friendly  products  that  are  able  to  protect  not  only  the  client  but  the  environment  as  well.In the study field ofbeautician, the aim is to acquire new knowledge and skills in  face  care techniques by using products  and  appliances  that  are  careful  with  the  skin  and   they  are  also  able  to nourish and  renew  it.  In the study field of manicurist-pedicurist, the aim is to  acquire  new  knowledge  and  skills  focused on  the  hand  and  foot care with the usage of instrumental techniques, care  and  arranging  of natural  nails,  shaping,  decorating  and care of artificial  nails  because  the  news  related  tomaterials  and  techniques for  shaping and  decorating  the  artificial  nails   come  to  the  market  very  dynamically.The part of the project is not only to familiarise with the new technologies, materials and methods, but also to adapt to the new working and living environment, to discover the country and its culture and to broaden and acquire the language skills.The participants will utilize their language and professional skills and theywillsimultaneously compare these skills to practices used by the host countries. The skills will be developed in England and Germany in the area of cities London and Leipzig and in the Czech Republic in the school salons. During the internship, the students will gain an overallidea about the daily working conditions and organisational structures in hairdressing, cosmetic and manicurist profession of given countries. Practical training will be related to the practical and theoretical knowledge and skills acquired by the students in their native country.The students guided by their professional trainers will transfer their theoretical knowledge into practice, they will be acquainted with the latest trends in the field of hairdressing, cosmetics and manicure and they will develop their imaginativeness and creativity.Everyday communication in English and German will improve their language skills.In Germany, the participants will visit Plastic surgery clinic and also a lecture with a professional make-up artist will be arranged for them. Above mentioned mobilities will take place in England in London, in Germany in Leipzig and in the Czech Republic in Pardubice fromSeptember to Novemberin the school year 2014/2015.The outcome of the project will be a complex finish of a client during the last days of the internshipperformed by the students using their newly acquired skills and preparations used in the given countries. These works will be documented photographically and processed in a digital form into a booklet that will be used as a promotional material.
Zagraniczne staże zawodowe dla uczniów Zespołu Szkół Elektrycznych w Kielcach

The Project of educational mobility entitled: "Foreign apprenticeships for students of the Vocational Electrical Technical  School in Kielce" was prepared by the teachers of the Vocational Electrical Technical  School in Kielce, (Poland) in cooperation with foreign partners, which are: ADC College London (United Kingdom), and Vitalis in Leipzig (Germany). The project will be implemented over a period of 24 months: two rounds of the 12 months each. The mobility project will involve a total of 72 students:  two groups in each round of the project: an electro-electronics group of 18 people will take professional training in Leipzig and an informatics group of 18 people will take professional training in London. In addition, 2 guardians- teachers for each group will look after students at the place of practice.

The major aim of the project is to enhance the attractiveness and raise the educational offer of the school as well as to facilitate mobility of young people, to raise their professional skills, language skills and their personal development. Foreign apprenticeships not only give the opportunity for beneficiaries to deepen their knowledge of specialized German and English language but also to learn about the realities of the German and British labor market, as well as to get to know the cultural heritage of Germany and the UK. Due to the fact that the practice will be held outside the country, students will also learn vocabulary and the realities of everyday life in these countries.



In recruitment process will be included third- grade students at ZSE in Kielce from following profiles: informatics technician, electrical technician and electronics technician. Majority of ZSE students live in the country, in the areas of high unemployment, some of them come from low income families. They have low awareness about the requirements  of labor market  what results in ignoring the need of education and finally contributes to long-term unemployment. In the third year of study, students are required to undergo a 4 -week professional practice in the field of: electricity, electronics and IT in factories and companies. Every year ZSE sends students to apprenticeships in local companies, however, having in mind expansion and modernization of  the content of our school programmes ZSE wants to organize  apprenticeships in Germany and the UK.



All beneficiaries who will be sent abroad will undergo professional language course as well as pedagogical and cultural training. During the apprenticeships they will have practice according to previously agreed between ZSE and foreign partners schedule. The students will be monitored by representatives of partner's institution and by  guardians -teachers of language and vocational practice from their own school. There is also planned a monitoring visit of ZSE school director in the abroad places of practice. 

The apprenticeships will be recognized in Poland as a compulsory professional practice for technical high school students on the basis of daily raports in Diary of Practice. Students will gain professional experience confirmed by  by the Europass Mobility and Certificates of Participation in the project. Participation in the project will motivate students to learn more because they will have to meet the requirements of the Rules of Procedure of Recruitment.  Work experience abroad will increase their competitiveness on the labor market in future.



In addition, ZSE teachers of vocational subjects of IT, electronics and electricity, English and German language by participating along with their students in the project will  gain additional knowledge and skills to put these solutions into school practice in subsequent years. An indicator of the results of the project will be the results of the final practice exam, and reports of the beneficiaries.

After finishing each round of the project ZSE will implement the dissemination activities to promote mobility of students of the school, such as: exhibition, presentation of the results to the Council of Education, the local media and the Educational Fair in Kielce. By introducing a foreign school apprenticeship ZSE would like to differentiate our offer training, presenting itself as a modern school open to the world. Through this project, the ZSE will strengthen cooperation with foreign training centers and will promote good practices in Europe. Cooperation with reputable centers will also improve the reputation and prestige of our institution, and thus increase interest in school prospective students.
Nové trendy v odbornej praxi žiakov

15 students of the third and forth forms of Business College in Šurany ( Obchodná akadémia Šurany ) will take part in the project.They will be accompanied by two teachers - an English language teacher and a teacher of Economics.The students in accordance with National Curriculum will attend the compulsory two-week specialized praxis in abroad.
The project will be focused on :
- the acquirement of practical skills and habits needed for the practical solving of  tasks and problems of economics
-manage to apply the knowledge gained mainly in  these subjects : Typing, Tourist Industry, Economics, Marketing, Business     Comunication, English language.
Typing - especially observing  the applying of valid standards in working out of documents and in a graphical layout of texts with regard to the culture of the locution as well as the work with documents using information and communication technologies.
Tourist Industry - observe the activities of a man as a participant of the tourism and its  position in the national and world economy but also the managing of the technical vocabubulary in English language and using it in communication with clients.
Economics - to understand the basic relations in the market economy, gaining new knowledge from the business activities of companies, their relationships in domestic and international trades.
Marketing - to search the marketing settings, marketing information system,  observe the behavior of the consumer and know and respect the inhabitants of the country, on which the marketing effort is aimed.
Business Communication - to verify and improve their presentation and communication skills, observe the national mentality,tolerate habits and differences between people.
English language - to improve the vocabulary in communication  in this language and in that way make easier the access to the current information and personal contacts which enable higher mobility and independence of a student.
- know how to solve adeqeuate tasks and problems in English language individually
- develope their communicative and social - interactive ability in the outland surrounding
The main aims of the projects are:
- to take part in the compulsory specialized training in abroad, so that students have possibility to discover, observe and compare, but also gain some new special knowledge
- to motivate students in their interest in study of English language, because their communication skills can be improved not only in  abroad, but also in their future workplace
- to learn about the life, culture and sightseeing of the UK
Anticipated performances :
- attending of the compulsory specialized students training in abroad
- working out and defence of the final work connected with the presentation
- assesment of the students
- motivate the students of Business College in their studies Mobility will take place in chosen firms in London, in March, April or May 2015 by means of cooperation with the mediation company ADC College.

Lier Upper Secondary School (Lier USS) is a s a vocational school offering programs in the areas of Health and Social Care, Electricity, Business and Administration and Design and Crafts, Customized Tuition/Special Needs and Supplementary Courses.  The School is aiming to improve the status of vocational education and is starting two new courses of tuition giving a double set of qualifications.  The students obtain a Vocational Certificate and at the same time become qualified for higher education by combining theoretical studies and apprenticeships.  The school management believes that this will improve the status of vocational education and make it more attractive to be a student at Lier USS.  Simultaneously, the school has strengthened its cooperation with local businesses and industries in order to educate good workers with formal skills. In the autumn of 2013 we therefore embarked on a major information campaign directed systematically at the local public, commercial and industrial sectors, at Buskerud county department of education, and at the lower secondary schools from which we recruit our students. In addition, we have used public - and social media and our website actively to spread information about the meaning of dual competence and the future opportunities it provides.



The main objective of the project is to improve the status of vocational education and make it more attractive to young people. Lier USS strives to maintain a good reputation, both in the community and, more generally, by working  systematically to achieve positive results. Given that we live in a multicultural society and a globalized labour market, we believe it is important for students to get more knowledge and understanding of the fact that they are part of a larger community. ADC College is our partner in London. Together we are planning for work placement for our students. A stay in London with practical work experience and experience from family and community life will give them new perspectives on other cultures and contribute to their personal development.

The Project Group consists of six people; Assistant Principal, Head of Department, and four teachers. All have higher education and years of practical work experience. The teachers selected for the project have high professional competence in their subjects, and have achieved good results with students they have taught. All six members of the Project Group have good interpersonal skills and ability to work systematically and consciously to secure a high quality outcome for students. A total of 30 students will participate in the program every year, and we apply for support for a two year period.  To ensure student involvement and influence a prefect from each class participate in the Project Group with effect from the autumn 2014.



Lier USS has produced a preliminary plan including the project's main milestones. Representatives from the Project Group will during the first year, which is a preparatory year,  go to London to become better acquainted with ADC, and further develope the relationship with them. Through this pilot project we will obtain in-depth knowledge of both relevant internships, suitable families and the guidance our students will get during their stay abroad. This is important knowledge to take back to the students and parents to prepare them for what to expect. In order to be selected for work placement in London, and to have an influence on the appropriate type of work they can get, the students have to write and submit an application with CV.  In addition, they will be called for an interview. ADC will also require a copy of the CVs from the students in order to customize the stay in the best possible way.



A strategy of communication will be developed for "Double Competency with International Work Experience". The information will be made available before, during and after the project and will enhance the positive reputation of our school. We expect that the project will be of great importance both for students and for Lier USS. Students will feel appreciated, they will experience success and be proud of what they have experienced . It will give them a personal growth and be important for their general education.



The School is planning to introduce dual course tuition for other programs of education. Lier USS would like to see that vocational training becomes more attractive to young people. This will result in increased number of applications for vocational programs and the status will be enhanced both for students and the community. In the longer term we hope that the new educational  programs will reduce drop-outs from upper secondary education. 



With the introduction of "Double Competence with International Work Experience " we will be in the position to educate young people with formal competences and thereby contribute to meeting our society's need for skilled labour.
VET- Youngsters from Lofoten to London

The mobility-project “VET-Youngsters from Lofoten to London” is a partnership between Aust-Lofoten videregaaende skole (Aust—Lofoten upper secondary high School) and ADC College in London. Our partner ADC College is a professional development and language tuition organization, involved in vocational and professional training for more than 20 years. The target groups for the project are students attending our Department for Vocational and Educational Training in the fields of Healthcare (Child- and Youth-care included), Business Management and Traveling studies and IKT and Media.  The project period is 24 months consisting of 15 student mobilities and 2 teacher mobilities every year. 



In addition to practical training in companies and work places in London, there is a detailed plan for pedagogical and practical preparation and for projects after the training period, both to be worked out at school. In the period after the training, students will produce different products, such as films, Guide for intercultural communication, news-paper articles and marketing material to be spread at our home page, facebook and used for marketing of the vocational and educational studies. 



The three phases of the project will secure the achievement of both concrete knowledge skills outlined for the students in every subject, as well as achievement of the more overall goals for the project.  Evaluation sheets containing knowledge skills and other goals for the practice period are designed for the firms or work places that the students are going to work in.    



The roles and responsibilities of each of the two partners in the project are specified in detail in the Letter of intent. 



The goals for the project are to reduce the number of VET-student dropping out of school, motivate the students to continue their vocational training into their profession and to increase the attractiveness of the vocational studies and our school. In addition, the goals are to increase the student´s and the teacher´s language skills, and to increase consciousness and skills due to intercultural communication. By involving the teachers, we have a goal of an increased international orientation, not only by traveling and working abroad, but also in the classroom. We believe that the project will increase the motivation for the everyday school life, and our goal is that the international orientation will gain all, also the one not traveling out to work. 



The goals outlined above must be seen in relation to a situation of today where too many of our students quite school and where the recruiting to vocational education and training is far too low, taking the needs in the local, regional and national business and labor market and the demographic change, facing an ageing population, into account. In addition, the need for language skills, especially English, and knowledge about intercultural communication has increased because of the multicultural society and international labor marked due to increased migration and globalization. 



In a long term view, we hope to continue this and other international projects, being able to build more cross cultural networks and knowledge. We hope to fulfil our goals of increased attractiveness for the vocational studies and motivation for our students, both to choose vocational studies and to fulfil school.
Praktyka zagraniczna w zawodzie Health care assistant

Project entitled 'Foreign practice in the profession of health care assistant' is devoted to students from medical school AWANSMED. 20 students participate in the project, who go to London with 2 teachers - caregivers. All students in medical education have the same educational medical base, so all of them are able to work as health care assistants. 
This occupation is lately very popular in West Europe. It depands on some semographic factors as: aging population, increased life expectancy, the loneliness of the elderly. Demand for specialists in this domain will increase, so it is chance for specialist within health care, especially well educated and with practical experience. 
The aims of the project are:
- practical knowledge of the profession "Health care assistant"
- acquisition of practical skills within care for elderly/depend/sick people
- iproving language competence through practicing English language
- knowledge the culture of foreign country (through living with English host families, who often are representatives of different cultures)
Generally the project increses the mobility of students on current and future European market.

In the context of the thematic priorities the project  moves matters related to the participation of young people in all kinds of activities and learning of foreign languages, as well as by a range of training and placements topics - health and well-being.

In the context of aims of mobility projects, the project:
- helps students to gain new competences (vocational and language). It will have positive impact on personal students' development
- increases the employability of students on the European labor market
- helps in better knowledge and understanding of different culture, let students make new international friends and let them develop new contacts - the project reinforces a sense of European identity
- increases the atractivness of eductaion in our medical school (new attractive offer)

Expected results of the project:
- 20 people with new practical skills
- 20 people who improve language skills
- 20 certificates and Europass-Mobility Certificates
- new experience within international cooperation
- indywidual for students - they will believe in their abilities.
The coordinator will take care on the correct implementation of the project.

With the project "Work Experience in Greater London 2014" the Ludwig -Erhard -Schule ( LES) , State Vocational School II Fuerth, continue their  three years of successful cooperation with the ADC College in Harrow (North West London). 20 commercial trainees will participate in the project and complete a one-week language course at ADC College followed by a two-week work placement.
Traditionally vocational schools work very closely with German companies providing a traineeship for vocational students. Especially companies in the Metropolitan region of Nuremberg attach great importance to education under international considerations, because in today’s globalised world they are used to increasingly establishing and maintaining business relationships outside their home markets. Since there are often Anglo-Saxon rules by which they communicate on an international level, we consider it as compulsory to provide our trainees with a training program in the UK in order to prepare them for the demands of the international economic environment. Unfortunately, it is no longer a matter of course to obtain a work contract with the respective training company after completing traineeship. Consequently, trainees must more than ever be willing to respond flexibly to changing and international labour market structures. Through this project, students can enrich their CVs  appropriately to be prepared for the European labour market.

All trainees of the LES in dual vocational training of the following sectors can apply for participation: office administration, retail, wholesale and foreign trade, real estate, industry, IT, personnel services , administrative professions. The LES selects the applications received according to the following criteria : age of majority , language skills B1 of the CEFR, motivation throughout the project duration (possibly in consultation with form masters), willingness to adapt to different circumstances. At an early stage of preparation the participants create their individual CVs and motivation letters . On this basis, the ADC College can choose work placements according to the participants' individual sectors and skills (e.g. real estate trainees were placed at English real estate agencies and personnel services merchants in the personnel departments of large hotels). Accordingly, we expect similar good placements of future participants.

The implementation of the three -week project in Harrow / Greater London is planned for March 2015.

For this purpose, participants will be prepared by the project leaders of the Ludwig -Erhard -Schule in five three -hour evening seminars and additionally by means of an online communication platform outside of the regular vocational school time and accompanied to Harrow . In case of questions, the participants can get in touch – either by digital means or personally - with their project leaders at any stage of the project.

The collaboration between the project management of the LES and the responsible coordinator at ADC College is given throughout the entire project by e- mail, by phone or in person, on the spot and very successfully. If problems occur, (e.g. homestay exchange) they are immediately discussed and resolved to the full satisfaction of the participants.

The evaluation by the participants takes place both at the ADC College on the last day of their stay abroad in terms of quality of housing in the host families and the quality of their work placements. In addition, participants evaluate the online course and way of communicating on the “Moodle” platform and the whole project (preparation and implementation) during a follow-up meeting after returning home and on occasion of meetings of their German training companies at the LES.
They also write short reports for the homepage of the LES and the annual report, so that both interested companies and schools as well as future interested parties can inform themselves . The project managers or experienced teachers of LES visit participants in their London placement companies in order to convince themselves of the quality (monitoring).

Distribution is done in numerous media : annual report, homepage of the LES , articles in the local press, in-house magazines , state-wide Monthly Bulletin of VLB (Association of Teachers in vocational schools of Bavaria ), instructor meetings , notices in the showcase, EU - room of the LES , PowerPoint presentation on the digital board, information in personal interviews with interested future project promoters (also outside Bavaria ), who became aware of the project through the above-mentioned dissemination media.
Za zkušeností a poznáním do zahraničí

Students from the Secondary School of Gastronomy and hospitality services , specifically students specialized in hotel services, businessstudies and vocational students specialized in cooking, waitressing and confectioning  will be joined into the project in two runs.
The school would like to provide the students with an opportunity to take part in a foreign training course focused on their field of study in Great Britain (London), where they will be able to check and improve their language skills as English is one of the compulsory subjects of these specializations in our school. Due to the fact that we have achieved  establishing  successful relations with our English partner in London and because of good experience from our previous projects, the same organization has been chosen as our partner organization. This organization has long-lasting experience with managing similar projects and is highly competent to arrange a wide range of professional training stations (restaurants, catering services, hotel services, organizations and services in tourism).
The second run leads to Slovakia, where we have established a partnership with a new partner – Hotel and Congress Centre. The object of that project is to integrate those students to the project, who are professionally skillful and efficient but  have problems with foreign language communication and for that reason have been excluded from the projects so far. Principal objective of that project is bigger motivation in their professional field of education.
Runs of mobilities of the students of mentioned specializations will be realised in two week trainings during the period of the project. Foreign training course will enable the students to meet new forms of work organization in real background and to motivate them for further education in both professional and language form.  Foreign training courses organized by our school lead to fulfillment of our School Educational Programme, which emphasizes as big interconnection with real training in the form of continuous and suspended trainings as possible. Selected students will participate in those trainings abroad. The main aim of the project is to improve quality of professional  preparation, to boost professional skills, to help in orientation on labour market and to strengthen participants´positions on labour market as well. Another object is to motivate primarily vocational students to build up their professional qualification in an appropriate way, to support and cultivate the exchange of professional experience and to varify the ability of communication in foreign languages.
In this way, students will learn about other country, other working and social culture, moral and lifestyle. Therefore intercultural aspect is significant and important part of the mobility project. Participants will attend preparation courses before the short-term foreign training, where they will improve their skills in particular foreign language and take part in cultural preparation focused on particularity of the given country. Students will note the training course in the form of diaries and project team together with the students will evaluate the course of the trainging and the results will be used for other school activities. Our school in co-operation with the project partners will arrange handing over the certificates of participations in the training and handing over the documents – Europass – mobility. The project will be continuously evaluated and presented on the school website, during various school events and in local press. The foreign training will be focused on both practical skills and theoretic knowledge improvement, foreign language communication support, mobility, flexibility of young people and ability of team work with the main aim to provide the best and the highest quality training for future career and with a reference to perspective of breaking through in the competitive environment of European labour market

The project focuses on foreign practical training for 47 students of 3rd and 4th grades of engineering education and economic lyceum. The school will verify the quality of vocational education and for its students it will get superstructure in the form of new expertise applied to teaching. Economic Lyceum students will improve their business skills and expand their language knowledge of terminology. They will become familiar with accounting related with legislation of the UK and will compare it with the Czech Republic. Students will also verify their ability to apply their theoretical knowledge into practice as well.  They also will become familiar with the requirements of the labour discipline and acquired work habits abroad that will enable them to apply for attractive jobs.
Students of engineering field will gain knowledge and skills that are an extension of the school curriculum. They also will gain expertise in the field of NC; they will learn to build a program for the NC milling machine and CNC programming code for multi-axis machine tools. All participants will improve their language skills.  Integral part of their internship is to learn to tolerance and cohesion, independence and ability to make decisions and take responsibility. These acquired skills and attitudes will lead to overall personal development.
The internships will be implemented in four cycles. For 4th grade students of both fields internships are scheduled in September 2014 in order not to disturb them of graduation exam preparation. On the contrary their participation in the project will support and deepen their already acquired knowledge. Internships for students of 3rd grade will take place in January 2015 (engineering) and March 2015 (economic lyceum). The internship will be recognized as part of the school education program block 14 - day practice. For the purposes of monitoring, validation and dissemination of the project, participants will fill out an internship diary. After returning they will elaborate presentations about their internship with the use of photos and descriptions of their work.  In addition economic lyceum students will elaborate the characteristics and organization of the company. Presentations will be the basis for evaluation their practice.
The aim of the project is to improve the training quality of students and their starting position for the labour market. Other objectives of the project are strengthening language skills, students’ self-confidence, improving social, intercultural skills. Other important objectives are improvement of  motivation to further education, the use of required information, removing barriers and above all establishing partnerships with ADC College for lasting cooperation,  as in the case of F + U Sachsen . 
Foreign experience and practice of direct participants will motivate and influence other students of school positively. Knowledge of different educational system, methods of work and commitments of partner organizations and companies will bring other benefits in the field of our school work quality .The project dissemination outside the official school by formal and informal presentations of participants will increase the prestige of the school and will affect future recruitment of primary school pupils and the long-term benefit of the project.
Placements will be certified by Europass - Mobility and certificated by partner organizations.

The mobility project is another realization of the school concept of providing students a part of vocational education abroad. Our school has been sending student interns to various European countries (Germany, Slovakia, Denmark etc.) for the past few years. The mobility project aims to provide students further experience and skills in currently attended study programmes at their home school. The project includes two activities – 2 internships in vocational education and training for the study programmes Cook – Waiter – Gastronomy and Tourism. The students of our school will be the participants in the internships. The first internship will take place in autumn 2014 (October – November) in Germany in the educational organization F+U Sachsen gGmbH, Chemnitz – Einsiedel and there will be 12 students of the study programme Cook – Waiter – Gastronomy and one person to accompany the students. The second internship will take place in spring 2015 (April – May) in ADC College in London, United Kingdom.  We intend to send 15 students of the study programme Tourism and one person to accompany the students. Both internships will last 2 weeks. We have a cooperation agreement regarding the realization of the internships with both partner institutions. The students will carry out their work plan in our partner institutions. The students of the study programme Cook – Waiter – Gastronomy will experience a new work environment in Germany, they will learn how to cook German specialities, manage new technological procedures, discover new recipes and familiarize themselves with the ways of serving customers. The students of the study programme Tourism will work in travel agencies, hotel receptions and other hotel departments, where they will gain professional knowledge, experience and skills. The internships will be an opportunity for students to get to know a new country and its culture, to practice their language skills, to make contacts. At the end of the program the participants will receive a Certificate of attendance from the internship company followed by Europass-Mobility. The internships will be prepared by both partners according to the agreement and schedule. The results of the internship project will be used in classes at our school, both theoretical and practical, and they will also be provided to our students and teaching staff.
Mobilitet i fagopplæring på Hadsel videregående skole og fagskole

Our students will have a two -week practice period and a week English course in England. This is part of vocational training at Level 2 study program in media and communication, and health and welfare . We will send 15 students from each study . In the internship , students should observe at the relevant jobs and learn how the profession is exercised in England.  The students will learn to care for patients , communicate with patients , participate in client meetings ,  industry standard in equipment and software and work with customer relations. They will gain an insight into how the profession is exercised in another country and use it in future employment.



Our partner, ADC College will meet our students at the airport and bring them to their respective host families and introduce them to their work. Through work experience abroad , we want students to gain experience and see both similarities and differences between their own country and the culture and that they visit. Such experience makes you appreciate what you have and at the same time realize that you can learn from other cultures . With this background, they will be better prepared to participate and contribute iwhere they work and in their social lives. They will have more skills and experience as emplyees, including in the European labor market .

Dalane videregående skole has defined internationalization as a key target area, and works strategically to develop international skills both for students and staff, and to develop and strengthen the organization towards international cooperation. This initiative is part of a strategy to promote the school attractiveness and to develop the school as a strong regional player.



As part of an international labor market, we consider it essential that our students get international perspectives and experiences throughout their educational careers. In this respect, we have for several years cooperated with schools in Europe for the exchange of students in vocational training for professional practice in enterprises in the partner country. Likewise, we have as part of our commitment to the development of a new national vocational education and training for wind technicians cooperated with various European institutions developing expertise in this field.



For the two years to come we will have the following focus areas towards internationalization:

1. Vocational education and work experience to give students international work experience and intercultural experience. Here we apply for a total of 66 students and 14 companions for mobility to UK, Germany and Finland.



2. Vocational education and training in European VET institutions to provide skills and training that we are not able to provide at the moment at our school, in an environment where different cultures and experiences can be broken and developed. We apply for a total of 38 students and six companions for mobility to various partners in Germany.



3. Enhance the competence for school staff on an international arena to develop higher quality education, individual expertise, capacity for innovation and international contacts that can be used in the classroom to give students better and more relevant training. We plan to send teachers to our partners for foreign teaching experience and / or specific training for both shorter and longer periods. All together, we apply for 32 staff members for mobility to UK, Germany, Spain and Denmark.



We experience that international cooperation gives students unique and sought-after skills in the labour market. Through staff mobility the school will expand the perspectives and expertise in relation to learning and teaching. Students and teachers develop language skills and cultural competence. The international cooperation enhances their ability to better understand Europe as one transnational labour market, and to develop their skills for learning and innovation. Through transnational sharing of experiences the entire organization develops in a direction where the understanding of international cooperation becomes increasingly important.
Mobilitou k novým poznatkom, inováciám a lepšej odbornej príprave žiaka

Due to development of the society, integration of our country into developed countries of modern Europe and requirements of the labour market, the need to support innovations and European dimension in OVP system, the improvement by means of observing positives and comparing has been  striking , especially in branches  in progress which are, undoubtedly, those studied at PaSA ( kindergarten teachers and school-club assistants, assistant teachers, social workers and animators).

Objectives of this project reflects the necessity of being given a possibility of individual mobility, improving qualifications, initial vocational training, gaining knowledge and experiences based on working in a particular branch abroad and a follow-up application of positive innovations in own vocational practice. Moreover, the realization of the project  meets the requirement of improving communication skills in English language and special vocabulary extension which will definitely support graduates´ job opportunities.
12 students of PaSA in IVT studying the following fields of study: kindergarten teachers and school-club assistants, assistant teachers, social workers and animators and two teachers of English, who will accompany the students and will be tutoring them, will take part in the project. During a two-week stay the students of the fourth form will realize their compulsory practice in institutions comparable to the equivalents of Slovak practice places. During the practice all the innovative observations will be reported in a student´s daily report document. This practice will be accepted by the school management as a proper compulsory practice and will be realized in a regular time. Consequently, students will apply their newly gained knowledge and innovations in the practical part of vocational maturita exam, i.e. at maturita exam project presentations focusing on quality improvement and innovations application in their future profession. Besides the above-mentioned maturita exam presentations the mobility participants will carry out presentations using their records and daily report documents, by means of which they may disseminate all the innovative methods, procedures and forms to other students in IVT in particular branches.
Better results in vocational education as well as more effectiveness in future vocational practice of trainees is regarded to be a long-term benefit of the project    

The mobility will be realised in November 2014 at schools, pre-school and social work institutions and those working in tourism or with teenagers and their free-time activities. The project shall be finished in December 2014/January 2015.

The planned activities are: Mobility of 76 trainees (including 8 following persons), 72 students (including 10 following persons), 98 vocational teachers/instructors from over 150 training companies across the county and 12 training offices, covering 20 different subjects, during two years . Duration of stay: apprentices for 13 weeks, students in VET: for two weeks, instructors for one week, following persons from 4 days to 2 weeks.

Mobility to following countries: Northern Ireland, Denmark, Germany, England , Finland , Belgium, Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Check Republic and Austria.

     All two - and 13-week work placements must include:

- Organizational arrangements, well planning of training/work content and stay,

- Cultural preparation in advance ,

- Web-based language courses in Norway ,

- Cultural program abroad

- Europass and in certain cases Memorandum of Understanding ,

- Rework , summary and evaluation.

Mobility for instructors consist of professional work placement, school visits , updating of professional skills and new methodology, new technologies, knowledge about the culture and traditions. The plan is also to offer a week-long linguistic development- English Courses- for vocational teachers and trainers from enterprises.

Mobility should give us: - In short- term: Professional development for participants: apprentices, students and teachers.

In long term:

 - Development of trustful and loyal contact/Partner network in the relevant countries for Mobility, exchange of experiences / knowledge, apprentices and professional leaders / instructors.

 - Improved recruitment to vocational training in trades and businesses in the county.

 - Increased expertise in general.

 - Professional co-operation in sectors between countries in Europe.

 - Promoting innovation and raise the status of vocational professional training.

 - Insight into the corresponding vocational training in other countries.

 - Instructors and vet-teachers with international competence is a positive contribution to business development in the county.

 - Catch up new trends in Europe.

 - Language development and knowledge of other cultures.

 - This is an important initiative for the county, according to strategic plans in NTFK , sector plans of the Department of secondary and International Strategy for North and South - Norway .

The project Work Experience (Praktikum International) 2014 will be realized by the assigned teachers of the Vocational College Meschede in cooperation with Partnership Europe in Ireland and the ADC College in London. The aim is the organization of mobility for students of the commercial college (Höhere Handelsschule) and trainees in industrial management, merchants in wholesale and foreign trade and office clerks. The students will have the opportunity to develop their cross-cultural skills. Further aims are the development of European mobility and the improvement of professional language skills.
The involved teachers of the Vocational College Meschede together with the ADC College have developed a three week long program that will offer about 40 trainees the chance to take part in a one week long language course focused on business communication. Afterwards they will do a two week long practical training in a London based partner firm. This will expand the learning opportunities at the Vocational College Meschede so that the trainees will be prepared for an increasingly international European work environment. Furthermore we hope for the development of trainees´ personality and the strengthening of European values like broad-mindedness and tolerance.
The aim of the project is to increase the participants´ confidence in their capabilities,  to promote international mobility, to reduce language barriers and finally to exchange vocational skills.

The program in Cork will differ from the description above, as the stay abroad for Commercial College students will be four weeks long (one week language course and three weeks practical training). It will be in July because the other Commercial College students will be doing their national practical training during that time. The possibility to enable students of the Commercial College to take part in a practical training in other European countries is an important element for the Vocational College Meschede to strengthen its profile and to take a step in direction of becoming an European school, which is a middle-term aim.
The students of the Commercial College will finish their course with a degree to enter a college of higher education. The practical training abroad will greatly improve their qualifications and increase their opportunities on the labour market.
The trainees will have European mobility as a vantage for their future training companies. Europe is growing together and the number of local companies that are operating internationally is growing, so the future trainees gain additional qualifications in order to compete on the international labour market by becoming a highly qualified employee.

Nowadays the number of students is sinking. Therefore the cooperation of all participants in the project offers the chance for the Vocational College Meschede to be attractive and to have a pool of motivated young people as its students and trainees.

The project "Studying without borders" is submitted by the Business School, Secondary Special School for Librarians and Further Education College Brno. The project will be implemented in cooperation with its partner ADC College from London. The presenter is an educational institution established by the South-Moravian region which realizes educational programmes in the area of secondary and tertiary education (it means further education colleges in case of tertiary education).

The target group of the project are students of the 2nd and 3rd form of the business academy and business lyceum. They have acquired both sufficient professional knowledge (economics, languages, IT) and communication and managerial skills. The students will attend 2 weeks of practice in London in economic and business workplaces (in two terms, 15 students participating in each term, the 1st term in autumn 2014, the 2nd term in spring 2015). Students, mentored by the company representatives, will be working actively at these workplaces. They will learn to present their work adequately to their mentors, colleagues or customers, which will contribute to the development of their soft-skills. Students will broaden their English professional terminology. New working methods and experience gained in the foreign language environment will be exerted in the Czech Republic during students´ further studies, practice and their involvement in the working process.

The aims of the project:
• increase of students´ knowledge and practical skills in the above mentioned fields of study
• improvement of language skills, development of students´communicative, social and personal competences
• improvement of the quality of skills in the profession, using new approaches, development of informational competences
• competitive advantage at the labour market
• knowledge of life and traditions of the visited country
• using innovative methods from the visited country and their dissemination during further studies and practice of students

Dissemination:
• final report and evaluation (for the recieving partner, Department of Education of the Regional Authority, Chamber of Commerce, National Agency)
• collective project of students and teachers
• brochure for students intending to participate in a similar mobility project
• school conference for students and teachers from various fields of study
• conference for teachers, school management and staff participating in projects
• presentation during meetings of teachers and coordinators of students work placements
• report and publicizing through the school internet site, parent-teacher meetings, Doors Open Day, Fair of Secondary Schools
• public seminar for teachers of other secondary business schools and for project writers from schools in different fields of study

All above mentioned ways of dissemination ensure the target groups will exploit the gained experience and innovation in their own practice or projects. The outcomes of the project and their impact on target groups (students and teachers both from our school and schools in different fields of study, school management, coordinators of students work placements, project writers from other schools, Department of Education of the Regional Authority) will ensure the long-term impact of the  project.

This is a mobilityproject for employees, students and apprentices, the project is co-ordinated by the Education and Training department in Sogn og Fjordane County, Norway.



The project is a consequense of a the focused work within international activities over the last five years. The project concerns practical training placements of staff, students and apprentices within the Hotel and Restaurant Trades, Technical and Industrial Production, Building trades and Health Trades.  The partners that will act as sending organisations training offices and upper secondary schools. The Norwegian partners that have international experience are sharing their contacts and experiences with the less experienced partners, thus sharing and building institutional competence. The receiving partners are situated in London, England; Murcia, Spain; La Rochelle, France; Copenhagen and Skagen, Denmark; Riga, Latvia and Prague, Czech Republic. 



The placements shall support the curricular and training needs within each trade area. The project shall support the need for for international working experience in the curriculum and training plans. The project is mutual; we will host students/apprentices from our partners. 



Main objectives

-Provide an opportunity to gain cultural and working experiences in an international environment

-Increase the interest for the trades concerned and make it more attractive as an educational option and thereby increase the recruitment to the lines of study and training involved

-Provide an opportunity to communicate professionally in another language

-Enable participants to achieve increased self-development through new cultural and professional challenges

-Prepare the participants for their exams and craft certificate test and their future working life through gaining a more varied and relevant work experience

-Give employees a chance to further develop their competencies within the trades concerned and in international activities

-Contribute to an increase in the education completion rates within the county

-Increase the international competence and understanding on institutional level for all parties involved

-Increase knowlegde and competence regarding the education and training systems & qualifications in other European countries

European career profiling



The Martin-Behaim-Schule is located in the Rhein-Main area were they collaborate with companies which are active on the European and the global market. In order to meet the requirements of the labour market the school wants to improve the level of key competences and skills of teachers and students. The project "European career profiling" aims on increasing opportunities for mobilities for learners and staff.  



We intend to send 6 teachers and 40 students attending the Upper Secondary Vocational School in business studies and administration or the College of Business Management to partner organisations in England and Italy. The receiving organisations will select work placement providers according to the students needs. Students have the possibility to gain international work experience for 3 weeks. During the first days the host organisation will coordinate monitoring visits and meetings with the relevant person in the partner company for the teachers. The teachers will gain experience in guiding and monitoring students on an international basis.



Through the mobility activities we hope to improve the competences of learners and staff linked to their professional profiles. The project will enhance employability and improve career prospects of the participants on the European labour market.  Further more we expect to have a multiplying effect on the school community which will increase an international opening within the school and the support for and promotion of future mobility activities for learners and staff. On a long term we aim on the implementation of a  network of international contacts in our school development program to create opportunities for mobilities and develop a sense of European citizenship and identity.

International cooperation is an integrated part of Hordaland County Council’s (HCC) strategy for regional development (International Strategy, 2013-2016). The strategy aims to create a sustainable, attractive and competitive region and give young people international competence, experience and shared responsibility. The region (approx. 500.000 inhabitants) faces challenges concerning climate and energy, sustainable development, access to a skilled and competent labour force, innovation and development in the economic sector. As school owner HCC has committed to use the schools as local resource centres for economic and local development (Regional Development programme 2013). HCC is continuously working to adapt education and training to fit the needs of the region, and to prevent early school leaving (dropouts) (Action Plan for Internationalisation in Education 2014). These objectives are to a large extent in correspondence with the EU’s 2020 strategy for smart, sustainable and inclusive growth. HCC is using participation in Erasmus+ Mobility as a strategic tool to reach these objectives, in close cooperation with priority partners: Vocational education and training, private sector, local authorities and civil society. 



The objectives for the project are to strengthen the region with professional knowledge, skills and competences adapted to the needs in different sectors, develop prosperous local communities, and improve learning outcomes for pupils, increase recruitment, prevent early school leaving and raise awareness in VET schools for internationalisation “at home”.



Participants: 230 VET learners/staff, 56 accompanying persons and 138 adult education staff (professionals).

HCC is the coordinator for the project and has extensive experience in project cooperation and management in different EU projects e.g. the Life Long Learning and Interreg programmes, and is well qualified to carry out this project. Coordination and quality management are based on strong and long term cooperation with sending, intermediate and receiving organisations in Hordaland and Europe. This involves communication and planning activities, project development, coordination and management, and dissemination of results. HCC encourages participants to focus on further development of the cooperation achieved in the mobilities.  



In this project VET learners will have the opportunity to experience daily work practices in European companies within different subjects e.g.: Building and construction, health care, social work, technology and industrial production, restaurant/hotel/food and maritime subjects. 



Different groups of staff will exchange experiences, and meet European colleagues through placements, work experiences, internships and meetings. For staff and subjects like:

-VET teachers: Technological subjects and design & craft.

-Regional and local cross-sectorial partner groups with focus on entrepreneurship and VET: Sustainable local development, innovation and need for new competences in companies, maintenance of sports complexes, transport & communication, aquaculture, local handcraft, tourism, public health and health care services in the municipalities.  

-Other professionals: Sustainable energy in buildings, healthcare, local food traditions and design & crafts. 



In the project, HCC will use the following methodology:

-Writing an application on behalf of participating organisations with a focus on European, regional and local needs and priorities

-Coordination and management of the mobilities

-Good relations with regional partners in Europe

-Assisting VET schools and municipalities with project development, and to strengthen relations with their partners in Europe

-Stimulating cross-sectorial and interdisciplinary European cooperation and interaction

-Strong anchorage of the mobilities in the sending organisations

-Arranging meetings preparing the participants for the mobilities

-Focusing on reciprocal mobilities, experiences and best practices 



Expected results:

-International competence, and new knowledge and skills to be implemented in the participating organisations and regions

-Increased VET recruitment and more motivated, international focused and self-empowered pupils (prevent drop-outs)

-Strengthen cooperation and cross-sectorial approach to economic and sustainable local development



This project has long term effects which contribute to reach the objectives for the participating partners. The mobilities will increase motivation and ability for future project cooperation on local, regional, national and European level. The schools are expected to use their experiences as a tool to incorporate internationalisation “at home”. As a follow up, the reciprocal focus in the mobilities will stimulate European partnerships to actively use the Erasmus+ programme for further cooperation also in strategic partnerships, school partnerships and teacher exchanges.

Context/background of project:

Fusa vgs is eager to provide the best professional and motivating learning to our students, and over the yeasrs we have 

objectives of our project.



Number and profile of participants: 

All together we apply for work placements for 20 young VET learners and for STAFFtraining abroad for 8 teavhers / assitants  from our vocational study programs.



Description of activities:

The VET learners are to work for 4-5 weeks in various companies, chosen by us or by our receiving partners.  The learning processes and practical issues will be handled by the parnters involved, agreed upon before carrying out the actual mobilities.    

The STAFF will be chioesn to patrticipate in relevant professional courses in order to increase their international persepctive of theri work and professions.



Methodology to be used in carrying out the project:

Fusa vgs believe in an holistic approach to our work, thus we plan to involve participants individually in the development of their preparation, iomplementation and evaluation.  Any learner or staff in this project is to be sure that they have qualified support in their learning prosesses. 



A short description of the results:

The immediate result should be the fulfillment of the mobilities, increased language skills and higher motivation for professional work. Also we expect to increase the number of applicants to our vocational programs.



Impact envisaged:

Zahraničná stáž ako súčasť úspešnej profesionálnej kariéry

The project Foreign internship as a part of a successful professional career is covered by the Secondary vocational school of hotel services and business as an educational institution that provides secondary education focused on services, business, hospitality, gastronomy and tourism. All the key persons who will be involved in the project have long-time experience in the field of theoretical and practical study, and actively cooperate with professional organizations and institutions of that focus.  
The partner in the project is the ADC College, the institution that operates in the Northwest London and is aimed at vocational and language training. This organisation is accredited by the British Council, and for many years has been engaged in international mobility projects in partnerships with educational organizations across Europe, has promoted partnerships and cooperation between schools and enterprises in the professional field, it focuses on the promotion of European values and ideas. 
The other partners in the Czech Republic are companies BORS Břeclav a.s. and Taures, a.s.. BORS Břeclav a.s. focuses on the operation of passenger and freight transportation, providing complete customs services and the operation of the petrol stations. The company Taures specializes in counselling in the electricity sector and gas utilities within the Central Europe with an emphasis on Czech and Slovak energy market. 

The main objective of the project: 
− verifying of existing professional skills and knowledge, 
− acquisition of new professional skills and competences,
− comparison and specification of differences in Slovak, English and Czech working environment in real businesses
Specific objective: 
− verifying and improving language competences in the general and professional English. 
The participants of the project:
− 8 students of the field of  hotel academy (2nd-5th grade, focused on gastronomy and hotel industry) 
− 12 students of the fields of business academy and management of the regional tourism (2nd-4th grade, focused on administrative work, correspondence, writing on the PC, accounting) 
− 2 accompanying persons for the mobility of London
Project activities:
− communication with the ADC College London and companies in the Czech Republic with a view to a detailed scope of the term of the mobility and jobs, where the students will be placed during the internship, with details of their jobs in specific workplaces,
− selection of  project participants according to pre-defined and publicly known criteria
− preparation of students, meetings with the key persons of the project, language training
− transport to London and the Czech Republic
− mobility – students will work on the agreed workplaces in London , Prague and Břeclav
Results and impact:
−  presentations and final reports of students (assessment of the benefits of the  foreign internship for their professional skills and career development)
− motivating students to lifelong vocational education
− presentation of project results on the websites of the school, city, region and through the mass media,
− implementation of new elements into the contents of practical training in school curriculum.
Long-term benefits :
− increasing the attractiveness and competitiveness of the school among schools of similar focus in the region,
−  the possibility of involvement of project participants in various professional competitions and school presentations at local, regional, national and international level,
−  development of European cooperation and establishment of contacts for further cooperation in organizing  foreign internships for students of our school.
Prehĺbenie odborných a jazykových kompetencií pre úspešné uplatnenie sa na medzinárodnom trhu práce.

The submitter and coordinator of the project is Obchodná akadémia Dušana Metoda Janotu in Čadca, Slovakia. It is a modern vocational school providing superior education in the fields of special economic subjects as weel as in foreign languages. During study, our students have to acquire great quantity of theoretical knowledge. That is acquired by the medium of modern methods of learning with active usage of the methodology CLIL - Content and Language Integrated Learning. Our main goal is to achieve that our students will be able acquired knowledge in real business environment. That is why we want our students to get an opportunity to complete an intership in enterprises in London where they can acquire practical experience and skills. There are especially following: the improvement of using English language as weel as special economic terminology, experience in the work in an international team - team work and team building, recognising a new culture, the opportunity to present our culture abroad. Participating in mobility will help students to increase their confidence as in our region there are not enough opportunities for pracitcal verification of their  acquired special knowledge and skills. The region of Kysuce, in comparison with other regions, does not have so widely developed business environment, as it is country evnironment, thus there are disadvantaged young people. Therefore, we are convinced that the participation of our students in foreign intership helps them to assert themselves on both national and international labour market. The school is planning to involve 15 participants - students of the 4th grade of billingual branch of study (Slovak - English ) and 2 qualified and well experienced teachers of the English language and special economic subjects taught in English language.  As a partner organisation, we have chosen the ADC College on the basis of its long - time experience in mobility of youth. This agency will provide complex services for our students including accomodation, placing in workstations in companies in Londnon a well as mentoring during whole duration of the intership. Group leaders - teachers will have the opportunity to control their students actively, to communicate with their leaders on work places and to provide needed help. After the completing intership we expect really positive impacts on several aspects:
- our students will improve their proficiency and especially they will learn to use theri acquired knowledge effectively in real entrepreneurial environment
- our school can remain in active cooperation with international institutions in Europe and improve its own profile
- both our school and students will acquire useful information and review of actual requirements of European labour market
Improve your chance at European job market

The project "Improve your chance at European job market" is created in partnership of Obchodna akademia in Žilina with ADC College in London and is focused mainly on obtaining practical working skills of our students abroad and using their English language skills in practice. The main objective of this project is to enable students of our school to get working experience abroad by experiencing practical tasks at work, adapting to new social and working surroundings, motivating them to work hard, be flexible and active in communication in a foreign language. Specific objectives of this projects are to improve communication, social and digital competences of students, to extend working abilities of the students abroad, to enrich formal and informal education by practicing abroad,  to learn history, geography, culture, art and life style of British people, to experience multiculturalism and mutual tolerance among EU citizens. 
15 students of the Obchodna akademia in Žilina at the age of 17 and 18  will participate in this mobility project. The project itself will be running for 12 months (from July 2014 to June 2015). It consists of the preparation of the project activities, realization of the project tasks by practicing working skills abroad and the final phase is connected mainly with propagation and dissemination of the projects´ outcomes. The mobility itself will take place in May 2015. Students will be chosen according to their language and practical skills. The chosen students will prepare their CVs and other necessary forms and documents. During the preparing course they will get all practical information about working abroad which they can use when practicing in administrative departments of companies as administrative assistants, sales assistants or receptionists. The students can use their school knowledge and skills in practical situations (communication  in English language, use of ICT, business correspondence, telephoning or personal meetings, data processing etc.). Excellent knowledge of English language is required from the participants of this project. 
Practical experience at British job market will help to develop student´s personality and increase their motivation to study English language and improve their skills in the field of economy. Spending two weeks in British families will give them a chance to get to know the culture, history, traditions and life style of  British people. 
The students will be accompanied by a Slovak teacher of English language who will be responsible for all the project activities like choosing students, organizing language course, planning and preparing the whole journey to Great Britain – transport, insurance, accommodation, etc. During the stay in Britain she will be responsible for monitoring the whole program, communication with ADC College and companies where the students will be placed.
Expected outcomes of this project are improving specific language skills of students, obtaining new working experience within the European Union and practising theoretical knowledge of economy in practice. Participants will receive the „Europass – Mobility“ and the certificate from ADC College in London.
Mobilitäts-und Arbeitserfahrungen für junge Auszubildende in Europa

The Commercial College in Hanau (KSH) intends to provide internships abroad for young student in vocational training schemes (dual system) and in vocational courses such as "bilingual assistant"/"personal manager with foreign language skills". The college wants to encourage mobility to European countries. We train about 600 apprentices in the commercial sector. Just few of those have been able to gather experience in European countries so far. Our college intends to boost this number significantly and prepares to become a major provider for internships abroad. We generally highlight the importance of internships of at least four weeks and in some departments of the school these are obligatory. 

The objectives of the internships abroad are personal development of the young students, insight in unknown entrepreneurial structures and rather foreign working processes and companies`profiles. Communication in the foreign language in the company and in daily life will be a challenge, which enables participants to become acquainted with a somewhat different culture and gives them a chance to use skills acquired at school in authentic situations.

Most participants dispose of GSCE level education ("O-levels") and thus need more motivation and encouragement than other students with higher education levels ("A-levels").

We expect the participants to benefit highly from their internships abroad. However, not only they will have an experience for their life, but also our school and internationally oriented companies in the area of Hanau will benefit from their step abroad.

Of course, we hope to be able to continue such projects in future, so that they will be a keystone in the concept of our college.

The project "Live and Learn in London" is targeted at students enrolled in initial vocational training (IVT). The participants will be students from different areas of business and administration who attend our school (Oberstufenzentrum II Potsdam) as part of their dual education programme. During the project the participants will be sent to London in autumn 2014 to take part in a three-week mobility programme. The programme consists of a combined language and content course at the ADC College during the first week followed by a two-week work placement with local companies and organisations in the Greater London area. 
The project aims at improving the students' foreign language skills and developing their professional skills by exposing them to a wide range of communicative situations in everyday life and business. During their work placement the students will be given the opportunity to gain first-hand experience of company life and culture in Britain and compare this with the conditions at home in Germany. This will help to enhance the students' intercultural competence and foster their cross-cultural communication skills which may also contribute to an increased willingness to accept mobility in their future professional and private lives.
