In this way, our school accounts for the process of internationalisation of vocational education and training in Europe. 
Taking part in this project will give students the opportunity to acquire  additional skills and knowledge  strongly required in today's globalised labour market. After completion of their initial vocational training students will be expected to maintain a high degree of professional competence. and any additonal certified skills such as the particpation in our project will significantly improve their employability.
Teachers´ Training and Students´ Competences Improvement

1. Context/background of project
TACTICS connects practice and school - education by professional practice for students and training, language, and methodology course for teachers. It is organized by Obchodná akadémia, Kukučínova 2 Trnava in cooperation with ADC College – professional training centre in London. It is financed from Erasmus+ fund under the KA1 action: Mobility of learners and staff mobility – VET learner and staff mobility. 
The project focuses on: 
- Improving students´ learning with effective mandatory practice during study and to enhance and sustain language learner motivation and employment benefits
- The qualification of VET teachers in the vocational education and training to teacher vocational subjects in English language
- Promotes and support lifelong learning and learner mobility 
- Improving the quality of education for vocational subjects
2. Objectives of your project
- Provide students with professional practice in a foreign country to develop and improve their competencies, skills, a level of English language, and the use of knowledge on the labour market with the intend to increase their employability after graduation
- Provide teachers with training, language and methodology CLIL course to learn new CLIL methods and trigger their competences, skills as well as to increase their level of English language with the aim to improve education, curriculum and the graduate´s profile. 
- Increase a wide range of resources, including interactive techniques
- Build an study environment of confidence, resilience and success for students
- Employers’ and industries’ perceptions of the quality and effectiveness of education and training and the competence of graduates
3. Number and profile of participants
Target group consists of :
- 30 students studying at 3rd and 4th year of bilingual and general studies at Obchodná akadémia Kukučínova 2 in Trnava.
- 6 teachers teaching at bilingual section
4. Description of activities
4.1. The project focuses on the main activities as such:
4.1.1. 2 – week practice for students in companies in London
4.1.2. 2 – week stay/course for teachers 
4.2. Other activities that are supporting the main ones:
- Project seminar for everyone from school to bring up to date about the project
- Interview for candidates interested in practice
- Info seminar for short-listed candidates
- PJKP course for students 
- Evaluation seminar for all participants and the project team to analyze the project´s aims and needs, and prepare new strategy for new projects

5. Methodology to be used in carrying out the project
5.1. Initiation
- Project case (SWOT analyse of school)
- Scope and deliverables (certificates, CLIL methodology, questionnaires, final reports)
- Objectives (main activities of the project: vocational practice and training course)
- Recourses needed (personnel, finance, capital)
- Milestone plan and timeline ( date of practice for 2 groups of students and training courses for 6 teachers) 
- Cost estimate, Risk and issues
5.2. Planning and Design
- Developing the schedule (Gantt chart) for the supporting activities 
- Developing the budget 
- Selecting the team members and creating their work plan
- Communication planning with hosting organization, participants of the project and other people involved in the project
5.3. Execution
- Logistics and organization strategy of departure 
- Communication with responsible people for the main activity at the both sides of the project
- Costs 
5.4. Monitoring and controlling
- Measuring the ongoing project activities 
5.5. Closing
- Certification
- Analyse of outcomes (questionnaires, final report, anonymous survey)
- Dissemination strategies of the project
6. A short description of the results and impact envisaged
Envisaged results of the project:
- Obtained certificates: the practice the CLIL course 
- Satisfaction questionnaire for the participants to learn about the practice and course
- Handouts and study materials with the use of CLIL methods to adopt them in the subject curriculum for the new school year 2015/2016
- Supporting materials for obtaining credits in school system to increase teachers’ qualification
Envisaged impact of the project:
- Develop skills, improve competences for practice and increase a level of English language
- Increase intercultural sensitivity
- Build strong partnership among the participants and organizations 
- Increase the use of CLIL methods in education, curriculum of vocational subjects taught in English language with the aim to enhance the graduate´s profile
- Improve the communication among professionals and public to inform them about the project
7. The potential longer term benefits
- Education which reflects current trends and employees´ requirements on the labour market
- School position on the international level by organizing international projects
- Modernised methods in education and support students and teachers´ mobility 
- School networks 
- Education by active studying

Project participants and their needs:
The project is aimed 12 students who attend the second, third and fourth grade of Commercial Academy, which offers Business and Tourism Programme. The students have knowledge of the following specialized courses: Applied Economics, Marketing and Management of Tourism, Business Correspondence, Accounting, Geography and Client Psychology). The students need to apply their knowledge in real life working experience. Concerning languages, the students are at A2-B1 level of CEFR. Similarly, they need to develop their communication skills and their intercultural competence in real life.  

The goals and outputs of the project
The goal of the project is to enable students apply their language skills and their knowledge of specialized courses during the two weeks of professional experience in various workplaces in the tourism and administration. Another goal is to get students acquainted with new trends in tourism and administration. During the professional experience students will develop their oral and written communication skills as well as their intercultural competence. The last goal of the project is to increase students’ competitiveness on the job market. The output of the project is a working experience report and its presentation. Each participant will present his/her experience to other students and to possible future students of our school. The school will also present the results of the project through various means: the school internet pages, the internet pages of Region of Pilsen, regional and national media.
In the Footsteps of J. A. Comenius

The project " In the Footsteps of JA Comenius " is developed in cooperation with our partners ADC College , based in London . Our purpose as a sending organization, was to provide their pupils with the opportunity mobility abroad, so that they can learn about different ways of teaching and learning technologies in alternative types of kindergartens.
The project is designed for 16 students of third and fourth years at four-year graduation study in the teaching for kindergartens and tutoring .
The main objective of the project is to promote quality and innovation in vocational training at our secondary school. The specific objectives of the project are mainly the improvement of communication skills, broaden the knowledge and skills necessary to direct educational activities with children, getting inspiration in alternative types of kindergartens in their field and acquire greater self-confidence in the performance of their future profession to follow better in the labor market. At the same time students get to know different levels of education , other forms of learning, different learning processes and different atmosphere relationships between teachers and pupils in alternative types of kindergartens and thus gain international experience in the field, ie. in real kindergartens .
These objectives achieved by implementing major activities: choosing the topic "Methods to improve the quality of the project entitled In the Footsteps of JA Comenius ' , exploring cultural diversity , using an approach through the school curriculum.
Internship students will be held in London for a period of two weeks in February 2015.
The project will also involve the teachers of English, who prepare students for language and cultural training course. Students through the course strengthen language skills, handle technical terminology in the field of pre- primary education and learn about cultural differences within Great Britain. Also develop a resume, complete the necessary forms and will be prepared to gain maximum knowledge, which then they use abroad. For a successful internship it is important to prepare the students  best.
During the internship the school will provide two accompanying persons whose task will be to monitor program, to communicate with the receiving organization ADC College and partner organizations, in which students will be during the internship placement .
The expected outcome of the project is to obtain a Europass mobility for all participants and participating internship certificate from ADC College. Likewise, the students will acquire professional competence and active identification with the department that they study and are actively involved in the running of the institutions during mobility.
Mobility should help deepen their professional knowledge and improve practical skills. Students will recognize different levels of education, other forms of learning, different learning processes and different atmosphere relationships between teachers and pupils in alternative kindergartens in the UK. Based on the above they will be able to compare due to the mobility of working practices and systems of work in kindergartens in Slovakia and the UK.

The project will be implemented in cooperation of two partners – Obchodní akademie Česká Lípa and ADC College. 15 students from Obchodní akademie who study Economic Lyceum Business Academy and the Public Service Activities, will be involved in the project,they are in the third grade. These students study English within the framework of the school curriculum. In practical subject such as accounting, public service, economics, written electronic communication, ICT, taxes and law they gain theoretical and practical knowledge and abilities, these they can improve and learn how to use in practice within the project activities. The participants will be chosen according to in advance set criteria such as English language knowledge, vocational knowledge and their personal approach. The choice will be carried out by a team of teachers of Obchodní akademie. The  chosen students will take part in a two-week stay in Great Britain in firms and companies in the administrative and sales positions.
These companies will be chosen in advance by ADC College. In the preparatory part of the project the choice of participants will take place and will be followed by their preparation itself – in the professional and socio – cultural fields. In this part of the project the contract between the partners that will name their responsibilies within the project will be signed. 
The mobilities will take place in the spring of 2015, the exact date will be set during the preparatory part of the project. During the mobilities the accompanying person will monitor the participants, will provide support and help when necessary.
The main focus of the project is to gain and improve vocational skills and knowledge that students learn during their studies – these are for example: processing documents – the archivation, creating, checking, processing post, administrative work with computer, working with goods – presenting in a shop, working with customers etc. Improvement of English language competence and motivating the students to continue in studying is a very important part of the project. The mobilities will help the students to validate and widen the knowledge concerning socio – cultural situation in the UK they got during their school studies and in preparatory courses. This can help the students with Maturita exam, with their own mobilitiy and in their future job.
The biggest advantage of this project is the connection of all these three parts together. The students can validate their ability to succeed in practical administrative work in English with English speaking co-workers and customers. This type of competence will help the most their professional and personal growth and will increase their chance to succed in finding the most suitable job for them. This is very important  especially for Obchodní akademie students because in Česká Lípa there are many international companies that belong among important employers of our absolvents and the ability to communicate in English, work with English documents is a very important requirement for new employees.
The school will present the project on its web page, in press and on Open-door days. The participants of the project will present their experience during the school conference. All the students of Obchodní akademie and also  the parents and the town representatives will be invited to the conference. This should motivate the conference participants to their own mobility, studying languages and taking part in similar projects.
Obchodní akademie and ADC College will issue Europass mobillity for all the participants and they will also obtain a special certificate issued by ADC College. 

The main objectives:  
- Acquisition of new knowledge in the field of administration and sale
- Improvement of practical skills in the field of administration and sale
- Improvement in foreign language
- Familiarity with innovative trends in administration and sale
- Improve communication in the foreign language in administration and sale
- Knowledge of history, culture, customs and traditions of the visited country
Expected outcomes:
- Copy of an essay on thier professional practice
- Copy of a presentation of pictorial material from professional practice and its presentation in the project conference
- Compiling  a pofessional vocabulary to a mini dictionary "My Professional English" 
- Publicizing the project on the school website
- Publicizing the project to the general public through articles in local and regional press
- Organizing conference for other students and public to inform them about the country visited - its culture and life of poeple there - and about the companies participating in the project with the help of the above mentioned presentations.

The representatives of our school have always tried to provide our students – future graduates – with the education of the highest quality to help them apply their knowledge in practice, possibly help them choose appropriate university education.
 To strengthen the quality of education, to improve language skills and support growth of teenagers’   personalities, we came with the idea of joining the project Erasmus+.
Our students regularly take part in various work experience in economic- oriented companies which help them use their theoretical skills in practice. The idea of experience their work experience abroad - in an English speaking country – sounds very interesting  because it would help our students to learn new practical skills and improve their language skills.
The aim of the project which is also included in its title “An innovative employee inspired by foreign experience” was to allow our students to have their work experience in a foreign country whose language they learn.   Our students would have the possibility to see life in a foreign country, learn about various work possibilities, new trends and being creative at work. The aims of the project are oriented on:
 
·         improving the quality and modernization of vocational education through foreign partners,
·         improving language level of our students,
·         creating  space for  development of original methods in the area of vocational education,
·         creating space for creativity,
·         increasing the level of practical experience and flexibility of our to-be-graduates.

We have chosen 20 students who are in the 3rd and 4th grade of their secondary education. They are all young, creative people with the high sense of responsibility.   They will practice their job experience in various companies, hotels and travel agencies.
After finishing their mobility abroad, they will obtain one of the highly regarded European certificates - Europass - which confirms going through the short-term attachment. For each participant it is a great experience and it is also very interesting if mentioned in CV and it can help our students finding jobs in the future.
Last but not least very important aim of the project is getting to know life and institutions, sights of the country, which is very helpful for their Maturita exam in English language.
As the long-term contribution of this project, we expect that our students will continue in developing their language skills, creativity and increasing their practical experience which might help them to be more interesting for their future employers.
Caring for People with Special Needs

The aim of our project is to support our students in practical training and their communication in English.
We are secondary medical school and we are interested in students´having practice lessons in social and health services and nursing homes in England.
Our host organisation ADC College helped us to find work placements for 16 students at the age of 17- 18 for two weeks.
The participants will work in nursing and care homes and care for the people with special needs. They will assist with hygiene or feeding of non sufficient clients. They will provide personal assistance to people with disabilities and practice communication. They will gain work experience, get known new methods and ideas and improve their skills in nursing of elderly people and disabled people. They will have possibility to compare different levels of social care in both countries.
The mobility will contribute to development of their professional and personal growth, increase of their confidence and improvement of understanding intercultural differences. That help them have better position in the labour market.
After providing written feedback on their project experience every student will gain Europass Mobility.

The project is submited by the Secondary Professional School in Benešov - branches Administration and Social Care. 
The project is aimed to enable the students to work in an English speaking country in their branch and use the knowledge obtained at school and broaden their horizons. 
10 students will take part (we expect 5 students of Administration and 5 of Social Care).

Students of Administration are trained to use computer programs Word, Excell, Powerpoint. They are able to type and some of them have passed the state exam. Students are alse well trained in law and have practical experience due to practice which is organized from the second class of the school.

Students of Social Care are trained to use computer programs Word, Excell, Powerpoint and have good skills in Social Care. Due to practice organized at our schools they have good practical experience. They work for Senior Houses, Care Homes and Children Houses and are going to work at similar places abroad. 

The English partner is ADC College. 
Students are going to work 
a) in the branch of Administration 
• dealing with incoming and outgoing post
• maintaining stationery supplies
• reception duties such as greeting and looking after visitors
• typing and formatting documents such as letters and reports
• updating computer databases
• filing
• using office equipment such as printers, photocopiers and fax machines
• managing diaries.

b) in the branch of Social Care
• getting to know individual clients and being aware of their special interests and social needs
• supporting clients with daily personal care such as washing, dressing, using the toilet and feeding themselves
• carrying out general tasks such as housework, laundry and shopping
• helping families adjust to new caring responsibilities
• working with other health and social care professionals to deliver individual care and development plans
• helping to organise recreational activities
• escorting clients to and from the residential home (for example, young people attending a local college).

In study stays the participants will test their theoretical skills and try them in practise. In this they strenghten their proffesionality. 
Owing to the stay abroad, the students will improve their English knowledge. They are expected to improve their specific vocabulary and their communication abilities. 

Students are also expected to braden their portfolio and have a better chance of further education and employment in the Czech Republic and countries of the European Union as well. 

The study stay will be realized in December 2014 or January 2015 and will last two weeks.
rojekt je předkládán na 12 měsíců a předpokládá se pokračování v rámci Erasmus+ i v dalších letech, nejlépe s projekty na 24 měsíců. 
Owing to this project our school will motivate students, especially those younger who are going to get known about the possibility to travel abroad for experience in Grat Britain and to improve language skills and get work experience. Students are going to get known that European Union makes work possibilities after studies much easier.
Rozvoj kompetencií budúcich zdravotníkov za hranicami Slovenska

In order to participate in the project Erasmus plus, the third-class  full-time study students with  the field of study - Nursing Assistant; and the first and the second- class students with  the field of study - General Diploma Sister, will take part in the exchange professional practice.The main aim is to verify and improve the competences and skills while working with patients and also in wider interpersonal relationships. 

We plan two weeks long exchange stay for students: 

The first flow : from 16.9.2014 to 30.9.2014 – 2 weeks : 7 students + 1 leader

The second flow : from 31.5. 2015 to 13.6. 2015 – 2 weeks : 8 students + 1 leader

The place of professional practise – ADC College London, UK,  workplace  of healtcare facilities.

Project objectives are: 

-to encourage the development of key competences of the students of the selected disciplines in practice abroad,

-to become acquainted with the latest trends in the treatment of the ill, which are applied in the health care facilities, 

-development of communication skills and language competences. 

The students will acquire independence in work, improve their nursing skills, become acquainted with the organisation structure of the local nursing institutions, they will check their knowledge of the foreign language in the interpersonal relationships among the staff and the patients, will become acquainted with the socio-historical and cultural peculiarities of the country. The accompanying persons will be monitoring them during their practice and will include new knowledge to their education in the following time. The implementation of the project, the aims, and the outcomes will be presented and published on the school, local, regional and national level.
Praktika in ausländischen Unternehmen – Workplacements in British Enterprises

Our project deals with work experience in London. Together with our partner, ADC College, we offer two weeks of practical experience in companies from different areas of business and a one week language course at the beginning of the stay. The companies can be real estate agents, wholesale companies etc.. Moreover our pupils stay in host families in London. Work experience and life in a host family enable the students to test their competence regarding getting around in new unknown areas and situations. These are things not only employers expect nowadays. Especially moveability and openness are important competences adults should have nowadays.
Firstly the stay in London is prepared in the English lessons at school before the work experience starts. Pupils learn how to behave in different situations in foreign countries and how to treat partners from different cultures. Moreover we meet several times to prepare the stay. These meetings will deal with questions like living in a host family or the city of London as a place to live. 
Together with our partner, ADC College, we work out a program for the stay in London. This mainly includes a language course (one week) and the work experience (two weeks). In the first week there is a meeting with the complete group every morning dealing with current problems etc.
After the stay we put emphasis on the evaluation of the stay. Every participant has to write a report about the time in London and everyone should be prepared to present this report to fellow pupils, teachers or employers. 
In cooperation with ADC College as proof of participation in the project we hand out the Europass Mobility. Moreover every participant gets a special certificate from Eugen-Schmalenbach Berufskolleg and a supplementary note as part of their annual report.

The project "Internship in London" is supposed to start a tradition of internationalization at the Martin-Segitz-Schule, Staatliche Berufsschule III, Fürth. We hope to be able – together with our partner-organization in London – to grant some of our students the possibility of a profitable stay abroad. This annual project would be of benefit for all parties involved. Next year we plan to start with the minimum number of 15 students, but are determined to increase the number of participants and at best, even the number of flows in the future.
In our "maiden project", trainees of the IT and media professionals complete a one-week language course and a subsequent two-week project in a company in their industry.
The already good cooperation between our vocational school and the training companies should be improved with this project by getting a partner organization – the ADC College in Harrow, London –and the English companies on board. The despatching organization hopes to trigger a boost of motivation for the students, together with incremental competences for students and teachers alike; companies in both countries may get an insight into the working processes of their foreign colleagues; the German companies benefit from this new, cultural facet in their training program. Supporting young people entering the labour market has to include the imparting of intercultural competence. Being able to communicate serenely with international partners, is now no longer a unique selling point, but has already become a basic requirement for survival in the modern labour market in the relevant line of business.
Every student of the media and IT professions being trained at Martin-Segitz-Schule can apply for the project. Majority, motivation, language- and social skills are the main criteria for selection. The latter will be carried out in consultation with class teachers and trainers.
In the preparatory workshop, or even before, the chosen ones will submit resumes and cover letters. These guarantee adequate allocation of internships and the student-centred design of the language-course. In addition, we will coach participants for the project in cross-cultural, linguistic and organizational terms. Students can ask all questions in person or communicate by phone with the project manager; they can swap ideas on the moodle-platform or via email. The accompanying staff of the BIII and coordinators of the ADC College will be always available on site at all times. The former are going to visit the students during the language course and every one of them at their internship position in order to be convinced of the quality of student activities or to intervene directly if necessary.
In April 2015, the three-week project will be carried out in Harrow, Greater London for the first time.
The day before departure, the interns evaluate the ADC College in terms of accommodation, language courses and internships. During the follow-up-meeting the evaluation of the sending institution takes place.
The students and their instructors should be convinced of the benefits of the project. We hope to succeed in that aspect by awarding various certificates. The trainees will receive a letter of reference by the foreign companies, a certificate from the BIII and the europass mobility. This learning completed document, completed in an outcome-oriented and competence-based way, confirms the success of learning of the participants.
To disseminate the project results we try and use all the media available to us. Those are: the homepage and the newsletter of the BIII, the ADC-homepage and the portal of the ECVET, presentations at instructor meetings, the local press, the vlb newspaper “accente”, in-house publications and the annual report of the neighboring school.
APL för ökad yrkeskunskap och kulturell förståelse

Workplaceexperience abroad gives our students the opportunity for professional development , cultural exchange and language skills. In addition to individual skills , we could see that this project will lead to the promotion of our school's internationalization.  Erasmus gives us the opportunity to support the achievement of the goals of internationalization mentioned in school curricula and Hjalmar Strömer school's vision .



In our education is at least 15 weeks of workplace-based learning compulsory. This project makes it possible to promote the development of vocational training by offering students at Hjalmar Strömer school vocational programs ( Trade , Childcare and Education and Health and social care ) ability to conduct job training  abroad. We aim that students should be given the opportunity to make their APL in 3-4 weeks.



Teachers benefit from this project will be that we promote international contacts while pursuing the objectives set out in the school curriculum . In each of our programs we have program-specific goals to be achieved through this project . All international experience rubs off on the school and education .



Today's globalization is placing new demands on our students as well as on our schools.  APL  abroad will able us to increase the understanding , experience and competence in the following way :



• Increased understanding of other cultures reduces prejudice and strengthens democracy and human rights

• Students gain increased mobility of labor and increases employability .

• The quality of VET is increasing because new methods spread and therefore increases the attractiveness and status of vocational education.

• Teachers and school develops through project their own activities, we learn from each other and gain new perspectives , which  leads to new pedagogical discussions.

• Students may be more motivated to achieve the goals of their courses / training while getting stronger self-esteem and confidence in their ability to dare and act , work or study in an international market .

• Pupils' learning is promoted in a natural way

• Our partners are very skilled and have high quality of internships.

• Our partners can develop their business through feedback and evaluations from all suppliers (workplace, students , accompanying teachers )



We know that APL abroad will benefit the school and students a lot, it gives them the opportunity to improve their language and job skills , they get easier a foothold in the European labor market . The gains for the school  locally as well as  globally is large then it will give a ripple effect through increased interest and attraktonskraft on programs among other things. We hope that we will be able to take part in this projekt to make our goals become reality!
Walisisch Englisches Berufspraktikum für Berufsschüler und Berufschülerinnen

Participating partners are Fritz-Erler-Schule Tuttlingen in Baden-Württemberg (Germany), Guildford College (International Centre for Education) in England, ADC College in England as well as ECTARC (European Centre for Training and Regional Co-operation) in Wales. Further co-operation partners are different regional companies from the partners' areas.



Background:

Our trainees are in their second year of their vocational training (industrial clerk or wholesale and export clerk). In the context of our additional skills program between 30 and 40 trainees go to the UK each June/July to attend a practical training.

We offer work placements to raise the autonomy of our trainees. Together with our partners in England and Wales we enable our students to individually plan and organise their environment in order to learn successfully. All partner organisations strive to help  achieving the goals of our school as well as those of our companies.



Objectives:

The participants improve their fluency, expertise as well as their social and learning skills.



Activities:

Language course, intercultural preparation, cultural activities in the UK (i.e. International Eisteddfod), work placement



Methodology:

The project runs year round at all three locations. The participants stay for four weeks in Wales or England. Our school prepares the trainees and organises the stay. At the very end of the stay our partner organisations evaluate the stay in the UK. Following that we evaluate the overall process.



Results and Impact:

The improvement of the trainees' fluency in school is noticeable. They have less inhibitions to apply the target language. 

After the project, the capacity for teamwork, openness and dedication of the trainees are raised considerably - which is also confirmed by the companies' training managers. The participants also act as propagators or "ambassadors" for our project. In the long run this mobility will result in a positive effect on the further education of our trainees as responsible citizens of the EU.

The Erasmus mobility project is organised by the ,Berufskolleg Wirtschaft und Verwaltung‘, a certified ,Europaschule‘ in North Rhine-Westphalia. It is an integral part of the school‘s scheme to offer motivated students the opportunity to serve a work placement abroad as part of their apprenticeship. The ,Berufskolleg Siegen‘ cooperates with partner organisations in Valencia (Spain), London (UK) and Kokkola (Finland). In the course of two years 59 apprentices will get the chance to do a three-week work placement (London)   or a four-week placement (Valencia, Kokkola) respectively. Students training to become clerks in various sectors such as industry or freight forwarding as well as the commercial college students who have a particularly Europe-oriented curriculum will take part in the projects.

After the application procedure the students are thoroughly prepared by project leaders as well as former participants. The projects start at different times during the year. The respective partner organisation abroad provides for suitable accomodation and companies for the work placement. It also serves as contact person in situ. In Valencia and London the partner organisations are experienced agencies specialised in taking care of international apprentices. The partner in Kokkola is a vocational school that is in charge of handling the organisation of accomodation and work placement. In this case the project is an exchange, i.e., Finnish students will come to Siegen for a four-week work placement as well.



 The aim of the projects is to give apprentices the opportunity to experience living and working abroad. The ,Berufskolleg‘ would like to increase the number of students taking part in projects throughout Europe. The work placement gives people the chance to use their skills in completely different settings than they are used to at home and thus they experience how work is done in foreign companies. Furthermore, the projects serve to broaden their language skills in everyday situations as well as in a business context and apart from that, they increase their intercultural competence. As a result, the projects help the students to mature on a personal level and to become more open-minded regarding foreign cultures. All in all, the students develop a better understanding of the diversity in Europe and therefore they can identify with the idea of Europe.



 A ,Europass Mobility‘ as well as a work placement certificate will be given to the participants. It is anticipated that these documents will help the students when applying for suitable jobs on an international level. Thus, the projects are of great importance to the ,Berufskolleg Wirtschaft und Verwaltung‘. As a certified ,Europaschule‘ it is constantly striving to strengthen its international-oriented profile. The network of international partner organisations is to be expanded to give students various opportunities to take part in international mobility projects.



 The whole region of Siegen-Wittgenstein as a location for international business and a high export share, profits from the apprentices‘ international orientation as skilled and open-minded employees are much-needed in an internationally operating company. Mobility projects certainly contribute to achieving this goal.
Jak to funguje v malých firmách v zahraničí?

The project is submitted and coordinated by Business Academy and Higher Professional School in Valašské Meziříčí which plans to involve students into international mobilities offering work experience in London.  London seems to be an ideal place because it is one of the biggest and most important business and financial centres in Europe.  Therefore there is a large number of companies suitable for work experience.

The main objective of the project is the use and extension of professional skills and knowledge in work experience with an active use of professional terminology in the English language.  English is the lingua franca in business and IT fields.
Other objectives are obtaining high-quality experience within real companies, the development of professional specialisation, qualification extension by work experience abroad, improvement in competitiveness, better job opportunities both in the Czech Republic and in the EU, personal skills development (e. g. ability to work on one’s own and responsibility), the innovation of specialised subjects curricula to meet potential employers’ requirements and improvement in competitiveness and reputation of the school.

The work experience will involve 30 students of the 3rd and 4th year of study studying Business Academy, Information Technology and Public Administration. There will be 2 flows of 2-weeks long work experience. The students might work as: receptionists, administrators, web pages graphic designers, web pages editors, IT technicians, sales assistants and customer service assistants for companies or organizations such as travel agencies, shops, educational institutions, local community organizations. The trainees will have a full-time job, which means an 8-hour working day. Working hours will usually be from 9.00 to 17.00 (or from 8.00 to 16.00, from 10.00 to 18.00). The trainees will be carrying out some of the following tasks according to their positions:
- copying
- faxing
- scanning
- word processing
- e-mail correspondence
- using MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
- repairing computers, notebooks and another IT equipment
- web research
- updating
- marketing
- products promotion
- ordering goods
- dealing with complaints
- market research
- web pages design and editing
- filing
- using Photoshop
- sale
- dealing with customers
- business correspondence
- etc.

The partner organisation is ADC College, which is responsible for choice of high-quality employers according to completed CVs and filled registration forms. In addition, ADC College will arrange accommodation, transfer, Oyster cards and insurance for the trainees. Business Academy is responsible for the selection of the trainees according to the stated criteria (e. g. test in specialised subjects, motivation, test of language skills and good manners). Business Academy will organise preparatory courses in specialised subjects, language and cultural background and risks prevention training. Business Academy will also arrange transportation to and from London.

Project and quality management will be legally ensured by the following documents:
1) letter of intent, 2) contract between Business Academy and ADC College, 3) individual contracts between Business Academy and the trainees including the annexes stating the particular work tasks.
Mentoring and monitoring will be carried out by 3 subjects: 1) accompanying persons, 2) country manager from ADC College, 3) mentors at particular work places. There will be issued 2 certificates, i. e.  Europass Mobility documents and certificates issued by ADC College. Final reports (participant reports and a beneficiary report) will be completed after the work experience. 

Expected results and impact on the trainees are the following: gain of new knowledge, acquirement of new competences (knowledge, skills and attitudes) and their improvement and improvement in study results. Competences of accompanying persons are expected to improve as well.
Longer term benefits for the students are: bigger motivation towards further study, participation in other projects, extension of qualification, bigger chances to be admitted to study at colleges or universities, improvement in competitiveness at job market.
Longer term benefits for Business Academy are: knowledge transfer from working environment and its following implementation into the curricula of specialised subjects and the English language, improvement in work experience management in the Czech Republic, improvement in teaching, better reputation, increase in the number of applicants for study, colleagues’ motivation to be involved in other projects, better preparation and management of further projects thanks to the experience gained.

This project intends to enable 24 students of a secondary VET college in Wels to broaden their personal, educational as well as professional experience by spending three weeks in London. The stay is divided into two parts: during the first week the participating students are going to attend a preparatory language & culture course which should help them overcome linguistic difficulties and make them feel more comfortable in a new culture and environment. The second and third week is set out to enrich the participants’ work experience at a London based company. By being accommodated in a host family, the desired linguistic and cultural output of the project should be further strengthened.

The most obvious and also important objective of this project is allowing the participating students to use their acquired language skills in an “authentic” environment, thus guaranteeing enhancement in terms of language control. Further, intercultural awareness and international mobility will be promoted, social and personal skills strengthened and the participants will get a unique chance to establish first international contacts which might prove helpful in their future as working professionals.

The successful realization of this project will also have a considerable impact on students’ attitude towards foreign language acquisition and the reputation of our school as a progressive educational institution. Specific measures to inform non-participating students and teachers as well as the local community and industry about the project, its importance and success will be taken.

The 24 selected participants are currently attending the third grade of the Chemistry department of a secondary VET college in Wels, Austria. All participants have been studying English for at least seven years and are highly motivated and open-minded students who are excited to learn and experience new things in life. They regard this project as an “adventure” and we are convinced that it will further motivate and show them that there are almost endless possibilities for (intercultural) learning and personal development, which are only waiting to be explored.
,,Spielen kennt keine Grenzen – Spielen als internationale Sprache“

The DAA – Vocational Schools for Social Pedagogy in Aalen and Goeppingen have been educating and qualifying child care workers, kindergarten teachers, and nursery nurses for 3 years now. As part of this on-the-job training and full-time schooling, we want to provide the future state-certified social assistants with the opportunity to make international experiences abroad.
Those experiences are meant to improve the language skills and to provide the participants with an insight into other educational systems and various pedagogical approaches internationally. 
The realization of a project in the field of “play“ enables participants to actively take part in the process of education and caring abroad. Thus “play“ becomes the international language.
The different aspects of “play“ and their pedagogical effects enable an easy implementation and realization in foreign institutions. It also guarantees good conditions for a quick integration process. The projects will be prepared and planned in workshops at the Vocational Schools for Social Pedagogy. Subsequently, the projects will be methodically evaluated. 
Our students can broaden their horizon of experience especially concerning pedagogical concepts, as well as national and international educational systems.  The participants will make various experiences which strengthen their personality and which will improve their educational skills.
A sustainable benefit is created by the enhancement and expansion of the language and action competence of the future social assistants. This also leads to better integration chances on the national and international job markets.
Projekt: Austausch niederländischer und deutscher Auszubildender im kaufmännischen Bereich

P:ANDA / apprentices in commercial occupations demonstrate their mobility by doing a three week internship in a company of the host country. Partners in this project are the Carl Theodor School in Schwetzingen in the Federal Republic of Germany and the ROC Horizon College in Hoorn in the Netherlands or the ADC College in London in the United Kindom. 



P:ANDA is an exchange project for apprentices in the commercial sector. 

The exchange of students of Carl Theodor School in Schwetzingen (Germany) ) lasts in each case three weeks. The participants are in their final year of training. 

Project participants  are five apprentices in the 3nd training year for tradesman in wholesale and foreign trade, office administrator, dialogmarketing or industrial sales, the teacher and the companies with competent instructors, the supervising teachers of the Colleges and the local training companies. 

The project allows students to implement their acquired theoretical knowledge in a practical business. More and more companies are not only working locally but also all around Europe and therefore require employees who have the experience and willingness to move abroad. 

This internship increases the possibilities of the participants in their future working environment. 

The usage of the English language, in occupational and private settings increases constantly. Communication in English is encouraged during the internship, since the working language in the exchange companies is English. The aim is to reduce existing inhibitions of students talking in a foreign language and to improve their communication skills. 

Through intensive study of another country, the socio-cultural competence of students is strengthened. They discover differences in lifestyle between Germans and foreigners, but also commonalities of the societies. 

Students can test their competence in project work in this exchange with the foreign country especially during local meetings, school visits, events planning and coordination work. Like this their autonomy is encouraged in a special way. 

Also the exchange of their intercultural competence is promoted, as the stay abroad allows a change of perspective which shows a different life and work environment. 

In this way the students learn a lot about the country, the people, the training standards and the demands of a job in the host country. They lose their shyness to work in a foreign country or to collaborate with foreign trading partners. At the end of the projekt the students receive the europass, which confirm her competence. The persons, which accompanies the students are able to make experience with the educational standards. They can see the commonalities and the differences between the countries, the schoolsystems and the market requirements.

The accompanying teachers get to know the other training standards. They gain experience in terms of the requirements that are imposed on workers in the commercial sector in the European labor market. They can also see the differences and similarities in education and in the school systems. Overall, these insights allow the trainees to prepare targeted to the needs of the future job market.
Kościerski Ekonomik zdobywa nowe doświadczenia w dziedzinie kształcenia zawodowego

The participants of the project entitled: "Kościerski Ekonomik gains new experiences in the field of vocational training" will be the third-year students of  technical college  technician in food and catering services (15 people) and technician in economy (15 people) of the District School No. 1 in Kościerzyna. They will take four-week work experience in different institutions of catering, business and administration industries in Harrow and London, in the UK. The project also provides weekly mobility of teaching staff in economic vocational training (6 people).

The main objective of the project is to increase, through participation in a foreign internship,  mobility of people who are at the stage of initial vocational training ( students of technical college) and the experience exchange in the field of vocational training. Professional training institutions identified by the project partner will enable participants to acquire the practical skills needed in the profession, getting familiar with British catering and economical standards. Participation in the project will also facilitate the introduction of customer service techniques, methods of preparing the hall, with the preparation of dishes-made on the basis of the various components, based on the tradition of British cuisine. The project will also support young entrepreneurs who want to start a business in Poland and will show them rules for opening a business in another country, they will become familiar with the policy of human resources, accounting and marketing activities.

Thanks to participation in the project students will improve their professional skills in organizing the catering business, entrepreneurship, creativity, ability to communicate in a foreign language and the ability to work in an international team. Teachers will increase their competence in the field of transfer of European standards in vocational training to the local ground. All participants will also expand the knowledge of British culture. At the end of the internship the students will receive the Europass Mobility, an assessment of the internship issued by the employers, and all participants will receive a certificate of participation in mobility exhibited by the ADC College.
Péče o seniory v Evropě - Elderly care in Europe

The project Elderly care in Europe is focused on the initial professional training of the third-grade students of the secondary health medical school majoring in nursing and the second-grade students of the medical college – branches Diploma general nurse and Diploma nutrition therapist. Within the project, two-week specialized practical trainings in London will be implemented. 40 students from our school will participate.

The main goal of the project is to extend and innovate professional training at our school through such experience abroad. By putting the project into practise, students should be able to compare nursing and nutrition care in Great Britain and Slovakia with the Czech one. 

No less substantial aim is the support of foreign language qualification, possibility to check the ability to communicate in a foreign language and broadening the vocabulary in the field of professional medical English. Thanks to the multicultural enviroment, indisputably provided in the city of London, students will also gain knowledge in the sphere of cultural and mental differences of foreign citizens and the development of their personal qualities (like independence, responsibility, tolerance) will also be supported.

Professional experience is the part of educational programmes of the above mentioned branches. Professional educational stays abroad are to be planned for the very same period when the other students will take part in such working experience in the Czech Republic. After successful finishing of the practical training, students will be given a Europass Mobility and the training will be acknowledged as part of the compulsory practical training.

The output of the project will be a specialist courses for students from the other grades focused on the comparison of experiences gained in the work places in London and in the Czech Republic, or, more precisely, oddities and differences in nursing and nutritional care in the United Kingdom. The mobility participants will present their conclusions and outputs from the project in form of presentations accompanied by photodocumentation.

Results of and knowledge gained during the educational stay will also be presented in our school’s magazine, website and in the local press.
Dobry zawód otwiera drzwi do Europy

Meeting the needs of its students, the Secondary Schools Complex in Malbork No 3 prepares the youth to find their own  place in more and more demanding job market. Creating friendly educating atmosphere the school enables the  students to achieve a wide range of professions such as hotel management technician, tourism service technician,  logistics technician, information technology technician.
The school involves students in numerous community and charity events which influences cultivating their characters. Thanks to the professional staff and the headmaster Mr Stawicki who is a very energetic and open to innovations  person, the school is a leader in vocational schools rankings
The number of students who succeeded in plentiful vocational competitions as well as high results of the final exams, which are much better than local and national results, prove the fact of the quality of the school and making the right decisions. Close cooperation and visiting  the colleges educating in similar occupations, undoubtedly  bear fruits. Such events as meetings with successful business people also help our students  look forward positively.
“A good profession opens the entrance to Europe” is a project which the Secondary Schools Complex in Malbork No 3 is going to elaborate together with the foreign business partner ADC College. The aim of the project is to use and develop the professional skills altogether with Information Technology, as well as social,  personal and language skills. That will enable the trainees to  gain work experience, professional awareness by finding out about opportunities and perspectives of the chosen occupation and enhance the chances to get a job. 
Enabling the students to  participate in apprenticeship in foreign companies, which apply modern technologies and European standards, will help the trainees obtain professional  competences in the future workplaces thanks to new abilities such as language, interpersonal and culture skills. 
The  project  presents the idea of four- week professional apprenticeship, prepared for September/ October 2015, for thirty students  from the third technical classes in the occupations of: hotel management, tourism service,  logistics, information technology technicians. There are also two attendant teachers who take care of the participating students.
The school is responsible for recruitment and preparing the participants of the project to departure. The students are to take part in series of classes which are especially arranged to equip them with the appropriate  knowledge about culture, character of professions and other useful  information. The participants will take language tests to check their language skills.
The transit from Malbork to the destination place is ensured. ADC College organizes stay  at chosen host families, that will be a chance for the students to familiarize with British culture and practice their language skills. Accommodation will be supervised by the teachers. Full board is also provided to the participants by the host families. Additionally, all the participants will be insured.
ADC College is also responsible for choosing appropriate places of apprenticeship, accordingly to the aims of the project, as well as for commuting of the participants. 
Planned accomplishment of the apprenticeship will be inspected by checking notes in the apprenticeship journals and on visits. The journals and a detailed plan will be prepared before the beginning.  The supervisors  will be responsible for marking the students’ apprenticeship time. The mark is an  integrated part of the journal and it will be the primary and essential part to complete the training.
ADC College in agreement  with the employers will deliver a special document certifying completing the apprenticeship.
The participants will have the chance to accomplish the apprenticeship,  develop their passions  and broaden professional knowledge. Taking part in such project will influence personal development of the participants, increase their independence, responsibility and resourcefulness, it will rise their self-confidence and self – esteem  as well as improve their self- assessment.
Achieved competences will  be confirmed with Europass Mobility document. By  participating in the project the school will increase the attractiveness of vocational educating program and will improve its quality. That will be the chance to indicate where new development’s  and work’ s  perspectives  are.
The position of school in the local environment  as well as regarding  the school by the local society will also benefit.  By completing the project the school will develop even closer relationship with the students’  parents, local businesspeople, administration units and press.
Auslandserfahrung von Auszubildenden im Rahmen eines Betriebspraktikum in England

One aim of a future oriented vocational education is to consider the needs of the world of work. Therefore the Wilhelm-Schickard-Schule Tübingen supports their apprentices by providing attractive educational opportunities to aquire profond English language skills and high quality learning outcomes in order to achieve succesful educational qualifications. Taking part in work experience programme in England makes the interns aware of cultural differences and common European values. The experiences of an internship abroad motivates the students to lifelong learning and being an active part of society and work life. 

Within the two flows 10 interns are taking part in a three week work experience programme each time. The project takes place in coordination with the apprenticing companies each in November 2013 and 2014. The students are educated in the dual system in a commercial vocational training. The students either take on additional lessons two times a week in the evenings in order to aquire a higher national educational qualification or work for a company with international business relations. The use of English beyond the lessons is essential for the target group. They use the language in their further education and in work life. The students already have a good command of English language skills in order to meet the requirements for an internship in an English campany. They have the chance to further develop their language skills through practical application.

With the help of our project partner ADC college the students take part in a one-week course that prepares them to the specific situations and cultural features in the English professional life. During the subsequent two-week work placement  the students learn about processes in an English company and deal with simple activities . The reflection of the gained experiences in a project diary allows a comparison of the operational processes and the characteristics of collegial cooperation of the foreign company with the training company .

The Participants will acquire skills that can be transfered to future professional situations. The acquired skills increase the willingness , courage and qualification to work in a business with international operations. This experiences will prepare them for the changing demands of a European labor market in terms of flexibility , mobility and intercultural competence. The focus is on the idea of a united Europe without borders .

The Wilhelm-Schickard-Schule supports the needs of regional cooperation partners with institutionalized programs for the acquisition of English language skills . The focus on the needs of the trainees and the requests of the apprenticing companies is a key success factor of a future oriented vocational education at the Wilhelm-Schickard-Schule Tübingen.

The project is intended to promote the European idea in the school, i.e. the development of student and staff mobility. In addition to the cross-cultural and professional experiences, the students will develop their personality . The aim of the project is to promote mobility across national borders, to give the students confidence in their abilities, and exchange practical professional as well as language skills.
Together with the ADC College in London, the participating teachers of Nelly-Puetz-vocational colleges have developed a three-week programme. The participants first attend a professional-oriented language course and then do an internship in London companies and institutions. Consequently, the range of Nelly-Puetz-vocational college can be expanded by a project that supports the preparation of students for an increasingly internationalized and European work environment and allows space for personal development and a strengthening of European values such as acceptance and integration.
The project involves students of the Dual System in the hotel, restaurant and hair-dressers’ trades, care workers as well as those of the College for Social Pedagogy.
The project combines a one-week language course with a two-week internship in different institutions and companies.
The preceding language course will improve language skills of the students to the effect that they will get along well in everyday life, but especially during their internship in England.
The main aim of the internship is to provide first international experiences for students. These will be very valuable for their professional future either with international guests or customers in Germany or abroad.
Other aims for all groups are, of course, the improvement of the communicative competence and the acquisition of key skills, such as social and intercultural competence.
The students create an illustrated blog in the form of a travel diary about their stay, their personal and professional experiences.
Trainees go abroad to look for new horizons

Under the name of „trainees go abroad to look for new horizons” the Berufliche Schulzentrum Schongau (Vocational School Center Schongau) in cooperation with its project partner - the  ADC College in London -  is organizing an international Leonardo mobility project this  year for the first time. Thirty clerical trainees in industries such as bank, office, retail, wholesale, automobile and industry will get the chance to spend three weeks in London to experience firsthand life and work in this world-city. First of all the participants are going to take part in a one-week language course at the ADC College which is intended to broaden both their general and their professional language skills and take away their fears of communicating in a foreign language. After that the trainees are going to complete an internship of two weeks at selected London companies to encounter the British way of working in respective operating structures.  Furthermore, the students are going to be accommodated with London guest families for their whole stay in England in order to get to know a wide spectrum of cultural aspects and practices of British lifestyle.
The objectives of the project are to enlarge the international orientation of the Vocational School Center Schongau through a first European cooperation as well as to increase the attractiveness of the vocational training. Secondly, the project is aimed to improve the quality of school and tuition by combining theoretical contents with practical applications in an international environment.  Through this stay in a foreign country the participating trainees are supposed to increase their English language skills and to improve their intercultural awareness for the interaction with people of a different nationality in both social and professional environment.  Many of the German companies where our students are doing their training already have foreign customers and suppliers and expect from their employees to be able to communicate and interact accordingly so that they can be sent off to foreign assignments at their global plants. At the same time the participants should develop competences during their stay in Great Britain that are demanded by almost any employer today: Mobility, flexibility, self-reliance and open-mindedness for new challenges. By gaining these competences our students are meant to qualify for the European job market. We hope to train their European awareness and motivate them for further trainings of this kind after the completion of their vocational training. Above that, we expect that through this project our trainees will improve their learning skills and professional competences especially in the field of marketing. They will be given a specific work assignment on this topic namely to compare marketing strategies of German and British companies and asked to present the results accordingly. The outcomes are to be used by the teachers of the Vocational School Center Schongau for their various subjects such as English or marketing communication and collected materials e.g. flyers and leaflets could be used as visual aids in class.  Furthermore, the participating companies where our students are doing their training as well as other local enterprises can use the results in order to reconsider their own marketing strategies and generate new ideas in the field of marketing communication. Finally, the fact that trainees take part in international projects might help participating companies to advertise training vacancies in the future.

The vocational college BSZ Wertheim would like to give participants the opportunity to take part in an internship in London, UK, in order to broaden their horizon and realize the idea of the European unification.
The main objective of the project can be identified as the improvement and development of the language and the professional skills of the participants. In addition, we consider the development of social, intercultural and personal competences just as important for the partakers. The aim will be an integral and extensive broadening of their horizon. As result the internship should have a clearly positive impulse for their professional career improving their chances on the employment market. Furthermore the experiences gained should help them further develop their personality in order to become responsible and self-confident members of the European society, in which they should take an active part. The project also aims at promoting tolerance and the European understanding by creating networks and establishing new links on a professional as well as on a private level.
The ten participants of the project will have mostly finished their second year of training of becoming Industrial Clerks. They will have the opportunity to do a two- to three-week internship with a company situated in London. The ADC College in London will be in charge of the organizational matters taking care of welcoming the participants and of finding them an appropriate company for an internship. The participants’ objectives will be to use their professional skills in a new work environment and by doing so they will further develop and improve those entrepreneurial skills. While the main objective clear is the professional development, the cultural and social aspects of such a stay must not be forgotten or underestimated. The trainees will also take part in cultural life of the city of London which has much to offer. In some cases the participants will receive lessons in English specializing in their professional fields. Those tutoring lessons will take place at the ADC College itself. This is also true for the mentoring sessions which every participant will receive as part of the program. In those a mentor will evaluate the student’s progress on the program, verify the quality of the placement and discuss areas of improvement with the participant.
A staff member of the sending organization, BSZ Wertheim, will also be present during the first days of the internships in order to support the students but also to monitor the progress and the quality of the project.
As a result of the internships the students should develop various competences on a linguistic, professional, social and intercultural level. In the process they should use their ideas and skills, examine and reconsider them and as a result develop and improve them. Consequently they should also strengthen their own personality and thus become mature members of the European society and also confident employees. 
But the development in the process of the project should not be limited to a small number of people. By publishing the experiences we anticipate a development for both the school community as well as for the companies and the entire region of Wertheim, Baden-Wuerttemberg. The project should prove to be a vivid example for the ideas and hopes of the European unification. In consequence we hope to help strengthening the authority of the European Union and their institutions. And as a positive side effect the project will help to support a friendly relationship between the people in Europe and essentially worldwide.
PROGRAMME DE FORMATION PROFESSIONNELLE EN IMMERSION

This project aims to offer young people at vocational school - some of whom have never been abroad and have not necessarily benefited from international contact – the opportunity to carry out one of their training periods in a European Union country in order to develop their autonomy, to discover a different working culture and environment, as well as to improve their language skills.

Our first mobility project enabled us to send 14 business students abroad and their very positive feedback has encouraged us to renew the project this year. 

We have chosen to offer this opportunity primarily to pupils in their penultimate year of the Business Studies Vocational Baccalaureate. The commercial sector offers many opportunities for work placements, allowing participants to achieve the objectives stipulated in the curriculum during their on-the-job training. The main activities which participants will carry out during their work experience include: welcoming customers, preparing sales, providing advice, acquiring technical knowledge about products that is necessary to sell them, communicating in the workplace and the ability to adapt to the characteristics of the country (sizes, measures, currencies, cultural customs...).

This sector has the advantage of allowing young people to be in contact with customers in the target country, which is a great training tool on both cultural and linguistic levels.

We would also like to offer this experience to pupils in their penultimate year of the Management and Administration Vocational Baccalaureate. This revised baccalaureate has replaced that in Secretarial Skills and Accountancy and now offers better prospects for work placements abroad with regard to the skills to be validated - welcoming in person, answering the telephone and administrative management tasks that involve less expertise but more versatility. As such, we will need to envisage a level of fluency in the language of the target country as a prerequisite.

At the end of their training, the young people will be encouraged to apply to different types of organisation (associations, local authorities, small or medium-sized businesses...) requiring linguistic knowledge that favours exchanges with foreign partners.

Participants will be accommodated with host families in England or in B&Bs for young students in Spain; they will be looked after and monitored by tutors of the intermediary organisations, who will offer logistical support as necessary. 

Participants will need to validate the professional skills referenced in the curriculum of the Vocational Baccalaureate in Business Studies. Academic evaluation grids will be translated into the target languages and assessments will be made by the tutors of the intermediary host bodies.

Thanks to this stay, participants will learn about various practices and professional organisations. They will open up to other working cultures. This should enable them to progress in languages and give a sense to their learning modern languages. 

The potential benefits in the long term - in addition to cultural openness and better understanding of the challenges and benefits of a European area - are to offer better prospects for integration and pursuing studies in higher education and a better ability to integrate and evolve in the working world.
Berufliche, sprachliche und interkulturelle Kompetenzen durch Mobilität in der Erstausbildung

Markets in the European Union have been growing together for many years. Frankfurt as centre of the Rhine – Main area is not only the place of the European Central Bank but also the residence of many international businesses. This development has been accompanied by the requirement of at least one spoken foreign language, mostly English as lingua franca. Most of the companies our trainees work for put a great attention on the trainees’ school marks which often are  decisive for their employments.  The level of their knowledge of English is a great part of it. Training companies are publishers, advertising and event companies, media and information services -especially at university libraries or similar organisations -, whoesale and foreign trade companies.  They also put a great attention on imparting the core skills in the business and administration sector, as flexibility, social competence, the ability to work in a team and cross-cultural competences. 

Consequently, receiving and improving these required qualifications as well as raising awareness for the challenges and possibilities of the EU are the objectives of our project. Furthermore the students are supposed to enhance their ability of self-organisation. They are involved in finding a partner company, writing their applications and booking  journey/flight and accomodation. The project coordinator and/or the partner companies will support them.

The placements will mostly take place during the second year of vocational training. The students will then have gained work experience and they will have attended the language courses at Stauffenbergschule. This will help them to adapt to the new business and cultural environment with the partner companies.

The periods of the placements  will differ mostly between  2 and 6 weeks depending on the common agreement between student, employer and partner company. If possible, they  will include the school holidays in order to prevent the students from missing too many lessons.

The project coordinator will make sure that the objectives of the Erasmus + project mentioned above will always be contents of the contract between Stauffenbergschule, employer, student and receiving company and will monitor the observance of the contract. To reach a comparability of the received competences , they will be described by using ECVET.

The project is aimed at the apprentices of three fields of study:  a three-year cook and waiter course, a three-year shop assistant course and a four-year merchant course. The group of trainees will be composed of 7 waiters, 4 shop assistants and 4 merchants.
The partnership is composed of two partner organisations: our school as a coordinating and at the same time sending organisation and The ADC College as a hosting organisation that will place the trainees into particular restaurants and shops. They will also take care of their accommodation and meals in London hosting families. English will be the language of communication. The ADC College is an educational facility that has been operating in Great Britain since 2009 and has a long-lasting experience with mobility within the scope of former Leonardo da Vinci Programme.
The subject matter of our project is a two- week placement of the trainees in restaurants and shops as waiters and shop assistants. The objective of the project is to present / introduce the trainees into the issues of restaurant and shop operation in Great Britain. All 15 trainees will take part in their placement at the same time but they will work individually in several different companies, which means, that the highest degree of independence is guaranteed. After a thorough language preparation the trainees will take part in their placements in March-April 2015.
During their stay in partner hosting organisations the trainees will acquire a range of elementary work operations in the field of restaurant service and preparation of dishes or working of shops and stores in London.
The outcome of the placement is acquiring new experience in the field of participants’ educational specialisation, language improvement in a common conversation as well as a special terminology. The stay will contribute to the extension of important personal experience. After completing the placement each trainee will receive the certificate of placement - a Europass Mobility.
Individuelle Förderung beruflicher und interkultureller Kompetenzen durch Auslandspraktika - Teil II

It is a major concern of the Hans-Böckler Berufskolleg to ensure a work-orientated education and encourage open-mindedness, tolerance and interest in cultural diversity.
