The following projects will prepare students from the business, media and science department adequately for the European job market. Approximately 60 students have the opportunity to gain work experience in countries like Poland, Great Britain, Spain, Malta, Iceland, and Norway by being part of international teams, and collaborating on common tasks and projects. Language skills as well social, cultural and content-based competences will be developed and advanced. The students will benefit from this projects by gaining a competitive advantage on the job market because they are acquainted to a variety of innovative work techniques and routines. Teachers will benefit from this project equally in terms of further methodical training and the exposure to a variety of languages in order to ensure bilingualism at school. A further goal is the initiation and deepening of collaborations of fellow organisations, companies and schools within Europe to lay foundations for further projects in the future.

BBA Oldenburg (an initial vocational school in Germany) wants to convey new inspirations and experiences to its students and lecturers.
Students and lecturers shall be able to establish ties with European colleagues and participate in European networks.
Necessities for the planned experiences are generated by changes in society (Europe 2020 strategy) and health systems (Health 2020 strategy) all over Europe.
The participants are to improve important skills (job-related and soft skills) through mobility. They shall communicate and interact with colleagues in Europe and deal cross-border with current professional and societal themes. The participants acknowledge lifelong learning and mobility as job-relevant themes in the EU.
The expectance in dealing with European themes is that the participants identify themselves with the EU and act as active EU-Citizens.
To achieve the mentioned goals, ten participants of the BBA Oldenburg will undertake a mobility activity abroad.
Eight students in their first year of training will take part in a fieldwork placement in a European country. Two lecturers of the BBA will participate in a Meeting of the "European Network of Occupational Therapy in Higher Education" (ENOTHE) in Nijmegen.
The Experiences of the participants are evaluated afterwards. Gained knowledge and competences are integrated in the further vocational training.
Mobility for Trainees in HR Services and HR Management III

The increasing internationalization of Human Resources in large enterprises and in the HR services sector has raised the demand for intercultural, foreign language and transnational professional competences of the employed people in this sector. The employees in HR and HR services highly contribute to the mobility of the European workforce by recruiting and placing people transnationally. That is why we think it is important to provide our future HR experts with international experience themselves at first. 



The participants, who are trainees in their 2nd year in a German dual traineeship which leads to the qualification “HR Services Consultant”, do 3-week work placements in different European countries. There are two ways of finding placements for them. Either our partners on Malta or in London provide suitable placements for our students or the students and their German training companies seek for a suitable host company themselves. The work placements take place in HR departments of larger companies or at HR services providers. The students get familiar with typical business processes in their host companies such as recruiting and working with staff as well as with customers. 



Our aim is to qualify our students for HR operations in an international context such as recruiting and placing staff cross-borderly, preparing employees for assignments abroad and communicating  with branches and subsidiaries in other countries. Therefore they need to be familiar with the HR tools and procedures in foreign countries. Also they require the relevant HR language to communicate effectively with business partners and employees. We also expect an improvement of the employability, the learning performance as well as the future mobility of our participants.
Auslandspraktika für Jugendliche in der beruflichen Erstausbildung

The project concerned is aimed at two target groups which have a common project background: improving personal competences and removing mobility obstacles. The primary project goals are therefore:

- Improving vocational competences

- Promoting intercultural competences

- Improving foreign-language competences and

- Encouraging general mobility.

The two target groups can be described as follows:

Group A:

24 trainees in their first dual vocational training as “management assistants in wholesale and foreign trade“ or as “management assistants in the manufacturing industry“. They are students of the part-time Vocational School in the first and second year of their three-year courses. The overwhelming majority of the participants have either the University of Applied Sciences Entrance Qualification or even the University Entrance Qualification.

Group B:

13 students of the last year (grade 12) of the Vocational College, speciality Foreign Languages – European Course. The required entrance qualification for this two-year full-time course is “Fachoberschulreife“, which is equivalent to the British GCSE qualification. 

The parties taking part within the framework of this placing project are Friedrich-List-Berufskolleg, Hamm (D), Hull College, Hull (UK), Srednja Skola, Biograd na Moru (HR), Alparslan Ticaret Meslek Lisesi, Istanbul (TU), ADC College, London (UK) and Lycée Professionnel Saint-Exupéry, St. Dizier (F). This project is focussed on providing foreign work placements for youths in their first vocational training. One intention of this partnership is to meet the rising demand for well-qualified young people expressed by companies located in Hamm and the surrounding area. These companies require young employees which have vocational as well as foreign-language competences. Very often companies criticize the school education of youths and their lack of  job mobility, which is inseparably linked to personal mobility. Qualifying youths for a European labour market is also one of the general goals of Erasmus+, especially now that the German employment agencies also offer to provide jobs EU-wide. In this connection it is a crucial task to enable young people in the best possible way to meet the requirements they are challenged by in order to improve their employment chances. A work placement abroad will sustainably promote the achievement of the required qualifications.

Especially the young people’s foreign-language competence will be substantially improved, but they will also acquire new skills with regard their first vocational training, which particularly applies to the trainees of group A. They will also gain more knowledge in the field of new information and communication technologies and gather new experiences about economic structures and socio-cultural conditions of the foreign country. The work placements will be done in selected companies of the regions East Riding and North Lincolnshire as well as Outer London (UK), Lorraine (F), Dalmatia (HR) and Istanbul (TU).
KSZTAŁCIMY ZAWODOWO! - INNOWACYJNOŚĆ I PRZEDSIĘBIORCZOŚĆ W KSZTAŁCENIU ZAWODOWYM

The aim of the project is to acquaint the participants with the working conditions, organization of vocational education system as well as the support system  for adult education in the countries of western Europe. The aim is to acquire the knowledge of economic rules concerning enterprise functioning, work organization , techniques and technology used in logistics and IT.
Activities in the project are devoted to students, teachers of vocational subjects, job adviser , the member of management board in Zespół Szkół Ponadgimnazjalnych nr 1 in Brzesko and representatives of Local Council in Brzesko.
Third- year students of Technical School of Logistics ( 8 students) and Technical School of IT 8 students)  will participate in 4-week vocational training in Valencia ( Spain). We intend to leave in November 2014. When it comes to the teachers’ visit “ exchanging experience” , 12 teachers and 2 representatives of Local Council will take part in  it. These will be people chosen by the district governor. They will influence  vocational education in borough of Brzesko. The visit is planned in August so that the teachers’ absence  will not  disturb the organization of the school year.
Teachers taking part in “ exchanging experience” will be acquinted with organization of vocational education on the level of vocational schools and technical schools .They will focus on vocational training. They will see technical equipment, laboratories and classrooms. They will learn about enterprices where dual teaching takes place.
This project will enable our  teachers to compare Polish and English vocational teaching environments. Ideas and solutions observed can contribute to modernization of teaching in Zespół Szkół Ponadgimnazjalnych nr 1. One of the most  essential factors will be breaking the  social and culture barriers, which will make it possible to make new contacts and exchanging experience. Gained experience will make teaching more effective and it will modernize educational offer including  educational offer for adults. The will compare  Polish standars , based on syllabus and examination standards, with standars in Great Britain. Teachers will become familiar with technical innovations, will see modern devices, technologies, work organization and education. They will hear about educational opportunities that are possible thanks to mobile technologies.  Participation of Local Council representatives will enable to use gained experience in improving educational system as they are persons who are responsible for  education and its budget in our borough.
Students’ participation in a work placement. 
The main objective of activities aimed at students is to prepare them for their profession and the work placement itself is one of the major stages of the preparation. An opportunity to obtain certificates confirming the internship abroad will be particularly important to young people in the process of job searching and it will definitely reinforce their position on the job market.
The range of activities related to vocational education on particular positions will be in accordance with the work placement programme that is wrought on the grounds of the curriculum of a specific profession. The curriculum was sent to our partner in Spain while we were working on the project preparation. The duration of the work placement has been planned  to last four weeks, which is concordant with the curriculum of a vocational secondary school. “Esmovia” (our Spanish partner) has a lot of experience in organizing work placement for students from all over Europe, which ensures workmanlike preparation and choice of internship places. Thanks to taking part in the work placement the participants get some additional professional skills which are then of importance on the Polish job market. Equally, these skills will create more professional opportunities for the participants and might turn out to be helpful in choosing future career, e.g. setting up one’s own company or applying for a position anywhere in Europe.  These goals will be achieved by following the specific targets:
- getting familiar with new technical solutions and new technology,
- exchanging thoughts,
- enriching professional vocabulary,
- developing mobility, professional independence and also responsibility for oneself,
- facilitating the beginning of an adult life,
- creating an open attitude towards novelty and also getting to know new people
The project has been planned for one year, to start on the 1st July 2014 and finish on the 30st June 2015. The work placement abroad is planned to take place in August and November/ December 2014.

The " A student in a foreign labor market " is addressed to students of the Post-secondary Medical School  in Morawica , who are in highest semester  of their studies, trained in the profession of massage therapist, n=beauty therapist and nursing assistant . Applying institution  is  Post-secondary Medical School  in Morawica . Partner institution is  Europe Training Ltd. of Plymouth in the UK, which has many years of experience in project management of the Leonardo da Vinci programme.

      The main objectives of the project is to enable students who are still learning the profession , gain work experience abroad and to raise the level of their communication skills in both general and professional English . An important point of the project would be to provide the Participants with participation certificates  including  Europass Mobility. . Participants will be able to know the organization and work culture in health care and implemented programs for rehabilitation , wellness , cosmetic services and medical care as well as to develop their skills and competences , linguistic and social . The practice will complement the curriculum by creating a way of knowing the actual application of various techniques in cosmetic treatment or wellness . The purpose of the placemst is to prepare the listener for independent work , decision-making and high culture of customer service.

       The project is also necessary to meet the objectives of the development plan of the Post-secondary Medical School in Morawica , in which the priority is to upgrade the facility to adapt it to European standards of education and practical training and educate qualifiied and skilled pupils prepared to face challenges in the European labour market .

      The result of the Project will not only be the experience gained by the participants but also the supplemented school knowledge in areas related to the organization of health in the UK. The project will promote shaping qualities such as creativity and flexibility in the performance of professional tasks.

Three-week placements will be realized in two groups on the following dates :

- Group I - 13.04 . - 01.05. 2015 -8 people ( massage therapist, beauty therapist and nursing assistant) )

- Group II - Group II - 4.04 - 22/04/2016 8 people ( massage therapist, beauty therapist and nursing assistant) )

Placements will take place in Plymouth, UK in institutions indicated by the partner and approved by the school . The project will start on 31 December 2014 , and will finish by 30 June 2016 .

The project will have not only the long-term impact on the Participants and their future career but will also increase the attractiveness of the educational offer at Post-secondary Medical School  in Morawica. This will contribute to the promotion of vocational education at  local and regional levels.

WinE - Workplacement in European Enterprises



The objective of the proposed project is to significantly improve the starting conditions of young adults for later possible occupations in foreign countries through the placement abroad . The placement also improves the employment opportunities in the native country as local and regional companies can benefit from young adults offering excellent foreign language skills and international experience.



The project particularly focuses on two groups of participants :



1)

14 participants come from the traditional field of vocational education within the dual system . The courses Industrial Business Management Assistant and Management Assistant in Wholesale and Foreign Trade train future employees in industrial and trading enterprises (training according to the Vocational Training Act / BBIG ) 

Due to the Europeanization of the economy, increasing globalization and the high export share of the German economy, these young adults will certainly have to deal with export and import transactions in their future working life.

The placement supports the trainees of the courses " Industrial Business Management Assistant " and " Management Assistant in Wholesale and Foreign Trade " in the acquisition and the use of knowledge , skills and  qualifications to be well prepared for this internationalization of companies . It promotes their personal development, employability and their willingness to participate in the European labor market.

2)

16 participants are students from the educational course Commercial Foreign Language Assistant. This is a full- time school-based educational course of vocational training by state law. The language assistants have fundamental , mainly theoretical knowledge that is complemented by professional practice. In this context, the placement serves the purpose of applying , consolidating and deepening the knowledge acquired . The aim of the placement is to apply the business and commercial knowledge and skills acquired in the full -time vocational course in practical operation. Therefore the development and promotion of economic linguistic competence is of special significance.

The foreign language assistants should gain first professional experiences abroad with a view to their future career in the framework of the placement.
Sprachliche,  berufliche und kulturelle Erfahrungen  in London

All participants are 11th grade students of the vocational schools for social care, child care and housekeeping, as well as of the dual system of vocational education. Many students grew up in rural areas and in a rather uneducated environment. They are still very young- mainly underage. Therefore, they have barley any experience with mobility projects. All students are already in their second year of their initial training programme, which means that they already have some good knowledge of the particular everyday-working-life. Due to the fact that most of the students just hold a successful certificate of secondary education (CSE) they have limited (native and foreign) language skills, which need to be improved. Additionally, most of our students haven’t had any experience with migrants so far. Their experiences refer to asylum seekers and gastarbeiter and they are rather based on prejudices. However, it is getting even more important in their kind of jobs, to get insights into working structures of other countries and to develop intercultural and personal skills through the exposure to strange cultures. 

As a result, basic project targets must be:

- Application of the English language in daily life and to reduce fears of contacts with foreign languages and cultures

- To gain professional skills by learning about new educational focuses in the partner country and through exploring the differences and similarities in the education.  

- Establishment of personal skills, like self-confidence and so on.



The number of participants is limited to 20 students per flow, since most of them are underage, which leads to a higher need of care and support. Additionally, financial costs are playing a big part, because many of our student’s families live in limited monetary boundaries, who can barely accomplish any additional cost.  

To develop a feeling for the language and to learn how to act self-respondent in an urban area, it is absolutely necessary to have a one-week language course before the placement takes place. The placement in the different professional areas lasts two weeks and gives first insights in the working-structures of the host country. The dealing with the different culture of the host country will be supported by the accompanying teachers in the afternoons of the first week and at the weekends, additional to their lives in the host families and at work of social facilities. 

The organisation of the mobility, like insurance, transportation to the airport, flight booking and flight, transportation in greater London will be done by the sending organisation. They will also help to organise special needs like visa applications.  The partner organisation is responsible for the organisation of the host families, the placement companies and the first information for the participants. During the whole mobility, the participants will be accompanied by both organisations. Placement visits  as well as personal and intercultural care and support will be done by the accompanying persons. Regular meetings at the partner organisation will be done to monitor, evaluate and ensure the learning progresses. 

There are many expected effects:

A strong personal effect on the participant’s self-confidence can be expected. The certainty to have been able to orientate in a metropolis supports the self-confidence as well as the experience to handle a new and strange situation. In the future, the willingness will be enforced to face and go through new and uncertain, anxiety-ridden situations. 

Effects on the language can be already expected during the first week of the stay, when the participants realize, that they are always able to find ways to express themselves – the main thing is that they dare to use the language. Language skills in vocabulary, through frequent speaking, as well as active and passive understanding will be improved, because the contact to migrants and British dialects require concentrated listening. 

In London-Harrow, in their families and working facilities, the participants will have contact to British people with different cultural background, which can be from Rumania, Jamaica or India. In that way they will be forced to deal with different cultures on a personal and culinary level and as well as the differences in values and conventions. This leads to a questioning of own prejudices and to a curiosity of foreign cultures.

To compare the professional facilities, the concepts and the working structure of the host country to the working situation at home and the questioning of familiar habits, lead to the ability to recognize connections and  dependencies in values of different cultural backgrounds. On a long term, that will result in a changed  attitude towards foreigners and a reduction of prejudices.

Project partners:

Project applicant: Střední odborná škola InterDACT, s. r. o., Pionýrů 2806, 434 01  Most, Czech Republic
Partnership organization: ADC College, Station House, 11-13 Masons Avenue, Harrow, Middlesex HA3 5AD, United Kingdom
Project term:  1 August 2014 – 31 July 2015

Project  "SWAT - Speak, Work And Travel" is intended for pupils of the secondary school  InterDACT, s. r. o., in Most. It is a short-term educational stay in London (UK) for early years students who study information technology and public-law service.  There will be 20 participants, 12 IT pupils and 8 public-law service pupils. 

The school InterDACT, s. r. o.,  will provide a language course focused on English language for special purposes. The course will be held on a regular basis before the educational stay. Within the project the pupils will gain the knowledge of the newest public administration methods, information processing and IT technologies. The participants will grasp new practical skills in the field of modern technology and IT development and they will learn about the UK public administration.  

The IT pupils will assist the firms with failure-free computer network operation. They will work with hardware and software, they will install and administrate operation systems and peripherals. The public-law service pupils will practise activities connected with office work. They will process and cope with various information sources. They will use IT technology. They will process and create documents and related materials. 

The length of the educational stay has been arranged. It will last for 14 days. It will probably be realized at the turn of November and December 2014. As some of the participants are under age of 18 there will be a teacher (InterDACT) accompanying the applicants during their stay. The intermediary partner ADC College will arrange the stay in London companies and firms for the participants (the pupils). The pupils will participate in everyday business company routines  as if they are regular employees of the companies. 

The main aims of the project are the improvement of pupils´ practical skills through the agency of educational foreign stay, the rise of motivation to communicate in English language and language skills improvement as such. Other project objectives:  the improvement of study subject perception as the support of employment in Czech and European labour market, international partnership establishment as the cooperation between EU nations and understanding of cultural differences and similarities. 

The project activities will help the pupils to eliminate language barrier. The main aim and profit of these activities is to increase competitive ability of the participants in the labour market thanks to the language and practical experience during the educational stay in Great Britain. The participants will learn how to be more independent, responsible, self-confident and co-operative.  They will broaden their  cultural horizons and also ethic al and aesthetic knowledge concerning their field of study.
Praktyka zawodowa ponad granicami - kluczem do sukcesu na rynku pracy

PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE BEYOND BORDERS- A KEY TO SUCCESS ON THE LABOUR MARKET - it is the project, which takes into account the needs of the changing labour market in the field of preparing a young man for the role of the participant contemporary market economy.The project takes account of the needs of students due to lack of qualifications, professional experience and lack of knowledge of existing mechanisms on the labour market.  At this project take part the students of all vocational profiles, which are learned in our school.

Mobility project includes 24 months and concerns the school year 2014/2015, deadline March/April 2015 and the school year 2015/2016, the time-limit March/April 2016.

The project relies on organizing the three-week professional training for 60 trainees ( 16 students from economist specialized technique, 14 students  from informatics technique and 30 students from open - cast mining college).

The partners of this project are the institution of ADC College in London and Foerderverein Steinmetzhandwerk placed in Demitz - Thumitz (Germany)



The aim of the project is  increasing the quality and effectiveness of vocational training, acquiring practical skills at European level and preventig students from falling out of the education system and their social marginalization. Use of the latest information and communication technologies in the educational process, the implementation of the European credit system for vocational education and training will increase the competitiveness of students Zespół Szkół at national and European labor market.



Project activities are focused on familiarize students with the requirements of the European labor market, its structure and rules of operation and providing them with a wide range of knowledge, skills and competencies needed to adapt to the permanently changing labor market in Poland and Europe. 

Internship in foreign companies will indicate the perspective of professional development our young people from families with a low material status, remaining on the margins of social life.  It will be a chance for them to compensate for educational opportunities and provide them a better possibility to present acquired education and gained experience on the job market.

The internship will be conducted in accordance with European standards and it will help to broaden the social, personal and intercultural competences.



Thanks to the three weekly stay in London and in Demnitz - Thumitz the participants get to know the exact working environment, they will be able to succeed in the future gained information to their own situation on the domestic  and European labour market. They will receive a certificate from the ADC College and Foerderverein Steinmetzhandwerk,  and the Europass Mobility in Polish, English and German, which will open up the possibility of finding a satisfactory work as computer science, economist or as menagement at open-cast minig branch not only in Poland, but also in the European labour market.
Internationalisierung der Ausbildung mit Hilfe von Auslandspraktika

The RBZ1 (regional vocational school, social education, nutrition, construction) plans that European topics and particularly the European vocational training is one part of the schoolprogram. This should be promoted by mobilities of teachers and pupils. The general orientation means: Our school is opening and also networking and intensifying the contact to the professional world on a regional and European basis.

The main character is the internationalization of the vocational training, which is implemented by the engaged players in Kiel and London. 

The most important question is: which other working organisations / processes are realized in the other country and how can these knowledges be placed to the school daily routine / school curricular. There is a big interest by the engaged dual partners in getting knowledge about working organisations and processes. Do the national qualification frames show any commonalities or specific differences?

In occupational areas and professions like nutrition and domestic economy especially the catering and sozial pedagogy want to get into contact with our partners and chosen business to get such knowledges.

Especially the contact with pupils is the quintessence of this projectmanagement. They should lead a learning folder about their practical training, to focus the differences between ocupational organisations processes.

These learning folders are reclined to the European qualifications and competences comparable. The pupils should realize if the knowledges, skills and competences were enough to exist on the European profession market. Furthermore we will try to realize new competences to make them usable for our region.

There are about 5000 pupils on the RBZ1. The focus of the RBZ1 you will find with about 3000 pupils in the dual training. 1% of the trainees should be sent with a companion to the ADC College partner to England. There the partner organizes places for practical training and host families. Our trainees will be trained and prepared linguistically, culturally and occupationally.

After their departure the participants will present their results to the RBZ1, their firms and the public and let them flow in their practical experience.

Another aim is to prepare the prospective young workers for the European and globalized professional market and also to sensitize the teachers for the importance of integration on the European professional market.
Evropský rozměr vzdělávání a pracovních zkušeností

European Dimension of Education and Work Experience



This project was conceived in the beginning of 2014 with the main goal of providing students and recent graduates of our school the unique opportunity of work experience abroad. It is going to offer them knowledge and skills which it would be very difficult to obtain in the Czech Republic. The next goal is to activate their existing passive knowledge of English language and help them acquire specialized business terminology in English during real work experience. The overall goal is increasing participants' qualification and motivation for further studies and work. We also wish to help the participants to see the importance of living in Europe together with other nations, of European citizenship and of the importance of own uniqueness as well as the importance of respect for other cultures.



There are going to be 12 students of the 3rd forms of our school participating in the project and the opportunity for joining is also going to be offered to our recent graduates. The project is divided into two cycles with work experience in spring/summer 2015 and spring/summer 2016. During the work experience the participants are going to be employed in London companies where they are going to participate at work and do their tasks and thus improve their knowledge and skills. These tasks are going to be recorded in Learning agreements, which are going to contain the goals of the work experience and which are going to be agreed on by all participating parties.



A part of the project is a wide scale preparation of the participants before the work experience itself which is going to take place both in the Czech Republic and in London. The preparation is going to include vocational, language and culture courses and it is going to try to help the participants of the work experience in the beginning and during their stay abroad. 



The project is going to be implemented by our school, i.e. Masarykova obchodni akademie, Jicin, and by ADC college in London. It is going to be divided into two cycles with each consisting of several logic steps which are going to be performed by one or both of the participating organizations. The cooperation of these is going to be outlined in Memorandum of understanding where the roles and responsibilities of both partners are going to be specified.



Expected results of the project are mainly increased vocational and language knowledge and skills of the participants as well as their increased self-confidence and motivation for further studies and work. We also hope that this experience will help them in the future when looking for a job. Another result is going to be a substantial enrichment of the educational program offered by our school by including this work experience abroad. We believe this project is going to motivate also those students who are not going to take place in it thanks to discussions with participants which are going to be held after their return from London. This, we hope, will be also visible in our region thanks to articles in local newspapers, on our website and during meetings with future applicants for studying at our school.

The purpose of this project is to give students an opportunity to experience informal and practical acquisition of knowledge and skills. This experience offers students a chance to greater employability in the local and European labour market. This project includes 15 students studying Business Academy and Economic Lyceum. It is intended for students of the third year of study, since this is the year when students go through a practical training in various enterprises. Students, aged 17-18, will take part in a three-week professional training in the field of trade, sale and administration in the surroundings of London, Great Britain. There they will be placed in local shops and enterprises in spring 2015. Students will get an opportunity to go abroad and employ their knowledge in an authentic setting. The main aims of this projects are acquisition of  business knowledge, applying of theoretical knowledge into practice, getting acquainted with real business communication and negotiations, comparing foreign and local trade and services, practising and improving students´ English language and English business correspondence, getting acquainted with culture and habits of an English-speaking country. The implementation of the project will be managed by the school as a sending organization and ADC College as a receiving organization. The sending organization will organize the selection of participants, their language and professional training, transport to the work place and monitoring of the project and internship, final evaluation and dissemination of results. Intermediary organization will ensure work placement of students, accommodation with host families, including food and transportation to/ from the place of internship, insurance, monitoring and evaluation. Apart from an official evaluation, students will participate in the presentation of their experience and results in their practical training at our school (or even on a regional level). After completing their training, students are expected to make two presentations. One focused on trade and sale, in which they will include their expectations compared to gained experience, they will compare means of trading in a foreign country and the Czech Republic. The other presentation will concern language points, such as business communication, acquisition of new English vocabulary, and cultural points. They will present these outcomes in classes and discussions to inform and motivate other students. The school accompanying person will evaluate the training from his/ her perspective and will present it to school management and public at special occasions such as inspections, open house days etc. The project and its realization will be published on school web pages, or in local press and media.
Mobilny pracownik na Wyspach i kontynencie

The " mobile worker on the islands and the mainland " is focused on professional and language development of students educated to be an economist technician, a computer technician, a nutrition and food service technician. The main objective of the project is to provide the participants - students coming from small towns and rural areas threatened with the risk of social exclusion- with knowledge, skills and language development based on European standards of work . Implementation of an internship abroad will allow participants to gain experience in the foreign labor market in isolation from national norms and stereotypes, to improve the attractiveness and quality of professional services provided by them. Moreover, participants will test themselves in new circumstances, new professional and life situations. Constant contact with a foreign language will improve their language skills and will help to overcome the language barrier . Implementation of an internship abroad will influence their labor mobility.
Within the project 40 students of our school will take part in the internship: they will be divided into two groups -
Group I - 20 people including 10 economists and 10 IT specialists - will go in August 2015 to London
Group II - 20 people including 10 economists and 10 caterers - will go in March 2015 to Frankfurt an der Oder.
Each group will be supervised by two tutors of ZSE for a period of three weeks. It is the best time to assimilate in new environment and acquire new professional and language experience.
Group I will complete an internship in a partner institution Internationaler Bund Förder -und Integrationszentrum in Frankfurt an der Oder, Germany. Group II will complete an internship at ADC College London in the UK.

The most important result of the project will be improvement of the level of knowledge, language and professional skills, acquisition of new interpersonal skills, obtaining a diploma confirming vocational qualifications that will be recognized by employers in the European markets, as well as experience in international projects.
Thanks to the project ZSE will strengthen its position in the local environment as an institution which offer both VET and language services at European level, which will have a beneficial effect on the perception of the graduates from lower secondary schools, choosing education in ZSE as their next stage of education. Our school will establish a constant cooperation with partner institutions and local employers.

BBS Stadthagen is a vocational school situated in Lower Saxony, Germany with an enrollment of approx. 2,000 students. 45 % of these are apprentices in 33 different professions. During the 2-year project period 28 apprentices from the following professions are supposed to get the opportunity to do a 3-week job placement in either France or England.



Job placements in France are offered for



- hotel and restaurant specialists

- cooks

- bakers

- sales assistants in bakeries



Job placements in England are offered for



- bankers

- office clerks

- management assistants for retail services

- management assistants in wholesale and foreign trade

- clerks in public administration

- information technology specialists

- information technology system electronics technicians

- technical product designers



The objectives of this project are to promote decision-making skills and responsibility among young apprentices in order to improve not only their foreign language skills and therefore their occupational skills, but also acting tolerant towards other cultures, increase their self-confidence and train their ability to manage conflicts .



Participants are chosen by their technical and foreign language skills but also by criteria that review the applicant's ability to adapt to new situations. Independence, willingness to aquire new skills and endurance are also important aspects.



Both during the preparation by BBS Stadthagen and during the stay abroad students will get a cultural training to prepare them for the host country's customs, but also to communicate and extend their knowledge in regard to the country's economy, culture, history and politics.  Language training for job placements in France will be carried out by BBS Stadthagen. Students travelling to England  will attend a one-week language class prior to their job placement, provided by the partner institution.



Staff from BBS Stadthagen will accompany the students during their stay abroad while the partner institution organizes accommodation, chooses companies where the students do their job placements, offers a cultural programme and does the mentoring. 



To ensure the quality of the exchange the participants and BBS Stadthagen sign a participant contract, which also includes a learning agreement, showing rights and duties of both parties.



At the end of the stay every participant is expected to evaluate the job placement together with their mentors, but each company providing a job placement is also asked to give a feedback on the student's performance by help of an evaluation sheet. 



After the students have successfully completed their job placements they will receive the Europass "Mobility". Information about the project and reports about participants' experiences will be published on the website of BBS Stadthagen and in the local press. On a national level experiences will also be shared during network meetings.
Analyse und Vergleich der unterschiedlichen Berufsbildungssysteme in Großbritannien und Deutschland - Analysis and comparison of different training systems in Great Britain and Germany

The project "Analysis and comparison of different training systems in Great Britain and Germany "is planned for three weeks at a time (group 1: 08/03/ - 28/03/2015 and group 2: 03/04/ - 23/04/2016).



The project partners are Berufliches Schulzentrum in Neusäß near Augsburg and ADC College in Harrow/London.



The project participants are pursuing a dual vocational education and training for being wholesalers, office or industrial clerks. Each project group will consist of 20 trainees.



The main goal of this project is the lasting improvement and expansion of personal, social, intercultural and linguistic skills.



Another aim is to promote and improve personal and social skills, as students will be required to independently commute between work placements and college, have to live with host families and have to complete an internship in a British company.



The exchange will lead to a better understanding of differences and similarities in vocational qualification in Great Britain and increase the participants´ intercultural competence. This goal, however, will not only be based on the actual experiences made in Great Britain, but will also be supported by a preparatory course and an evaluation seminar which will take place in Neusäß after the stay.



An increase in linguistic and communicative competences will be achieved, as all participants will have to use English on a daily basis in their host families, internships or during other social activites and by being taught by native speakers in the classroom.

The participants are involved in real terms operational procedures in their export-oriented companies and therefore need linguistic and communicative competence in the world language English.



The trainees will be taught in ADC College during their first week in London, complete their internships in London in the second week and and will return to the College in their third to receive further language traininng. They then will also have the opportunity to work on their final presentation for their individual projects. 



On the weekends and after finishing college programmes or work placements, the participants will have the chance to become acquainted with London by visiting theatres, museums, sights or by participating in guided tours. Other excursions - for example to Cambridge and Brighton - are planned as well. 



This stay will convince the project´s participants to take part in the lifelong improvement of their language skills.



Participating will not only improve their chances to get into higher qualified jobs in Germany, but also to get jobs in other European countries and companies as well as in the international subsidiaries of their current employers.



In the long run, this mobility activity will not only lead to extensive higher qualifications, but will also diminish the possibility of  future unemployment. 



In addition to that, the trainees will serve as multipliers for  the rich intercultural experience they made and will accordingly promote the idea of a European community.



The project is based on the interconnection between education and vocational training as well as the integration of British language and culture.
ИНОВАЦИИТЕ В АДМИНИСТРАЦИЯТА - АНГЛИЙСКА ВИЗА ЗА БЪЛГАРСКИЯ ТРУДОВ ПАЗАР

Graduates in a vocational economic school have to learn not only interprofessional knowledge but also practical skills; they have to deal with practical tools and new technologies, to analyze, to make responsible decisions. This is the way for providing education’s convertibility and workforce in the European Union, competitiveness in the labor market and willingness of young people to their role as citizens of the United Europe. 
The project objectives are specified on different levels: 
• users - familiar with European practice and the acquisition and improvement of skills in business administration; Improving formed in the PGI "Racho Stoyanov" competences in the field of business communications, creating opportunities for transfer of skills developing in new situations, improving the competitiveness of the market labor in the United Europe. 
• sending organization - improving the quality of vocational education by enriching with new teaching methods, improving the quality of vocational training in PGI "Racho Stoyanov" by multiplying the results of the practice; Resolve lack of competence in the field of foreign language in business communications. 
• host organization - familiarity with the specifics and standards of secondary education in economics in Bulgaria; Approbation of students, developed their innovative methods for the formation and development of business communication skills, development of customized programs for future users. 

The beneficiaries of the project are 20 students from X to XII class that will go through the procedure of pre-selection. Two teachers from the sending organization will accompany the students; they will be their mentors and they will have clearly defined responsibilities. 
Project activities are divided into:
Preparatory activities - include a procedure in seven stages for pre-selection of users - informing, specialized test, essay developing, language training, specific professional training, cultural training, final selection of users, signing contracts; developing of an effective procedure for participants’ protection and safety.
Main activity / Mobility / - The practice lasts three weeks and will be implemented in ADC College - London, United Kingdom, in July 2015. The practice program is divided into 3 modules and provides each student the possibility to be part of the administrative departments which prepare and implement a workable business plan, to use foreign language communication and professional terminology, to master the art of actively conducting business negotiations with foreign partners. At the end of the practice each "department" will summarize, analyze and evaluate the performance of their work and present it as a project with a presentation to a committee of representatives of the ADC College. The accreditation of practice will ensure the issuance of each user of Europass Mobility Certificate. After the successful practical projects presented to a jury in the host organization, each participant will receive ADC College Certificate. 
Follow-up activities - activities include awareness and dissemination of results; measuring of the impact on different levels - individual, institutional, local, regional, national, international; reporting and monitoring of the project; implementing best practices in the curriculum of the school. 
In the methodological aspect of training and simulation sessions, case studies and the development of strategies are used to improve the management and organizational skills of the beneficiaries. The content emphasis is on the upgrading of specialized management skills and business administration and formation of specific competencies in the field of business communications, including and negotiating competences.
In personal aspect the goal is the formation and improvement of organizational and communication skills and qualities needed for future young economists.
Participation of beneficiaries in the project would increase the confidence and capabilities for their better positioning in the labor market following the acquisition in another country, knowledge and experience and language skills in a professional context. The participation in the program will motivate students for their future developing, their entrepreneurial spirit and for initiatives for their successful implementation on the labor market in Bulgaria and in the European Union. 
In the long term acquisition of practical skills, competencies validated by certificates, and related to the basic operating organizational principles, a proper behavior in organizations, business ethics, information technology, administration and others will lay the foundation for the acquisition of managerial skills of the students in real business life and make them more competitive in the labor market.

Economic practice in London is a VET project expanding the former project with the title Gaining vocational work experience in the European labour market. The aim of the project is two-week long working experience of students involved in initial vocational training, in particular ten students of secondary vocational school and ten students of higher professional school in Příbram. Thanks to the partner organization ADC College, the training will be arranged in economic entities in London, which cooperate with ADC on the long-term basis. The mobility will be realised during the regular practice of our students – in February 2015 and May/June 2015. The main objective of the project is gaining vocational experience, development of language, social and cultural skills of participants and encouraging of their awareness about the European Union and integration into the European labour market. The results of this project will include acquiring and deepening of skills in administration, especially computer work, and paper work, secretarial work, administration, execution of inquiries and orders, work in stock, learning about the firm structure and its departments and products. After the training, the students of the tertiary school will compile a presentation about their experience, which is a condition for gaining credit in the subject vocational training. The students of the secondary school will process a power-point presentation, which will be presented to their schoolmates and to the public at the open-door-day. English is an international language and its developing will help students to better competitiveness, for that reason we have chosen Great Britain to be the place of our training experience.  Long term benefits of our project include smother integration of our students into the labour market and better chances for a prestigious job.

While preparing the project, we drew inspiration from similar projects, which have been succesfully implemented by other secondary schools in the Czech Republic. We used information that we acquired from their dissemination activities, especially the contact and reference about the partner organization that is going to arrange the internships in London, and we adjusted the whole project to suit our studets's needs. All the key staff have praticipated in the preparation of the project and have set realistic targets that both the students and the participating organizations will benefit from. 

The project's aim is to implement internships for 15 students who are doing the third and fourth year in the fields of Information Technology and Management and Electronic Computer Systems. The students possess theoretical knowledge and have gone through internships in the Czech Republic. The accepting institution, which has extensive experience in vocational and professional training, is responsible for selecting suitable work placement companies. The sending institution is responsible for selection of students. The students are expected to work in the companies for two weeks and they will be accomodated in families. Thanks to that they will have opportunity to get acquainted with everyday life and culture of another european country. The purpose of the project is to improve our students' skills and knowledge, especially IT and language skills. The internship in British companies will enable our studets to gain work experience in another EU member country and will improve their future outlooks in the job market. Students will be assigned jobs that relate to their field of study, e. g. ICT retail,   (communication with customers, the ability to specify ICT parameters), ICT service (communication with customers, definig problems), computer network maintanence and support. In addition to the Europass document, awarded to all students of our school, all the project participants will recieve a stamp in their Europass mobility document on completion of the internship and the recieving institution certificate. The sending instituion and project parnter will also gain practical experience with ECVET system during the project.
Europejskie kwalifikacje zawodowe ekonomistów z Zespołu Szkół Nr 10 w Warszawie

Participants of the project will be students of OA SOŠZE  Žatec and their English teacher who will prepare language-cultural programme for them. 

The sending organization will arrange the transport of the participants to London, transfer to the airport.The teacher will arrange the monitoring of the programme, communicate with the host organization ADC College a firms and organizations, where the participants will work. 

 The partner organization ADC College  will  arrange the  local transport tickets, accommodation, insurance of the participants and prepare  the adequate working places for the students. Students will write the CV a fill in the necessary forms and will try to get as much knowledge as they can during the preparation course, which they can be useful for them during the future stay in UK.

The main goal of the project is enable to students to get work experience abroad, improve their skills to fulfill the given tasks, settle down to the new place, improve the flexibility and their mobility of labour, improve their skills to communicate in foreign language.
This project should help students to increase their self-confidence which should help them to find attractive jobs. The ability to communicate in foreign language is the basic qualification to get a good job especially in Ústecký region where  many foreign firms exist and have a lack of employees with international work experience and good language knowledge (industrial zones Triangle, Verne, Louny, Joseph).

The work experience should contribute to increasing interest of students in education. Because more knowledge and skills they  have more interesting job can gain. The participation in the project should motivate the students to work on improving of their education  and to work more on themselves.

The anticipated output of the project is getting the Europass-Mobility for all participants of the work experience and Participant Certificate from ADC College.
Do Londýna na zkušenou – praxe žáků v zahraničí

The project "Experiencing London – Student Internships Abroad", hereinafter "LZP", aims to enhance the existing school curriculum of CZECH SALES ACADEMY Trutnov - secondary vocational school Ltd., to give opportunity for students  who attend higher classes on a full-time basis to take part in a professional internship abroad, to support students in using and deepening their knowledge and skills acquired during the previous education, to improve their language and professional skills and broaden their awareness of opportunities for study and employment in the European Union. 



The project counts on the involvement of students (in total 20) in full-time education (mostly students of the 3rd and 4th year) in the field of study Economics and Business, who will show a serious interest in a foreign internship and demonstrate sufficient language knowledge and relevant expertise. 14-day foreign internships in the areas of administration and retail will be provided by a partner organization ADC College from Great Britain, which our school worked successfully with on the projects of Leonardo da Vinci Mobility. The internships will take place in London companies and organizations during two terms (autumn 2014 and spring 2015), for each term one alternate member will be determined.



The division of roles between two partners in the project will be defined by the "Internship Agreement within the program Erasmus +". Communication between the partners will be realized by phone and e-mail, as well as by using videoconferences. The main project activities (project preparation, the launching of project activities, preparation and execution of foreign internships, processing final reports of participants, validation, evaluation, dissemination and accounting of funds) are divided into 3 stages.



The project implementation will support the efforts of CZECH SALES ACADEMY Trutnov - secondary vocational school Ltd., to prepare best the students of full-time education for their future employment in accordance with the current requirements of the labour market. It will help the participants to better their professional skills, improve their ability to solve problems and challenges, professional communication, deepen and strengthen their language skills. The students will also be able to compare cultural, living and working conditions in Czech and British firms. Gained Europass Mobility Certificate and ADC College Certificate will contribute to their better entry to the labour market.



Thanks to the project implementation CZECH SALES ACADEMY Trutnov - secondary vocational Ltd., will continue in improving the quality of the vocational training.

The project  “Developing competences for the tourism of the future”  intends to facilitate the transition from school to real active life for 15 students, who  study tourism and catering at  „Ion Ghica” Economic College, and who will develop the competences of delivering basic and supplementary hospitality services at a European level, at present, but also for the future,  as a result of a practice training placement which will take place in different tourism and catering companies in London: Ace Café London, Bedford Arms Hotel, Berjaya Eden Park Hotel, Best Western Cumberland Hotel, Café Piccolo, Crown Plaza Ealing, Grim’s Dyke Hotel, Harrow Hotel, Holiday Inn Elstree, Intercontinental Hotel, Jurys Inn Watford Hotel. 
The general objective of the project is to develop the competences of organizing and running activities in hotels, for the students in tourism and catering domain, to facilitate their transition from school to present active life, but also on long term.
The specific objectives subordinated to the general aim are: developing competences of meeting, hosting and offering supplementary services through a European practical training placement, for a number of 15 students studying tourism and catering; facilitating the transition from school to active life for 15 students in the domain of tourism and catering through a practical training placement which opens for them a big range of opportunities of getting a job; developing the students’ linguistic competences regarding hospitality; knowing, understanding and accepting the present and future European entrepreneurial and cultural diversity.

The participants are 15 students from tourism and catering base domain, general training domain: tourism who will finish the Xth grade, 2nd qualification level  by an integrated practical training stage, in 22.06 - 5.07. 2015. 

Along the two weeks of practical training in the hotels and tourism agencies chosen by our partner, ADC College, the participants will work for  10 days, 6 hours a day, under the supervision of the tutors named by  ADC College and the tourism companies, and of the Romanian monitor, but they will also participate in cultural and socializing activities. The project management is assured by a team of 4 teachers from "Ion Ghica" Economic College. They come with their experience in this domain and by using the Gantt diagram, they intend to coordinate, monitor and evaluate as efficiently as possible, students’ training activities , evaluation and certification of the stage and the acquired competences, of the partnership established in the project framework, but also of the dissemination and publicity activities which will take place. 

The expected results of the project are:
-  professional level: 15 students from the domain tourism and catering will be able to meet the tourists and to offer them services according to their wishes and demands, but also according to the professional standards specific to this domain.
 - linguistic level: 15 students from the domain tourism and catering will be able to have a professional conversation with different types of clients in English, getting accustomed to the speciality terms; 
-  social and cultural level: 15 students will integrate in an environment that is specific for the international hospitality industry and they will socialize with persons belonging to another culture and civilization, understanding and practising the principle of ethnical and cultural diversity;
- personal level:  15 students will be able to create and maintain professional relationships with clients and colleagues, they willl practise conflict and expectations management techniques, thus developing their life skills, 15 students will get certificates of attendance at the European professional practical training placement and Europass mobility certificates.

We consider that this project will contribute mainly to attracting European funds for the professional development of the future labour force in tourism , at the level of the local, national and even international community.  It will ensure the broadening of the professional, cultural and spiritual horizon of the participants, but indirectly of the persons they get into contact at a local level. It will open a bridge for future cooperation with other schools with the same profile in the county, region or at a national level. It will create a competition among the high schools in our town and in Bacau county  to identify the best alternatives of running practical training stages in the country or abroad. Romanian students’ preparation and getting accustomed to the hospitality industry in UK enable a faster integration of the future graduates on the free European labour market.  Thus they find out about the realities of European markets, EU clients demands, and the percentage of persons who cannot adapt and generate negative image and perception effects  will be reduced.

Professional traineeships in properly chosen English companies and industrial plants are going to have an effective input in vocational training at the Commerce Schools in Bydgoszcz via better youth preparation for gaining qualifications and a job and also motivating students to further study and skills improvement. The aims of the project are included in the school mission and vision determined in the School Development Plan the Bydgoszcz Education Development Strategy in the years 2013-2020. The nature of the project is an exchange of 3 groups of our students with counsellors, being trained as commerce technicians and advertising technicians, who are supposed to take part in three-week vocational trainings combined with an English course in London.  The students are aged 16-20 coming both from a big city (Bydgoszcz) and villages. More than half of the students are disadvantaged, from societies endangered with unemployment and having binding opinions and PPP decisions. Our students are active and motivated people, willingly participating in every possible extra classes (European Union classes, extra classes offered by the school). They gain very good marks in the employers in whom they have professional traineeships. The criteria according to which the participants will be chosen: the student attitude, the traineeships evaluation, linguistic competence. 10 students with best marks and 5 disadvantaged ones with best marks will be qualified to participate in the project. The additional criteria will be gender: 7 boys and 8 girls. The project realization will provide synergy of many programmes and skills by improving work quality of the teachers and students. The project partner, ADC College will distribute signed Europass cards and the completion certificate among the participants. From our side, apart from practical and logistics activity we will provide language and cultural preparation of the participants, essential to the effective traineeships. The foreseen results and effects of the project are mainly key competence improvement, which are stated in the attachment to the European Parliament and Council recommendations of 18th Dec, 2006. As for the long-term advantages, the participants have a unique possibility of enriching their CVs and, what follows, gaining more chances for employment. The Commerce Schools will increase the attractiveness of the educational offer in the region and will adjust it to the needs of the Polish and European job market via comparison of the methods, ways and job tools compulsory in other European Union countries. The European additional value of the project is the possibility of transferring the experience from the traineeships abroad to the local economics and the possibility of offering the society an independent, resourceful and innovative graduate, who will participate actively in economical, social and cultural city and country development.
Praktyki zawodowe w krajach Unii Europejskiej kluczem do sukcesu zawodowego

The project „Traineeships in the European Union countries are the key to professional success”, prepared by Zespół Szkół Terenów Zieleni in Radzymin, will be carried out in two places: 

- places organized by ADC College in London

- places organized by Tellus company in Italy.

In both cases that will be in hotels, restaurants, IT companies or garden companies. Four groups of students will go on a traineeship:

Group A – the students of Technical Vocational School; specialization – Food technology and catering services technician. (3rd year students)

Group B – the students of Technical Vocational School; specialization – Waiter. (2nd year students)

Group C – the students of Technical Vocational School; specialization – Computer specialist. (3rd year students)

Group D – the students of Technical School of Landscape Architecture. (3rd year students)



Groups B and C will go on traineeships to England, whereas groups A and D will go to Italy.

All groups will go for two weeks. In groups A, B and D there will be 16 students, whereas in group C there will be 20 participants, because the computer class at our school is very numerous. The total number of all participants is 68. Two teachers will go with each group.



The methodology used during the project includes: demonstrations, lectures, analysis, presentations, observations.



The project responds to the educational needs of the country associated with an increase in the level of effectiveness of vocational training, acquiring new skills and experience to adapt to the requirements of the labour market in Poland and Europe. It also lets the students expand their knowledge of foreign languages, especially the professional language.



The project responds to the needs of the region. 

Firstly, the need for land-use planning around the houses and housing estates within Wołomin county, where Radzymin is situated. It is connected with the traineeship which will be carried out by the students of Technical School of Landscape Architecture in Italy. (Group D)

Secondly, Warsaw and its surroundings are frequently visited by tourists. After the organization of EURO 2012 in Warsaw, the number of tourists, especially foreign ones, has increased. This contributed to the development of catering sector in Mazovia. The demand for qualified, experienced catering and customer service staff, who speak foreign languages, will also increase. It is connected with the traineeship which will be carried out by the students of Technical Vocational School in England and in Italy. (Groups A and B)

Since 2012, in our school we have had Technical Vocational School with the specialization of Computer Specialist. Information technology is constantly improving. We want our students, who learn to become computer specialists, to have the chance of foreign traineeships experience. The needs connected with computer services and web pages programming are still growing. The demand for such services is still high. (Group C). 

The aims of the project:

-Gaining new professional skills by the participants. These skills are supported by Europass certificate, increasing therefore opportunities to find employment in a local as well as European markets.

-Using and improving language skills in English and Italian languages.

-Creating opportunity to travel abroad for  children, especially for those from underpriviledged background: coming from rural areas, where unemployment rate is very high. They may have a great chance to gain more self-confidence and of course essential professional skills.

-Making the participants aware of cultural diversity in Europe

-Making professional education in our school more effective and atractive for students

-Developing of IT competence especially for group C



The results we expect:

-68 students with skills and experience gained abroad, confirmed by Europass certificate.

-68 students with better professional language skills: 36 English language and 32 Italian language

-Increasing of self-confidence, improving of communicational and organizational skills as well as wider opennes of the participants on cultural diversity in Europe

-More candidates enrolling in our school as a result of increasing atractiveness of professional courses in our school

-Recognition of labour market in Great Britain and Italy as well as the rules of work in firms, companies and restaurants in the fields of gardening, catering industry and IT

-Exchanging  experience between our school teachers and organzations or companies which host the training courses for our students



      After the completion of the project, we expect its participants to find jobs they were preparing for. We do not expect them to become unemployed at all.

We also have a hope that they will freely and fluently use professional foreign language at their workplace. They will also not be afraid of looking for a job abroad.

Another benefits we expect is increasing number of candidates enrolling in our school  as well as improving cooperation
Европейски опит и практики за качествено професионално обучение

The main purpose of  “European experience and practices for qualitative professional education” project is to help students from Varna Vocational High School of Electrical Engineering to acquire and use knowledge,  skills and training to assist their personal growth, work ability and participation in European labour market. In order to implement the main objective, the project contains a plan for training and mobility of 20 students from Vocational High School of Electrical Engineering–«System programming», «Computer Networks» major,  in  the United Kingdom, London, ADC College for 3 weeks. During the mobility all students will be involved in training by educational institution, which would allow them to receive training much higher than the average standard training level for this major. Еnhancing abilities for team working and adapting  them for different fields would be possible through project preparation and  implementation of chosen topics.All students, who would be the target group for this project are studying advanced English – a fact that contributes additionally for improvement of language skills and easy adaptation on the European Labour Market.
The project is in response to specific recommendations of partner companies, which introduce students to their practices and allow them to test their knowledge in real working conditions, as well as to curriculum analysis of specific subjects. Development of computer technologies requires students to know more about innovations in this field and realize importance of lifelong learning as a needful part of their professional qualification. The current project would fill the gaps in the knowledge and would add more knowledge and skills; would allow a better level of proficiency and successful students’ realisation and attract ambitious young people to these specialties.
After completing work on the project, we expect the following results:
1. Successful experience in ADC College –London; additional knowledge and skills related to computer technologies and media acquired
2. ADC College mobility certificates received by the participating students
3. Established contacts with European companies for training, qualification and production 
4. Increased self-esteem in the students – based on the acquired knowledge and experience in an EU country
5. Improve quality of professional education and establish traditions and skills in working on European educational programmes and projects.
Заедно в бъдещето на технологиите и бизнеса
Моето е-портфолио-виза за пазара на труда

Modern labor market requires specialists with developed intellectual properties, high mobility of knowledge and established capacity for professional development. At the national level meetings held between representatives of the education and business, employers emphasize the young people in our country do not know how to promote themselves and their achievements when applying for a job. The good performance includes demonstrating skills, curriculum vitae writing, presence on social networks and appropriate statement in which applicants to identify all training and certifications that have passed, technology, which can handle and the international experience is strongly recommended.
         We are applying this project as school preparing young people in the field of IT technology   to enable our students to gain professional experience state of the art, high quality standards, combined with the skills for career performance by gaining experience abroad. This project aims to implement the following specific objectives:
 - Improvement of professional qualification of the students
- Development of communication skills in foreign language environment 
- Acquisition of a new social experience and personal skills
           The project will be implemented in close cooperation with partners ADC College, which is an organization for professional development and language training, located in North London. The project will involve 20 boys and girls over the age of 16 who are trained in the school of professional sphere "Electronics, automation, communication and computer equipment" and will hold a three-week practice in the UK. 
        Students who wish to participate in the project will demonstrate their interest and commitment to participate through motivation letter before a commission of teachers. They will participate in the project after the announced selection criteria related to the learning outcomes and the level of their preparation. . School will organize preliminary preparation of students to successfully adapt to the new environment. It will include:  training in English terminology - 90 hours, preliminary acquaintance with the possibilities of creating an e-portfolio using open source software -30 hours and 30 hours additional training to stay in the host country. Preliminary training will be conducted by external organizations with experience in the field with which the school will contract. The school will purchase in advance tickets for the trip and will ensure students and their parents detailed background information for the entire journey. Mobility will be held in a well-equipped computer lab partner ADC College, which offered an appropriate program to enhance the professional competence of students. Project partners will organize the overall stay - accommodation, meals, local transportation, cultural programs and technical equipment. Will provide specialists with experience that will support the successful achievement of project objectives by requiring the students specific tasks and monitor their progress during the practice. At the end of practice, the applicant and project partners will issue a certificate Europas mobility of people, which will allow them to demonstrate clearly and easily their skills to employers across Europe. ADC College will issue a specific certificate, and School of IET "Lomonosov" certificate for completed vocational training acquired competencies of students to create Web products and working with specific software. Licensed organization that will conduct training in English terminology will issue a certificate for the training. The resulting documents will be very useful for students, and we expect it will be just the first step in their career development. Participation in an international experience will allow students to developed and grow professionally, to strengthen their interest in a successful career and to recognize themselves as citizens of the European Union.
     Stay in a real language environment and communicating with English speaking in the field of computer technology will increase their confidence to present and discuss professional issues in international online networks.
    Changing the environment will create positive emotions and additional motivation for lifelong learning.
