Because of the language course and the traineeship in the company the professional and the language expertise are fostered realistically. Moreover working in London does not only serve the personality development but is also broadens the young people’s horizons because the students are integrated in the life and work in another country. Due to this experience they will develop more acceptance and tolerance towards the other culture. Also the getting to know of other operation methods is an important method to develop an understanding for the other culture. 

Vocational training personnel: The vocational training personnel, who teaches English, complies with two tasks on-site during the first phase: firstly they accompany the students and guide as well as support them  with the project work, secondly they compile the conception of the teaching unit “Working and living in today’s London” which is supposed to be a eight to ten lesson unit for all school types represented in our school. This teaching unit is adjusted to the requirements and conditions of all these school types and it is also substantiated in the framework of providing individual support by working with different difficulty levels.

In summary the theoretical knowledge of “the general” will be fleshed out by the practical experience in “the specific”. This experience will never be forgotten and will be multiplied by all project participants. Due to the realization of the importance of the economic relationships between Great Britain and other EU members it is pinpointed how important the preservation of Great Britain’s EU membership is. Further it is highlighted how companies as well as individuals profit from EU trade. In conclusion the Erasmus+ project does not only provide a considerable professional expertise for all participants, but with many also discloses a new perception of Europe, hence serves the promotion of the European idea.

BBA Oldenburg (an initial vocational school in Germany) wants to convey new inspirations and experiences to its students and lecturers.
Students and lecturers shall be able to establish ties with European colleagues and participate in European networks.
Necessities for the planned experiences are generated by changes in society (Europe 2020 strategy) and health systems (Health 2020 strategy) all over Europe.
The participants are to improve important skills (job-related and soft skills) through mobility. They shall communicate and interact with colleagues in Europe and deal cross-border with current professional and societal themes. The participants acknowledge lifelong learning and mobility as job-relevant themes in the EU.
The expectance in dealing with European themes is that the participants identify themselves with the EU and act as active EU-Citizens.
To achieve the mentioned goals, 19 participants of the BBA Oldenburg will undertake a mobility activity abroad.
16 students in their first year of training will take part in a fieldwork placement in a European country. Three lecturers of the BBA will participate in a Meeting of the "European Network of Occupational Therapy in Higher Education" (ENOTHE) in Bulgaria and Ireland.
The Experiences of the participants are evaluated afterwards. Gained knowledge and competences are integrated in the further vocational training.
Trainees go abroad to look for new horizons 2

Under the name of „trainees go abroad to look for new horizons2 ” the Berufliche Schulzentrum Schongau (Vocational School Center Schongau) in cooperation with its project partner - the  ADC College in London -  is organizing an international Erasmus+ mobility project this  year for the second time. Thirty clerical trainees in industries such as bank, office, retail, wholesale, automobile and industry will get the chance to spend three weeks in London to experience firsthand life and work in this world-city. First of all the participants are going to take part in a one-week language course at the ADC College which is intended to broaden both their general and their professional language skills and take away their fears of communicating in a foreign language. After that the trainees are going to complete an internship of two weeks at selected London companies to encounter the British way of working in respective operating structures.  Furthermore, the students are going to be accommodated with London guest families for their whole stay in England in order to get to know a wide spectrum of cultural aspects and practices of British lifestyle.The objectives of the project are to enlarge the international orientation of the Vocational School Center Schongau through a first European cooperation as well as to increase the attractiveness of the vocational training. Secondly, the project is aimed to improve the quality of school and tuition by combining theoretical contents with practical applications in an international environment.  Through this stay in a foreign country the participating trainees are supposed to increase their English language skills and to improve their intercultural awareness for the interaction with people of a different nationality in both social and professional environment.  Many of the German companies where our students are doing their training already have foreign customers and suppliers and expect from their employees to be able to communicate and interact accordingly so that they can be sent off to foreign assignments at their global plants. At the same time the participants should develop competences during their stay in Great Britain that are demanded by almost any employer today: Mobility, flexibility, self-reliance and open-mindedness for new challenges. By gaining these competences our students are meant to qualify for the European job market. We hope to train their European awareness and motivate them for further trainings of this kind after the completion of their vocational training. Above that, we expect that through this project our trainees will improve their learning skills and professional competences especially in the field of marketing. They will be given a specific work assignment on this topic namely to compare marketing strategies of German and British companies and asked to present the results accordingly. The outcomes are to be used by the teachers of the Vocational School Center Schongau for their various subjects such as English or marketing communication and collected materials e.g. flyers and leaflets could be used as visual aids in class.  Furthermore, the participating companies where our students are doing their training as well as other local enterprises can use the results in order to reconsider their own marketing strategies and generate new ideas in the field of marketing communication. Finally, the fact that trainees take part in international projects might help participating companies to advertise training vacancies in the future.

Nowadays, it is essential for young people in a vocational school to become accustomed to and comfortable within an international working environment. This goes beyond excellent language skills to include in-depth knowledge of other cultures. Our school, BHAK/BHAS Bad Ischl, is therefore applying for the funding of a two-week work placement (36 participants with three accompanying teachers) in London. 

It is vitally important that pupils have the opportunity to complete work placements abroad during their school education. Such experiences help them not only to improve their language skills but also to gain a valuable insight into a foreign company. Furthermore, the participants should develop a stronger European awareness and therefore be optimally prepared for their future career start. 36 pupils from our school, currently in their third year (at the time of the work placement they will be in their fourth year), are applying for the funding as part of the Erasmus + Mobility Program. The program will enable the pupils to develop openness to different cultures, thus contributing to the employment skills and mobility that Europe is looking to strengthen and promote. During their stay in London, the pupils’ independence will also be in focus. They will not only collect valuable work experience and establish contact with host families and friends but also have to find their way in the metropolis of London. 

We attach great value to the preparation and post-evaluation of the project and its defined objectives. We would like to achieve this using video analysis, for example English telephone and customer dialogues (before and after the traineeship), as well as questionnaires and project diaries. We are also planning an event where the participating pupils would report on their traineeship to a panel of business representatives, teachers, fellow pupils and parents. In this way we hope to inspire other younger pupils from across the region to take part in work placements abroad.  Our long-term aim is also to establish international and national networks between our school and companies.

Work Experience London 2016

Besides general education, vocational training is a major part of our business schools.
Our aim is to improve the technical, intercultural and language skills of our students. This year, twelve students will have the opportunity to do an internship abroad.
We expect them to gain more confidence and foster entrepreneurial skills in a professional environment and hope that they will solve challenging situations independently in the future.

Since 2012 there is a competency model for social and personal skills for vocational education. The application had been limited to the classroom. The question of the applicability of the internship was not explicitly checked. Since in our education focus "social management" are to be completed a total of 6 months of internship we would like to expand the concept to the internship.

Outcome:
With this model of competence our students should learn to assess their learning experience and identify. The school will check which skills were actually  for internship abroad acquired and where a demand remains open. They will also increase their competences regarding professional, methodical, intercultural aspects and  languages. So they get a better access to the labor market because of this expierence. 
Other schools in Austria can use our outcome/expieriences for their vocational training, to evaluate their internship

Profil: 
Participating students / insides have already completed 4 months of internship in Austria and know different social / educational facilities.
For summer 2015/16  are projected 17 mobilities in Spain / Sweden / Romania  for 40 Days..
2016 17 mobilities in London for 14 Days. 

Acitvities: 
The students / insides will work in various social institutions between 1 and 2 months and then determine their competence acquisition according to the model. Before they will be  introduced with the model during their lessons, and the facilities abroad or the partner institutions. Other competences will be described in written form - with support of our partners. 
Process and ascertainment : 

Effects and sustainability
The school may assess the effect of the placement abroad regarding the acquisition of social skills better and increase the quality of the placement. At the national level, the results can be made available to other school sites. They also develop their abilities for intercultural perpective und languages. 
Our partners in the project can also use our model for social competences.
Our international network will be strengthen and will be the basis for new projects/cooperation in the future. We as school can dispose of sustainable intenships and we know what more  precisely the possibilities  of the acquisition of different competences.

The Handelsakademie and Handelsschule Feldkirch (Higher Level Secondary Commercial College) is located at the junction of four countries. Due to this fact as well as the demands of a globalised society and economy more and more effort is needed in commercial education to prepare our students for their future careers in business.
Our project aims at different goals on various levels. As the first ‘Handelsakademie’ with an entrepreneurship certificate on an advanced level (ÖNORM) we put special emphasis on internships abroad as part of our school profile, whose ultimate aim is to support the education of independent, reflective and open-minded graduates. Therefore we would like to offer the opportunity to do part of the mandatory internship (as required by the new curriculum 2014) abroad. Offering internships abroad creates a competitive edge over other schools. Our students can gain additional competences and skills and hence improve their career opportunities. Certificates and other documentary proof of additional qualifications (such as the Europass mobility, certificates from the ADC College or references in the certificate for their diploma and A-level equivalent qualification) provide competitive advantages for future applications. 
By supporting occupational mobility across borders, by increasing their self-confidence as well as the confidence in their abilities, by overcoming language barriers and finally by further developing their  practice-oriented knowledge and job-related skills students will be well-prepared for future studies, the entry into working life and life in general.
For our first project in summer 2015 ten students of the third and fourth form have been selected by our headmaster. There are plans to increase the number of participants to 20 next year.
The main purpose of the two week stay in London is a job-related internship. The students will be placed in host families. Our partner organisation is the ADC College in Harrow. The centre for languages and further education has been involved in the successful development and implementation of the European mobility programme for many years. It is closely connected to regional enterprises. Daniela Lichtenegger, the Country Manager, will be the person in charge for our school and our students while they are doing their internship.

This project aims at giving students the chance to do practice abroad.  By the time they go to London they will be in their fourth  year of professional pedagogical education (out of 5) and they will have learned English for 8 years. Also they will have completed a substantial amount of practice in local nursery schools and other child care institutions in Austria.
In the course of this project they will work in nursery schools in London to gain international experience, which should enhance their understanding of different cultures and should give them an insight into a different education system as well as different working conditions for pedagogues. 
These practice weeks should not only broaden the students´ horizons and make them more flexible but also enhance their language skills, especially the vocabulary that is specific to this profession.

By taking part in this project, we want to help our students to gain work experience in a foreign country and to improve their language skills. Furthermore, we are convinced that having completed an internship in London will definitely upgrade our students’ CVs.
Staying with host families should help to foster the cultural exchange of both parties. In addition to that, a stay in multi-cultural London will give our students the opportunity to enhance their social skills (tolerance, open-mindedness, ability to work in a team). 
However, offering such an international program will not only be at the students’ advantage as it is expected that reports about Erasmus+ on the school website as well as in local newspapers will have a positive impact on the reputation of our school.
In addition to that, we, the teachers at BHAK & HTL Freistadt, want to offer the best education possible to our students and we are convinced that taking part in the Erasmus+ project will help to reach this goal.

The mobility project should enable 18-year-old students of the Kindergarten Teacher Training College (Bildungsanstalt für Kindergartenpädagogik) to get insight into various childcare institutions in London, to do placement work there and reflect their on their internship experiences afterwards.

The students should gain initial vocational experience in British pre-school or after-school settings. Work experience in these settings should help students to enhance skills and further develop and expand their experiences in their field of work. The opportunity to get insight into British institutions should  make them open to current aspects of  elementary education and new approaches in childcare. 

Thirty students will do two  weeks of  placement work in London, four teachers will accompany them . They are in close and constant contact with their cooperation partner ADC who is responsible for  implementing the project as well as coordinating host families and childcare institutions.

The project is meant to promote competences in the following areas:

It will help students to:

• develop intercultural awareness and understanding
• build up self-confidence and  develop entrepreneurial skills
• foster independence and self-organization
• acquire and extend specialist language skills in their field of work
• compare and contrast British and Austrian nursery schools and reflect on the differences
• develop soft skills (intercultural communication, adapting to a new setting and integrating in a team, negotiating..)
• face new, challenging situations and develop suitable problem solving strategies

The experiences mentioned above will be reflected upon, analysed and discussed and presented in a public setting. This means the project will not only broaden the horizons of both teachers and students regarding their own school , but also be part of an exchange among the headmasters of Austrian Kindergarten Teacher Training Colleges.

The accompanying teachers will act as multipliers and will try to create low-threshold access to British nursery schools, so as to motivate and encourage students to consider working in European childcare institutions after they have graduated from college.

The proposed project is focused on the group of 15 students of the 3rd and 4th year of study in the Secondary School of Commerce in Hlohovec (further referred to as "OA") who have not participated in work experience abroad so far and 2 accompanying persons in London at the same time  (OA teachers with experience from international projects). The project participants will have to successfully pass the selection procedure after applying for participation in the work experience. The selection procedure will be implemented by a selection committee consisting of the OA managers and teachers. Participants will have to meet not only educational, language and professional requirements, but also certain personal characteristics - they must be independent, flexible, adaptable, responsible, reliable, communicative and able to represent the school. On the basis of our previous experience with Leonardo da Vinci and Erasmus + programme we have decided to participate in the mobility again by implementing a 2-week mobility in London, UK and to cooperate with the mediating organization ADC College.
This project will be implemented as a 2-week vocational training in companies in Great Britain - in London. Placement of participants will be arranged by ADC College. Selection of companies will be based on professional needs arising from the OA curriculum. Vocational training will be performed in the companies active in the area of administration and retail. An integral part of the project will be also language training. This vocational training will be accepted as part of the school curriculum results for the students.
The project will be aimed at the development of European dimension of education, acquiring new working skills and abilities in the European environment, development of language skills and key competencies, getting to know a new culture, getting European contacts, increasing the level of independence and ability to work in the international and intercultural environment. The aim of the project is also to develop and to support the cooperation between the world of education and the world of work as well as the importance of lifelong education. The gained experience will be included in the school curricullum.
The primary goal is to improve the starting position of the future graduates in the national and European labour market. The supporting goals are comparing the approaches in theoretical and practical education and training of students, gaining new abilities, competencies and skills, increasing the self-confidence of students, possible also for starting their own companies. The main added value is the direct experience from the vocational training abroad they can apply in their future employment. This will contribute to the development of European dimension of the educational process. Partners can initiate further cooperation in the future. What is more, participating teachers will share their experience with their colleagues. This project will be of a huge benefit also for the school - OA as it will increase its goodwill and credibility as well as the international character of the institution.
The vocational training (work experience) will be implemented in London, Great Britain.

Due to development of the society, integration of our country into developed countries of modern Europe and requirements of the labour market, the need to support innovations and European dimension in OVP system, the improvement by means of observing positives and comparing has been  striking , especially in branches  in progress which are, undoubtedly, those studied at PaSA ( kindergarten teachers and school-club assistants, assistant teachers, social workers and animators).

Objectives of this project reflects the necessity of being given a possibility of individual mobility, improving qualifications, initial vocational training, gaining knowledge and experiences based on working in a particular branch abroad and a follow-up application of positive innovations in own vocational practice. Moreover, the realization of the mobility in Activity 1  meets the requirement of improving communication skills in English language and special vocabulary extension which will definitely support graduates´ job opportunities.
24 students of PaSA in IVT (12 per each activity) studying the following fields of study: kindergarten teachers and school-club assistants, assistant teachers, social workers and animators and two teachers of English (in case of Activity 1) and two teachers of vocational subjects (in Activity 2) , who will accompany the students and will be tutoring them, will take part in the project. During a two-week stay the students of the fourth form will realize their compulsory practice simultaniously in institutions comparable to the equivalents of Slovak practice places in Great Britain and the Czech Republic in two activities. During the practice all the innovative observations will be reported in a student´s daily report document. This practice will be accepted by the school management as a proper compulsory practice and will be realized in a regular time. Consequently, students will apply their newly gained knowledge and innovations in the practical part of vocational maturita exam, i.e. at maturita exam project presentations focusing on quality improvement and innovations application in their future profession. Besides the above-mentioned maturita exam presentations the mobility participants will carry out presentations using their records and daily report documents, by means of which they may disseminate all the innovative methods, procedures and forms to other students in IVT in particular branches.
Better results in vocational education as well as more effectiveness in future vocational practice of trainees is regarded to be a long-term benefit of the project.

Given the location of ROC Arcus College internationalisation is explicitly part of the objectives of the education program and the strategic policy. We attach importance to foreign experience of students: they get in contact with other languages, habits, cultures and customs. Nowadays students get more and more confronted with a boundless labour market which he/she should behave as a European citizen. Projects and mobility in learning is encouraged, especially within the framework of Focus op vakmanschap. Students and teachers/staff broaden their horizon and  ideas within their craftsmanship.

STAFF MOBILITY 

Project 1: Peer review: a bridge to professionalization 
A Uniform way of review for the whole ROC is that peer review is not part of our work. Yet it is the best way to learn from each other, critical to each other and to keep training vivid. 12 teachers/educational managers of training HZW, MMZ and OA want to be responsible for review of competencies of the English Institute and implement in own curricula of the various training programs. This knowledge is passed on to colleagues by not participating departments so that there is uniformity in the way of testing.

Project 2: Media abroad
A young, new and enthusiastic team Media Design training as a team to make their programs more attractive. By going in the same direction as a team one can support and complement each other if necessary. 7 teachers (complete team and manager) want to gather knowledge and experience and learning from success experiences in teachingmethods from colleagues abroad and implement this in curricula. By being trained as a team they hope to avoid discussions about what to include, exclude or change in our curricula. Our professional vocabulary of English will be on a higher level.

Project 3: Childcare and primary education in one 
The merger of child care and Netherlands State primary education is still in its infancy. Arcuscollege anticipates to merge the education of OA and PW. Surrounding countries have longer experience in training and practice. 12 teachers of both programs are introduced to different workplaces where proposed cooperation already taking place. Goal is to gain experience by working in practice and practical interpretation investigations (guidance, joint teaching methods and handling of internships). They shall exchange knowledge/experience with Danish colleagues and build lasting contacts with Exchange programs. Implementation in curricula of training courses aimed and optimising cooperation. In contact with the field of action knowledge and experience is shared with professionals. Success experiences are on joint study days deepened so that they can implement the practice in their work.

Project 4:   Healthcare Abroad
The school in Lahti has a special, proven successful way of teaching in theory and practice. The guidance in practice change accordingly and is special. One collegue already  has  gained experience in Lahti. Now  3 teachers from the education VP/VZ-IG take part in theory (job shadowing) practice and guidance of students experience. That experience and knowledge they work on  a change proposal on curricula. The educational manager looks for answers around early school leaving, internship policies (deficits), quality assurance regarding student satisfaction and BPV-rating, and the issue labour market versus training.
Project 5: Alternatieve vormen van Kinderopvang
In Berlin is childcare in regulation, building, pedagogical approach and parental participation filled in total different way like in the Netherlands. 6 teachers want to gain experience in a variety of chlidcareplaces. Also the internship supervision and tasks are examined. They thus strengthen own competencies and substantive quality of lessons: students getting a wide range of childapproaches, childdevelopment and buildingstructure.

LEARNERS MOBILITY  

Project 6: Explore work abroad as a group  
Although increasing the studentsenthusiasm  for internship abroad , we also notice  hesitation by the students. The shortage of jobs in Euregion and the 'surplus' to places across the border was the reason for the proposal of this groupstage. Students and teachers are enthusiastic. They will be the next 2 years actively participate in the Open House school and informationevents. 

Project 7: Individual stages
By internship abroad experienced they are in a different language, habits and customs working methods. 
Goal: stimulate and appeal  them to choose, do and carrying out responsibility in work and private life.
Students´ internships in England and Germany

The project "Students´ internships in England and Germany"   enriches the vocational education  with practice.  It is organized by Obchodná akadémia, Kukučinova 2, Trnava as the sending organization and ADC college and WBS as partners´ organizations.  It is funded under the action type is: VET learner and staff mobility in Erasmus+.

Primary project´s aims is to:
- increase the number of students who conduct the practice in an multicultural environment in foreign countries as the UK and Germany. 
- improve quality, proficiency and  efectivity of the students´ mandatory practice - internships

Secondary projects´ aims are to: 
- create the space for multicultural and bilingual working environment for the students studying at 4th and 5th grade at Obchodná akadémie, Trnava
 - prepare training activities  of internships for the short-listed candidates 
- organize info workshops and seminars  for the school and public in order to promote the interships´ learning outcomes, certificates, and Erasmus+

Number of the participants: 45 students and 3 accompanying persons
Profile of the participants: the students of  4th and 5th grade at the bilingual and general study programme at Obchodná akadémia, Trnava

Main activities:
2 - week internship (14 days ) in England provided for  30 students of  4th and 5th grade at the bilingual and general study programme 
2- week internship (14 days) in Germany provided for 15 students of  4th and 5th grade at the bilingual study programme
1st flow - Feb 07th - Feb 20th, 2016, 15 mobilities sent to England and 15 mobilities sent to Germany
2nd flow - Jun 12th - Jun 25th, 2016, 15 mobilities sent to England

Methodology:
internship, workshops, seminars, discussions, presentations, one-to-one meetings, štatistics

Project´s outcomes and impact envisaged: 
1) improved skills for leading positions (managers and leading staff of the school)
2) educational process enriched by practice and real gained of language speaking competences
3) increase in the number of lessons aimed at creativity, enterpreneurship and innovation
4) increase of the european awareness, equity, active citizenship and sensitivity to multiculutural environment 
5) increase in the number of employed graduates after the graduation
6) bigger interest in VET 

Potentional longer benefits:
- good school profile and prestige
- bigger interest  in our graduates  by  companies and firms on the EU labour market
Kwaliteitsborging met ECVET : de docenten aan zet!

General objectives : 
The project is focused on Quality Assurance and validation if Learning Outcomes n the framework of EQF en ECVET. The teachers play a crucial role in this proces. In order to get a good description of Learning Outcomes  and Learning units for students, it will be necessary the communicatie intensively with the partner institutions for sharing and exchanging information on curricula en methods.
On the other hand, our goal remains to increase the number of mobilities of students throughout Europe. We want to create more awareness of the global impact and of the European values and to make them realize that a united Europe and a good cooperation between the member states are crucial for the economic development in Europe. 
We aim at offering challenging education and we look for possibilities for designing  programmes for Excellent students but also for developing the talents of our students with a social lower background and to offer them a life changing experience.

More specifically :
1. The teachers will make arrangements with partners institutions abroad for describing Learning outcomes and Learning Units within the framework of EQF and ECVET by comparing curricula and exchanging information and good practices. 

2. An increased activity of school staff training in structured courses and jobshadowing to support their professional development and their language skills. Guestlecturing of teachers at a partner school abroad. This also includes supervisors of our regional enterprises providing training at a VET institute or company. 

3. Expansion of the number of mobilities of other educational courses within Friesland College by  adapting the curriculum and redesigning  the time period of the  work placements in order to  enable students to do their internship abroad. 

4. level 2 students, lower qualified and  with a low social background  living will participate in this project in order to strenghten their employability and transition to the labour market. 

5.  the quality of  workplacements. The standard will be kept high by using solid and renomated training companies,  by consulting the Dutch recognition organisations,  the intermediate organisations in the host country, the network of our educational partners abroad and by using the European instruments for the agreements on content, monitoring, validation, recognition and evaluation. 

6. More focus on subjects as Quality assurance, Excellence programme, sustainable energy, watertechnology, social entrepreneurship  and healthy Ageing. 

7. Leeuwarden as Capital of Culture 2018 , together with Malta Valletta 2018 will be a major theme within the international activiteiten in the years to come. 

Mobility projects have a hugh impact on the personal and professional development  of students and teachers by working in a different context, using different methods and foreign languages. They have a better understanding of the advantages of a European cooperation. In this call we will pay attention to the development of a programme for excellence as stated by the Minister of Education in order to develop the talents of our students from all 4 levels .
Exchange of knowledge and  good practices  and the comparison of curricula have a positive and enriching impact on Friesland College and its partners abroad. New methods are explored and shared amongst our regional and international partners. Quality assurance and validation of Learning outcomes are in our scope of attention. This project will also give an impulse to new KA2 projects in the future.
The experience abroad offers more perspective on the labour market in the region, especially for our level  1 and 2 students. 
The methods and activities are described in the Policy Document for Internationalisation 2015 - 2018 (annex)

Number of participating students : 118
Number of participating teachers and staff : 45. This is a considerable n increase  of mobilities. Especially our professionals will play an important role in the recognition of ECVET and EQF.

The primary aim of the project is to take into consideration all the requirements of the contemporary job market, and based on that to improve the  vocational and linguistic training of our students, and to strengthen their professional competence and specific linguistic competence - skills of effective communication, and the usefulness and uniqueness for the modern European job market.   

Additionally, we would also like to integrate our physically disadvantaged student into the working group, and to enable him to grow professionally, and increase the social consciousness of the whole group, and finally to ensure a personal growth for all the members of the group with the integrated student.

The experience with the employability of our students suggests us, that  youth has increasing problems with finding suitable jobs. The activities of our institution in cooperation with real firms, the experience form the subject training company, and the experience acquired from international fairs of training firms indicate the need for new, progressive and innovative methods of education based on the needs of Slovak and European job market. These methods emphasise the practical understanding, next to textbooks, they implement real situations from real life.       

Our vision is to recreate and improve a student's profile with professional and linguistic knowledge within five years, which follows the needs of the modern European job market. The basic tool for this change is the new and updated school educational program, which takes into consideration these requirements.  We would like to concentrate on the multicultural differences within Europe by learning about, and trying to understand and accept it.

From the perspective of the students' and employees' training the aims of our project are:
-to introduce to the students and to the employees the departments of the firms, and the agenda of each department
-to enable students and employees to consult with the professional workforce and with the management
-to introduce to the students and employees the work of the marketing department (marketing research, contact with clients, the preparation of catalogues and promotion materials, data processing, PR, the preparation and realization of meetings)
- to introduce to the students and to the employees the work of the HR department (training of the employees, types of contracts and  agreements, benefits, recruiting, job interviews, the preparation of a professional CV)
-to introduce to the students and to the employees the work of the economic department (budgeting, bookkeeping ,bookkeeping, reporting, statistics 
- to enable students and the employees to improve their communicative competence and professional vocabulary in English

We planned our mobilities as follows:
a/ students of the study field business academy - bilingual studies  - 10 students travel for three weeks to London, the mobility will take place either in November/December 2015, or in February 2016. We will clarify the time after the announcing the results of the selection.
b/  students of the study field business academy  - 10 students travel for three weeks to Vienna, he mobility will take place either in November 2015 
c/ employees - English group - 2 teachers travel to London for two weeks, the mobility will take place in October 2015.
d/ employee - Vienna, Austria - 1 teacher travels to London for two weeks, the mobility will take place in October 2015.

Target group of the project "Vocational Training Abroad 2" are the students of Business Academy in Levice. The project reacts to changing labour market needs and the movement of workforce in the united Europe.  It is continuation of the project being realized in 2014/2015 school year and aims at the educational services quality improvement offered by our school. At the same time it is an important factor of internatioanalization of our school and modernisation of methods and ways of education in it.
Main objective of the project is to provide participants the possibility to go through vocational training in a foreign working environment, to strengthen their specialist knowledge and improve practical skills leading to better and easier employability at the European job market.  
30 students of our school will take part in the project in two flows - in autumn 2015 and in spring 2016. 
Partner organization in Britain is ADC College in London.
Theoretical and practical knowledge of participants will be implemented into activities as: office work, work with office  and computer hardware, work with office and economic software, work with business correspondence, ICT work, e-communication, marketing and sales, etc.
The project will support participants´  communication skills in English language, especially in the field of terminology, which will enable them to be competitive at the European job market.
Project participants will get to know the country and people´s lifestyle, their mentality and values. That will enrich their personalities and develop their interpersonal and intrapersonal competences.
The results of the project will be disseminated on local, regional, national and international level.
Long-term impact of the project will be gradual stronger internationalization and modernization of our school and implementation of European dimension to education of students and teachers.
Zahraničná odborná prax - cesta k pracovnému úspechu

The project will take place in late January and February 2016 and will be attended by 10 students from SOS sv. Klementa Hofbauera from field cook / 6 students/, beatician/ 2 students/ and hairdresser/2 students/. The students who will participate in the project reguraly attend English classes. The group of students will be accompanied by an English teacher and another member of staff who also speaks English. The persons who will accompany the students are also responsible fo running the entire project and its outcome. They  will cooperate with Miss Kyselova who is the country manager of the ADC College and is a mediator among  SOS and plants. The main purpose of this project  is Professional development of the students in their field, raise the level of competence that will help students succeed not only in domestic but also in European or global market. Another reason is that the implementation of the project will allow students to carry out training in English plants and facilities where they can apply their theoretical and practical Professional potential in abroad, to acquire new skills and knowledge, learn new methods, techniques and technological processes. / cook- technique of oysters opening, preparation of English breakfast, serving English tea, new technique of folding table-napkins, preparing tables for quests, beatician- deep face cleaning by spoon, gel lacquer coating, eyebrow shaping strings, removing facial imperfection using crystal-microdermobrasia, hairdresser- straightening using steam curling brush, knitting synthetic hair in brainds intended for afro-hairstyles, massage/. Other objectives of international professional experience is improving technical terminology and conversation of students in foreign language. The students will also learn team work, discipline, work ethics, carrying out given tasks, they  broaden their cultural and social perspective and understandig for other culturs and increase confidence. Implementation of the project „International professional experience -the way to success at work“ school creates space for innovative way of learning, gain new knowledge, skills and experience in the area of training which will drive the futher training of Professional staff. The  Importance of the project is also aimed at strenghtening cooperation between education, training of the students and labor market. After succesful approval of the project  „ International Professional experience –the way to success at work“, the board of the School will carefully select through fair and objective criteria 10 students from three different studying fields mentioned above. The persons accompanying the students on their project will organise their travel arrangements to London, four months preparation course, one week English course with native English speaker, ensure signing contracts. They will organise and arrange variety of free time activities, time-monitor plan, provide students with leaflets of planned activity, create questionnaire and carry out monitoring. ADC College is the intermediary link between SOS and plants where students will perform Professional experience and also provides accomodation, meals and transport. The plants send details and requirements for students regarding international professional experience. Student assessment will be based on questionnaires completed by students and managers of plants, diares accompanying persons a monitoring. After the international Professional experience accompanying persons will prepare a final report. The content of the report will be made by benefits and importance of professional experience. The experience that the students gain help them to became more independent, more responsible, more mature and they realize the importance of continuos learning and work on themselves. After completing the program the students will be awarded with attending certificate and Europass Mobility which help them while looking for a job at labor market or if they decide to open their own business. It is a great opportunity for the students who will attend this program to represent their school, the region and most importantly the Slovac Republic. They will be spreading their culture, customs and traditions and help to improve its good reputation. Furthermore, the school SOS sv. Klementa Hofbauera will establish international partnerships with other schools and gain important business contacts. The publicity and awareness of the project will increase the school position and ranking among the other schools in the region. This will also attract more students and therefore will become a desirable place to study. This will highly improve the school´s name and reputation.

The main intention of the educational and school activities of the Secondary technical school (SPŠ)in Snina, SR is their interconnection with the employment politics and their adaptation to the job market requirements. Theoretical and practical educational level of the school graduates creates space for their employment also in other economic fields and sectors.
The main goal of the project Theory and experience is the possibility to orientate oneself:   
-in the world of the information and communication technologies, in newest technologies within the field of the machine engineering, industrial informatics, in the diagnostics and construction of the motor vehicles, in economic activities, in the transport logistics and to become a recognized specialist within these fields, to ensure the monitoring of the graduates’ demand and their required expertise. This mobility internship is a part of the School Educational program as an alternative possibility to the continual technical practice lasting for 2 weeks. It is also a part of the educational process and interlocks theoretical technical subjects. Strategic school intention is to integrate as many students as possible into the practice in various companies;their production orientation relates with the contents orientation of the technical subjects’ students taking part in these practices. The project goal is to enable school students their practice in various companies, which create for them suitable working conditions in accordance with the work program. Partner organizations and home organization submitted the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), where they declared to follow the ECVET conditions. Project contribution for students represents especially the possibility to use the most modern technical equipment, which can be used by target groups neither within the technical school practice nor in regional companies. At the same time, they can improve their technical terminology in foreign language area and learn a company culture.  
On the project Theory and experience will be participating 3 partners as follows: 
1. SPŠ in Snina, SR as home organization; 
2. BaK production Ltd. Písek, CZ as mediatory org.; and host org. in Písek -HEYCO WERK, UNITERM, ELO+,PETOKOV,–in this stage of the project preparation, they have already signed the documents of their acceptance and the letters of acknowledgement;
3. ADC College in London, UK as mediatory org.;and host org. in London centred on the IT, economics and administrative–Active Care, Chipping Barnet Library, Computer Aid International, Harlesden Library, Harmony Nursery Montessori, Home Library and Outreach Services, Kenton Library, Lewinson Centre Library, North Harrow Library, Pronta Print East Sheen, Pronta Print Harrow, Snappy Snaps Baker Street, Willesden Green Library – we have a long-time experience with them.
Project is going to be realized as follows:
I. in the CZ – in BaK production Ltd. in Písek& host companies – in activity A1 in 2 turns: - 1. 20. 9. 2015 – 4. 10.2015 – 15 st. &2 accompanying pers. - 2.: 4. 10.2015 – 17. 10.2015 – 15 st. &2 accompanying - from the following fields of study: machine engineering, technology &transport operations &electrotechnics; 
II. in the UK – in ADC College in London and host companies – in activity A1 in 2 turns: 
- 3.: 20. 9. 2014 – 3. 10. 2015 – 12 st. &2 accompanying pers., 4.: 4. 10. 2015 – 17. 10. 2015 – 12 st. &2 accompanying pers., - from the following field of study: technical lyceum.    
Specific goals of this field-trip are:- to gain practical skills& experience in the contents orientation to the students‘ fields of study and ICT;to integrate internship participants into the work cycle in the cooperative companies;to compare the last technical processes& trends gained throughout the theoretical learning &apply them into the practice; to make students familiar with operations &leading of the company, with the technological equipment in the host companies & also in other customer companies by the use of the technical excursion into them; to improve students‘ technical & field language competences in English; in the final workshop–to evaluate the contribution of the mobility internship–to add some specific technical & field matters into the topic educational plans & to make a discussion proposals for the subject commissions; to implement gained knowledge into the School Educ.Progr.every participant will process a presentation upon the topic of the mobility:Mobility internship according to me–report &contribution & surprise;from mobility internships–to create a calendar for 2016. Participants finish the internship with the:Certificate about the taking part in the internship presenting students’ gained skills & their evaluation–from host companies & mediatory organization, Certif. from the SPŠ Director about the acknowledgement of the technical practice–from home organization, certify. Europass Mobilita &Student’s personal letter.

The Business Academy (OA)  is a secondary vocational school based in Topoľčany. The school has long-term experiences in the field of education and is focused on preparation of students for execution of specific economic activities  OA tries to find a balance between theoretical knowledge and practical skills and supports the training in the real working environment. OA as the applicant organisation  will organize learners mobility in cooperation with the partner organisation ADC College based in London.  ADC College is a professional development and language tuition organisation. It has been involved in vocational and professional training for more than 20 years. 
The Aims:
The aim of the project "Education for Life" is to link theory with practice and world of work, to enable students to be involved in a mobility stay abroad. Students will be placed in companies the field of Business Administration in London. Different working and language environment will give students new experience and insight into the world of work in one of the biggest cities in Europe.  The participants will have to use English language in real-life situations. The project will support the idea of multiculturalism in students and their self-confidence and self-reliance will be strengthen as well. Thanks to the project the participants will become active in the labour market in Slovakia and  in the EU countries. The project is also a motivation tool as the academic results are one of the selection criteria.
The number and profile of the participants:
15 students and 2 accompanying persons  in the months of October and November 2015. 
All the participants are the students of the 6317M field of study – business academy. In their studies they gain theoretical knowledge in the subjects such as economics, accountancy, administration, correspondence and ICT.  Later they can apply their theoretical knowledge in training firms and  during their training in companies in Topolcany. The regular English language classes are supported by Business English. The graduate will gain theoretical knowledge and will obtain basic practical skills in the field of their study. The participants will be selected on the basis of their interest, academic results and language skills. The level of students´ language skills will be evaluated by entrance test, interview and essay. 
Description of activities:
Applicant organisation is responsible for:
Selection of the students based on their interest, academic results and language skills.
Language tuition in the form of a course focused on Business English and speaking skills.
A lecture on cultural differences and possible dangers of travelling and staying abroad.
Initial informative meeting for the participants and their parents.
Gaining the necessary details about students in order to provide the best placement in a company and family.
Transport to and from London.
Social security, mentoring and monitoring of the participants provided by two accompanying persons.
Informing about the activity in press and via video clip on the net.
Evaluating the contribution of the activity via the questionnaire for for the participants and the accompanying persons.
Organizing a lecture and discussion for students and teachers involved in secondary vocational education.
Praxou v zahraničí k zvyšovaniu kvality školy

From the long-term view of the labour market development, the fresh graduates of business academies will always be required. The employers demand graduates who are professionally well-prepared. The researches carried out lately uncovered the lack of skills of 
graduates to work individually, to solve the problems, and the research realized among the students of 3rd and 4th grades just supported, that the compulsory professional experience is mostly formal and does not bring along any expected results.
For that reason we have decided to improve the quality of already stated subject by means of the project Praxis abroad improves the school quality and by that the quality of school and its general image at the regional level as well. The very main objective of our 
school is to achieve improvement of graduates’ unemployment index (see UPSVaR). The total planned number of participants is 34; the number of students is 30. More than 50% of our students comes from the surrounding areas of Bratislava – they do not have 
the permanent place of living in Bratislava; and it is this group that has been monitored carefully, and has no will to take part in any type of mobility to undergo some professional experience. In case of participating these students on the foreign labour market, this particular personal experience with work abroad can help them break the stereotypes and enhance their interests in various work positions, where they will be able to completely embrace and apply adapted skills, education and help them get rid of fear and worries of mobility. The planned praxis will be held in 2 fortnight turns – 10/2015 and 5/2016 for the students of 3rd and 4th grades in London and Havířov, while 10 students will be sent to London and 20 students to Havířov; 4 teachers will go as pedagogical guides. The main activity is to practise professional praxis in enterprises and organisations set in London and Havířov. The students sent to Havířov will improve their soft skills in the real corporate environment on the daily basis and professional competences with emphasis on oral and written communicational abilities, archiving accounting documents, elaborating salaries and keeping the evidence of contracts. The priority to those taking part in London will be development of soft skills by realising commercial assets, marketing activities in English language. By usage of modern office equipment and computer software the students will 
adopt new skills and knowledge. The project will be held in the first and second turn according to the scheduled plan 
with applying project methods so that every student will accomplish stated goals. They key methods will include solving the problem situations and motivational challenges. The second and third realised turns will include elaborated and implemented proposals of students and teachers for improving organisation and the process of mobility.
The total result of the project will be professional praxis abroad; in the number of 30 students. The quantitative results will be represented by the number of students who obtain Europas Mobilita and certificates (the assumption of 30 students). Another result will be attested methodology ECVET in praxis – in the process of preparation, realising and evaluating the mobility. The qualitative results will display innovated organisation of teaching the subject – professional praxis; innovated School Educational Programme; in the part of the graduate’s profile as well as implementing of new forms and methods into the process of teaching. The essential impact of realising the project will be manifestedin the reinforcement of competence of project team and extending conceptual and organisational competences of participated teachers – 4 teachers, who will implement new forms and methods of education 
process into professional subject, what will be manifested in the final results and temporal  horizon by decreasing the number of unemployed fresh graduates (see UPSVaR). The innovations within the field of professional praxis will bring our students - in the long term - a potential to prepare for the current national and international labour market.
"Look What I Did!''-Portfolios in Nursery Schools

The project "Look What I Did!''-Portfolios in Nursery Schools is developed in cooperation with our partners ADC College based in London. Our purpose as a sending organization was to provide our students with the work placement abroad, so that they can learn about continuous (formative) assessment, in which the teacher regularly collects the products of child activities and evaluate them, forms child's pre-school portfolio. Continuous assessment is in nursery schools in Slovakia frequently absent and its contribution is not fully appreciated yet, although it is an important part of an effective process of education in the nursery.
The project is designed for 16 third-year and fourth-year students at four-year graduation study in the teaching for kindergartens and tutoring.
The main objective of the project is to promote quality and innovation in vocational training at our secondary school. The specific objectives of the project are mainly the improvement of communication skills; broadening the knowledge and skills necessary to direct educational activities with children in their field of the study, obtaining a better understanding of the continuous (formative) assessment and of different options in developing child's pre-school portfolio. Also they acquire greater self-confidence in the performance of their future profession to have better chances in the labour market. At the same time students get to know different levels of education, other forms of learning, different learning processes and different atmosphere relationships between teachers and pupils in nursery schools and thus gain international experience in the field, i.e. in real nursery schools.
These objectives achieved by implementing major activities: choosing the topic methods to improve the quality of the project entitled "Look What I Did!''-Portfolios in Nursery Schools, exploring cultural diversity and using an approach through the school curriculum.
The work placement will be held in London for a period of two weeks in February 2015.
The project will also involve the teachers of English, who prepare students for language and cultural training course. Students through the course strengthen language skills, handle technical terminology in the field of pre- primary education and learn about cultural differences within Great Britain. Also develop a resume, complete the necessary forms and will be prepared to gain maximum knowledge, which then they use abroad. For a successful internship it is important to prepare the students best.
During the internship the school will provide two accompanying persons whose task will be to monitor program, to communicate with the receiving organization ADC College and partner organizations, in which students will be during the work placement.
The expected outcome of the project is to obtain a Europass-Mobility and a Europass CV for all participants and participating internship certificate from ADC College. Likewise, the students will acquire professional competence and active identification with the department that they study and are actively involved in the running of the institutions during mobility.
Mobility should help deepen their professional knowledge and improve practical skills. Students will recognize different levels of education, other forms of learning, different learning processes and different atmosphere relationships between teachers and pupils in nursery schools in the UK. Based on the above they will be able to compare due to the mobility of working practices and systems of work in nursery schools in Slovakia and the UK.
Get new skills for better job oportunities

The project "Get new skills for better job oportunities" is created in partnership of Business Academy in Žilina with ADC College in London and is focused mainly on obtaining practical working skills of our students abroad and using their English language skills in practice. The main objective of this project is to enable students of our school to get working experience abroad by experiencing practical tasks at work, adapting to new social and working surroundings, motivating them to work hard, be flexible and active in communication in a foreign language. Specific objectives of this projects are to improve communication, social and digital competences of students, to extend working abilities of the students abroad, to enrich formal and informal education by practicing abroad,  to learn history, geography, culture, art and life style of British people, to experience multiculturalism and mutual tolerance among EU citizens. 
15 students of the Business Academy in Žilina at the age of 17 and 18  will participate in this mobility project. The project itself will be running for 12 months (from June 2015 to June 2016). It consists of the preparation of the project activities, realization of the project tasks by practicing working skills abroad and the final phase is connected mainly with propagation and dissemination of the project´s outcomes. The mobility itself will take place in May 2016. Students will be chosen according to their language and practical skills. The chosen students will prepare their CVs and other necessary forms and documents. During the preparing course they will get all practical information about working abroad which they can use when practicing in administrative departments of companies as administrative assistants, sales assistants or receptionists. The students can use their school knowledge and skills in practical situations (communication  in English language, use of ICT, business correspondence, telephoning, mailing or personal meetings, data processing etc.). Knowledge of English language (CEFR B1) is required from the participants of this project. 
Practical experience at British job market will help to develop student´s personality and increase their motivation to study English language and improve their skills in the field of economy. Spending two weeks in British families will give them a chance to get to know the culture, history, traditions and life style of British people. The students will be accompanied by a Slovak teacher of English language who will be responsible for all the project activities like choosing students, organizing language course, planning and preparing the whole journey to Great Britain – transport, insurance, accommodation, etc. During the stay in Britain she will be responsible for monitoring the whole program, communication with ADC College and companies where the students will be placed.
Expected outcomes of this project are improving specific language skills of students, obtaining new working experience within the European Union and practising theoretical knowledge of economy in practice. Participants will receive the „Europass – Mobility“ and the certificate from ADC College in London.
Leerlingen, leerkrachten en directie op internationale ontdekkingstocht

The project consists of three pillars:
 I) pupils mobilities:
-1 vocational students Group (9) from the study direction ' CNC controlled machine tools ' is going to be one week practice lessons in a Finnish school-SALPAUS-in Lahti.
ather the first week these students will go for 2 weeks on internship in Finnish companies. 
They reside in apartments
-a second group of students from the professional disciplines ' hair stylist ' (8) and ' care ' (7) is 3 weeks on internship in London these students stay in host families.
A large part (+ 65%) of our school population consists of GOK-pupils. These are so-called ' disadvantaged ' students.
We want to offer these students the opportunity to gain international experience in order to raise their chances on the labour market. Offering these students the opportunity on participation in an international project, we want to prevent early school leaving

II) teachers: 
We want to acquaint teachers with the Finnish education system and offer them the opportunity to exchange experiences with colleagues. The aim is to exchange good practices and at the Finnish colleagues , to take a look in their classrooms and teach 'guest lectures' to Finnish pupils in English.
We expect that this is a win-win situation for PISO en SALPAUS

III) management and staff members: 
the planned educational reforms will require us to adjust our vision and the organisation of our school.
To do this in an appropriate and thoughtful way to, we want to raise our insight  in the education system of Finland and change thaughts with our colleagues in Salpaus (= consortium of schools in Lahti-Finland) We want tolearn about school organization, guidance of pupils and pedagogical approach of problem situations such as bullying, immigrants etc..

Each group will of course taste the culture, habits and customs of the country in question.
This experience will raise at every level the awareness of the need for pushing the boundaries, internationalization in education, increasing mobility within Europe -for learners and trainers-and widening the vision of internationalization in general.
This project will contribute to increasing tolerance, broaden the spirits, strengthen the European ideal and to demonstrate the advantages of mobility for young people.

The Atheneum Dixmuide organizes in Newport a third degree care. This training prepares the students for a job in the children, the elderly, and home care. The emphasis is on the practical work where our students learn to deal with themselves, with colleagues and with people who need daily care. This training is both the development of young children as the process of aging. Attention is paid to relationships, behavior, communication and etiquette. The students are trained to observe and report, in collaboration with colleagues in the preparation of infant food and other meals. They learn about first aid, healthy food, the basis of dietetics and are familiarized with the labor law, the rights and obligations and health law. During the internships the students get acquainted with the future work situation and they get familiar with care situations with children in day care and the elderly in nursing homes. However, we note that our students often come from disadvantaged backgrounds, they have low self esteem and a narrow vision of the future. We want to change this, and the most efficient way is to acquaint the students with another world. We want to stage run in the healthcare sector in the metropolis London. This will have a huge impact on them because they have to survive in a country foreign to them in a foreign language. In many areas, they will find that they are much more capable than they realize. The far-reaching autonomy will be a huge boost in terms of their personal development. Their horizons will be broadened, and they will realize that more is possible in life. Naturally, the professional competences addressed and it will be for them an enrichment to compare the method within the healthcare sector between Belgium and Great Britain. There will be 15 students who get the chance to run two-week internship in London and to adapt to life in the big city within a family. On the stage, they will take care tasks in the elderly. There will also a supervisor of the school to support them where necessary. Our partner ADC College will provide a lot of support and follow up. They provide regarly consultation moments between student and internship. The project will be announced through the local press, on our open house, through Facebook and the website. The students will be making a portfolio and also get a certificate through ADC College and a validated Europass. All of this will be a huge value in the quest for a future employer. But besides that they will get a harder measurable effect : self-confident and motivated students who are ready to conquer the job market.
Heb je al gehoord van de Europese zevensprong?

Have you already heard about the European cross section? 

The Wijnpers is a secondary school of the province of Vlaams-Brabant, with professional, technical and artistic training modules and it accommodates 600 students between the ages of 12 and 20. The school stands out with education in specific areas as biotechnology, zoology, environmental and horticultural studies, a specialized refrigeration/cooling and heating division and applied arts and art education. The Wijnpers chooses for quality education starting from the abilities and talents of the students. 


Over the last couple of years we ensured a strong expansion of project work, a thorough induction of the workplace, internships and possibilities to connect with the labour market. The aim is to let our students graduate with success, reduce school dropouts as much as possible and offer them opportunities within their future career. The foundation of a seventh grade (vocational education) and the Se-n-Se-year on the one hand agricultural and green management and on the other in graphic design (additional seventh years after technical and artistic secondary education) fit within this framework. Based on their recent policy choices, the Wijnpers wants to profile itself as an international, multicultural and open-minded institution and with those aims in mind, we want to extend the internal workings of the school. 
 
Our strategic aim is that students need to encounter at least two years of international experiences and succeed to use foreign languages in a functional way. It is an ambitious goal since the Wijnpers’ population has a lot of socially vulnerable students and students with learning disabilities. Therefore, the school will start with a CLIL-course, language exchange and e-twinning and they will continue their ongoing tradition of multi-day study tours and project weeks to European cultural capitals abroad. This project situates itself within three different areas, all in line with the major objectives of the school’s vision: a training of the starting CLIL-tea, long internships abroad for students of the 7th grade (preceded by intensive training) and a targeted training of all the specialist teachers involved. The aim of foreign training and internships is to offer the students enough broad experience and to motivate them for a course and employment in engineering, science and multimedia.


It is expected that the project will provide a significant increase in motivation, practical language skills, learning and working abilities and choice ability of young adults so that their chances of further study or work career will rise significantly. The training of teachers has to cause a multiplying effect, both in terms of teaching abilities and as the internationalization of the school. The specific training of the CLIL-team, concerning the teaching methodology and the active language skills will result in strong professional results of all the teachers involved, an essential condition for the success of the CLIL-trajectory and the school’s general stand on the (foreign) language policy. For the school and their foreign partners this project will function as a learning curve, within which knowledge, contacts and experience will be exchanged. This addition can be, after positive evaluation and corrections by the quality caretakers, extended in the future and will lead to more extensive collaborations and new projects.

To be able to experience an internship in a vocational education is vital for the student's professional development. It also provides a better understanding of the profession and the environment that the profession is conducted in. To gain more understanding one should also look at other countries and cultures, how they work and what you can learn from them. We want to start this project to give our students the opportunity, while getting an understanding of other cultures and develop themselves, get better self-esteem and also improve their language skills. We want to send five students from the Beauty and Hairdressing program and the Childcare and education program to gain experience of working abroad. Our project partners have good contacts within these professions and can help us with good internships, but at the same time arrange accommodation and provide guidance about London and culture and life in the city. They will be introduced by the project partner about practical matters in London and be prepared for their internship. An accompanying teacher will also visit their work placements and ensure that the students have a good placements and look for other needs. They will also meet a mentor provided by the project partner during their internship, so their work will be monitored. 
We believe that the students will gain better insight into their professional field and more understanding of other cultures by doing their internship abroad. They can use their experience in their future professional life and share it to classmates, teachers and future colleagues.

DCC has four goal that this project will develop: 
1) That all students within the vocational program should complete their education. 
2) That all students at DCC should be qualified for employment after graduation.
3) To make the education interesting through internationalization. 
4) To promote the project to other schools and within the line of business

We will start this first year by sending 10 st students to London. These students are taking the business program and the hotel and tourist program. 
We will commence the selection of eligible students in May-June via a application procedure, where some questions, that we within the project have decided, should be answered. In addition the students will attach a cover letter. The selection committee consisting of teachers that know the applicant will then hold an interview with the student. 
We have chosen our receiving partner ADC since they have extensive experience receiving students and placing them at the right internship. They will also be able to help students with various kinds of issues, such as switching internship if the first one was not suitable. 
The diploma project (final thesis during year three) will be integrated in the internship project and the selected students will present a project plan for the diploma project. The diploma project will ensure that the final part, the spreading of the  Erasmus project will succeed. The students applying for the internship abroad will commence their final year of upper secondary education and will start preparing immediately for the internship when the final school year starts. DCC will prepare the students with workshops on working conditions, vocational English and well as coaching. The students that will participate in the project must pass all their courses within the program before going. 
The project is well in line with the National Agency for Education aim and goals both for the Hotel and Tourist program and the Business program. The aims for the Hotel and Tourist program, laid down by The National Agency for Education, says that advanced language skills as well as knowledge about destinations and routes is a requirement in the industry. Consequently, the training should enable the student to develop these skills. In the goals for the business program, the National Agency for Education, says that this line of work requires contacts between people and countries and personal encounters are important. The students should also have the opportunity of formulating and communicating viewpoints and messages in speech as well as in writing and also with the help of different media. Further, the business program should also provide students with the opportunity of deeper studies in English. Additionally,  the internship will give the students a diploma in Europass. 
The DCC students will finish the project by arranging a photo exhibition with documentation from the internship. Schools from our educational group (Academedia) as well as representatives from the industry will be invited to this event. 
The four goals that DCC is working to achieve will mainly be covered by this project. The project leader and the headmaster will evaluate the project after the first and the second year.

More than 35% of pupils and students regrets within one year the choice they have made. This counts for the choice of a job as well.
Pupils often don’t know what they want, generally. They go through an unclear orientation phase and decide at the last moment. Drop-out rates in higher education are, therefore extremely high.
Also pupils that take vocational training see themselves often confronted with a choice of profession that does not suit them after all. Also they need to receive better information and guidance regarding their professional possibilities. It is important that youngsters make work of a thorough self-reflection as to what would match their possibilities, interests and abilities. As a school, we should be there to guide and support them during this process. Secondary school need to make more specific and more thorough work developing a necessary and qualitative advisory function towards their student
Pupils need to test-drive the sector and profession of their choice during an internship. Pupils need more practical experience It is of utmost importance, not only to study their possibilities in theory, but to practice different work situation in real-life. This will help them to make a more realistic assessment of the different aspects that form part of their possible future professional life. Already acquired competences can be integrated within their the specific context of their internship. Also new competences will be developed.
