- improvement of the quality of vocational and language training,
- increase of outer students' interest in the school, and thus increase in its competitiveness on local educational market,
- expansion of the international apprenticeships offers in cooperation with British employers,
- after the graduation students will start their professional careers easier,

For city and its boroughs participation in the project will mean:
- increase of the attractiveness of vocational education in the region,
- perfect promotion,
- delivering on the labor market a better qualified and competent staff. It will result in improving the quality of services in the catering and hospitality.
The assumed objectives of the apprenticeship are therefore:
- gaining practical skills and work experience in catering and hotels fields, 
- gaining new qualifications and experience in the catering and hospitality,
- acquiring the knowledge of new technologies not available at school or local employers, 
- acquiring the ability of better and more efficient customer service in hotels and restaurants according to their needs and European standards,
- acquiring the knowledge about the cuisine of other nations, regions (working with products typical for regional cuisine),
- acquiring the knowledge about the operational specifics of the English restaurants and hotels (culture, customs, customers and guests habits, effective English communication,
- effective English communication and improving the efficiency of the usage of professional |English language,
- encouraging others to learn foreign languages,
- higher students motivation to learn 

The assumed objectives of the project are:
- 16 participants will gain professional experience of working in restaurant in England,
- 16 participants will gain professional experience of working in hotels/ travel offices  in England,
- 32 participants will gain language and cultural competences
- 2 vocational teachers will gain the knowledge about technology and production processes in catering and tourism fields.
- 1 English teacher will gain and broaden the knowledge about commonly used professional language.
Europejski wymiar kształcenia zawodowego w ZS nr 7 w Koszalinie

The project entails the realisation of two actions in school years 2015/2016 and 2016/2017 in which 64 students and 8 teachers from School Complex no 7 from Koszalin, Poland, will be involved.
Action A1 – completion of a 2-week  traineeship for 64 students from School Complex no 7 in training centres of the Plant of Promoting Vocational Training of Association of Building Construction Industry of Berlin and Brandenburg in Frankfurt/Oder and Cottbus.
Trip I
One group of 8 students from technical school of building construction will take part in training “Bricklaying craft – the wall in the construction of vaults”
One group of 8 students from vocational school specialising in finishing works in buildings will take part in training “Developing interiors using drywall”
Trip II
One group of 8 students from technical school of landscape architecture will take part in training “Shaping landscapes/gardens” (additional topic – “Small architecture in gardens”)
One group of 8 students from technical school of landscape architecture will take part in training “Designing ways and paths in natural stone and concrete in landscape architecture (additional topic “Visiting German gardens”)
Trip III
One group of 8 students from technical school of digital graphic processes will take part in training within the scope of basics of printing, multimedia techniques (presentations, animations)  and digital printing
Trip IV
One group of 8 students from technical school of building construction  will take part in training “Bricklaying craft – the wall in the construction of vaults”
One group of 8 students from vocational school specializing in finishing works in buildings will take part in training “Developing interiors using drywall”
Trip V
One group of 8 students from technical school of digital graphic processes will take part in training within the scope of basics of printing, multimedia techniques (presentations, animations)  and digital printing.

Action A2 – completion of 1-week training stay for vocational training teachers from School Complex no 7, including the representatives of the managing staff , in ADC College in London within the mobility “Sharing Good practice”
One group of 8 teachers will take part in training on the topic “Vocational training in Great Britain at secondary school level”
Objectives of the project:
1. Raising practical skills of the students within building construction works such as bricklaying, drywall processing, small architecture in gardens, designing and developing gardens, decorative paving as well as digital graphic processes.
2. Creating a dynamic team of teachers in School Complex no 7, characterised by engagement and professionalism.
3. Raising the attractiveness, quality and effectiveness of vocational training in School Complex no 7   through internationalizing the educational process and enriching teaching syllabuses with innovative elements.
4. Making possible for the participants to receive the certificate Europass-Mobility as well as other certificates and in this way adding to the improvement of the level of clarity and recognition of qualifications within the European Union.
5. Preparing and training graduates who will be competitive on the local, domestic and international job market, equipped in necessary vocational and social skills.
6. Raising language skills in the students and teachers within the scope of foreign languages.
7. Developing  the habit of “lifelong learning “ in the project participants (students and teachers).
8. Raising intercultural competences in the participants.
9. Gaining new professional experiences by the teaching staff and the raise in their competences connected with particular training profiles, including the ability to manage a school in case of the managing staff.
10. Better comprehension of practices, strategies and systems in the field of training and education systems in various countries of the European Union.
The expected results of the project are as follows: transfer of innovation from the German and British vocational training market, gaining and raising key competences by the participants from School Complex no 7 within such trades as technician of building construction, technician of landscape architecture, technician of digital graphic processes and technologist of finishing works in buildings as well as developing in the participants the attitude of openness towards taking up jobs and in-service training courses not only in their home country but also abroad.

Centrum Kształcenia Zawodowego i Ustawicznego (CKZiU) is a recent estabilished institution. It provides education to students in different types of school: technical and vocational, post-secondary and qualifying vocational training. The school offers students opportunity for lifelong learning and to gain qualifications for new jobs. In the  school  1236 students are educated and 189 teachers are employed. 


The main goal of the project is to gain new qualifications and skills and to be identified on the European labor market; and  to develop language skills.
Students will develop their vocational competences -  it will improve their self-development skills and it will help them be more experienced on the labor market in Poland and in Europe. Students will improve their vocational competences in the following specialities: 
- The economist technician - The traineeship will be held in offices, institutions and companies  where students will have the chance to get in touch with customers and to prepare business documentation. They will learn the accountancy system in Portugal and Spain.
- The advertising technician – students will opportunity to develop their  skills in fields of banners designing and slogans creating. They will learn the structure and function of advertising.  
- food technician and waiter will have a Chance to learn New methods and techniques of customer service, they will learn how to prepare new meals and beverages and they will learn how to operate machines and devices in the kitchen. They will develop their language skills and new techniques of sales.
- students who are trained in the field of hotels and hospitality will learn the structure of hotel organization and customer service .
-  students who are train in the field of clothes designing will learn how to create traditional Spanish and Portuguese clothes.
Students will learn European Work Safety System and the organization of companies.
During visits teachers will have opportunity to learn new teaching methods in vocational schools in other countries. They will have opportunity to be more communicative in foreign languages. Teachers will have opportunity to develop their vocational skills and lessons in their schools will be more effective and efficient. 
In both groups participants of the project will be aware of social, language and cultural diversity.
Paricipants of the Project are not the only adventaged group. School and the teachers will receive better qualified staff and  students who are prepared for the labor market. In order to the cooperation with foreign institutions the school will be more innovated and attractive through the new methods of working .
CKZiU  will organize the logistic side of the project and language and cultural preperation.
CKZiU will be responsible for the recruitment of the participants and all the rules will be clear for them.
Participants of the project will receive: Europasses of mobility prepared by CKZiU, certificates of the work placement and training of the staff prepared by host partners, and ECVET. In order to work placement, students will prepare the multimedia presentation. It will contain information about the host country, information about the host partner and the host company, the cultural preparation. The presentation will be displayed on the school website and will be presented during the final conference about the project.
Teachers will be obligated to write the report and prepare training materials ( lefleats, multimedia presentation for the teaching Staff of CKZiU) and present effects of the visits. Training materials should contain information gathered during visits and trainings ( methods of vocational training, didactic materials, feedback).
For the final conference about the project CKZiU will invite local authorities, representatives of other schools and representatives of employers.
Participating in the project will influence the quality of teaching and will increase the prestige of the school.

The aim of the project 'Młodzi mobilni - sięgajmy po więcej'  prepared by Zespol Szkol im. ks. J. Tischnera in Dobczyce near Cracow in Poland is to acquire by the participants additional occupational competence by developing their knowledge and skills in IT, catering and hair and beauty and use them in practice in a real work environment. They will find out about modern, innovative technologies and develop their language competence using English in communication.  Four groups of students (16 students in each group) from IT, hair and beauty and catering from Zespol Szkol im. ks. Jozefa Tischnera in Dobczyce  will be sent to a two-week apprenticeship in companies in London organized by ADC College. IT students will have apprenticeshipin the following companies: Brightbox Marketing, Chiswick Computer, Computer Aid International, Covent Garden Dragon Hall Trust, Finchley Computer Center, hitech Computer Repairs, KF Computers and Imaging. Catering students in Cafe Rive Gauche, Cleveland Hotel, Crowne Plaza London the City, Holiday Inn Bloomsbury, InterContinental London Park Lane, Marriot Hotel Maida Vale, Renaissance Hotel Heathrow, Travelodge Tower Bridge, and hair and beauty students in Roxy Beauty, Shades Tanning and Beauty, Essensuals Hairdressing, Andy Hair Studio, HOB Baker Street, Toni ang Guy Ealing. The apprenticeship will be held: hair and beauty - 08.11.2015 - 21.11.20015, catering (first group) - 22.11.2015 - 05.12.2015, IT - 28.02.2016 - 12.03.2016 nad catering (second group) 13.03.2015 - 26.03.2016. Sixty four students at the age of 17-18 and eight teachers will take part in the project. Participation in the project increases occupational and language competence of the students and their chances on a job market. They will also develop social and individual skills, it enhances their self-esteem, confidence, responsibility, ability to work in a team. The acquired skills will be confirmed by Europass Mobility and ECVET. The students come from Dobczyce or nearby rural area with high unemployment rate. The project intends to increase knowledge and to develop skills in reference to the needs of a job market, promotes vocational training in the real job environment which will result in greater attractiveness of participants among employers and will increase their employability. Moreover, the project is connected with the school needs stated in the school european development plan and quality plan. Our school is planning to develop contacts and cooperation with partner organisations from other European Union countries which will lead to internationalisation of vocational training and exchange of experiences and good practices with partner organisations. In the long term it will improve not only the quality of vocational training but also foreign languages competence and knowledge about cultures and culture differences in European Union countries. Participation in the mobility will motivate students to learn and extend their knowledge. What is more, the project will foster to adjust vocational training to the needs of local, regional and national job markets as well as will enhance the region development by providing vocational training in trades where there are shortages.

The project entitled “Europe educates professionals” is to prepare and undertake a placement in training institutions abroad in the UK in England. This project is going to involve 46 students and 4 teachers from Vocational and Technical Secondary Schools in Lubliniec. Students in our school are trained in mechanics (project planned for 12 students), catering services (16 students) and hairdressing (18 students). The project will be implemented in three phases: preparing a foreign internship, a foreign internship and evaluation. In preparation for the trip will be a teacher for classes on stress management, coping skills in crisis situations, multiculturalism and language preparation classes. The traineeship will last three weeks, hairdressers and mechanics will be trained in the training center HWK Potsdam, Germany while the caterers are going to have practical classes in companies supported essentially and practically by ADC College London - the United Kingdom. The program has been developed jointly by mail and telephone. With the training institutions will be signed a contract which will contain the implementation of the practices, arrangements for accommodation, food and transport, care of the participants, social facilities, organizing trips.
The project responds to the needs of the school, the students and the district. The school needs are increase market position of educational services, as well as its prestige, raising the level and quality of education, increasing recruitment results, raising the level of intellectual and cultural of students. The needs of the student are work experience, developing the professional and linguistic abilities, job mobility, gain new life experiences and knowledge, becoming independent, learning about other cultures and gain life skills in a multicultural society, and thus develop cultural awareness project participants. The needs of the district are to promote, improve the quality of services relating to motor vehicles mechanics, hairdressing and catering. Tasks of school and other training institutions involved in vocational education and their implementation are determined by changes taking place in the economic and social environment which affects in particular the idea of ​​a knowledge-based economy, globalization, economic and social processes, increased international trade, geographical and occupational mobility, new techniques and technologies, as well as an increase in employers' expectations in terms of the level of knowledge and skills of employees.
The objectives of the project are to improve professional skills, raising the level of knowledge and professional skills, qualitative improvement in European mobility project participants, participants' language skills with special emphasis on professional foreign language training, improving teamwork and individual work, work experience in a modern company oriented to the development of employee, to certificate attesting to the practice and certificates of the companies taking on an internship, learning aspects of work in different linguistic and cultural conditions.
The main results of the project will strengthen the professional capacity of participants confirmed by certificates – certificates Europass Mobilities, participation certificates and certificates of the companies taking on an internships, certificates attesting to the language courses and cultural preparation classes.
The project involves the dissemination activities results by: summing up conferences, articles published by the local press, articles posted on the internet on the school website, school fb profile, a group on fb relating to internships and workshops for secondary school students and promotional meetings in secondary schools. The project will be constantly monitored and evaluated. Evaluation will be carried out by means of questionnaires developed by the project team checking how participation in the project affects the professional skills of participants, individual and group. In addition there will be organized competition for the best multimedia presentation relating to an internship acquired in the language of the country in which the internship will take place. All the  activities will be aimed at finding the strengths of the project, as well as the weak so that the final analysis provided an opportunity to formulate conclusions useful for writing final conclusions useful for work on other projects. All activities are part of  European strategy for development which is part of the implementation of strategies for solving social problems in the district.
Pierwsze doświadczenia zawodowe w zagranicznym przedsiębiorstwie

The current economic reality in Europe creates an urgent need for preparing young people to take on difficult roles of participants of modern market economy. The mobility project, which is a part of the program called Erasmus+, creates an opportunity to organize apprenticeships abroad for thirty economics and IT college students. The improvement of student mobility is a part of the European Plan for School Development.
There are three groups of students:
1. Two groups of economics students will serve a three-week apprenticeship in London, UK. 
The first group is planned between  7th and 25th March 2016 and the second between 6th March 2017 and 24th March 2017.
2. For IT students the four-week apprenticeship will be served in IT firms in Germany and is planned between  4th and 30th January 2016. 
The project’s partners are: 
The Polish side: Zespół Szkół Nr 10 im. Stanisława Staszica ( sending partner)
The German side: Vitalis Betreuungsgesellschaft für Modellprojekte mbH residing in Schkeuditz near Leipzig.
The British side: ADC Technology Training Ltd residing in London.
The fruitful cooperation between partners results from previously completed ‘Leonardo da Vinci’ projects.
The partners will do everything they can to meet the project’s goals with the highest standards and quality.
The main goals of the project are:  
- to upgrade the quality and effectiveness of professional training and teaching ;
- to broaden international cooperation in the field of implementing apprenticeship;
-to improve social and organizational skills
- to gain practical and professional skills on European level ;
- to use the newest  information and communication technologies in the training process;  
- to improve both professional English and German;
- to increase professional mobility of students and their teachers;
- to develop tolerance towards cultural, ethnic and religious diversity.
- to increase the chance of finding employment in the European Union.
The programme of apprenticeship was agreed with the British partner and consists of the following modules: practical improvement of foreign language, getting to know the company’s functioning in its indoor and outdoor surrounding, commercial documentation, human resources policy, accounting and marketing activity of the company in economic market conditions. London is a perfect place for economic professional training, it has a special place on Great Britain’s market map and is a core financial and trade centre for the country as well as the whole Europe.
The British partner will organize apprenticeships for students in the following companies: Wellworking Ltd, Active Care, Maygrove Estate Agents (Kilburn), BFS Interiors. London’s multiculturalism will help the students shape their understanding of other cultures. The students will gain new skills in testing and servicing computer hardware and software. They will also have an opportunity to communicate in English. These are very important life and work qualities needed in the globalization of the European economy. 
The apprenticeship programme for ICT students provides that will work in German companies from the IT industry such as ZAW – Zentrum fur Aus – Und Weiterbildung In Leipzig GmbH, Robotron Bildungs – Und Beratungszentrum GmbH Leipzig. The students work will involve configuration, operation, installation and maintenance of computer hardware and software. The participants will receive a proper language, cultural and pedagogical training. The project’s participants will be given a certificate and Europass Mobility document in Polish and English which provides opportunities for finding employment not only in Poland but also in the whole European Union. They will also receive references from their employer to make their CV more attractive. In order to complete the apprenticeship the students have to gain a grade consistent with the European Credit System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET).
Innowacyjna praktyka w Europie - lepszy start w przyszłość zawodową

The project entitled ”Innovative training in Europe – better start in professional future” carried out by Zespol Szkol no3 in Wadowice  will last for 12 months, it intends to organize 4 mobilities:
1) in London for 16 students (8 trade technicians + 8 economic technicians) – 3 weeks
2) in Austria/ Carinthia for 20 students (10 food and gastronomy service technicians + 6 waiters + 4 hotel industry technicians) – 3 weeks
3) in Plymouth for 28 students ( 12 graphic design technicians ) – 4 weeks
4) in Lisbon for 20 students ( 12 graphic design technicians + 8 hotel industry technicians).
The main aim of this project is to improve the quality and vocational education innovation by gaining professional and language skills, and socio-cultural competence by 84 students from our school, the acquisition of valuable experience and professional skills and also language development of their trade, and thus improve their qualifications and competitiveness on the labour market. Our trainees will work in various positions in catering, hospitality, advertising, trade and business companies in English and German-speaking environment.
The new skills they will gain make them more attractive on the Polish and European job markets. They will also be effective and helpful for students while starting the first job or running and managing their new businesses. All these skills will let them easily deal with  various ingredients used in Austrian cuisine, modern technology used in trade or business, and also computer software used in advertising or hotels. The language and civilization skills will help them in  future business contacts with English, Austrian, Portuguese partners. The long-term benefits of their work experience are:  high self-esteem and awareness of gaining new skills.
The expected effect of the project is the acquisition of the new practical knowledge and professional experience, which directly increase the attractiveness of our future graduates in the job market, as well as the improvement of  communication skills by using professional vocabulary in the participants’ trades (catering, hotel, advertising, business and commerce).
The participants of the project will receive certificates of Europass Mobility and ECVET documents confirming the acquired knowledge and skills.

The Applicant Organization , Zespol Szkol Morskich in` Gdańsk, is planning to implement and carry out the second edition of a project called “A hotel worker in London”. The project concerns a group of 20 students aged 17 and 18, studying at a secondary technical school (hospitality major) and two teachers from the school. The partner Organization is ADC College from London, an organization offering education and professional development programmes for students and teachers from many countries. The students from Zespol Szkol Morskich who will take part in the project will be chosen according to a clear set of criteria set by the school headmaster and designated teachers. 

The participants are  going to have a 4-week training in hotels in London according to a programme developed together with ADC College, after taking into consideration the participants’ needs and expectations. This programme will correlate with the Polish syllabus of  the Ministry of Education for hospitality major. Before leaving, the students with attend a course which will give them psychological, cultural and linguistic preparation. Emphasis will be placed on a stay in multicultural and multiethnic London, apprenticeship in international working environment and thorough psychological preparation for a month stay in a big metropolis in a foreign country. ADC College is going to organize work practice in a number of London hotels and accommodation with host families, public transport and transfer from and to the airport. During the time of the project the students will be supervised  by the appointed teachers from Zespol Szkol Morskich. They will also be provided constant monitoring of their progress by the experienced workers of the Partner Organization, ADC College. In the time of their stay in London the participants will find out about the tourist values of London and will be able to participate in an interactive way in the multicultural environment, in the city where people from the whole world meet. Apprenticeship in London hotels, where workers from many countries are employed, will enable them to gain not only professional competences, but also cultural, personal and practical ones. The necessity to use English language during work and afterwards will increase the communication skills, which, due to the fact that Poland is becoming more and more popular among foreign visitors, may prove a great asset for the students’ future careers.  

After the project concludes and the students return to Poland, the ECVET procedure will be implemented and  the students will be awarded  Europass - Mobility Certificates. The effects of the project will be disseminated in the school, local and national environment (website, articles in the press, hotel conferences), but also internationally (references and job offers from London hotels). 

The predicted aims of the project are:
- gaining high European competences and professional skills in hospitality industry
- getting better professional perspectives and adaptation to rapidly developing working environment, also international
- increasing quality of work of the team of teachers responsible for professional training
- acquiring better English language skills
- increasing multicultural and European awareness
- deepening the knowledge of the benefits of European projects, higher motivation towards future projects
- achieving higher motivation in learning and personal development, self-confidence and life long learning process
- increasing professional mobility
- learning the history, culture and tourist attractions of London.

All in all, the project will definitely contribute to higher quality of work of Zespol Szkol Morskich, the applicant,  in the future, with special regard to its innovative and international character. It will have a positive impact on the international mobility of the students and teachers.
Zwiększenie szans na zatrudnienie poprzez europejski wymiar nauczania w SOIZ

The project called "Enhancing the chances of employment through European educating standards in SOIZ"is targeted at the  third grade students attending Technical Secondary School of Tourism and Technical Secondary School of Logistics in the School of Organisation and Management in Cieszyn. Whithin the project three sixteen - student groups along with two teachers will go abroad to take part in the work experience. Students from the logistics school will go to London where they will work in the companies whereas students from tourism school will spend two weeks working in hotels and travel agencies both in London and Rimini. Most of the students commute to school from nearby villages. Only 30% of them live in Cieszyn. They come from families with low incomes and therefore low living standards. 24% of the students come from famielies where one parent does not have a job. Students coming to SOIZ usually received  average grades in Junior High School. Low motivation to learn, low self-esteem, lack of self-confidence, low level of English language competence, lack of possibilities of gaining experience in working in multicultural teams, weak mobility are their main weaknesses. Students from tourism school study only the theory but they have no opportunities of experiencing other countries, their cultures and real language.Through the European educating standards in SOIZ we want to enable students to get to know European job market. Taking part in the project is supposed to create the chances of gaining work experience, additional job qualifications and experiencing new cultures and learning languages. Another significant aspect is development of personal competence such as increasing students' self-esteem, ability to cope with sterss, international team cooperation, increasing their motivation to learn and become more open to their mobilities. Getting job qualifications, language and personal competences approved by Europass Mobility Certificates are aimed to increase thei chances of being employed and entering the job market in Poland and Europe.The project gives the opportunity for development of students' job skills as well as personal development of teachers involved in the project. It will enable the students to get to know European job market, develop English language skills and increase their mobility. It is also a big opportunity for the school to teach in European standards.The students taking part in the project will be chosen by a selection committee. After that, they will attend a special profession, language and culture-oriented programme, which will prepare them to take advantage of the training so that their working skills could improve significantly. The programmes of the work experience for both professions were made together by vocational subject teachers and institutions employing students to enable them to gain all the skills which they would not get if they had the training on the domestic and local markets The work experience will last two weeks and will be organised in cooperation with ADC College in London and Instituto Turismo In Rimini.After completing the training the students will get certificates issued by partner insitutions, school and Europass Mobility Certificate as well. The training will be evaluated by vocational subject teachers,  which will have some influence on their final grades in the vocational subjects. The grade will also be typed on their school report. The realization of the project will be monitored all the time by the project coordinator, but the realization of the training will be monitored by the tutors ( vocational subject teachers supported by language teachers) and people from the partner institutions.  An agreement concerning the  realization of the training programme  as well as  implementing the  ECVET system will be signed to make the training compatible with the project assumptions. The working skills gained - in fact the students' learning effects- will be evaluated strictly according to specified requirements in England and Italy where they will have the training.Expected results:1. Students will have international job skills connected with tourism ald logistics along with relevant work experience and Europass Certificate, which will make them more attractive on the job market2. Students will have better language skills related to professional language (proper vocabulary, speaking skills) and they will be more self -confident while speaking foreign language.3. students will enhance their personal.and social competence and their mobility will be increased4. Students will gett better chance to find a job on both domestic and foreign job markets5. the school will be more attractive and efficient due to European educating standardsThe project coordinator will be responsible for substantive and financial monitoring. She will also control the level of achieving effects assumed in the project.

Gymnazium M.R. Stefanika Kosice (GMRSKE) is a grammar school situated in Eastern Slovakia currently with extended language education. Legislative changes in the educational area effective since September 2015 have brought for foreign language teachers many challenges. English, German and French language teams in the school have identified foreign language methodology problems and the introduction of the CLIL method as the main challenges facing the school and its language teachers.In order to look for solutions to these problems we selected three courses taking place in English speaking countries and appointed three English language teachers to attend. Two of the courses focus on CLIL methodology where the first will be organized at ADC College in London in The United Kingdom and the second will take place at The University of Limerick- English Matters in Ireland. The Methodology and Language course at Anglolang is located in Scarborough in The United Kingdom. The courses will be undertaken during summer 2016.Participants will demonstrate their newly acquired skills at GMRSKE during the academic year 2016/17. Consultation, clarification and support for all members of staff will be available throughout the academic year. The GMRSKE management team will monitor progress, measure outcomes, research teachers and students on success of the new methodology.The expected impact of the project on GMRSKE is to upgrade language qualification levels and teaching competencies of our language teachers in keeping with European Union best standards in language education. This has to finally benefit our students in being more competitive in applying for EU University places or well capable to withstand the competition on the EU’s labour market if they opt for work experience after they complete secondary education.

The Business Academy (OA)  is a secondary vocational school based in Topoľčany. The school has long-term experiences in the field of education and is focused on preparation of students for execution of specific economic activities  OA tries to find a balance between theoretical knowledge and practical skills and supports the training in the real working environment. OA as the applicant organisation  will organize learners mobility in cooperation with the partner organisation ADC College based in London.  ADC College is a professional development and language tuition organisation. It has been involved in vocational and professional training for more than 20 years. The Aims:The aim of the project is to enable employees a professional training abroad and development of teaching skills. The participants will  receive a tailored training in implementation of CLIL into non language school subjects. English lessons will enhance  course experience and make employees more confident when using the English language during their vocational lessons. This professional and qualified staff  will enhance the competitivenes of the school.  The school becomes the place with the new and attractive learning environment  and more tailored  curriculum  to specific needs of the students. Thanks to the project the participants will benefit not only professional but also personal growth . The project is also a motivation tool as the other employees will work more effectively to participate in a project.The number and profile of the participants:Altogether 5 teachers in June 2017, 3 English language teachers and 2 teachers of vocational subjects. All of them have some experience in managing previous Comenius now Erasmus+ projects Description of activities:Applicant organisation is responsible for:Language tution in the form of a course focused on Business English and speaking skillsOrganizing a lecture and a workshop about mobility and application of CLIL into non language subjects.Sharing and publishing the activity in press and school magazineSharing the teaching materials from the activity on school and edu page.Organizing a discussion for students and teachers involved in secondary vocational educationEvaluating the contribution of the activity via the questionnaire for the participants.Transport to and from LondonADC College is responsible for:Announcing the content of the courseTailoring the content of the course to a specific needs of the applicantOrganizing the accommodation in familiesMentoring and monitoring of the participants Issuing accredited Certificate
ΠΡΑΚΤΙΚΕΣ ΕΜΨΥΧΩΣΗΣ ΚΑΙ ΔΙΑΧΕΙΡΙΣΗΣ ΓΙΑ ΤΗΝ ΑΝΑΠΤΥΞΗ ΤΩΝ ΕΚΠΑΙΔΕΥΤΙΚΩΝ

CONTEXT AND BACKGROUND OF THE PROJECT:Teachers are recognized as key to the quality of any educational process. To offer what they can, they need, like all professionals, a positive work environment that encourages, motivates and understands them and manages the crises that arise. Such an environment is created by a proper management of human resources, which in addition can be applied from the teachers to the pupils, and create a positive work environment (and therefore learning) in the classroom. So knowledge on human resources management causes benefit to both teachers and students.With this in mind, the sending organization wants to educate those of its staff interested in the subject of human resources management in education. For this purpose it chose a relevant 27-hours course, run by the educational organization ADC College.OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT:1. Development of the staff of the sending organization in human resources management, motivation, encouragement and awareness, so as to improve the working environment2. Improvement of the quality of the educational process of the sending organization through the use of the skills of Objective 1 for the encouragement and motivation of the students of the organization3. Creation of a European dimension to the organization and conveyance of it to its students4. Acquisition of management skills and professional development of the participants, as the course is aimed at teachers who wish to serve as education officials.Objectives 1 and 4 fall within the area of management skills and Objective 2 in the field of personal skills.Targets 1 to 4 fall in European Priorities 1, 3, 4, 5, 9 and 10 of the action KA1 and cover specific needs of the sending organization, as specified in its European Development Plan.NUMBER AND PROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS:Participants will be nine (9) teachers of different disciplines, which will be placed in the sending organization in the school year 2016-2017. They will be interested in getting management positions in education and have several years of service before them to exploit in secondary education (as managers or teachers) the training that they will receive. As specified by the host organization, prerequisite is knowledge of English of at least B1 level. DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVITIES:The training has duration of five (5) days and negotiates four issues: Effects on Human Behaviour, Individual Differences and Diversity, Learning and Development and Creating Incentives and Satisfaction. At the end of the day's presentations, participants will be divided into groups and do groupwork on subjects set the host organization. On the last day they will present their findings to the trainers and evaluators that will assess the training.METHODOLOGY:- Signing of Contract of Cooperation, Training Agreement and Quality Commitment, Declarations of the participants. - Preparation of the participants on practical issues- Realization of the mobility- Evaluation of the progress of participants by trainers and by themselves, evaluation of mobility- Creation of deliverables, submission of them to the National Agency together with the final reportDELIVERABLES, DISSEMINATION AND EXPLOITATION OF RESULTS:   1. Creation of a new eTwinnng group on the subject of our mobility and posting there as a starting material of the presentations that will have to be done as part of training   2-6. Creation of a dissemination workshop,  an issue or leaflets, a CD,  a blog, articles in the local newspaper and in wider circulation newspapers with the with presentation of the results of the groupwork IMPACTThe impact of the project is expected to be significant.PARTICIPANTS:  come into contact with open educational issues, express their European understanding in teaching practice and apply new knowledge and skills to pupils and colleaguesSENDING ORGANIZATION: improve its educational process due to the above knowledge and skills, enter the European environment, acquire European experience and cover some of the needs identified in its European Development PlanHOST ORGANIZATION: contribute to the improvement of education in Europe and integrate the sending organization in its cooperation networkTarget group STUDENTS: experience the improvement of the educational process and the school atmosphere due to the participants' knowledge and skillsTget group ASSOCIATION OF PARENTS AND GUARDIANS AND LOCAL SOCIETY: add the sending organization to the few local institutions that study scientific and practical educational issues, realize that the sending organization shows real interest to get better for benefit of the younger members of societyPOSSIBLE LONG TERM BENEFITSCreation of partnerships and twinning with schools abroad, involvement of other teachers in European mobilities, increase of the prestige of the sending organization in the local community
PROYECTO DE APOYO A LA FORMACIÓN DEL PROFESORADO PARA INTEGRAR LAS LENGUAS EUROPEAS EN EL APRENDIZAJE DE LOS CONTENIDOS CURRICULARES

Institut Jaume Mimó is a public school teaching compulsory education, bachelleratoa and vocational training (BETC3 and BTEC5).There are 696 students in morning and afternoon shifts.At all levels of education students pursue English and French  as a foreign language being one of themain subjects necessary for their future work. The Strategic Plan of the school promotes the realization of a project aiming to improve the English language skills of the students in secondary education, integrated in the CLIL (Integrated Content and Language Learning) which has started to be developed so far. The strategic action of the project is to improve teachers' language skills and to innovate their teaching methods to develop the CLIL strategies. Our school has reached an agreement with a European training centre ADC College, specialized in languages, located in northwoest of London, accredited by the British Council for its educational quality of English. This centre offers a wide experience in structured corses for different aims and especially for mobility projects associated with other European educational institutions.Requirements have been established for hiring teachers to access to the project, prioritzing those teachers who have started the teaching practice of their curriculum in the English language and have made a commitment with the organization of continuing  teaching the subject in the English language during 2017/2018 and the two subsequent academic years. Another important element is to sign an agreeement with the organization to revise and improve the teaching methodology implementing strategies gained in this mobility project.The methodology of the project is a training course in the CLIL method, with the aim of providing the teaching staff with tools and strategies to create an effective methodology and curriculum to teach English in different subjects. Teachers commited to the project will develope new materials and methods for the teaching and learning in the CLIL methodology and the use of programs and updated resources.During the course 2017/2018 the teacher participating in the project will teach their subject in English. The expected impact of this action provides a quantitative improvement in the results of basic skills in the English language of each group of students and in all the levels at school.The qualitative improvement of students and teachers will reflect in the English language skills. These impacts will be assessed through monitoring systems and external tests that already exist in our organization.We hope this project promotes other goals, such as improving student's motivation for academic success and reduce the student's dropout in the future. We are looking forward to having a great impact in the participation of the educational community as a consequence of improving the langauge skills and promote intercultural relationships among different countries int eh European Union.

The Institute of Higher Education "Perito-Levi" of Eboli (SA) has been actively involved in projects for the promotion of the teaching and the integration with the territory for years in order to encourage the rediscovery of the historical, artistic and cultural identity. This union is showed in the guidelines defined by the POF (extra-curricular course proposal) where, among its most important goals, the support for cultural promotion initiatives sticks out. In this perspective, the Institute aims at underlining its natural vocation of innovative educational space, involved in the integration between the institutional training tasks and the renewed attention to the issue of the promotion of cultural heritage. In both areas, the Institute promoted activities designed to improve education  and events for the recovery and the appreciation of the artistic and cultural tradition.  The project C.O.O.L. - Culture: Opportunity of Learning - represents an opportunity for a dialogue with Spanish and English teachers/experts to begin a process of qualification of the teaching and professionalization of training pathway. The experience of mobility will offer participants the opportunity to sharpen teaching skills and evaluate the occasion to use ICTs. At the same time, they can have the chance to get acquainted with the management and development systems of the artistic and cultural heritage and of initiatives that host countries adopt in order to increase the tourism flow.The main objectives that the project C.O.O.L. aims at are:- strengthening internationalization and continuing education in the perspective of lifelong learning;- activating a network of exchanges with educational institutes in other European countries on the issues of innovative teaching and transfer of new approaches based on ICT;- experiencing new methods of teaching (CLIL);- enriching the knowledge of the impact of new technologies on the increase of tourism flows;- encouraging the integration between the contents of the disciplines of study and the opportunity to experience cultural marketing strategies and methodologies for optimizing the use of cultural heritage.The beneficiaries of the planned activities (job shadowing and structured courses) will be 20 teachers of subjects related to art and related to different fields of study. They are teachers who show peculiarities and common needs, particularly careful to the dimension of the lifelong learning, sensitive to the theme of the enhancement of the cultural heritage, open to transnational dimension and to professional and educational mobility, promoters of initiatives for the recovery and the reevaluation of the local, artistic and cultural tradition. The mobility period, at “ADC College” in London, will last 15 days (excluding travelling time) and the expected activities will be aimed at learning new methodologies in the classroom and laboratory teaching. The courses, organized by "Cervantes Training Institute" of Madrid, will last 15 days, too and they will focus on: cultural marketing and strategies of strengthening and awareness of the local heritage.The project C.O.O.L. foresees results that have an impact of short and long term with important consequences on the improvement of individual skills, on the upgrading, on the innovation of educational programs, on the internationalization processes and on a more fruitful connection with the territory of origin.The expected results in the short term will be:- The acquisition of a greater awareness of the importance of the mobility experience and of the planning of exchanges with foreign schools;- the improvement of the quality of education through the use of innovative technologies (CLIL, ICT);- the enhancement and strengthening of language and communicative skills.The expected results in the long term will focus, primarily, on the impact that the project will have on local and national levels in terms of opportunities for collaboration and cooperation. Specifically, the Institute "Perito-Levi" will benefit from:- an increase in opportunities for the development of a European network aimed at ensuring the continuity of relations of collaboration and exchange;- a strengthening of the bonds with the territory through the implementation of initiatives in collaboration with the cultural bodies interested in the value of the artistic heritage;- an enhancement of the turnover of school/work initiatives aimed to field testing of skills and knowledges acquired as a result of the update of the educational programs.
Innovation, originality and applicability in teaching using ICT

This project is designed to meet the needs of the teachers in our school, identified in the results of a local research regarding the necessity for professional training and refers to the development, at European level, of the lesson approach methods by improving the methodological knowledge and skills, the working skills and the necessary competences for student training in any field.The Mobility program consists of a training course for 15 teachers in 3 groups of 5 teachers from "Elena Doamna" Food Industry College, Galati, Romania, for 5 days in Valencia, London and Cosenza.The training in an EU country is necessary due to the desire to raise the quality standards of educational services in our school. Professional development through training in the EU is one of the actions by which one of the priorities of PAS is planned to be approached. The course will aim to stimulate teaching innovation and originality in approaching the learning content to improve the link between theory and practice, increase the attractiveness of educational activities and exchange good practices with partner institutions.Objective:-Professional development of teachers by attending training courses abroad in order to learn new active-participatory methods used in teaching, learning and assessment to increase student interest in personal and professional development, to reduce absenteeism and dropout with 2%.Specific objectives:O1- improving pedagogical and methodological competences of developing innovative and attractive teaching strategies to actively involve the students in teaching, learning and assessment process;O2- improving digital skills in order to increase the applicability of the lessons;O3- sharpen the teachers' communication skills in foreign languages.During the training course, the objectives will be achieved by:- Attending classes to learn and apply new active-participative methods in teaching using ICT to increase students' interest in learning and personal development;- Understanding and using collaborative and cooperative tools using ICT (Moodle, Blog, Weebly, Social media, vuvox, checkthis, thinglink, video converter, online pdf, Grock, YouTube mp3, Word, Star Planet, Mooc)- Attending workshops in order to integrate in the lesson plans the new methods and tools to develop innovative teaching strategies based on the active participation of the students in classes;- Visits in schools where discussions and debates with teachers and students will be carried out, regarding the innovative practices and methods in teaching, learning and assessment;- Visits to food industry economic agents - Fabio olive - factory, Spadafora wine factory and Bella Calabria - restaurant.- Validation and certification of the learning outcomes;- Dissemination of the project.The expected results for the beneficiaries are: improving the skills needed in training students, a portfolio that includes lesson plans with teaching/learning sequences, scorecards, handouts, questionnaires and ppt presentations.The aims for school are: to increase the quality and attractiveness of educational activities to reduce absenteeism, dropout, improving the results in BAC exam and Qualifications exams, to improve the quality of cooperation with institutions and organizations at national and European level.Project results:• Each participant will develop a portfolio containing:- Minimum 3 lesson plans with new learned methods;- An analysis study of the number of early school leavers, the problems caused by this, and solutions to reduce early dropout applied in the host countries;- Assessment methods and tools based on the learning outcome;- Reports completed after the mobilities.• Creating a blog and a Facebook group of the project where there will be loaded the materials developed during mobilities, the materials included in portfolios and power-point presentations disseminating mobilities.• A CD containing demonstrative lessons with the new creative methods that were acquired while participating in the mobility.• Photo album with pictures from the training activities• Notice board in school.• The dissemination of the project will be done in the school newspaper, local press, in “Scoala Galateana” magazine, the school website, the teachers‘meetings and the project website.• e-Twinning partnership.The improved results of our students and the participation in European projects, school contests and extracurricular activities will promote the school and motivate and attract eighth graders graduates to continue their studies in our institution.
F.L.A.S.H. - Foreign Languages and integration as an Asset for ScHool development

The project FLASH - Foreign Languages and integration as an Asset for school development has been designed to meet the following needs:1. A poor language proficiency (English and French) of the teachers who have expressed their intention to work within the working group for the development of the European dimension and EU projects;2. Difficulty in adapting education systems of the partner schools that have emerged during the performance of KA2 projects. These difficulties concerned the various methods of teaching, relationship with the students, classroom management and time. We consider it essential, in order to achieve better quality in our international dimension, to deepen networks created thanks to projects approved in 2014 and 2015, to strengthen cooperation with some partner schools and create new ones;3. Responding to the growing number of special needs students through the methodological innovation and learning best practices from Europe. Our school is very attentive to the training of teachers in inclusion and we believe that the exercise of comparison with European colleagues can increase the skills of the school on this important and sensitive issue.This needs analysis resulted in the preparation of FLASH, which thus aims to achieve the following general objectives:- Promote quality improvements, innovation excellence and internationalization, particularly through enhanced transnational cooperation with our European partners to enable us to understand methodologies and approaches, overcoming the difficulties encountered by comparison on the field ;- Improve the ability of teachers participating in the mobility project and part of the working group "Erasmus +" to determine changes in terms of modernization and internationalization of our school;- Improve the understanding of the practices, policies and systems of higher school education (age 14-19) in the partner countries;and to achieve the following specific objectives:- improve the language skills and the intercultural awareness of a specific target group of teachers interested in learning more about European cooperation;- Improve the understanding of the interconnections between formal and non-formal education, vocational training and the labor market: all partner schools are in fact mixed institutes general + VET providing considerable attention to training for entry into the labor market, to self-employment and to a good alternance between school and work;-Improve the ability to address the needs of the least advantaged, with specific reference to the acquisition of skills in the area of inclusive best practices.The project involves 9 units of teaching staff in 18 mobilities, including 9 job shadowing and 9 training courses. The staff corresponds to different teaching profiles i.e. art, natural sciences, languages and Italian literature. These teachers are those who, following a transparent and participatory process of selection, have shown a greater motivation to follow a path of internationalization and modernization of its skills, and who take part to the working group "Erasmus +". The job shadowing will take place in UK, France and Denmark at schools with which cooperation is already in place thanks to KA2 projects approved or submitted for approval in 2016; training courses will be held in the UK, France and Finland.The expected impact results, for the participants, in a general consolidation of skills, language and methodology, greater familiarity and security in the management of international relations, overcoming the barrier of fear due to the lack of language skils that leads to communication difficulties, greater competence in the area of best inclusive practices and integration of new teaching methodologies aimed at the inclusion of students with special needs and their educational success. For the organization, the impact will be a greater ability to manage and plan EU quality projects, strengthening cooperation with partner schools and integrating best practices, certify the results of learning and systematize the professional development of staff. This impact will bring long-term benefits to our school and will generate a large multiplier effect with the birth of new projects, under other actions of the Erasmus + and other EU programs.

The main objective of this project is to promote and improve, with efficacy and efficiency, the quality of service offered by our institution.  From this point of view, the aim is to give the teachers of our school the opportunity to speak at least one foreign language, so promoting a greater intercultural awareness among the members of the different countries and raising the level and the quality of teaching-learning by acquiring the necessary strategies required by our teachers and our headmaster . Therefore, the conflicts in relationships, the teaching of CLIL in math and science, the communication through the drama and the different organizing strategies to create a sustainable change become inevitable and represent a sign of growth.  For our school , it is important to promote a training plan abroad with the aim of providing the necessary instruments to reach the integration of foreign students with the creation of a protocol of immigration politics that we adopted in a school meeting on Nov. 4th. 2015.  It has the course of action and the setting-up of an intercultural welcoming commission to deliberate and propose with regards to the inclusion of foreign students in our classes (DPR 31/08|99 n. 394 art. 45 “scholastic enrollment”):  It would be an occasion for professional growth for the school staff and for the territory, if the plan were approved.  It is the aim of our commission to promote the communication and the collaboration between school and the territory on the themes of intercultural welcoming and education.  Moreover, it is an opportunity that gives an international context to local activities, so opening the doors to an further cooperation with the partners of the involved countries  .  The competences and experiences acquired by the teachers, who will participate in this project, will be employed in the strategic development of our institution which aims at the European sharing and cooperation.  Besides the headmaster, the teachers involved will be 18.  Only the teachers, who are able to implement the European projects of our school, will be chosen according to established criteria such as: motivation, the aims for mobility, the desire to share the experience at their return.  The courses organized in a flexible and modular way will allow participants to adapt what they learn to their needs and consequently  to the needs of the school.  Therefore, the itineraries, the contents, the methodologies will be created by adapting them to the formative needs of everyone by using innovative and stimulating methods.  With regards to the impact or the effects that the activities and their results will have on people, uses, organizations and systems, we will promote the diffusion and the value of results of plans in the phase of the development of the project so that they will have an immediate effect on participants and partners in future.  It will be of great value if the teachers give a feed-back of what they have learned  to the entire scholastic community through the development of different competences, such as: linguistic competences, confidence, open-mindedness, international openness, intercultural awareness, cooperative learning, motivation, communication, management abilities, management of  projects, international relationship, multi-stakeholders partnership, formal and informal education stakeholders cooperation, support for teachers, the innovation of the teachers  and an entrepreneurial culture.  These are the aims we want to reach and which will reinforce the quality of teaching and learning, by activating changes that make the school modern and international.

The State Comprehensive School "A. B. SABIN" proposes a mobility project for teachers, in line with the training initiatives planned for the next three years, according to the improvement plan, shall provide for digital skills, language and skills certification. The proposed project includes n. 9 mobility lasting 7 days (including travel days), during which the teachers will have the opportunity to attend a  STRUCTURED COURSE on the issues of the use of the Moodle platform, CLIL methodology and discuss, through a small business job shadowing, on methods of assessment and certification of skills. This project is part of a plan of the initiatives that the Institute, belonging to a disadvantaged area from a geographically and socio-economically, is putting in place to improve the training of its teachers with the general purpose of implementing the educational proposal aimed at its user base, through the acquisition of new digital skills, methodologies and skills certification. The general idea is to show teachers that training must go through internationalization, comparison and implementation of their professional skills and cross through mobility and contact with languages and cultures 'other'. During the project will alternate moments of formal and non-formal, both in the run-up to mobility in the same mobility.Participants will have the opportunity to meet colleagues from other European countries, to exchange ideas and opinions, observe and compare strategies, methods and techniques used by those involved. They can take advantage of the training courses provided and acquire know-how in different fields (linguistic, technological, organizational, relational, procedural, educational). The skills acquired will enable participants to support, in general, the professional development of the whole school community and, ultimately, to affect the process of teaching / learning through the dissemination and subsequent rethinking of experience. The impact will be on direct and indirect participants and more widespread, initially on a working group specially formed and narrower (Coordinators of departments, functions Instrumental) which has the task of defining the architecture of an education and training of quality and later on all Bodies for a shared planning experience and integrated curricula. The school will implement diversified modes of dissemination that are articulated in the promotion and information measures. Among the activities, measures have been designing and advertising logos and spaces (physical and virtual) for the dissemination of project results Te @ m - Te @ cher in mobility (eg. E-twinning, creating a youtube channel, mailing list ). The Institute proponent along with all foreign partners will be involved in the dissemination and implementation of multimedia products to present in an agile and more engaging the educational value of the project and its results for the start of an innovative, stronger policy cooperation in 'optical development, growth and self-improvement.

Our project aims to raise the profile of French across the curriculum with a specific focus on language development through reading and speaking and listening. We are currently delivering French to all year groups from Year 1  to Year 6 ( children aged 5 to 11years). We wish to develop staff  knowledge, understanding and skills in French teaching and learning. This will include improving staff's skills in French. We also want to build capacity within the school to deliver high quality teaching in French alongside our objectives of raising outcomes in reading and speaking and listening for children.We believe that taking part in the  project will impact upon our aims and objectives. This project will also provide the children with skills in French and awareness of European languages and culture. Other advantages for doing this project are:- involving all stakeholders, i.e, children parents, staff governors and the LA in this collaborative activity- For staff to attend an intensive language course in France in order to facilitate this project with our partner school-to plan with our partner school and implement relevant engaging activities- through an immersion programme deliver French through other subjects within the curricululm, e.g. French, Maths and Art - continue to sustain work with our European partners and share with other local schools through our knowledge centre work in English, MFL and EAL.- to provide children and staff opportunities for staff in a modern society.- to become citizens of a Global Society

ALLE - Arbeiten, Lernen und Leben in Europa

Title: Working, learning and living in EuropeParties involved: Participants (trainees to be management assistants in freight forwarding, industrial business management assistants, office administrators, automobile salesperson and retail sales person), their training companies, applicant organization – the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School, our partner organization – the ADC College London and selected companies in Greater London. Duration of the project: September 2016 – July 2018Time of placement: May/June 2017, May/June 2018 (combination of working in companies and language course)Summary:Kirchheim unter Teck is situated in an area with many small and medium-sized companies which often operate as European enterprises. Therefore it is crucial that these companies have employees being able to act in an intercultural appropriate way and at the same having the much needed special skills and knowledge of their profession. On these grounds the aim of the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School is to prepare the students in the best way for the challenges they have to face in their future working life. By working in competitive markets it is necessary that students do not only enlarge their expertise, their social and personal skills but also to develop the ability to act as active European citizens.In order to reach those goals the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School would like to give 30 students (15 participants in each year) in the following two years the chance to take part in the proposed project.The aim of the project is to give selected students in their second year of training the possibility to work, learn and live for three weeks in one of the largest metropolis in Europe, more precisely, in London. All our students are based in Greater London and will do their placement in selected companies in the area of trade, office work, management and retail. The participants will stay in host families provided by the partner organization. During the first week out of the three the participants receive language lessons and an introductory course including organizational or cultural aspects e.g. how to behave in a foreign environment, in daily life as well as in business situations. This is provided by the ADC College London. Additionally, in the following two weeks the trainees gain practical experience in selected British companies in London. In terms of quality management it is crucial for a successful work experience in a foreign country to tackle the needs of the participants in the run up and to prepare them in preparatory meetings for their stay abroad. Therefore the participants are supported in several ways, e.g.  including the awareness and improvement of their cultural, language, social, personal and task-related competences. During their stay in London the participants will be monitored, accompanied and supported by a member of staff of the ADC College and teachers of the Jakob-Friedrich-Schöllkopf-School. After being back home the participants present their experience, impressions and their newly acquired skills and competences at school and at other selected events to other students, teachers and their companies as well as to other stakeholders and representatives involved in education and the local press. Hence by participating in this project the students become valuable employees for companies doing business within Europe. Besides the participants broaden their horizon, their professional way of acting and improve their language skills and thereby lay the foundation of a successful future. The participants’ newly acquired knowledge, skills and competences will be documented in the Europass. In addition the ultimate outcome of the project is not only to expand and ensure our quality in vocational education but also to contribute to the learning process and skills of our students in an intercultural and European way.
Mobilitäts- und Arbeitserfahrungen für junge Auszubildende in Europa

The Commercial College in Hanau (KSH) intends to provide internships abroad for young student in vocational training schemes (dual system) and in vocational courses such as "bilingual assistant"/"personal manager with foreign language skills". The college wants to encourage mobility to European countries. We train about 600 apprentices in the commercial sector. Just few of those have been able to gather experience in European countries so far. Our college intends to boost this number significantly and prepares to become a major provider for internships abroad. We generally highlight the importance of internships of at least four weeks and in some departments of the school these are obligatory. The objectives of the internships abroad are personal development of the young students, insight in unknown entrepreneurial structures and rather foreign working processes and companies`profiles. Communication in the foreign language in the company and in daily life will be a challenge, which enables participants to become acquainted with a somewhat different culture and gives them a chance to use skills acquired at school in authentic situations.Most participants dispose of GSCE level education ("O-levels") and thus need more motivation and encouragement than other students with higher education levels ("A-levels").We expect the participants to benefit highly from their internships abroad. However, not only they will have an experience for their life, but also our school and internationally oriented companies in the area of Hanau will benefit from their step abroad.Of course, we hope to be able to continue such projects in future, so that they will be a keystone in the concept of our college.
Sprachlicher, beruflicher, kultureller und persönlicher Kompetenzerwerb in London

All participants are 11th grade students of the vocational schools for social care, child care and housekeeping, as well as of the dual system of vocational education. Many students grew up in rural areas and in a rather uneducated environment. They are still very young- mainly underage. Therefore, they have barley any experience with mobility projects. All students are already in their second year of their initial training programme, which means that they already have some good knowledge of the particular everyday-working-life. Due to the fact that most of the students just hold a successful certificate of secondary education (CSE) they have limited (native and foreign) language skills, which need to be improved. Additionally, most of our students haven’t had any experience with migrants so far. Their experiences refer to asylum seekers and gastarbeiter and they are rather based on prejudices. However, it is getting even more important in their kind of jobs, to get insights into working structures of other countries and to develop intercultural and personal skills through the exposure to strange cultures. As a result, basic project targets must be:- Application of the English language in daily life and to reduce fears of contacts with foreign languages and cultures- To gain professional skills by learning about new educational focuses in the partner country and through exploring the differences and similarities in the education.  - Establishment of personal skills, like self-confidence and so on.The number of participants is limited to 20 students per flow, since most of them are underage, which leads to a higher need of care and support. Additionally, financial costs are playing a big part, because many of our student’s families live in limited monetary boundaries, who can barely accomplish any additional cost.  To develop a feeling for the language and to learn how to act self-respondent in an urban area, it is absolutely necessary to have a one-week language course before the placement takes place. The placement in the different professional areas lasts two weeks and gives first insights in the working-structures of the host country. The dealing with the different culture of the host country will be supported by the accompanying teachers in the afternoons of the first week and at the weekends, additional to their lives in the host families and at work of social facilities. The organisation of the mobility, like insurance, transportation to the airport, flight booking and flight, transportation in greater London will be done by the sending organisation. They will also help to organise special needs like visa applications.  The partner organisation is responsible for the organisation of the host families, the placement companies and the first information for the participants. During the whole mobility, the participants will be accompanied by both organisations. Placement visits  as well as personal and intercultural care and support will be done by the accompanying persons. Regular meetings at the partner organisation will be done to monitor, evaluate and ensure the learning progresses. There are many expected effects:A strong personal effect on the participant’s self-confidence can be expected. The certainty to have been able to orientate in a metropolis supports the self-confidence as well as the experience to handle a new and strange situation. In the future, the willingness will be enforced to face and go through new and uncertain, anxiety-ridden situations. Effects on the language can be already expected during the first week of the stay, when the participants realize, that they are always able to find ways to express themselves – the main thing is that they dare to use the language. Language skills in vocabulary, through frequent speaking, as well as active and passive understanding will be improved, because the contact to migrants and British dialects require concentrated listening. In London-Harrow, in their families and working facilities, the participants will have contact to British people with different cultural background, which can be from Rumania, Jamaica or India. In that way they will be forced to deal with different cultures on a personal and culinary level and as well as the differences in values and conventions. This leads to a questioning of own prejudices and to a curiosity of foreign cultures.To compare the professional facilities, the concepts and the working structure of the host country to the working situation at home and the questioning of familiar habits, lead to the ability to recognize connections and  dependencies in values of different cultural backgrounds. On a long term, that will result in a changed  attitude towards foreigners and a reduction of prejudices.

For several years Berufskolleg Meschede, a vocational training college in Meschede, has offered young students the opportunity to develop intercultural skills by doing a work placement abroad. A three-week or four-week program was developed in cooperation with the ADC College in London, the SWAN Training Institute in Dublin and the AIP Language School in Valencia. The programs include a one-week language course followed by a two- or three-week work placement in a partner company in London, Dublin or Valencia. Up to 90 students can take part in the programs. At Berufskolleg Meschede these students either attend a two-year, full-time commercial course or they come to college once or twice a week for the theoretical part of their training as an industrial management assistant or management assistant in wholesale and foreign trade.The promotion of European mobility and the exchange of job-relevant language skills are objectives of the mobility organisation. With this project Berufskolleg Meschede prepares its students for an increasingly international working environment.
