The internship shall develop the students’ ability to analyse and evaluate their own work and learning as well as their ability to independently choose among techniques and materials. The international perspective shall also contribute to developing the students’ understanding and knowledge in order to be able to better approach the increasing cultural diversity within Sweden and our county Västerbotten.Dissemination of the results deriving from the project will be done through flyers, reports and different social media to demonstrate that the vocational programmes Hairdressing, Stylist and Spa offer a safe and inclusive environment where we are consistent about human equality. Press, media and social tools will be used to promote the project. We will invite our APL supervisors in the business and share the wonders of embracing the multicultural perspectives, and what knowledge our students will have obtained to enrich their future positions.Desired results: When the students become a part of the labour market they will have a higher degree of understanding and are more prepared to meet the multicultural clientele they will face in their profession. The students’ creativity, curiosity and self-confidence will have increased to such extent that they dare to try their ideas in action and believe in their ability to solve problems. The quality of the education has improved. Potential and long-term benefits: Increased motivation from the education to develop and maintain international networks. Will open up possibilities of a global career. The professional skills of both teachers and students have increased/improved.Follow up: The students’ experiences from the London internships will be shared by giving talks to lower grade students about the value of working and residing in a multi-cultural environment and the new knowledge they have attained. To reach parents and students, media will be invited to spread the possibilities for development as an individual but also as an organization by participating. in EU-programmes. Special theme-days will be arranged where the hairdressing-, stylist- and spa-students invite potential prospective customers that due to religious or cultural reasons usually cannot don´t use the range of treatment ordinarily offered at the establishments.
Arbetsplatsförlagt lärande för ökad yrkeskunskap och kulturell förståelse för våra elever på Handels- och Administrationsprogrammet

An international APL period gives our students the opportunity for professional development, cultural exchanges, and language skills. In addition to individual skills, we see that the project will lead to the promotion of our school and the municipal internationalization strategy. The Erasmus project gives us the opportunity to support the achievement of the goals of internationalization under both the curriculum of high school in Malmö Idrottsymnasium and in Malmö Stads vision and strategy for employment and training of the citizens.Our professional training program contains at least 15 weeks of work-based learning (APL). The Erasmus project makes it possible to promote the development of vocational training in a larger perspective by offering students at Malmö Idrottsgymnasium vocational programs in Commercial Service an opportunity to conduct three weeks of their workplace-based training (APL) abroad.Teachers benefit from the project will be that we promote international contacts while pursuing the objectives set out in the school curriculum and the municipality's approach to education and the labor market in our region.Today's globalization is placing new demands on our students and our school. By APL abroad  we are increasing our understanding, experience and competence in the following way:• Increased understanding of other cultures reduces prejudices and strengthens democracy and human rights• Students gain increased mobility of labor and thereby increasing employability.• The quality in vocational training, as new methods spread, thereby also increasing the attractiveness and status of vocational education.• Teachers and the school is developing the project its own operations, we learn from each other and gain new perspectives, which in turn leads to new pedagogical discussions.• Students are more motivated to achieve the objectives of their courses / training while giving them greater self-esteem and confidence in their ability to dare and act, work or study in an international market.• Student learning is promoted in a natural wayWe know that the APL abroad will benefit the school and students a lot, not least, it gives them the opportunity to improve their language and professional skills. They get easier a foothold in the European labor market. Profits for the school both locally and globally are substantial as it will contribute to increased interest and attractiveness of our education in the multicultural Malmö City.

Rauma Videregående skole and Rauma and Vestnes apprentice office wish to send 12 students/apprentices with vocational background on internship to London. One teacher and one assistent will follow the group. In essence, this is intended to be conducted with students from VG 2 childcare and youth work and VG 2 health workers, together with apprentices from the same proffesion. The school and apprenticeoffice will work with ADC College which will organize the stay from arrival to departure in London.Criteria we will use to choose students will be academic interest, attitude, behavior and languageskills.Information to parents, colleagues, students and partners will be given in good time before departure. Special focus will be devoted to security and what obligations the students have as representatives for their country and school.The reason for this application:We want to recruit more students/apprentices into subjects that in recent years has struggled with the number of pupils in school and not least in the profession later. We see internationalization as a motivating factor in an otherwise demanding school/work day. The goal is to challenge students on the professional level and personal sides of themselves. To travel together, experience together, try themselves in a new situation, be challenged on language and academic activities,  will hopefully give students/apprentices an experience they can use in a vocational career later in life aswell as in school. More impressions and more knowledge provides greater opportunity for reflection.The students/apprentices normally get to know the Norwegian health care and education system through internships locally in Norway. Maybe the picture becomes a bit oversimplified when there is nothing to compare with. We hope to give the student/apprentice an insight into another country's health and education system and employment. The cultural differences will be topics the students/apprentices will be working with before, during and through the evaluation process afterwards.The students/apprentices will during the period stay with host families and this is a different and challenging situation in itself. How we behave in someone elses home, what they eat, what rules they have and why and how to communicate. This will put the students/apprentices to the test, and hopefully put their own lives in Norway in perspective.The students/apprentices will be placed in schools, kindergartens and health institutions. This will test their language skills and professional knowledge. Communication may be challenging. We hope that professional training in advance will give the students/apprentices an extra confidence in communicating in English. Our englishteachers will conduct the training.We hope that the students/apprentices are left with a broader understanding of labor across borders. We also hope that they have a personal development in the period they are in London, linguistically and socially. Hopefully they have got positive experiences they will share with others students, friends and potentially new students. Rauma VGS and the apprentice office wants to use the students/apprentices experiences and reflections in efforts to promote subjects attending. We look at digital media and oral/written presentations as tools for this.The school and the apprentice office will in the wake of the deployment have experiences in the staff that can motivate others vocational studies to think internationally. Tutors who participate will have acquired knowledge that can be shared with others and used in everyday teaching/work.

European Mobility is a project where students from the Hotel and Tourism programme, the Restaurant management and Food programme, the Business and Administration programme and the Handicrafts programme within Jämtlands Gymnasieförbund, the federation of Upper Secondary Schools in the County of Jämtland are offered international work placements through the project partners:- Work Experience provider ADC College in the United Kingdom. - Hotel Salzburger Hof in Austria- Norlandia Hotel Group in NorwayThe aim of the project is for the participants to learn new methods, competencies and gain professional development within their specialization; to increase their employability; to develop within entrepreneurship and encourage the entrepreneurial culture; personal growth and confidence for future challenges as well as improved language skills and confidence to use other languages within their profession.The project provides the students with international work experience and professional development within the field of work, favoring themselves as well as the industry. The project leads to strengthened craftmanship and qualifications that in the long run benefits the industry and in the short run their future work placements and time in school.

This is a mobilityproject for employees, students and apprentices, the project is co-ordinated by the Education and Training department in Sogn og Fjordane County, Norway.The project is a consequense of a the focused work within international activities since 2007.  The project concerns practical training placements of staff, students and apprentices within the Hotel and Restaurant Trades, Technical and Industrial Production, Building trades and Health Trades.  The partners that will act as sending organisations training offices and upper secondary schools. The Norwegian partners that have international experience are sharing their contacts and experiences with the less experienced partners, thus sharing and building institutional competence. The receiving partners are situated in London, England; Murcia, Spain; La Rochelle, France; Copenhagen and Skagen, Denmark; Riga, Latvia and Prague, Czech Republic. The placements shall support the curricular and training needs within each trade area. The project shall support the need for for international working experience in the curriculum and training plans. The project is mutual; we will host students/apprentices from our partners. Main objectives-Provide an opportunity to gain cultural and working experiences in an international environment-Increase the interest for the trades concerned and make it more attractive as an educational option and thereby increase the recruitment to the lines of study and training involved-Provide an opportunity to communicate professionally in another language-Enable participants to achieve increased self-development through new cultural and professional challenges-Prepare the participants for their exams and craft certificate test and their future working life through gaining a more varied and relevant work experience-Give employees a chance to further develop their competencies within the trades concerned and in international activities-Contribute to an increase in the education completion rates within the county-Increase the international competence and understanding on institutional level for all parties involved-Increase knowlegde and competence regarding the education and training systems & qualifications in other European countriesOur experience from prior project has been exellent. It is expected that the aims & objectives in this project will be achieved in a similar manner as in previous projects. In a longer perspective participation in this kind of projects give a increased and valuable competence amongst the participants and the companies they will be working for in the future.

Lier Upper Secondary School (Lier USS) is a s a vocational school offering programs in the areas of Health and Social Care, Electricity, Business and Administration and Design and Crafts, Customized Tuition/Special Needs and General Studies - level 3.  The School is aiming to improve the status of vocational education and started two new courses of tuition giving a double set of qualifications; the students obtain a Vocational Certificate and at the same time become qualified for higher education by combining theoretical studies and apprenticeships.  In these new courses, the school will contribute to the possibilities for international school- and labor experience. The school management believes that this will raise the international dimensioon of vocational education and make it more attractive to be a student at Lier USS.  Simultaneously, the school has strengthened its cooperation with local businesses and industries in order to educate good workers with formal skills. In the autumn of 2013 we therefore embarked on a major information campaign directed systematically at the local public, commercial and industrial sectors, at Buskerud county department of education, and at the lower secondary schools from which we recruit our students. In addition, we are using public - and social media and our website actively to spread information about the meaning of our courses with international  labor experiences and the future opportunities it provides.The main objective of the project is to raise the international dimension of vocational education and make it more attractive to young people. When they have finished their education, they will become attractive to the employees. Lier USS strives to maintain a good reputation, both in the community and, more generally, by working systematically to achieve positive results. Given that we live in a multicultural society and a globalized labor market, we believe it is important for students to get more knowledge and understanding of the fact that they are part of a larger community. We are therefore planning for  labor placement for our students Great Britain. A stay abroad with practical labor experience and experience from family and community life, will give our students new perspectives on other cultures and contribute to their personal development.The Project Group consists of eight people: Assistant Principal, one Head of Department, four teachers and two students.. All the staff have higher education and years of practical work experience. All members of the Project Group have good interpersonal skills and ability to work systematically and consciously to secure a high quality outcome for students. 34 students will participate in the program. To ensure student involvement and influence a prefect from each class participate in the Project Group with effect from the autumn 2016.Lier USS has produced a preliminary plan including the project's main milestones. Representatives from the Project Group wil during the first year, which is a year, go abroad to become better acquainted with our partners, bring the evaluetion from the last project and further develop the relationship with them. Through this pilot Project, we will obtain in-depth knowledge of both relevant internships, suitable families and the guidance our students will get during their stay abroad. This is important knowledge to take back to the students and parents to prepare them for what to expect. In order to be selected for international labor placement, and to have an influence on the appropriate type of work they can get, the students have to write and submit an application with CV.  In addition, they will be called for an interview. Our partners abroad will also require a copy of the CVs from the students in order to customize the stay in the best possible way.Our school has developed a strategy of communication for "Vocational Education with International  Work Experience".  We expect that the project will be of great importance both for students and for Lier USS. Students will feel appreciated; they will experience success and be proud of what they have experienced. It will give them a personal growth and be important for their general education.The school is planning to introduce international labor experience for other programs of education and we would like to see that people will consider vocational education with new eyes, and become more attractive to young people. The international dimension will result in increased number of applications for vocational programs and thus enhance the status for students and for the community. In the longer term, we hope that these opportunities will increase the number of students fulfiling upper secondary education. With the introduction of "Vocational Education with International Work Experience", we will be in the position to educate young people with formal competences and thereby contribute to meeting our society's need for skilled labour.
Sortland Upper Secondary School - Service and Communication Vocational Intl. 16-17

Project background:Sortland Upper Secondary School is a subsidiary of Nordland County, located in the regional centre of Vesteraalen, Norway. Our Service and Communication vocational curriculum is designed to offer two years in upper secondary school, and two years of apprenticeship in private or public organizations. We cover four vocational trade areas: Office and Business Administration, ICT services, Sales, and Security.  We recruit students from all over the Vesteraalen and Lofoten regions, a total of approx. 50 000 inhabitants. The region experiences a strong growth in internationalisation in the above mentioned trade areas. In order to meet the increased international competency requirements, we seek to develop and offer a combination of vocational skills,  language and cultural competency. Since English is the main and preferred language in servicing foreign customers and business networks, we actively seek to improve and develop new and relevant learning arenas where this combination can be offered with the greatest impact.For vocational students in particular, "learning by doing" is paramount. An intensive workplacement period in an international environment where relevant vocational workpractice is executed, is our preferred choice. Project objectives:Nordland County has an overall plan for internationalisation for 2012-2025. The objective is to be the most international county in Norway by 2025.  To deliver accordingly, Sortland Upper Secondary School must be a regional contributor in meeting the objectives: A) The County regions must be internationally attractive.  B) Our students and apprentices will be "global citizens" locally, regionally and internationally.  C) Educational organizatons will be integraded into larger internationalisation initiatives. Our school must develop the region's future workforce by developing relevant  vocational-, language-, and cultural competencies.  Also, a rapidly growing international workforce living in our region, will be integraded better and more rapidly.  Consequently, participation in Erasmus + VET learner practice is important for our students.  Our specific objective is to provide two weeks of vocational learning workplacement for 20 of of students during their 2nd year of their vocational studies in upper secondary school, 10 students per year. Number and profile of participants:10 participating students per year over two years, across the vocational trades defined above. Student candidates are selected according to an assessmentprocess of their individual skills, their business- and language competency level, combined with their ability to show initiative, level of self-efficacy, dedication and ability to contribute in the workplace. Up to 30 % of our students will be selected for this workplacement project, provided that they meet the appropriate high level of performance.  Description of activities:Pre-assignment: awareness and skills training for all our students; across vocational-, language- and cultural skills. Testing and selection of students. Workplacement period: Induction upon arrival in London. Relevant vocational workplacement for two full working weeks. Private housing of students to also gain general cultural competency. Continous monitoring and mentoring of the students, including daily review of student's digital logging of worktask performance and learning objectives reflection.    Post-assignment: Both students and the accompanying teacher participate in dissemination of their experiences and learning towards future and fellow students in the region, teacher peers, apprentice instructors and vocational trade companies. The accompanying teacher is also involved in development and improvement of cross-curricilum learning activities for future students.Methodology:Project management is based on quality mangement principles and routines. Students aquire a higher competency level through "learning by doing". The learning activity is an integraded part of the school's curricilum grading system. Procedures, agreements and roles are defined and documented.Short description of the results:Documented international vocational education of 20 students. Improved cross-curricilum learning programs domestically in Sortland. Effective dessimination of project to future vocational students, apprentice admin. bodies and teachers. Impact envisaged:Students competency contributes to higher level of apprentice achievements. Vocational trades receive higher attention, increased attractiveness to future students and necessary reqruiting.  Potential long term benefits:Both Region and County get a vocational workforce that delivers higher qualilty and meet the requirements for international trade, networking and value creation. Nordland County meets it's internationalisaton objectives.

Our school has partaken in international exchanges for the past ten years. However, it has been the theoretical programmes such as civics and science who have been able to benefit from these cultural exchanges. Focus has been on entrepreneurship, science, language and inclusion. The vocational programmes have not been able to partake for two reasons; one, many vocational student study english but no other foreign language. Two; they have 15 weeks workplacement over three years and if the exchange has been during the work placemnet period these students have been excluded as they require 15 weeks work placemnet to be able to graduate. All students should be given the same opportunity but our school has not been able to find the right project for thie when it comes to our vocational students. Being able to offer them workplacement abroad would be fantastic.The students are 25 upper secondary students in their second and third year, studying either Health and Social Care or Retail and administration. Work experience is compulsory on these programmes over the three years.By working with ADC college our school could have an international profile that benefits allt the students. If our vocational students could have two weeks work experience in London they would be able to broaden their horizons, feel a sense of pride when it comes to their chosen career, see that work can be in Sweden or abroad and get a better understanding for cultural differences and likeness as wel as improve their language skills. Many of the criteria in our courses have an international angle and it is difficult as a teacher to bring these to life purely by theory.To date we have struggled to find a project that truly links in with  the vocational programmes we offer. An international exchanges in partnership with ADC college and their work placement programme would mean that every student at  Akademi Båstad gymnasium has a chance to experience life abroad, improve their language skills and open up their minds to the fact that we are all one large community and work does not necessarily have to be in your country of birth. They will  learn new skills  and grow on a personal level, helping to create responsible citizen, succesfull learners and confident individuals. Furthermore it would increase their understanding of the possibilities of what a EU membership  means to them as citizens and that the we are part of a large international community where diversity is key to success.On a local level it may help to increase student motivation on our two vocational programmes as a pass on work experience and national english test would be required to be able to partake in the programme.Our students would be able to apply for this experience, providing they have passed the above mentioned criteria.As a school we focus on entrepreneurship, internationalisation and inclusion. By offering this work placement in London all students at Akademi Båstad gymnasium would be given the same opportunity when it comes to partaking in an international exchange. Entrepreneurship and inclusion would be an integral part of the project as help us embedd these values further at our school.The health and retail industry are an important part not only of the Swedish economy but also the European community. By enhancing our programmes with this work experience abroad we believe that this will attract more students to the programmes and the long term benefit would be qualified and motivated students ready to join the proffessions, health and retail.
VET-Youngsters from Lofoten to London III

The mobility project VET-Youngsters from Lofoten to London III (2016-2018) is a partnership between Aust-Lofoten videregående skole (upper secondary high school) and ADC College in London. The main activity of this project is a three-week long student work placement in London. Participants in the project are second year vocational students in the fields of Healthcare, Childhood and Youth Development, Tourism and Media and Communication. During traineeships, students work in companies across London relevant to their field of study, and stay with selected host families. This is a two-year project, applying yearly for 27 student mobilities and three accompanying persons in London at any time. Our school involves international perspectives in all fields of studies. We excel in efforts such as International Week (IW), where we have been awarded best IW three times. During IW the school abandon the normal curriculum and focuses on global issues like poverty, inequality and development. Our partner ADC College has long experience in successfully developing and executing international mobility programmes in partnership with educational institutions from all across Europe. The main objectives of this project are to motivate students to complete their vocational education and training, and to raise the attractiveness of vocational studies and hence increase the number of applicants. Expected learning outcomes are improved English skills and cross-cultural competence, as well as greater international orientation. Objectives are targeted through work placement, interaction and communication with companies, host families and others. Students' personal development and skills gained will be documented in Europass documents and increase students' employability. Accompanying teachers will monitor students' learning outcomes and personal development, as well as bringing experience back to the school and boost future international efforts. These objectives are strongly linked to drop out at vocational studies and low recruitment compared to the need for skilled workers, which are challenges shared across Europe. Expected outcomes of the project include increased number of applicants for vocational studies, improved rate of accomplishment, and more well-skilled students to join the workforce for growth industries. In a broader perspective, we hope to contribute to a common European solution through exchange of experience gained in international mobility projects.
Take your chance for better life in the European union

The project "Take your chance for better life in the European union" is created in partnership of Business Academy in Žilina with ADC College in London and is focused mainly on obtaining practical working skills of our students abroad and using their English language skills in practice. The main objective of this project is to enable students of our school to get working experience abroad by experiencing practical tasks at work, adapting to new social and working surroundings, motivating them to work hard, be flexible and active in communication in a foreign language. Specific objectives of this projects are to improve communication, social and digital competences of students, to extend working abilities of the students abroad, to enrich formal and informal education by practicing abroad,  to learn history, geography, culture, art and life style of British people, to experience multiculturalism and mutual tolerance among EU citizens, to certify the competences of students attained through ECVET tool. 15 students of the Business Academy in Žilina at the age of 17 and 18  will participate in this mobility project. The project itself will be running for 12 months (from July 2016 to June 2017). It consists of the preparation of the project activities, realization of the project tasks by practicing working skills abroad and the final phase is connected mainly with propagation and dissemination of the project´s outcomes. The mobility itself will take place in May 2017. Students will be chosen according to their language and practical skills. The chosen students will prepare their CVs and other necessary forms and documents. During the preparing course they will get all practical information about working abroad which they can use when practicing in administrative departments of companies as administrative assistants, sales assistants or receptionists. The students can use their school knowledge and skills in practical situations (communication  in English language, use of ICT, business correspondence, telephoning, mailing or personal meetings, data processing etc.). Knowledge of English language (CEFR B1) is required from the participants of this project. Practical experience at British job market will help to develop student´s personality and increase their motivation to study English language and improve their skills in the field of economy. Spending two weeks in British families will give them a chance to get to know the culture, history, traditions and life style of British people. The students will be accompanied by a Slovak teacher of English language who will be responsible for all the project activities like choosing students, organizing language course, planning and preparing the whole journey to Great Britain – transport, insurance, accommodation, etc. During the stay in Britain she will be responsible for monitoring the whole program, communication with ADC College and companies where the students will be placed.Expected outcomes of this project are improving specific language skills of students, obtaining new working experience within the European Union and practising theoretical knowledge of economy in practice. Participants will receive the „Europass – Mobility“, „Certificate ECVET“ and the certificate from ADC College in London. Completing the job experience programme in Great Britain will increase the chance of all the participants to find a good job at the European job market.

Summary of the project „Experience practice abroad“The project „Experience practice abroad“ is for students, teachers and the management of  The Business Academy Nevädzová 3 in Bratislava. After successful completing of various projects and competitions held at school, Slovak and international level, this mobility project will enable all the participants to develop their knowledge, skills and abilities of professional, social and linguistic character. By this pilot mobility project, The Business Academy Nevädzová 3  fulfills its European school development plan and contributes to its internationalization and opening to the world.  We expect from the project „Experience practice abroad“ a contribution to improving the quality of vocational training, gaining practical experience, knowledge and skills in working and learning environments of the partner organizations. We would also expect the recognition of acquired knowledge and learning outcomes in a qualification profile of a participant. By meeting  this objective we want to achieve an increase in professional eligibility of students and broaden the scholary perspective of teachers of vocational subjects. Lessons learned will be carefully evaluated and processed in other future international activities. The aim of our project is to enable the comparison of practice at our and at partner school abroad,  to gain new inspiration, new procedures and teaching methods, enable students to get valuable experience at a foreign employer. The Project participants will include school management (2 participants), teachers of vocational subjects (3 participants) and students (4 participants) with excellent academic results and exemplary behaviour. They will be carefully selected by an expert commission on the basis of questionnaires. Participants will gain valuable competencies that will be recorded in documents:  Europass – Mobility and The Certificate of foreign practice completion.The result of the project will be the new benefits and the modernization of teaching  and curriculums of  vocational subjects, new inspiring examples,  relevant experience of pupils and teachers from the foreign practicing, enhancing the reputation of school for current and future students.The project will help to raise teachers' awareness of their own competence and real  assessment of their professional level when compared with  foreign colleagues. After completing the five-day lesson observations of specialized subjects we expect for teachers of vocational subjects  acquiring new inspirational impulses, new pedagogical strategies and competencies. After completing the two week practice abroad we expect for students new working experience from a completely different cultural environment. Extending the possibility to gain professional experience abroad we also expect increased  interest of employers in our graduates and better prospects of our students with foreign companies and enterprises. In the long term the project will increase the attractiveness of the school and its graduates, increase the professional employment of the graduates, widen the horizons of teachers and their lifelong learning, strengthen the position of  the school among successful schools. Our students and teachers will build a good will not only of their schools, but also the region, Slovakia and Slovak education.
Implementácia odbornej praxe v zahraničí v procese skvalitňovania odborného vzdelávania

Secondary Vocational School of Business and Services is one of the largest vocational schools providing education in the field of business and services in the district of Komarno. We have been providing high quality education in the following fields of study: Business Academy, Business and Information Services - International Business Relations. Graduates of these fields of study can continue their education at colleges or apply for professions such as accountants, tourist guides, personal assistants, bank clerks, salesmen, receptionists at tourist information center or at many levels of management in banks and enterprises. Besides these two fields, students can study in educational fields such as chef-pastry chef, cook, waiter, hairdresser, beautician, painter and bricklayer. After successfully completing the final examination they may continue at postgraduate courses in Entrepreneurship in Crafts and Services, which is completed by passing the school leaving examination. After graduation, the graduates are ready to be employed in the field of study, start their own business, or continue their studies at university. For these reasons, we consider it our priority to continuously improve the training of our students, bringing new modern trends, draw inspiration for the improvement of vocational education providing students with work placement abroad to gain knowledge and skills which will be further implemented in their work experience thesis. Our aim is to provide students with the education that will integrate specialized theoretical knowledge and participation in  work placement abroad to create a compact set of knowledge, skills and competencies that a graduate needs to enter the labour market in Slovakia and in other countries of the European Union and beyond. By modernization and internationalisation of vocational education at our school, the ability to respond flexibly to the demands of the labour market that are affected by regional conditions and preparing high-quality professionals we aim at attracting more students to study at our school and gradually we want to offer courses that will better respond to regional, European and global labour market. Currently, our school is not involved in any international project that meet these requirements. For this reason, we consider it important to establish close partnerships with institutions abroad that can provide our students knowledge and useful information essential for labour market needs and develop their skills and abilities. Participating in work placements abroad, which will be the first in school history, we want to modernize our school, open it up to new forms of cooperation not only with educational institutions but also enterprises, so we will be able to prepare our students for the requirements and needs of European and world labour market. Such cooperation will also form the basis for further international projects not only within Erasmus + programs. The aim of the accompanying teachers participating in the project will be to gain valuable experience and knowledge, establish contacts and partnerships in order to build up a team after their return to school, whose task will be to develop and implement partnerships and collaboration on various platforms. Professional development of teachers is part of European Development Plan of our school. One of its long-term strategy of improvement of their professional competencies and skills is also their involvement in international projects, creating long-term partnerships and integration into the international network of institutions providing teacher development courses and training programs. ADC College, North London is able to provide work placements at enterprises and institutions where students acquire the necessary knowledge, skills and competences. Primarily it is the development of entrepreneurial skills and competencies of students` activities to be carried out directly in the workplace. Due to participation in work experience in London students will experience many interesting and inspiring impulses that they can use in their future professions and businesses. Finally, they will be able to develop language skills in multicultural environment of cosmopolitan London, which is one of the necessary conditions for their professional development in the field of domestic and international business, tourism and services. The project will involve a total number of 28 students who will perform following activities: office and administrative work related to the running of the company, working with office equipment and information and communication technologies, work with office and economic software, communication with clients of the company and many others. The outcomes of the project will be later used in eTwinning projects, where we will continue to carry out the European Development Plan of our school.
Mobilita - moja prvá skúsenosť s európskym trhom práce

The project named “Mobility – my first experience on the European Labour market ” we want to address one of the most acute issues of the European Union of today, the youth unemployment. Since the professional skills together with foreign language and ICT skills and competences have become critical in terms of getting and keeping a job, by our project we want to address improvement of the above competencies and thus make our students’ entrance to the European labour market easier.We believe that the work-based learning in an authentic working environment of foreign companies is the most natural and effective way of acquiring of the all above competencies. Accordingly, the main aim of the project is to enable the highest number of our student to improve the above competencies through a work-based experience in a foreign company related to his/her professional field of studies.Twenty-four students of the 2nd, 3rd and 4th grades of the Secondary Technical and Art School of Samuel Mikovíni, who study paper and old book bindings restoration, graphic design, biotechnology, pharmacology, environment and geodesy will take part in the project in three countries of the European Union – Germany, England and Spain. Students will be acompnied by 3 teachers. The participation in the project will thus enable our students to see, observe and experience the world of advanced Europe with its modern technologies, processing procedures, use of materials and machinery operation at their workplace. The project also includes also one individual mobility for a teacher of paper and old books binding restoration. The proposed length of the work experience is 14 days. Students will work for 7 hours every working day.Further expected positive outcomes of the mobility project is that students will achieve professional working competences and active professional involvement in their field of study, active participation in operation of the firms, companies and organisations. Last but not least are the learning outcomes of the non-formal education as well as personal, social and working contacts. After the work experience the mobility participants will receive the Europass mobility and Personal Appraisal Form to certify acquired learning outcomes, which should improve position of our graduates on Slovak and foreign labour market.The project will not finish by the end of the actual mobility. After the professional working internship abroad students together with project coordinators will take an active part in dissemination activities - in our region, on the primary schools, on web - the result of which should be improvement of the perception of our school and youth related EU activities by public, project partners and foreign employers. The students will present their abroad experience to students and teachers of our school. They will also take part in our schools’ promotion and presentations for primary schools pupils to attract them to choose vocational education at our school. Our dissemination activities should also inspire other schools and organisations to get involved into the mobility activities within Erasmus + programme. Project coordinators are also ready to share the experience with the project management and introduction of ECVET methodology on the information seminars of the National Agency. With regard to assessment, transfer and validation of  acquired learning outcomes our school  used the ECVET methodology for the first time, which we have found very useful concerning the description of acquired skills and competencies of the mobility participants. This significantly facilitated communication between sending, receiving and employer organisations related to arrangement of tailor-made quality foreign work placement for our students. The evaluation and assessment of the project outcomes will serve to increase the quality of cooperation with partners’ and employers’ organisation as well as to identification and description of learning outcomes that our students will be able to acquire thanks to mobility projects.In a long-term period we would like to continue in developing cooperation with partner and employer organisations at organising other types activities within the Erasmus + programme, such as partnerships or mobilities for teachers of professional or ICT subjects.
Get Better Opportunities With Foreign Work Experience

Aim of project Get Better Opportunities With Foreign Work Experience is based on the problems of the region where the school is located - high level of disadvantaged citizens, and thus a high level of unemployment.Project responds to the long-term problem district of Spišská Nová Ves and helps participants to acquire the knowledge, skills, competencies and experience, to provide more competitiveness and attractiveness to potential employers after graduation.The main objective of the project is to provide to selected participants (15 students from study fields of mechanic of computer networking, mechanic electrician and marketing manager) work experience and placement in London - in companies which are directly related to their field of study. The aim is to improve their knowledge, skills and key competencies of participants and evaluation and validation of the stay by the usage of ECVET elements.The project will greatly help to combine theory with practice, an important objective is the adaptation of students to the working environment and collective, fulfillment of duties and assigned tasks. They learn independence, timeliness and greater responsibility in the daily commute by subway, train or bus. Finally, important sub-objective of the project is the improvement in foreign language, as students will communicate daily in English not only in the workplace but also at host families, so their ability to active communication will be improved. A particular aim is also to support the participation of students for life in Europe, awareness of both Slovak and European citizenship and strengthen the multicultural dialogue, as London is one of the most multicultural cities of the world; and also inclusion in society and solidarity.Finally, the project aims to support participants in the generation and exploitation of knowledge, skills and qualifications to facilitate personal development, employability and participation in the European labour market, improve the quality and scope of cooperation between educational organizations and businesses across the Europe. The priority is to develop the skills and competencies of young people in vocational training, learning to work in an international team and help students with the integration of the European labour market, improve the personal development of the participants, their social skills and so getting to know their own personality in different situations, encourage communication skills and language development of the participants.The project is a priority for improvement in knowledge, skills and key competencies of participants. Improvement in practice in the areas of marketing, ICT and acquisition of international work experience. We also expect a significant improvement in the level of English in particular in the field of communication and technical terminology. Improvements will be measured by the level of input and output tables with point evaluation scales, questionnaires and tests completed by the host organization, accompanying people, participants, but also masters of professional practice and teacher of English at the school before and after the arrival. Participation in the foreign work placements will affect the increase in self-esteem of students, their flexibility, autonomy, job mobility, ability to adapt to the new team of a multicultural working environment and growth. We also expect that the internship will have a significant impact on improving the knowledge and skills in practical areas such as the opportunity to consider a lucrative practical training during their studies. Since the school is located in a region with high unemployment and the project we want to involve disadvantaged students, mobility will potentially improve their own competitiveness on the labor market.Participants will broaden their horizons, get to know the culture of Great Britain thanks to visiting the city and family in which they stay during mobility. We expect that students will be able to work well under pressure and stress of a new and foreign environment and create a positive attitude towards work and work habits.The project will support the international relations of the sending organization SSŠ SEZ Krompachy with European and international institutions and improve the quality of vocational education graduates. We expect that the project will improve the prestige of the sending organization and will also help in the region and the recruiting activities of the school. It also improves communication between the teaching and professional staff of the school and their mutual cooperation for better connectivity and continuality of theoretical and practical training. Thanks to foreign experience will not only students, but also accompanying people get benefit of new approaches to teaching and by subsequent agreement may be introduced into the process of new thematic units and a total upgrade teaching to the European level.

Submitted project “Odbornosť bez hraníc” (“Open traineeship”) was conceived to fulfill basic requirements and expectations aimed at providing vocational education and preparation. It rises from the need of connecting vocational education with the needs,  expectations and possibilities of technical praxis. As a part of the solution of the project we set the following goals: 1. Improving quality of vocational competence and skill of participants; 2. Improving quality of lingual competence with a emphasis on using technical terminology; 3. Improving quality of provided educational activities of our school. Into the project implementation will be engaged the pupils of Spojená škola, Komárňanská 28, Nové Zámky from three fields of study: electrical engineering, IT and economical academy. Among the main project activities is the mobility of 18 pupils to London, with the aim of realization vocational internship directly in companies based on the character and the study profile of their field of study. Another intention of the project, transformed into the shape of a project activity is preparation of study materials, which in the future will support introduction of teaching technical English. Beside these activities we planned an interesting meeting in the English language with experts, but also a competition in translation of technical texts. We expect, that by realization of the project we contribute to simplification of implementation technical English into the educational process, by which we would considerably improve the quality of the services provided by our school. Positive impact of the project also presents itself in the field of improvement of vocational and lingual competences of pupils and teachers alike. We expect a long term benefit of the project to be in reforming curricular school documents as well as in personal growth of the participants.
ΑΝΑΠΤΥΞΗ ΔΕΞΙΟΤΗΤΩΝ ΑΝΘΡΩΠΙΝΟΥ ΔΥΝΑΜΙΚΟΥ ΣΤΟ e- ΕΠΙΧΕΙΡΕΙΝ

The Cooperative of Kozani of saffron Producers, as it is known has a unique product that is PDO and it is established at national and European level. The cultivation has reached very satisfactory levels as well as the quantities produced. Also, the cultivated land which it thrives are specific and additionally as time goes by the lands are dismembered. The only way out - solution for an upswing of the Association is to bypass intermediate suppliers and direct sales of saffron products from the Association that can be achieved with e-commerce. One of the ways to achieve is the " Development skills in human resources in e-business". The Cooperative participates in the planning of this proposal by selecting the specific topic according to the needs of its members and because the movement of agricultural products today is moving into a new era, which is characterized by e-commerce and electronic trading. The e-commerce is a challenge in the current economic situation in the country contributing to the increase in distribution channels of products and market range for rural businesses. ELECTRONIC ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN AGRICULTURE gives new outlets and opportunities in an electronic market which differs from the conventional and forms its own rules. The laws of competitiveness deem necessary the participation of agribusiness in this electronic market. The program aims to promote e-commerce technologies and the training of human resources, emphasizing the bi-business transactions (business to business - B2B) and retail sales (business to customer - B2C). The aim is both to train members in the use of e-commerce, and understanding of the ways and the critical points for the use of new technologies and the Internet to the implementation of e-business.The project will contribute to the effort to modernize human resources managers of the Partnership in electronic commerce and followed all those training adult training methods (brainstorming, active participation in all stages of education, connection of theoretical knowledge with practical applications) in order to provide the best possible results.Aims of the project are defined:1. The staff training in e-commerce technologies,2. The determination of factors affecting the results of electronic commerce and the benefits of online activity,3. The direction of human resources in the use of di-business technologies to reduce their operating costs,4. Promoting use technologies addressed to customers to improve service and gain pumping, directly or indirectly,5. Spread transactions at national and global levels.This plan regards a mobility of 20 participants, manpower managers - members of the Association, who for a period of 14 days will go to England. The duration of the mobility abroad is satisfactory to meet the educational needs of the participants to gain knowledge regarding the training object and simultaneously strengthen the linguistic and cultural skills.    The education-training program was designed according to the characteristics and needs of participants (adult education) in order to obtain the expertise required with respect to e - business. This action will have a multiplier effect and benefits for both organizations and participants, as it will create a framework for networking and future collaboration. The host organization ADC College chosen for the implementation of the program specializes in electronic transactions and has great experience in adult education.

Offering students and professionals an international orientation / experience is very important to Koning Willem l College.An important goal in this project is offering students an international workexperience in an accredited place where he/she can acquire  labourmarket relevant learningcontent. Student will be also chaallenced to improve his language skills and thesocial skills  too.Activities done during internship are intergrated in the regular curriculum and monitored by a professionals from Koning Willem l College and a specialist from the accredited internshipplace. Another important goal is providing professionals with labourmarket relevant opportunities to go abroad for international experiences to improve and/or update their skills.The mobility of professionals is instrumental for the studentmobility and the internationalisation of the curriculum. Professionals who can share an international labourmarket relevant experience with students and local industry are a rolemodel for students and ideal promotors for international mobility and cooperation.In cooperation with the heads of the departments and our HRM department the international labourmarket relevant jobshadowing or internship is promoted in our college. Professionals apply through HRM, after discussion with their head of the department for an international labourmarket experience.The international experience will be integrated in the Professional development plan of the professional.
PERIODE DE FORMATION EN MILIEU PROFESSIONNEL DES ELEVES: REPOUSSER LES FRONTIERES ET ENCOURAGER LA MOBILITE DES ELEVES DE LYCEE PROFESSIONNEL

The project is a Franco-German exchange implying the professional development organisation EBL based in Frankfurt, in Germany and the Vocational High School of l'Horizon, based in Saint-Denis, Reunion Island. It is also the opportunity for the students of the English  European Section to perform a training session in London, UK.The Franco-German exchange consists in sending  French apprentices to Germany and in receiving young German apprentices.Three groups are concerned by this mobility program: pupils in final year of BTEC National in Structural Work, Public Works, and in Business Administration, for a total of 24 students and six accompanying teachers.The host organization organizes cultural and educational program. It also provides accommodation, catering, transport and urban planning internships in companies in its network of companies.Pedagogically, the project aims to consolidate the gains indispensable for the job requirements; thus uses the binational method.ADC College offers students one week of language and cultural preparation, students are then placed in the business area of Harrow and London, in the administrative field for a period of three weeks.On a technical and professional level, the student moves from the local dimension of the European dimension.In human terms, this mobility project is an opportunity for young people from disadvantaged backgrounds to discover other areas participating in cultural awareness, language and openness to the world.These training sessions complete the training of students and help to develop their soft skills.

Tio University of Applied Sciences - Enrollment into MBO Erasmus+ projects.Tio University of Applied Sciences is entering the Erasmus+ projects for their MBO education now as well, as part of extending the international mission of Tio. With the idea of providing students with maximum opportunities for building up international learning experiences in order to prepare them in the best possible way for a career in the global job market, entering the Erasmus+ for MBO was inevitable.Only if we motivate our students and make the barriers for an international experience a s low as possible we can expect a growing number of our students that are going aborad for this 'once in a lifetime' experience that will truly change their lives. Tio is entering this program not only to help the students financally, but also to ensure the quality of the internships. By entering the Erasmus+ program there is an additional stimulus to sign MOU contracts with all our internship organisations, where we now still work with internship contracts. These overall MOU's will help in ensuring the quality for a longer period of time, and buidling upon a strong and better international network.Tio is looking forward stimulating more and more students to become 'European citizens' instead of inhabitant of The Netherlands, by offering them an international experience in one of our European countries. Our slogan: Ready for take off? Go and explore!

The last 15 years Aventus invested much into sustainable relations with European partners. Reciprocal projects and knowledge exchange especially concerned:- Improvement of the quality of preparation and tutoring of international work placements by both Aventus and the foreign training companies.- Building up (formal) European networks of partners designing policies as to contents and validation of international work placements- The structure and curricula of the courses and innovative projects/routes resulting in European Job Profiles with units of learning outcomes, such as: European Management Assistant, European Import and Export Assistant, European Transport & Logistics Assistant, European Green Automotive Energy Mechanic, European Fashion Designer, European Fashion Production Coordinator, European IT System Administrator, European Application Developer, European Marketing Assistant, European Private Security Assistant.- Monitoring of the trainee’s learning process during the international work placements while accomplishing growth with linguistic and intercultural competences- Connecting assessments of growth of intercultural competences (within the  international work placements) with career guidance of participating students - Introduction of ECVET proof “European Job Profiles” for Welfare and Health care coursesDuring the last 3 years ECVET instruments were implemented, such as the Memorandum of Understanding, Learning Agreements and Units of Learning Outcomes. The translation from work processes into “units of learning outcomes” was completed within the first 10 European Job Profiles. The outcomes of international work placements have become more transparent and valid. Aventus has become a member of the following “European Job Profile” networks: NETINVET (International Trade and Transport & Logistics), EUrFASHION (Fashion), EURO-AST (Management Assistant), EEE (green car technology), Shaping IT (IT System administrator, Application Developer and Media shaping), AEHT (Hotel and Tourism) M&C (European Marketing Assistant) and NOKAS (European Private Security Assistant). Aventus believes that for the next few years it is of great importance to cooperate with European partners by using ECVET instruments to create more clarity about the learning outcomes of international work placements and to get to a fitting assessment system for them. In order to do this Aventus is an active member of both formal and informal networks that are based on  “European Job Profiles”. Aventus aims at exchanging expertise, experiences and best practices as to assessment and validation of professional tasks during international work placements of students, innovations and tested recipes to complicated educational issues together with its partners within these networks.  All project partners within this project offer many ideas for realising  learning goals for the individual students derived from the European Job profile concerned. As a learning organization Aventus will submit this application both from the perspective of the individual student and the qualifications they aim at with a new focus at level 1 and 2 with the “Professional Orientation” and at level 3 and 4 with assessments of professional units of learning outcomes and last but not least validation of these meaningful learning experiences for the participants at all 4 levels. The effect for the students will be that the professional as well as the personal learning goals like “self reliance” and the status as a Europan Citizen, in which cultural differences are recognized and accepted. The effect for the entire partnership is that in determining a fitting international work placement the current curriculum, the job profiles and the connection to the European labour market will be reviewed. Both Aventus and the participating students will be stimulated to invest into flexibility of the work force, so that European citizenship also gets a wider European labour perspective. In designing the “Professional Orientation” international work placements the main focus will be on determining how the connection between current curriculum and foreign language learning can be made. The effect for the corporate world lies in extending their own European network by participating in the EUROEX project and reciprocal projects of Aventus’ European partners and getting to know new, sometimes innovative approaches. The ECVET-instruments that will be used in this project are “Memorandum of Understading”, “Units of learning outcomes” and the “learning agreements”. These learning experiences will be endorsed bij the development of the extra course 'Internatinalisering" I and II, bij offering Cambridge language courses and courses at the Goethe Institut. In short, "EUROEX" will challenge the Aventus student to excel in the professionally highlighted parts of their education as well as in the areas of linguistic and interculturel competences and European Citizenship.

Context/backgroundAfter some years of inactivity in internationalization, ROC Leiden aims to become an active player and partner in international cooperation. There still is some experience, there are ideas for the long run and there are a lot of students and lecturers who really want to have experiences abroad. In order to reach this aim, ROC Leiden is planning to act in two ways at the same time.Start facilitating international internships for a group of students and international activities for a group of teachers. At the same time start formulating the strategic vision including internationalization, while using the experiences and evaluations of the participants in the project.Objectives of the projectThis project is meant as a first, but important step in  the process of internationalization of ROC Leiden. The main objectives are:- creating an enthousiastic experienced group of students;- creating and keeping an enthousiastic group of staff members;- learning internationalization by practice and translating this in policy development.Number and profile of participants- 20 students, selected on excellence, motivation and enthousiasm;- 10 staff members, selected on motivation, enthiusuasm and capability to help develop an international network and contribution to the development of the strategic internationalization vision and policy. Description of activities.De methodologie van dit project komt overeen met het onderwijsconcept van ROC Leiden, kortheidshalve: praktijkleren.- realizing internships abroad for 20 students in three selected countries, made possible by the cooperation with our partners;- realizing activities of 10 teachers in the three selected countries;- stimulating the participants in co-developing the strategic mission and vision, including internationization.MethodologyThe methodology of this project is consistent with the learning methodology of ROC Leiden, which is based on learning by doing.The theory of chance is to support a group in their international activities now (by using partners as ADC and Estudiantes) and in this way as a stone in the pond create support in the organization to develop the stategy in internationalization.ResultsThe results will consist of two years of evaluations of 20 internships and 10 staff activities in a Western-, Southern and Northern European country. Also a strategy and policy in internationalization with a broad support in the organization;The experiences will be disseminated by articles, Facebook posts, films, interviews etc.There will also be the foundation of an international network of companies and educational institutes.ImpactThe impact on the organization will be the conviction that internationalization is a valuable and necessary part of the strategy of ROC Leiden. There will be possibilities for more students to go abroad and there is support from staff members, teachers and management. There is a foundation for continuing projects in Key Action I as well as Key Action II. Regional, national and international stakeholders will recognize ROC Leiden as an interesting partner.

Explore EU! is an international project, carried out by Drenthe College. Drenthe College is a vocational college, situated in the northern part of Holland and nearby the German border.the project aims at all students of the college, who can apply for an international practise period abroad, therefor preparing them for the labour market, as a part of society. Apart from professional skills, students will also learn personal skills and language skills. Drenthe college has performed more projects in the past.The project will also offer the possibility for staff to go abroad and explore the EU with all its possibilities. By performing this project, the college clearly states that it sees itselves as part of Europe, offering all people within the college, both staff and students, the possibility to expand their borders.As the college has a clear view about which direction it wants to move towards to, the partners have been carefully selected and there has been made a plan about all placements, which offer the college the opportunety to be fully in control of the project.There will be the possibility of 150 students, doing an international practise, and 70 staff members.
Mondriaan European Experience Three: International Natural Gathering

MEETING, the new Erasmus + project ROC Mondriaan, is the follow-up of project MEE. MEETING stands for Mondrian European Experience Three, International Natural Gathering: to meet, to come together, to learn from each other. MEETING has expanded the number of mobilities, and more importantly, more schools are connected. Internationalization is a priority at ROC Mondriaan!ROC Mondriaan (1.950 employees) is the VET Institution in the The Hague region which offers vocational and adult education to approximately 21.000 students. It promotes employment and/or social participation of its students. Mondrian has written its internationalization program in the policy document "Mondrian local as well as global". The policy consists of three main parts: 1. The Hague International City, 2. International orientation of schools, including the overseas internships and 3. Exchange programs. The strategic ambitions 2016 - 2019 of our institute include explicitly an international orientation as well; the themes "Improvement of education quality" and "Promoting/encouraging innovation and global citizenship" have both an international perspective.In this project, Mondriaan wants to stimulate individual experience abroad and embed international activities in the organization. Our overall objectives are:- to develop international competencies- to broaden horizons and prospects- personal development- to improve foreign languages- to gain inspiration, motivation and knowledge by staffThe mobilitiesCare and Welfare / Estonia 20 students BBLIn Estonia our partners demand a possible solution on a specific case. Out students will work on this topical issue for two weeks. The students present the possible solution and will engage the employees to implement the new method.Nursing & Care / Spain 34 studentsOur Nursing students go on a 20 weeks internship, Our car students go on a 12 weeks internship. They go to hospitals and nursing homes in Spain. The activities in Spain are more specialized and our students deal with more accountability than in the Netherlands.Tourism and Recreation / Spain, Germany 30 studentsStudents who want to follow the shortened duration curriculum level 4 of the courses Front Office Manager, Manager travel salesman, or Executive leisure & hospitality, make this study visit addition to the curriculum. Our students will work together with the students of our partner schools using Spanish or the German language.Fashion / England, Turkey 8 studentsFashion students start a 15-week internship in England or Turkey, which is mainly contributed to the production process itself. And which is almost impossible to experience in the Netherlands.Technique / Malta, Ireland 24 studentsThese students do a 12-week internship in Malta or Ireland. In Malta they follow a language training one day a week and follow an approved apprenticeship four days a week. In Ireland they go intern at an IT company to make a full apprenticeship.Lifestyle, Sport and Exercise / Austria 10 studentsStudents go on an internship for three weeks in Austria. They will give ski and snowboard lessons for children and adults at different levels and of different nationalities.Hairdressers / England 10 studentsStudents follow a training at the ADC college and do their internship at Hair and Beauty Salons. They are placed in host families during two weeks. They will have a focus on cultural differences and trendy new skills while learning English.46 employeesThere will be two group study travels: the team of (Specialized) Pedagogic employees go to Finland, and Hospitality and Facility Services go to Belgium / Northern France. They will acquire knowledge, visit schools and exchange experiences with colleagues. The program of all individual training / study trips is compiled based on the learning needs of the employee and / or training.All participants will have an unforgettable experience: an experience abroad deepens knowledge and provides new insights and inspiration. The internship contributes to the autonomy, self-reliance and personal responsibility of students and employees. They acquire a better knowledge of a foreign language, move in a completely different context than they’re used to and therefore it will deliver a wealth of experience and a better perspective on the labor market. Together with our partners we are building a European network for proper placement and knowledge exchange. The internships abroad are means to embed Internationalization in a structural way. It will connect the international labor market and is a way to present the schools attractively. The Hague region has a large international business field and with the structural embedding of our internationalization policy, we are an interesting partner for the regional labor market.
Nuotolinio mokymo būdo pritaikymas profesiniame mokyme

The main objective of vocational training institutions is to provide high quality service aiming to satisfy need of labour market and clients. Recently the increasing need of distance teaching has been noticed. Therefore seeking to ensure the customers’ demand Panevėžys Labour Market Training Centre is planning to provide vocational training services by innovative – distance way.Currently the supply of distance learning services are limited by the lack of vocational teachers, lack of competence in distance learning area and limited possibilities to improve them. Personnel lack knowledge in organizing distance learning, in using teaching methods and in estimating achievements.Seeking to provide teaching services by new learning way and ensure the right competence of vocational teachers, training organizers a mobility project is being carried out. The main objective of the project “Distance learning adaptation in vocational training” is to improve personnel competences in distance teaching area and apply this knowledge in organizing trainings distance way.  Project tasks are the following:1. Develop competencies of vocational teachers and training organizers in distance training and organizing area by taking part in performance monitoring visits, by performing the improvement of practical tasks and by gaining necessary knowledge and experience for providing new teaching way. 2. By summarizing experience obtained during the project, perform preparatory works for organizing distance learning.  Panevėžys Labour Market Training Centre vocational teachers and training organizers will take part in the activities of the project “Distance learning adaptation in vocational training”. During four internships (in Czech Republic, German, United Kingdom and Spain) participants will develop professional competences in organizing distance learning. During monitoring and practical skills developing activities they will get acquainted with the specifics of distance learning and watch how distance learning is implemented in vocational training institutions. Also during monitoring visits participants will get acquainted with new technologies and process how to ensure learning programs, plan preparation, learning quality. Project visits are planned in September and November 2016, February and March 2017. Hosting organizations have a reputation of a reliable partner and big experience in organizing mobility projects. Project will be administrated by experienced project team members, who also will ensure the quality of the project. The duration of the project “Distance learning adaptation in vocational training” is one year.During visits gained vocational competences will be directly adapted to training organizers and vocational teachers work. Participants after summarizing gained experiences will be able to create an optimal virtual area for Panevėžys Labour Market Training Centre. After carring out the project activities, there will be a possibility to implement trainings by innovative distance way in Panevėžys Labour Market Training Centre. As the result the quality of services will improve, organization’s competitiveness and effectiveness will increase.The closing conference will be organized in May 2017. During this conference invited guests from region vocational schools will be introduced with practical organizational aspects of innovative distance training way.  Other vocational training institutions will be also promoted to start new way learning. In this way the attractiveness of VET will be increased. The project promotes the developing of innovative practices by transferring experiences from one country to another. The project will help to popularize the new training way for vocational training, will increase the attraction of vocational trainings, will enlarge the education services compliance for market demand and will increase the amount of vocational training students.

The project "Studying without borders III" is submitted by the Business School, Secondary Special School for Librarians and Further Education College Brno. The project will be implemented in cooperation with its partner ADC College from London. The presenter is an educational institution established by the South-Moravian region which realizes educational programmes in the area of secondary and tertiary education (it means further education colleges in case of tertiary education).The target group of the project are students of the 2nd and 3rd form of the business academy and business lyceum. They have acquired both sufficient professional knowledge (economics, languages, IT) and communication and managerial skills. The students will attend 2 weeks of practice in London in economic and business workplaces (in two terms, 15 students participating in each term, the 1st term in autumn 2016, the 2nd term in spring 2017). Students, mentored by the company representatives, will be working actively at these workplaces. They will learn to present their work adequately to their mentors, colleagues or customers, which will contribute to the development of their soft-skills. Students will broaden their English professional terminology.
