New working methods and experience gained in the foreign language environment will be exerted in the Czech Republic during students´ further studies, practice and their involvement in the working process.The aims of the project:• increase of students´ knowledge and practical skills in the above mentioned fields of study• improvement of language skills, development of students´communicative, social and personal competences• improvement of the quality of skills in the profession, using new approaches, development of informational competences• verification of the unit of learning outcomes "Bussiness Correspondence and Working with the Client Database" in the ECVET frame• competitive advantage at the labour market• knowledge of life and traditions of the visited country• using innovative methods from the visited country and their dissemination during further studies and practice of studentsDissemination:• final report and evaluation (for the recieving partner, Department of Education of the Regional Authority, Chamber of Commerce, National Agency)• brochure for students intending to participate in a similar mobility project• school conference for students and teachers from various fields of study• conference for teachers, school management and staff participating in projects• presentation during meetings of teachers and coordinators of students work placements• report and publicizing through the school internet site, parent-teacher meetings, Doors Open Day, Fair of Secondary Schools• public seminar for teachers of other secondary business schools and for project writers from schools in different fields of studyAll above mentioned ways of dissemination ensure the target groups will exploit the gained experience and innovation in their own practice or projects. The outcomes of the project and their impact on target groups (students and teachers both from our school and schools in different fields of study, school management, coordinators of students work placements, project writers from other schools, Department of Education of the Regional Authority) will ensure the long-term impact of the  project.

The purpose of this project is to give students an opportunity to experience informal and practical acquisition of knowledge and skills. This experience offers students a chance to greater employability in the local and European labour market also thanks to ECVET which supports greater transparency and quality of practical trainings. This project includes 18 students studying Business Academy and Economic Lyceum. It is intended for students of the third year of study, since this is the year when students go through a practical training in various enterprises. Students, aged 17-18, will take part in a three-week professional training in the field of trade and business administration in the surroundings of London, Great Britain. There they will be placed in local shops and enterprises in spring 2017. Students will get an opportunity to go abroad and employ their knowledge in an authentic setting. The main aims of this projects are acquisition of  business knowledge, applying of theoretical knowledge into practice, getting acquainted with real business communication and negotiations, comparing foreign and local trade and services, practising and improving their English language and English business correspondence, getting acquainted with culture and habits of an English-speaking country. The implementation of the project will be managed by the school as a sending organization and ADC College as an intermediary organization. The sending organization will organize selection of participants, their language and professional training, transport to the work place and monitoring of the project and internship, final evaluation and dissemination of results. The intermediary organization will ensure work placement of students, accommodation with host families, including food and transportation to/ from the place of internship, insurance, monitoring and evaluation. Apart from an official evaluation, students will participate in the presentation of their experience and results in their practical training at our school (or even on a regional level). After completing their training, students are expected to make two presentations. One focused on trade and business administration, in which they will include their expectations compared to gained experience, they will compare means of trading in a foreign country and the Czech Republic. The other presentation will concern language points, such as business communication, acquisition of new English vocabulary, and cultural points. They will present these outcomes in classes and discussions to inform and motivate other students. The school accompanying person will evaluate the training from his/ her perspective and will present it to school management and public at special occasions such as inspections, open house days etc. The project and its realization will be published on school web pages, or in local press and media.
Posílení odborných kompetencí žáků EOA Děčín při zahraniční praxi

Successful implementation of the mobility projects within the Leonardo da Vinci programme or the Erasmus+ programme and a very positive feedback from the project participants led us to the decision to take part in further activities of this kind. We want other student of the school to experience a two-week internship in companies abroad. The main objective of the project is to realize a mobility of 20 students of the European Business Academy in Decin to the British capital city London for a 14-day work experience. Within this mobility of the students in vocational education and training we expect students to improve particularly their professional and language skills during the stay. In order to achieve these aims students will be accommodated in British families and they will be employed in various London organisations in administrative positions or retail. The internship will lead to acquiring or improving students’ professional competences related to work on a PC, secretary work, administration or various kinds of correspondence. In retail students will learn how to deal with customers, accept or dispatch goods. According to the ECVET principles for both these fields specific units of learning outcomes have been defined, observance of these units will be included in the final evaluation of the project. The course of the practice in British firms will be monitored by the ADC College representatives, two teachers of our school and mentors from the receiving organisations.  Among the planned project activities belong a specialized language and cultural preparatory course organized by the school before leaving for the internship and, after the return, the evaluation of the acquired knowledge and skills and their dissemination among other pupils and teachers of the school and the wide public. We suppose that successful completion of the work experience will motivate other students of the school who might want to take part in similar activities in the future. This experience and the Europass Mobility document should help all project participants succeed on the labour market and contribute to a higher level of education in the whole region.

Project Zahraniční praxe ve Velké Británii (Foreign placement in Great Britain) is aimed at improving quality of vocational education of its participants, establishing contacts with partner organizations and last but not least at improving knowledge and skills of English. It is prepared for  for the pupils of Class 3 of Commercial High School, fields Bisiness academy and Economical lycee. It is planned for 20 participants. The placement will enable them to transform theoretical knowledge into practical skills, discover the environment of a foreign firm, which might be different from a Czech one, it will enable to compare needs and wishes of Czech and foreign clients. The project arises from needs of students to learn about the life and working style in the EU countries, which will bring them practical experience for future professional life. The main aims of the project are getting to know economical situation abroad, intercultural education, improving language knowledge, improving ICT skills, learning tolerance, independence, flexibility and independent decisions.The pupils of Class 3 of Commercial High School have integrated economical subject included into the curriculum (synthesis of economics, ICT+internet and accounting, which is followed by a training firm form specialized in accounting. Pupils of Economical lycee have subjects of economics and technics of tourism. During their studies the pupils take part in excursions to various firms. The foreign placement will enable the pupils to get practical knowledge and skills, compare teoretical knowledge and practical skills. The 2-week placement will take place at ADC College and their partner companies (United Kingdom), main focus on administrative work, in spring 2017. All participants will receive a Europass Mobility Certificate and an ADC College Certificate. In the project criteria of the European system ECVET will be used for improving quality of mobilities in vocational education.
Vocational Experience for Business Academy Students

The whole project has come into existence out of the needs of the sending organisation – Business Academy Česká Lípa – to enhance vocational knowledge and future employment options of the students and to support the connection of education, entrepreneur sector and state organisations. The main aim of the project is to broaden vocational knowledge of the students, their socio-cultural knowledge and the vocational terminology in the foreign language. The main part of the project are two- and four- week long stays abroad for carefully chosen students. The two-week long stays take place in London and the four-week stays in small and middle size companies in Austria. The main partners in the project are Business Academy as the sending organisation, ADC College as the receiving organisation in London and BVÖ Bildungsberatung & Vermittlungsagentur GmbH as the receiving organisation in Austria. Both institutions are well-experienced in Erasmus plus projects. The participants of the stays will be chosen from all three branches of study, it is Business Academy, Lyceum of Economics and Public Service Activities, their age is 17-19 years old, third grade of the school study. Fifteen students will take part in the vocational experience in London and ten in Austria. The students gain theoretical and practical knowledge and abilities in vocational subjects such as accounting, public service, economics, written electronic communication, ICT, taxes and law and they can improve and learn how to use them in real life situations within the project activities. The participants will be chosen according to in advance set criteria such as vocational knowledge and their active participation in school activities and foreign language knowledge. The choice will be carried out by a team of teachers of vocational subjects, class teachers, foreign language teachers, study mentors and the headmaster of Business Academy.In the preparatory phase of the project the partners will sign the Memorandum of Understanding and other contracts defining their obligations within the project. They will set the exact date of the stays and the exact work posts. The chosen participants will prepare for the stays, will fill in the necessary documents, sign Learning agreements, Quality commitments, will take a language test, will be prepared in vocational and socio-cultural issues.The stays will take place in the given term in carefully chosen companies in London and Austria. The accompanying person will monitor the participants during the stay and help them to solve all possible problems. The content of the stays is focused on gaining and improving vocational skills and knowledge that the students learn during their studies, these are for example: processing documents – filling, creating, checking, and processing post, administrative work with computer; working with goods, communication with customers and co-workers in a foreign language. The stays will help the students to verify and widen the knowledge concerning socio-cultural situation in the foreign countries they got during their school studies and in preparatory courses.After the stays are finished the evaluation and dissemination of the results of the project will be carried out. The project team will approve the results of the units of learning and will evaluate the results of the questionnaires. A conference to the project will be organised for the students of Business Academy, primary schools, representatives of companies, state offices and public. During the conference the participants will present the content of the stays, their experience and photos taken during the stays. The participants will also be given Europass mobility containing units of learning. The members of the project team will present the organisational, administrative and financial matters. Further dissemination will be carried out in the form of newspaper articles, messages on school web sites, open days at school and other occasions where the school presents itself.The benefit and result of the project is the improvement of the vocational knowledge of the participants, improvement of their communicative skills in a foreign language and contribution to the fulfilling of the aims of the European educational policy.
Моделът на дуалната система на професионално обучение в ИКТ сектора- европейски хоризонти за обучаеми и обучители  в СПГЕ "Джон Атанасов"

The project “The Model of the Dual System of Vocational Training in ICT sector – European Horizons for Trainees and Trainers in VHSE “John Atanasoff” is in harmony with the key activity 1 supported by the European Programme Erasmus+.Representatives of European institutions recognize the incapability of educational institutions to meet entirely the needs of the labour market and they direct the attention of the new member states in the European community to the key role of vocational training while solving the problem. The dual system of training is one of the ways to establish a link between education and economics. Its specific nature consists in the fact that the dual system offers theory and practice in real work environment. A leading state in the applying of this kind of training is Germany whose experience in this field has provoked strong interest on behalf of the Bulgarian educational institutions, too, to use the German experience when introducing the dual system of training in Bulgaria.The participants in the projects are three groups. The first one consists of 8 initiative trainers. One of the main goals of the project is to increase the qualification, the professional competences of the pedagogic specialists with regard to the teaching methodology of the subjects in vocational training that will be carried out in Bulgaria. The teachers who can apply to participate in the project are those who are responsible for working out strategies for the development of the vocational training, for the adoption and implementation of a new methodology of the subjects taught in vocational training, for the preparation of tests, methods / scales of assessment, more effective training methods for acquiring certificates (relevant to VHSE where Microsoft and Cisco academies function). They will learn about the different ways of developing new theoretical and practical tests in the field of vocational education. I.e. beneficiaries may be teachers responsible for specialties of modular training, teachers responsible for methodological associations in vocational training, teachers of vocational training, instructors in the school Cisco Academy, head teachers, assistants of the principal, the principal; with a certificate of competences in English. Teachers in English can also be included as the subject “Foreign language in the profession” is taught in the school, but also the good foreign language competence increases opportunities for the students’ implementation at the labour market.All described above can be carried out  with the German educational institutions and companies in Berlin, Germany, by exchange of good practices, innovative ideas and approaches. The collaboration between different sectors to exchange knowledge and  its practical application will lead to a smoother and quick transition of students from school to practice on a particular working place.After the implementation of the mobility of the teachers and the dissemination of the results, in 2017 a selection will be made of the second group of participants in the project –22 students who will be sent to a mobile practice to Dresden/ London in the field of computer technologies /web design and computer nets/. The mobility will be carried out in Berlin in the period 30.10.2016 – 05.11.2016 for the group of the teachers and 06.08.2017-26.08.2017, Dresden/ London, for the students and 2 accompanying teachers. The working language is English. The host organizations are WBS Training AG and ADC College.  Main aims:- familiarization with the basic principles of application of the dual system of training;- getting good training practices and technologies in real working conditions in an international environment;- acquisition of work habits and skills for teamwork; - improvement and expansion of linguistic skills in the technical field, improving communication skills in foreign languages, acquisition of skills for communication in a multicultural environment as well as motivation to learn foreign language;- strengthening the interaction between educational institutions and production environment;- dissemination of the accumulated experience in this area, which will be implemented by means of ICT and will be directed to the needs of vocational education and training of young people in this new and promising field. This will ensure the increase of public awareness for implementing modern solutions at regional and national level;- acquisition of knowledge, skills and qualifications to facilitate personal development, employability and competitive advantage in the participation, both at the national and European labour market, and more.Expected results:- more detailed knowledge and opportunity for wide dissemination of the practice; - improved communication between education and business in the field of ICT;- experience acquired to solve current practical cases;- created on-line platform to share the activities and results achieved.

The project is submitted and coordinated by Business Academy and HPS Valašské Meziříčí (further BA) which plans to send students into international mobilities (2 flows) offering work experience in the UK.  Regarding the fields of study at the school, the UK seems to be an ideal place because it combines our students’ needs for high-quality employers and language benefits because English is a must in the IT and business fields.The main objective of the project is the applying, improvement and verification of professional competences, skills and knowledge in work experience with an active use of professional terminology in English. Other objectives are qualification extension by work experience abroad, obtaining high-quality experience within real companies, improvement of key professional abilities and skills regarding the labour market, personal skills development (e. g. ability to work on one’s own and responsibility), the extension of international dimension of education and vocational training and their synergy with the labour market, the internationalisation and innovation of education, implementation of good practices into educational process and daily activities at school, the innovation of specialised subjects curricula to meet potential employers’ requirements and improvement in competitiveness and reputation of the school. The work experience will involve 25 students of the 3rd and 4th year of study studying Business Academy, Information Technology and Public Administration. There will be 2 flows. The students might work as: receptionists, administrators, web pages graphic designers, web pages editors, IT technicians, sales assistants and customer service assistants for companies or organizations such as travel agencies, shops, educational institutions and local community organizations. The trainees will have a full-time job, which means an 8-hour working day. The trainees will be carrying out some of the following tasks according to their positions:copying, faxing, scanning, word processing, e-mail correspondence, using MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint, repairing computers, notebooks and another IT equipment, web research, updating, marketing, products promotion, ordering goods, dealing with complaints, taking photos of faulty goods, market research, web pages design and editing, working with multi-media files, using internal software of the company, filing, using Photoshop, sale, dealing with customers, business correspondence, bookkeeping etc.The partner organisations are The IBD Partnership and ADC College, which are responsible for the choice of high quality employers according to filled documents. In addition, they will arrange accommodation, transfer, local transport and insurance for the trainees. BA is responsible for the selection of the trainees according to the stated criteria (e. g. test in specialised subjects, motivation, test of language skills and good manners). BA will organise preparatory courses in specialised subjects, language and cultural background and risks prevention training. BA will also arrange transportation to and from the UK.Project and quality management will be legally ensured by the following documents:1) Letter of Intent and Memorandum of Understanding, 2) contracts between BA and the partners, 3) individual contracts between BA and the trainees:a) Participant Agreement stating rules for work placement financing, insurance, the conditions of grant return if the trainee does not finish the work placement; b) Quality Commitment c) Learning Agreement including an ECVET unit of learning outcomes.Mentoring and monitoring will be carried out by 3 subjects: 1) accompanying persons, 2) the managers and/or coordinators from the partner organisations, 3) mentors at particular work places. There will be issued 2 certificates, i. e.  Europass Mobility documents and partners’ certificates. Final reports will be completed after the work experience. We are going to use the ECVET system.The trainees are expected to gain new theoretical and especially practical knowledge and competences (knowledge, skills and attitudes) with respect to the labour market and further studies. Longer term benefits for the students are: motivation towards further study, participation in other projects, the extension of qualification, higher chances to be admitted to universities, improvement in competitiveness at the labour market. Longer term benefits for BA are: implementation of gained knowledge and experience into the curricula of specialised subjects and English followed by their innovation, improvement in work experience management in our country, improvement in teaching, better reputation, increase in the number of applicants for study, colleagues’ motivation to be involved in other projects, better preparation and management of further projects, the internationalisation of education and higher awareness of EU programmes.

Students from the Secondary School of Gastronomy and hospitality services , specifically students specialized in hotel services, businessstudies and vocational students specialized in cooking, waitressing and confectioning  will be joined into the project in two runs. The school would like to provide the students with an opportunity to take part in a foreign training course focused on their field of study in Great Britain (London), where they will be able to check and improve their language skills as English is one of the compulsory subjects of these specializations in our school. Due to the fact that we have achieved  establishing  successful relations with our English partner in London and because of good experience from our previous projects, the same organization has been chosen as our partner organization. This organization has long-lasting experience with managing similar projects and is highly competent to arrange a wide range of professional training stations (restaurants, catering services, hotel services, organizations and services in tourism) and has experience with the introduction and realisation of the system ECVET  that will be implemented for the first time in our project and will lead to improving the quality of mobilities abroad.The second run leads to Slovakia, where we have an established partnership with the partner – Hotel and Congress Centre. The object of that project is to integrate those students to the project, who are professionally skillful and efficient but  have problems with foreign language communication and for that reason have been excluded from the projects so far. Principal objective of that project is bigger motivation in their professional field of education. In the case of this partner the system ECVET will be also implemented that will be beneficial for both the sending and the receiving organization and will help to improve not only the present but also future projects.Runs of mobilities of the students of mentioned specializations will be realised in two week trainings during the period of the project. Foreign training course will enable the students to meet new forms of work organization in real background and to motivate them for further education in both professional and language form.  Foreign training courses organized by our school lead to fulfillment of our School Educational Programme, which emphasizes as big interconnection with real training in the form of continuous and suspended trainings as possible. Selected students will participate in those trainings abroad. The main aim of the project is to improve quality of professional  preparation, to boost professional skills  thanks to the introduction of the system ECVET and thanks of it also to the possible introduction of units of learning outcomes during the vocational training going in school and by social partners, as well as during the practical vocational subjects. The project aims  is also to help in orientation on labour market and to strengthen participants´positions on labour market as well. Another object is to motivate primarily vocational students to build up their professional qualification in an appropriate way, to support and cultivate the exchange of professional experience and to varify the ability of communication in foreign languages.In this way, students will learn about other country, other working and social culture, moral and lifestyle. Therefore intercultural aspect is significant and important part of the mobility project. Participants will attend preparation courses before the short-term foreign training, where they will improve their skills in particular foreign language and take part in cultural preparation focused on particularity of the given country. Students will note the training course in the form of diaries and project team together with the students will evaluate the course of the trainging and the results will be used for other school activities. Our school in co-operation with the project partners will arrange handing over the certificates of participations in the training and handing over the documents – Europass – mobility. The project will be continuously evaluated and presented on the school website, during various school events and in local press. The foreign training will be focused on both practical skills and theoretic knowledge improvement, foreign language communication support, mobility, flexibility of young people and ability of team work with the main aim to provide the best and the highest quality training for future career and with a reference to perspective of breaking through in the competitive environment of European labour market.

There are two appointed foreign languages in the educational plan of the students attending the pedagogical profile. The two foreign languages taught in the “Vasile Lupu” Pedagogical Highschool are English and French. The first foreign language is taught within two hours a week during the four years of highschool, the second language is given, beginning with the superior cycle, which is from the 11th and 12th grades, only one hour of study. The students who choose to take the certificate which allows them to teach the foreign language (they may choose the first and/or the second foreign language, or both of them) are allocated, according to the present curriculum, only half an hour. This means that during one half an hour a week of pedagogical practice we must achieve the teaching of the foreign language didactics (French or English) as well as the accomplishment of the foreign language practice stage. Therefore, it is obvious that the foreign languages teachers, methodologists of the pedagogical practice, make huge efforts to raise the students’ language level within 2 hours or even one a week, same time which is also allocated for teaching the foreign language didactics.  This project was designed as a consequence of our needs, thouroughly analysed and researched, and it aims at completing students’ education in the field of acquiring linguistic knowledge, abilities and competences in order to teach foreign languages at primary level, education which cannot be achieved under best circumstances currently, at the “Vasile Lupu” Pedagogical Highschool, only because of the allocated time of teaching within the present curriculum (half an hour a week) for the pedagogical practice and the teaching of the foreign language methodology.    The objectives of this project are the following:1. To acquire specific methods and strategies of teaching-learning the foreign languages at primary level: teaching the vocabulary items, the phonetics, the grammar, the communicative structures. 2. To develop the competence of speaking and writing in the foreign language, of socially interaction with the pupils. 3. To develop the competence of writing the didactic project in the foreign language, according to the curriculum and the study level.  4. To develop the competence of intercultural communication in professional context. The target group is made up of 32 students of the “Vasile Lupu” Pedagogical Highschool, pedagogical profile from 10th and 11th grades, registered at pedagogical practice of a foreign language, who are going to take the foreign language certificate for teaching at primary level, at the end of 12th grade.  The certificate of foreign language teaching at primary level is taken, each year, by students who choose either French or English. Thus, the project takes into account the students’ training for the two languages: a first flow of 16 students for english and a second flow of students for taking the french certificate. In order to accomplish these objectives, the students will perform the following activities:1. Acquiring the foreign language methods and strategies of teaching at primary level: teaching the phonetics, the vocabulary, the communicative structures by solving the work tasks during the training. 2. Taking actively part to workshops, having as themes methods and strategies of teaching foreign  languages at primary level.  3. Noticing and writing down in their training notebook the demands expressed by the teacher using the foreign language, the social interaction phrases in the classroom, during  watching the lessons at primary level.  4. Writing the didactic projects for different activities using the foreign language. 5. Performing a lesson sequence using the foreign language.  The students will speak and write in the foreign language under authentic learning contexts. During the first week, they will acquire foreign language teaching methods and strategies in the group workshops, they will have the opportunity to practice their knowledge by making didactic projects and solving practical tasks.  During the second week, they will have a practical stage at primary schools, where they will watch the foreign language activities, they will make up didactic projects and they will perform sequences of foreign language activities, they will interact with the pupils, the tutor and the mentor using the foreign language. The results of this project concern the development of knowledge, abilities and competences to teach a foreign language at primary level, for a group of 32 students. This training will have a positive impact on the quality of the test and final classes of the participants, in order to take the Foreign Language Teaching Certificate at primary level and it will also encourage other students to register at the foreign language pedagogical practice.

Project partners: Applicant: Secondary School InterDACT, s.r.o., Pionýrů 2806, 43401 Most, Czech RepublicPartner´s organisation : ADC College, station House, 11-13 Mason Avenue, Harrow, Middlesex HA3 5 AD United KingdomProject period: 1.9.2016 – 31.8. 2017Project called „Enjoy London!“ is aimed for the students of the secondary school InterDACT, s.r.o., in Most. It is about a short term educational stay of a group of 20 students at the beginning of a professional education in London (GB), who study IT, social and public studies. In the group there will be 8 IT students, 4 students of social activities and 8 students of public studies.The length of the stay was agreed on 14 days and the most probable stay time is about the turn of November – December 2016. The students will be accompanied by one teacher as a supervisor. The arranging partner, ADC College, which has been working in the field of education and special training for many years, will provide students with professional training in the appropriate firms in the town of London, transport, accommodation and food. All the students will be treated as their own employees.Before the stay a special language course will be held concentrating enlarging English technical terminology. The students will get new info and trends in the sphere of social care, public matters and administration and IT information.  They will enrich their knowledge by using modern technologies, they will receive information about the newest trends in the sphere of IT in Great Britain. IT students will help secure failure–free work of all PCs in the individual firms, they will work with their hardware and software, they will install and care for the operating systems and their peripherals, they are expected to work with the basic equipment, apply the most suitable protection system, programme and make websites including their designs. Public activities students will work in the branch of all kinds of administration using all sources of information with help of IT and office technology, they will process factually, linguistically and formally correct documents, they will communicate with the public and clients orally and in a written form. In the branch of the social care, they will work in the social services, where they will suggest the best way of rehabilitation and help directly their clients.The guarantee of the stay is the usage of the results of the educational system ECVET, the sending and partner´s organisations are both responsible for and  the Europass Mobility as well, which validates the participants´ results.The main aim of the project is to deepen practical knowledge, abilities and competencies of students during their stay abroad, increase motivation to communicate in English. Another aspect of this stay is to make their study branch much more attractive, which should support finding better working possibilities within the EU market. Next task is to establish an international partnership leading to the mutual international understanding between the EU states, improve to feel the differences and similarities of both cultures.The stay will enable adequate possibilities with the regards of the students’ knowledge and abilities for their personal and professional growth and a chance to obtain a job. Project activities will lead to their professional growth and get rid of their language barrier. The main goal of the stay is to increase the competition within the EU market, to intensify their specialized and language experience obtained via this project in Great Britain. The stay will lead the students to their own responsibility, higher personal independence, self-confidence, ethical and esthetical knowledge in their own branches, even more it will make their cultural horizon wider.
Do Evropy za zvýšením kvality odborné přípravy

The project called To Europe for Vocational Training Improvement is aims at the basis of tertiary vocational education – high quality of vocational preparation of students, who will become highly employable, and also on current situation in Czech and European labour market, whose demands on higher adaptability on multicultural environment is increasing.The objective of this project is to increase the quality of vocational training of tertiary vocational school students by them undergoing a part of their compulsory placement in the United Kingdom specifically in London and in Greece. The required increase will be further achieved by using the ECVET system as a tool of defining outcomes of these placements, whose evaluation will be provided by our partner abroad on the basis of mutual trust. Defining the Learning Outcomes and evaluating whether they were specific enough will result in even closer interconnection of education and training. These Learning Outcomes will be used for further placements in Czech companies as well as abroad as they allow increasing transparency of placements and internships for schools, students and companies. 27 students of tertiary vocational will be involved in this project. 25 students will do their placement in London, in two cycles, and similarly 2 students in Greece, in two cycles. The aim of these placements is to cooperate with foreign colleagues apply and test their practical knowledge and gain and widen further abilities and competencies.  The criteria for selection of students will be firstly their specialized subjects and language study results. The students’ social background and behaviour will also be taken into consideration as the student will represent the school and the Czech Republic abroad. Both destination countries of our placements are as well as the Czech Republic members of the European Union; however there exist a variety of differences in working conditions, habits or historical development. During the placement, students will understand how important it is to respect rules of the living in multicultural society, deepen their social abilities, and test their adaptability in different social and cultural environments. Last, but not least their language competencies will improve mainly in the area of specialized terminology. International internship will increase employability of these students in the Czech and foreign labour market.The project is scheduled for two years. Before each placement, students will undergo cultural and language preparation, language testing and Learning Outcomes will be prepared for them. After students’ return, language testing will be repeated and outcomes will be compared with the initial ones, Learning Outcomes will be evaluated and adapted in accordance with this evaluation. During each placement one school teacher will provide a monitoring visit. Although we have selected our partner organizations very carefully and we trust them we feel that we need to personally experience the environment, where our students gain and deepen their professional, language and social competencies. Developing competencies in the area of implementing ECVET for improving quality and evaluating outcomes of work placements is an extremely important issue for the school. Defining Learning Outcomes before the placement allows transparent and clear evaluation of the placements. ECVET allows lifting administrative burden of work placement providers, which, we presume, will be highly welcome by these companies. We believe a number of them will encounter this system for the first time in the Czech environment. Practical experience of the use of Learning Outcomes will be used in updating tertiary school study programmes, which need to be newly accredited every 6 years, in preparation of new programmes and last, but not least in improving the quality of education itself.Cooperation with foreign partners will result not only in the above mentioned improvements of education and increasing competencies, but also in the school’s higher prestige and ability to compete among school institutions.
BENCHMARKING INOVATIV IN INVATAMANTUL TEHNOLOGIC SI TURISM PENTRU O COOPERARE EUROPEANA DURABILA

The project with the title "Innovative Benchmarking in Techological Education and Tourism for a Sustainable European Cooperation" is a Erasmus+ KA1 and VET mobility project for students and staff which contributes to the objectives of the Action Programme of the EU on training and provides the European dimension of education, corresponding to the national priority in order to ensure the access to quality education in initial vocational training, while at regional level is correlated with the priority of ensuring transparency of qualifications and promotes the European mobilities.The AIM of the project results from a real need for training the high school students from 10th and 11th grade from the Technological specialization, Services profile, ‚Tourism and catering’ domain, with the qualifications "Hotel worker" and "Technician in tourism", providing an initial training correlated with the Romanian and European employers' expectations from tourism. The project also satisfies the need to apply our high school’ in-service (continous) training policy of the high school teachers specialized on VET to ensure the European dimension of the technological education.The OBJECTIVES of the project are: a) General: -international cooperation for innovation and sharing the best practices for technological education; -developing cooperation in the European education and training of studentsb) Specific: b.1.) specific for students: Formation of core competencies transition from school to work and teamwork, specific skills to provide quality hotel services and achieving the technical operations of the travel agency, cross-curricular skills : communicating in a language Stain and digital;-forming the behavior based on respect and hospitality tailored to the expectations of European tourists;-forming a positive attitude in order to improve the quality in technological educationb.2.) specific for teachers:- improving the professional skills capacity for analysis and synthesis of technological education in the European context;-applying new methods and tools to increase the quality of European Benchamarking in the technological education;-developing skills to use ICT, communication in a foreign language; adapting to the European organizational culture, work in an international team.The target group consists of 28 students from 10th and 11th grade with the qualification: ‚Hotel worker’ and ‚Technician in tourism’ and 10 teachers specialized on VET education who teach in the high school and post secondary school.MOBILITYFlow I: 6 specialist teachers from the high school, Job Shadowing, April 2nd-8th, 2017 -Helsinki, Finland, partner organization-EUNEOSFlow II: 14 students, qualification ‚Technician in tourism’; June 4th -24th, 2017-Portsmouth, United Kingdom, partner organization - Traning Vision LtD.Flow III: 4 teachers specialists at the post-secondary school, Job Shadowing,Aprilie 3rd- 20, 2018 -Nancy, France; School partner Frederic ChopinFLOW IV: 14 students qualifying hotel worker, 17iunie-July 7, 2018, Rimini, Italy organization partner -Sistema Turismo PROJECT ACTIVITIES:-Information in two meetings, announcement on the board with projects;-Selection of beneficiars based on the following criteria: 10th grade or 11th student, technological high school, Services profile, basic training field - Tourism; or teachers -specialists in the Technological education area who have not benefited of a Erasmus+ scholarship;submitting a complete application file; selection tests: test of knowledge and test in the foreign language;-Pedagogical preparation -6hours / flow; Linguistic preparation in the country for English / French / Italian, 20 hours on for the teachers’ flows and 35 hours for the students’s flow; Cultural and pedagogical preparation -8hours in the country and 10hours  abroad for students, 4 hours for teachers;-Monitoring the mobilities by observing, advice, satisfaction questionnaires, diaries, filling in of practice and individual reports- Initial/during/final evaluation of the participants in mobility using tests, work samples-Certification, validation of the results by the foreign partners and Sc.Sup.Com.N.Kretzulescu- Dissemination locally, regionally, nationally and internationally through mass media, meetings of methodical committees, symposia, fairs of training firms, workshops, the following results: 28 students with upper level professional standards skills for the qualifications ‚Hotel worker’ and ‚Technician in tourism’ and 10 teachers with improved professional skills in order to increase the quality of the technological education, obtaining for each beneficiary of the Europass,of the participation and foreign language certificates, 38 portfolios of mobility, 20 new teaching materials using ICT, a methodological guide for increasing the quality of technogical education, a CD with videos, with modern teaching activities, the project website, a partners’ network.

The modern labor market is demand-oriented of personnel with high mobility of knowledge and developed capacity for professional development. Preparation of qualified personnel with attitudes for career development in the profession requires improvement and updating the professional preparation. As a vocational school with a tradition of training courses in the field of initial vocational training we need to provide our students a complete and high-quality professional preparation. The project "Work experience through European placement" is a specific initiative on GHG IET "M. V.Lomonosov "for the development of  professional preparation in high school with the resources and tools for European cooperation between countries. Participants in the project will be 20 students from the high school boys and girls over the age of 16 years,, who attend a high school for the acquisition of third degree of professional qualification in the profession "Construction and Architecture (5 students from 12th grade) and by profession Computer equipment and technologies (15 students from 10 to 12th grade The overall objective of the project is to provide opportunities and resources for quality professional training of participants in a real multicultural working environment, which will increase their opportunities for professional development in the national system of labor.The project is aimed in the realization of  the following specific objectives:• Increase the practical exam in the profession in a real working environment as part of the training school• Improving the professional skills in order to ensure sustainable employment and professional development• Development of intercultural and social competences of the participants• Promoting and improving foreign language skills as a precondition for successful realization of the labor market.• Raising the prestige and popularity of high school professional education through dissemination of the good practices.The project will be realized with the partnership of Kairos Europe, a company from London, dedicated to to the promotion and development of programs aimed at increasing cultural exchange between European countries.The main project activities includes conducting a two-week practice of real jobs in companies from London in the period 02.04. 2017 to  22. 04.2017 year. Participants will be selected through a selection of clear and objective criteria . Will be given equal access to every student at the school who are targeted.The mobility will take place on a work program agreed between the partners in the preparation of the project proposal. Participation in the tree-week practice of real jobs in London will help students gain professional experience in the real business environment, depending on their field of study. Students from specialty "Construction and Architecture" will perform work tasks in the field of geodesy. They will participate in the implementation of ongoing projects of the host company and will learn by assist the work of the more experienced surveyors. During the practice, they will work with specific software and tools used in geodesy and will improve skills and competence in the field of standards for design and construction in line with modern trends in their profession in the UK. Students from "Computer Engineering" will work in companies in the IT sector and will be involved in the maintenance of computers (hardware and software), maintenance and configuration of networks and customer service. During the practice they will improve their skills to work in the profession and will deepen their knowledge of operating systems, networks, hardware and software in accordance with developments in the working environment in the host country.Participants will get the opportunity to test their knowledge and management skills from school in an English environment. They will learn to plan, implement and control work tasks assigned to them in a foreign language to communicate and learn from professionals in the profession The results of the practice will be documented with a certificate of Europass Mobility, receiving references from companies and specific certificate from the partner. The acquired documents and experience will be a plus on their CV and will give them more opportunities for employment upon completion of general education at school.The experience gained will increase self-esteem and their confidence for a successful career performance. The change of the environment will create positive emotions and extra motivation for lifelong learning.

"The Student of a vocational school – a European specialist" is a mobility project within the Erasmus + programme, Key Action "Mobility of students and staff”, type of action "Mobility of students and staff in vocational education". It will begin on 01/06/2016 and end on 30/09/2017. The project comprises one mobility action in the field of  “Internships for students in foreign institutions of education / training". The applicant is Zespół Szkół im. Władysława Grabskiego in Lublin and the host organization is ADC College based in the UK. The total amount of funding is 90,354.00 EUR.The overall objective of the project is to complete a learning mobility, i.e. a 14-day practice in companies in the UK by 45 students who specialize in the following fields: business and administration – 10 students, retail – 10 students, IT – 15 students, advertising – 10 students.Objectives of the project:• Obtaining by the participants Europass Mobility certificates, certificates issued by the partner organisation of the project and improving academic performance in professional English language in the school year 2016/2017.• Increasing employment opportunities for the project participants and facilitating their entry into the labor market.• Increasing the degree of self-empowerment and self-esteem of the participants.• Achieving greater intercultural awareness and improving the knowledge of foreign languages• Increasing students’ motivation for learning vocational subjects and foreign languages.The project participants will be second and third class students of Zespół Szkół im. Władysława Grabskiego in Lublin.More than half of the students are from outside of Lublin (mainly from rural areas and small towns). Their parents are employed, self-employed or work on their own farms. A large part of the parents remain unemployed. A small number of the students’ families are dysfunctional and some adult students move out of the house and live independently.The participants of the project will be students selected according to established criteria, who are good at communicating in English, able to work in a group and have a good assessment of vocational subjects, English language and behavior.The project consists of three phases: preparation, learning mobility and activities after its completion. After the agreement with the strategic partner is signed, the recruitment of project participants will be carried out. The participants will have additional free classes of intercultural and language preparation. The following activities will take place during mobility: flights, accommodation in host families, classes organized by ADC College, apprenticeships, cultural program, conducting surveys summarizing the project, preparation of the final reports, preparation of  Individual Achievement Schemes and Europass Mobility certificates and their validation. After the completion of mobility the project will be assessed, and its evaluation carried out. During the evaluation the analysis of the documentation and surveys will be used and the discussions with participants and foreign partner will be held on the strengths and weaknesses of the project and future opportunities.The participants will be selected on the basis of average grades at the end of the school year 2015/2016 with vocational subjects (30% of the component), foreign language (50% of the component) and the assessment of the behavior (20% of the component). In the case of an equal number of points, the decisive factor is possessing certificates appropriate for a given profession. The list of participants will be created. The participants will be required to declare their willingness to participate in the project and they will have to submit the consent of the parents / guardians.Results:- 45 students’ practice in enterprises in the UK,- obtaining certificates Europass Mobility, Europass CV and certificates issued by the partner institution, - students obtain better results in learning in the school year 2016/2017- the increase of employment opportunities in the European labor markets- increasing participants’ degree of self-empowerment and self-esteem - achieving greater intercultural awareness and improvement of foreign languages- increasing motivation for learning vocational subjects and languages.The impact of the project on the school (ZS1):- knowledge of the professional environment, work organization and work culture in other countries,- improving the language skills of students and teachers,- promotion and support of intercultural dialogue, tolerance and understanding of diversity, prevention of prejudice, racism- acquiring the experience in organizing mobility (Erasmus +)The participants will acquire the experience and certificates that will help them in applying for jobs in the European Union and increase their competitiveness in the labor market. The implementation of ECVET supports mobility and learning throughout life.

Work Experience AbroadThis project was conceived in the beginning of 2016 with the main goal of continuting to provide students and recent graduates of our school the unique opportunity of work experience abroad. It is going to offer them knowledge and skills which it would be very difficult to obtain in the Czech Republic. The next goal is to activate their existing passive knowledge of English language and help them acquire specialized business terminology in English during real work experience. The overall goal is increasing participants' qualification and motivation for further studies and work. We also wish to help the participants to see the importance of living in Europe together with other nations, of European citizenship and of the importance of own uniqueness as well as the importance of respect for other cultures.There are going to be 18 students of the 3rd forms of our school participating in the project and the opportunity for joining is also going to be offered to our recent graduates. The project is divided into two cycles with work experience in spring/summer 2017 and spring/summer 2018. During the work experience the participants are going to be employed in London companies where they are going to participate at work and do their tasks and thus improve their knowledge and skills. These tasks are going to be recorded in Learning agreements, which are going to contain the goals of the work experience and which are going to be agreed on by all participating parties.A part of the project is a wide scale preparation of the participants before the work experience itself which is going to take place both in the Czech Republic and in London. The preparation is going to include vocational-language and culture courses and it is going to try to help the participants of the work experience in the beginning and during their stay abroad. The project is going to be implemented by our school, i.e. Masarykova obchodni akademie, Jicin, and by ADC college in London. It is going to be divided into two cycles with each consisting of several logic steps which are going to be performed by one or both of the participating organizations. The cooperation of these is going to be outlined in Memorandum of understanding where the roles and responsibilities of both partners are going to be specified.Expected results of the project are mainly increased vocational and language knowledge and skills of the participants as well as their increased self-confidence and motivation for further studies and work. We also hope that this experience will help them in the future when looking for a job. Another result is going to be a substantial enrichment of the educational program offered by our school by including this work experience abroad. We believe this project is going to motivate also those students who are not going to take place in it thanks to discussions with participants which are going to be held after their return from London. This, we hope, will be also visible in our region thanks to articles in local newspapers, on our website and during meetings with future applicants for studying at our school.  And one of the goals of this project is also to improve the quality of provided work experience, both in the vocational and language fields and in the field of culture.
Internacionalización, Innovación, Empleo y FP en Europa

The difficult situation of the labor market in Spain, where youth unemployment exceeds 50% , makes it difficult for young people to find their first job. Mobility projects facilitate and expand the expectations of accessing the labor market , both national and European , of students who are finishing their training and recent graduates .The IIEFPE project has been created in answer to the needs for schools to provide their students the opportunity to expand and improve the quality of their training by performing practices in European companies to get in touch with the European labor Market . The close collaboration of the schools in the consortium  has facilitated the development of this project in response to demand from schools.Moreover, the schools  need to establish long-term networks of knowledge that allow them to get in touch with: companies, schools , social partners and local authorities. This will allow them to get in touch with innovation , sharing best practices and knowledge of European policies , improving the quality of their teaching and combating youth unemployment. The consortium is made up of 8 institutes of the Valencian region coordinated by one of them IESSVThe projectt is designed for 72 students or recent graduates in VET in the of "Administration" (Administrative Management ) and " Computer and Communications " ( microcomputer Systems and Networks ). It will run from 01 of june 2016 to 31 of may 1017 to allow, in the case of students, to integrate the mobility into their training as a part of the subject (FCT) . The motilities will be held in  UK, IT,LV and PT.The main objective of IIEFPE is that participants develop through training practices in European companies, skills and abilities to complete, in a practical way, the skills acquired in VET for being efficiently incorporated in the European labor market. They need to develop specific skills and techniques on the subject that they have studied but they need to develop other key skills such as cultural, linguistic, entrepreneurship and individual initiative, ability to work in teams and knowledge of other working environments to facilitate their insertion in the European labor market, like self-employed or employed.The main activities carried out by the project partners are:-Preparation mobility that includes: selection of participants, initial assessment of their skills , previous training participants , logistical and contractual issues, coordination ...-Mobility. Working on enterprises and making cultural activities.-Evaluation of the participants. The skills acquired during the period shall be certified using  ECVET and defined from an initial evaluation. The activities within the company will aim to achieve these skills and will be adapted for each of them.-Monitoring. A tracing of the evolution participants will be will be made by the means established in the project.-Evaluation of the project activities.-Dissemination. The dissemination activities are planned throughout the entire project. A final dissemination conference for showing the results of the projectBesides the impact on the participants, the project will affect the partners promoting European cooperation and rapprochement between enterprises and schools.Dissemination activities and mobility itself will create an impact at the local, regional and national levels. Although they are not involved in the project, other entities at the local, regional and national levels will benefit from the project results:- Improving the skills and competitiveness of  the young students that will be adapted to the digital age and a global economy based on knowledge. -Improving youth employment rates promoting sustainable growth-To establish contacts with other European institutions to share best practices-To develop projects of European cooperation-Improving the quality of education provided in schools-To facilitate the incorporation of the enterprises to the network for receiving foreign students-To improve the use of the models of certification. ECVET and Europass-To facilitate the incorporation of women into the labor market.-To Encourage social inclusion, equity and equality.The project is directly linked with the 2020 strategy and strategic priorities agrees to help the EU and its Member States to generate higher levels of employment, productivity and social cohesion

The "Być jak Hilton" (Be like Hilton) project is dedicated to 3 grade students of technical vocational  secondary school to give equal chances to young people from the local environment. The main aim of the project is broadening the knowledge of foreign languages and raising awareness of using job related vocabulary both in English and German. Moreover, it emphasises acquiring practical skills in the housekeeping and hotel gastronomy fields of hotel industry. The subject of the programme is to obtain a student who will become a competitive and efficient hotel employee featuring high level in foreign language use. Manners, excellence and professionalism in the customer service will be the key competences of a Polish hotelier who is open to the surrounding world and international contacts.30 students of the third grade of the technical vocatonal secondary school of hotel management will take part in the four-week work experience. These are the students living in less favourable communities, often in neighbouring villages, who rarely visited the abroad parts of their own country. The students chosen to participate in the project must show tolerance to other people, and feature willingness to learn and work hard to achieve success and they also must be keen on broadening their horizons. The participants of the "Być jak Hilton" project will work on the school programme of work experience in the United Kingdom.For the first two weeks they will work in housekeeping, and the next two they will spend in hotel gastronomy (kitchen and restaurant). Thanks to this division of labour the participant apart from practical abilities will acquire and practice vocation vocabulary in the above mentioned fields of work.The participants will be monitored and assessed for their progress by the Polish tutors and ADC College employees, who will use especially designed progress-check cards which will feature all the key competences the students  must learn during the programme. The students will get 0-5 grades for completing particular elements of the work experience programme and their attitude towards their work and co-workers. The students will also be responsible for keeping track of their work experience by writing short daily reports.The final effect of this four-week programme in the United Kingdom will be a self-aware professional students who is not afraid of the future work requirements also in an international work environment. Another benefit of participating in the project is acquiring richer vocational vocabulary and fluency in every day life situations, not only at work. Acquired abilities the students will use in the future work.Thanks to organising work experience in the United Kingdom, the school will get experience in obtaining professional contacts with institutions supporting foreign students  exchanges. The accompanying Polish tutors will get new knowledge and experience which they will share practically with their students in the classroom environment and the fellow teachers in their school and outside. The work experience programme will become the flag acticity for the school. Thanks to the project the interest in vocational professions connected with customer service and tourism will incease sharply.
Nejen čaj o páté - prakticky anglicky

This project is designed for pupils of the 3rd and 4th year at the Secondary Specialized School and Vocational School in  Jindřichuv Hradec studying branches: information technology, economics and business and cook/waiter. It is planned to enable participation of 28 pupils and 4 apprentices in this project in two 2-week flows altogether. Foreign practical training will allow participants to transform theoretical knowledge to practical skills, get acquainted with the environment of a foreign company that differs from Czech, and will allow them to compare the needs and desires of home and foreign clients companies.The content of the practical training will be the placement of candidates to various positions according to their field of study from service at the restaurant facilities, administrative activities in companies to work at computer companies, where they will improve their skills especially in network management and computers maintenance.This practical training will give participants practical work habits, increase their independence and strengthen their confidence, therefore it will contribute to their professional and personal development. Pupils will be motivated to apply knowledge and skills acquired in their study in real situations during their practical training. Participants will also improve their knowledge of English while communicating in the workplace as well as in host families.Pupils can verify their theoretical knowledge gained during classes in practice, where they also get familiar with the real business communication and behaviour. Participants verify their ability to communicate in a foreign language, defend their own arguments and proposals for solving problems in communicating with colleagues in the team during every day of the working week thanks to this internship.The school wants to try ECVET principles that could be applied to similar projects in the future. Methodology and ECVET evaluation system would subsequently be used in teaching technical subjects at school, including practice.With regard to the concept and focus of the whole project, the results will be mainly intangible. Foreign practical training will enable to develop professional and personal potential of participants and will move them to the current labour market requirements. Certificates (Europass mobility), which will be received by the participants and photo and video documentation from the practice training will be tangible outputs. The photo and video documentation along with articles will be published on the Internet and in local media.The school expects that students will be able to compare the work habits of the Czech Republic and Great Britain, and learn from both systems more effective habits. Organization of work in a foreign company can become an inspiration for their further personal and professional development.The pupils will have the chance to learn tolerance and openness to other cultures, autonomy and flexibility in dealing with those situations in the foreign environment. Project participants will get acquainted with the cultural aspects of the country, thus contributing to promoting openness to other cultures. From learning about other cultures they can also gain new knowledge that can help them in their future lives and careers. Participants will deepen their knowledge obtained while studying vocational subjects in the classroom and in practical training for a future career.Participants will learn tolerance, independence, flexibility and ability to make individual decisions. They will be motivated to further studying not only in language but also in their field of study.The project aims to improve the quality of the training of the participants, establish cooperation with partner organizations and last but not least, increase knowledge and skills of English.

Praktyka czyni mistrza (Practice makes perfect) project is addressed to the teachers and the students of Vocational High School (ZSZ) in Aleksandrow Lodzki. The project is going to be carried out within 20 months starting from 01/06/2016. The participants of the project are to take part in a two-week vocational trainning and a seven-day workshop in companies and institutions in London. The project is going to be realised in cooperation with ADC College with its seat in North London. The anticipated dates of mobilities are autumn 2016 and summer 2017. 50 students of ZSZ including IT technicians, economics and retail technicians, catering technicians and advertising technicians and 10 teachers of vocational education and trainning will take part in the project.The school's needs derived from the SWOT analysis led to formulating the following targets:- development of participants' language skills,- advancement in professional competence accordingly to each profession which will enable students to obtain better results in their vocational exams and strenghten their competitivness on the job market,- development of participants' interpersonal skills,- increase in multicultural awerness of students,- development of students' self esteem,- mastering teaching methods and tools as well as improving learning techniques,- increasing the school's recognition in the local environment,- emphasising the importance of vocational education.In order to gain the above mentioned aims, the following actions are going to be taken:- forming top-priority skills which students should master during the vocational training,- evaluating students' level of English on the basis of language competence tests,- organising additional English lesssons,- carrying out cultural and adapting workshops,- informing participants about the EU projects' certificates (eg. Europass, ECVET and Youthpass),- acknowledging students with a training programme, a mobility schedule and tools used for monitoring the students' performance during the training in London,- introduction meeting with the students' parents,- mobility in London,- preparing the report summarising the mobility,- passing the information about the completed project on to the local TV and website and the school website,- meeting with the local companies, institutions, authorities and presenting the skills the students acquired during the mobility as well as characteristics of working environment in London,- students meeting with peers and school's applicants in order to share the experience gained during the project,- participants meeting with other teachers employed in ZSZ and other schools from the region.The project's actions will be taken by partners 4-5 months before the beginning of the first mobility. The process connected with training placement will be based on individual needs of each participant, their language test results and covering letters.Participants will stay with English families, which will enable them to develope their interpersonal and language competences, as well as associate with British culture, customs and traditions. While looking for the participants' accommodation, ADC College will take into consideration the distance to the place of training. Cultural classes conducted by ZSZ teachers before the mobility will be complemented by adaptation classes organized by ADC College staff in London. In order to monitor the students' performance during the training, the ZSZ teachers accompanying students during the mobility will cooperate on daily basis with the students' mentors in their workplaces. Moreover, students will fill in the training documents online every day so that the vocational training teachers in Poland can also monitor their progress. Both ADC College and ZSZ staff will support all participants before and during the mobility.The participation in the project will promote vocational education in the region and improve the quality of the school's work. Future graduates will gain both excellent general and vocational education as well as skills required on the demanding European job market. Thanks to the project realisation the school will set an example of sharing good practice in the local environment.The ZSZ teachers involved in the project will get knowledge needed to upgrade the school vocational and training programme according to the latest, high-quality European standards. They will also gain skills and experience useful in applying for other projects supported by EU.
"Zagraniczne praktyki zawodowe atutem na rynku pracy"

The ZS Nr 3 in Warsaw (The Complex of Schools No. 3 in Warsaw – secondary technical and post-secondary Vocational Schools), having met the requirements and demand of the local and domestic needs and having taken care of the professional, intellectual and social development of our pupils, prepared the project entitled: “Foreign practical apprenticeship as a chief asset on the labor market”. The project relates to a four-week stay in London in order to let 20 students undergo the internship in the professions of the economy specialist and marketing specialist. The pupils will be accompanied by four teachers (two English language teachers and two vocational subjects teachers). London has been chosen for the venue of the apprenticeship as it  is the financial and banking sector hub of the world. Our pupils, who in the future are planning to work as  tax and financial advisors, accountants and entrepreneurs will be given an opportunity to get acquainted with the modern and contemporary methods of managing a business. Pupils who have chosen marketing field in which they would specialize will have a chance to transfer the good practices, which they will experience in the country where advertising companies have been operating for ages, onto the domestic Polish marketplace where the novice promotional-campaign firms have just begun to develop and operate on a large scale.  Despite the fact that our school is situated in Warsaw, a great number of students come from the poverty-stricken families, and so the apprenticeship will be the only opportunity for them to find themselves in the international environment in order to have contact with other cultures and with people from different backgrounds, having different concepts, visions and attitudes.  The primary goal of our project is the improvement of professional, linguistic, social and interpersonal skills of our students who would undergo the internship in a British company by developing the cooperation with the professionals representing other cultures, languages and work ethics. In the contemporary world in order to become competitive on the market, a candidate, apart from being a professional in his trade, must have a knowledge of a foreign language in the professional manner and become used to the cosmopolitan work environment. Undoubtedly, the practice which one acquires in London may give our students a chance to develop the aforementioned ideas, concepts and abilities.The participants will go through the project in the new social and cultural conditions under the watchful eye of the Polish supervisors and mentors from the ADC College. The students will get to know the particulars and details of the how a business, a firm, or any other form the private establishment is functional, operational and run in the UK. The students’ progress and achievements will be evaluated according to the gathered documentation in their portfolios, and so the participants will be credited with the Europass Mobility certificate. Pupils are given a chance to boost their own self-esteem and to discover new professional development paths. They may possibly take advantage of the newly-gained knowledge domestically or internationally.  Having returned to Poland, the students will take part in the dissemination of the project results at the conferences, debates and meetings. For many of them it also poses a great challenge and new experience that will allow them to believe in themselves and their own capabilities.Accomplishment of the apprenticeship will strengthen and bolster the students’ chances on the local domestic market, will make it possible for teachers to improve their qualifications at the same time, and will inevitably and positively reinforce the image of the school as the establishment which takes on new challenges in order to better the quality of education and in order to have an incentive to collaborate more closely with other schools, employers and local authorities.
Efficient Travels– Efektywne Podróże - tworzenie europejskich ścieżek kariery.

The project „Efficient Travels – Creating European Paths of Career” is addressed to the students and teaching staff at Zespół Szkół Technicznych i Licealnych in Czechowice-Dziedzice (Poland).
