Analyzing the needs of our school we have found  the necessity of increasing the knowledge of our students during vocational training in European educational institutions and training companies, where the most important idea is studying their innovative solutions and to expand our teachers’ competences dealing with the situation of contemporary job market and the expectations of enterpreneurs for future employees in the vocational field.The project will involve 72 students and 8 teaching staff members (mainly foreign language and vocational subjects teachers) in four mobilities to Ireland and Great Britain.The main aim of the project is to improve the quality of work of our school throughout the development of the competences of the participants of the project – both students and teachers, expanding the vocational knowledge, actively participate in the programme improvement processes, gaining and widening the experience of the working conditions in  European companies, finding out about innovative strategical solutions in the field of logistics, catering, hospitality and IT  and in the vocational education. Through  the project we would like to make our students more competitive in the labour market in their trade, they will increase their chances to find a job in various industries, they will understand the importance of  studying  and upgrading their skills lifelong. Extending the European dimension of the school through the project  is crucial too. Establishing the international cooperation with new partners, finding out about working conditions in the European companies  and their innovative approach in business in the field of logistics, catering, hospitality and IT, will be essential to share the knowledge in the local environment. It will allow to spread our activities across the communities of our town and its surroundings and attract high school students to our school. Another important objective is to increase the foreign language competence of the participants of the project, increase their self-esteem and become more competitive in the labour market.Other valid goal of the project is to broaden the cultural knowledge of the European countries both through the cultural workshops and the direct contact with Irish and British people. All the participants of the projects will get rid of the stereotypes about foreign people and will become more tolerant. They will also learn how to manage in difficult and stressful situations, during the travel, at host families or in the work place.The project is supposed to bring the following results:- improve the quality of school work throughout the development of the knowledge in the field of logistics, catering, hospitality and IT; -  strengthen the motivation to learn the vocational subjects due to the widening the opportunity of finding the job in the trade after finishing the school;- the vocational teachers will teach in more creative way due to better awareness of the demands and expectations of contemporary employers and the development of didactic and tutelary competences;- the knowledge of foreign languages, especially vocational ones, will be widened because the students will notice the importance and opportunity of using them in the future job; - the project participants will broaden the cultural knowledge of the European countries what will help them to become more tolerant toward multi-cultural Europe and get rid of the stereotypes about foreign people;- the European dimension of the school will expand,  the prestige of the school in the local community will increase and the knowledge of Erasmus+ projects will spread; - the prestige of the European institutions cooperating with our school will increase;- the idea of learning lifelong and constant upgrading skills will appear; - more our teachers will participate in Erasmus+ projects in the future;- other schools will start taking part in Erasmus+ projects modeled on our school. To sum up, the project „Efficient Travels – Creating European Paths of Career” carried in Zespół Szkół Technicznych i Licealnych in Czechowice-Dziedzice will bring many positive aspects for our school and our community and it will inspire other schools to start Erasmus+ projects.
Shape our Future - Ukształtuj swoją przyszłość

The project "Shape Our Future in Europe" is the venture steamed from our previous good experiences and results conected to mobilities of the young people abroad, in frames of Erasmus + (mobilities for vocational learning). The better results of A-levels   exams and  vocational - qualifying exams our students, which have taken part at practice periods in Germany , Ireland and United Kingdom  in last years, has motivated us to continue such a projects for the following groups. The most important aims of this project are: increase of competitivenes on the labour market, rise of professional competences, learning about operation in european institutions; increase of language skills, encourage the students to methodical learning and finishing school. The another aspect this projects focuses on interpersonal sphere the participiants. We`d like to  shape the good attitude to foreign culture, people and customs. We teach tolerance, self - esteem and confidence in contacts with another residents in European countries. Our 2-years project includes 60-persons group. The one half goes to Germany, the next 30 participiants are going to United Kingdom. These are the students of 3. class the upper secondary  school from profiles like: opencast mining, IT and economy. Every participiant has to attend the language - culture -, and pedagogical preparation before their travel. The participiants become all informations, that they need during mobilities, and the pocket - money.  The co-ordinators will help in any case, if needed. For every group will be appointed the mentor, which will take care for participiants during beeing abroad. With every group will go the carer from Zespół Szkół w Strzegomiu. He will supervise the practice and help the students. During practice-periods every student works on special position and will fill dutes, which will be simmilar to his jobs position in the future. Our previous projects have proved, that such a activities have got a lot of good and long-term results. The projects participiants are the young people with the wide world view. They feal confident in some international society, have good language skills, they know and understand the foreign culture, traditions and customs. They know the duties connected with their job, have competences, which are impossible to achive in the practice period in Poland. The participiants get the Europass Mobility and Europass CV, what is the next advantege in the labour market. It is already proved, that the local bussinesmen and potenctial employers offer the job to our students, even before they finish our school. But first at all, they look for these, who had attendet the practice - periods in the foreign countries  and finished it with good marks. We are certain, that this project, which is realized with biggest care, and is very precisely considered and better adapted to the needs of our students and institution, can bring even more good results, and let us  shape the future ours graduates in present-days Europe.
Staże zawodowe uczniów ZSTZ Radzymin w krajach Unii Europejskiej

+The Project „ Placements of students from Technical Vocational School in Radzymin in the European Union countries” anticipates trips of 3 groups of year three students.Group A – the students who study to be catering and nutrition technicians (15 people) and waiters (5 people). 20 people altogether. In group A there are students of 2 professions because the programme provided for this placement includes the same issues. They will go for placements at restaurants, hotels and cafés in Italy.Group B – the students who study to be computer specialists (16 people). This group will go for placements at computer companies in the UK.Group C – the students who study to be landscape architecture technicians (10 people). Group C will go for placements at horticultural companies in Ireland.(The companies addresses for all groups are in the attachment to this form).The total number of participants is 46. 2 attendants will go with group A and B. 1 attendant – with group C.Methodology used during the project includes: demonstrations, lectures, analyses, presentations, observations.The project responds to the educational needs of the country connected with increasing the level of efficiency of vocational training, acquiring new qualifications and work experience to adapt to the requirements of the labour market in Poland and Europe. It also helps to develop the knowledge of foreign languages, especially work related language.The project responds to the regional needs. Firstly, Warsaw and its surroundings are the places popular among tourists. After the organization of sporting and cultural events of European and world interest, the number of foreign tourists in Warsaw has increased. This contributed to the development of catering sector in Masovia. The demand for qualified, experienced, foreign language speaking catering and customer service employees is increasing. The placement of catering students and waiters fits perfectly here. (Group A). Secondly, information technologies are constantly developing. The needs for computer services, creating websites or databases are still growing. The demand for such services is still high. (Group B). Thirdly, there is the need to use the space around houses and housing estates in Masovia resulting from the constantly growing number of houses, housing estates and other buildings, especially in Wołomin county, where Radzymin is located. The placement of landscape architecture students  in Ireland responds to these needs. (Group C).Aims:-gaining by the participants of the project profesional skills supported by the Europass certificate, this results in wider opportunity for them to find a job in the local as well as European labour market.-using and dveloping English and Italian language skills-creating opportunity to travel abroad for underprivileged students: those who come from rural areas and whose families are at risk of unemployment, the project may help them gain more self-confidence as well as essential profesional skills.-sensitizing the participants to cultural diversity of Europe and increasing tolerance for other cultures.-increasing atractiveness of vocational education in our school.-development of IT competence especially group BExpected Results:-46 students with professional skills and experience gained abroad and confirmed by Europass certificate.-Participants will be entitled to add information about their new experience gained abroad in their CV.-46 students with higher professional language skills: 26 English, 20 Italian language. Familiarisation with labour market in Italy, England and Ireland as well as functioning of  firms, companies and restaurants in the areas of gardening, IT, gastronomy and catering.-Growth of self-esteem, improvement of communication and organizational skills, greater opennes of the participants on  cultural diversity of Europe.-Increase in number of candidates applying for our school as a result of increasing atractiveness of the vocational education.-Exchange of  skills and experience between our school and organizations and companies which will host our apprentices.After completing the project we expect them to find job in the professions they were trained for. We believe thus that it will prevent them  from joining the group of unemployed. Another hope we have is that they will use English language fluently at their work and they will not be afraid to look for a job abroad.   Another essential profit  is a distinct increase in number of candidates applying for our school as well as tightening and development of cooperation with our partners  in connection with another upcoming projects.Influence of the project:The project will have a meaningful effect on school society who will have opportunity to watch the presentation and talk to the participants of the internship abroad. It will also affect the town of Radzymin, Wolomin district, parents of the participants, employers, junior high school students.

Meeting the needs of its students, the Secondary Schools Complex in Malbork No 3 prepares the youth to find their own  place in demanding job market of these days. Creating friendly atmosphere, the school enables the  students to achieve a wide range of professions such as hotel management technician, tourism service technician,  logistics technician, information technology technician.While teaching the school devotes attention to cultivating proper attitudes of its students. For years the school has been a leader among vocational schools that meets the needs of local job market. Successes of students who succeeded in plentiful vocational competitions as well as high results of the final exams, which are much better than local and national results, prove the fact of the quality of the school. Close cooperation with  the colleges educating in similar occupations, organizing visits promoting the culture of professions and meetings with successful businesspeople undoubtedly  help our students  look forward to the future.“European experience – a better start” is a project which the Secondary Schools Complex in Malbork No 3 is going to elaborate together with the foreign business partners ADC College from London, Casa da Educacao from Lisbon and VFBQ Association from Bad Freienwalde near Berlin. The aim of the project is to use and develop the professional skills altogether with Information Technology, as well as social,  personal and language skills. This way the trainees will be enabled to  gain work experience, professional awareness by finding out about opportunities and perspectives of the chosen occupation and it may enhance their chances to get desired professional skills. To show comprehensive approach in January 2017 the Secondary School Complex no 3 in cooperation with Casa da Educacao has planned to organize one-week  workshops with job shadowing lessons for the teachers educating the youth in the main professions such as: Hotel Industry, catering, and logistics. The  project  presents the idea of four- week professional apprenticeship, prepared from 17 September to 14 October 2017, for the group of forty-five students from the third technical classes in the occupations of: hotel management, tourism service,  logistics, information technology technicians. There are also three attendant teachers who take care of the participating students.The school is responsible for recruitment and preparing the participants of the project to departure. The students are to take part in series of classes which are especially arranged to equip them with the appropriate  knowledge about culture, character of professions and other useful  information. The participants will take language tests to check their language skills.The participants of the workshops for teachers will take part in an intensive course on culture of Portugal.The transit from Malbork to the destination places is ensured. The foreign Partners in the cooperation with our school will organize accommodation at host families, with full board. Appropriate places of apprenticeship will be also chosen accordingly to the aims of the project and all local transfers will be provided. Additionally, all the participants will be insured.The quality and progressing will be observed by the Partners, attending teachers and the school. Planned accomplishment of the apprenticeship will be inspected by checking notes in the apprenticeship journals and on visits. The journals and a detailed plan will be prepared before the beginning.  The supervisors  will be responsible for marking the students’ apprenticeship time. The mark is an  integrated part of the journal and it will be the primary and essential part to complete the training.Taking part in such project will influence personal development of the participants, increase their independence, responsibility and resourcefulness, it will increase their self-confidence and self – esteem  as well as improve their self- assessment. All the partners in agreement  with the employers will deliver a special document certifying completing the apprenticeship. Achieved competences will  be confirmed with Europass Mobility document. By  participating in the project the school will increase the attractiveness of vocational educating program and will improve its quality. The school will be regarded as modern and pro-European one. That will be the chance to indicate young people where new development’s  and work’ s  perspectives  after completing the school are.The position of school in the local environment  as well as regarding  the school by the local society will also benefit.  By completing the project the school will develop even closer relationship with the press, administration units, students’  parents, local businesspeople and will share its experience with other schools with similar educating profiles.
Współpraca międzynarodowa w zakresie organizacji staży zawodowych dla uczniów technikum

The changing European reality creates an urgent need to prepare young people for the difficult role of being an active participant in modern market economy. Zespół Szkół Nr 10 im. Stanisława Staszica in Warsaw is taking action leading to improve the quality and enhance the usefulness of qualifications and skills of students by organizing international apprenticeships available in the ERASMUS + program. The priority of our project is good preparation of graduates for their role as modern market participants with the knowledge of foreign languages, open to other cultures and equipped with needed professional qualifications adapted to the ever increasing requirements of employers. Improvement of the mobility of students based on international cooperation is part of the European School Development Plan.In our mobility project, which is part of the "Erasmus +", international work placements are organized for students trained to be economists, freight forwarders and IT professionals.10 economists, are to have a 3-week internship in Berlin, the European centre of business.The dates are: 05/03/2018 - 03/23/2018. The internship will be organized in collaboration with BERLINK ETN GmbH company.The training program, agreed with the German poject partner, includes the following modules: practical improvement of the German language, getting to know with how the company operates in an internal and external environment, commercial documentation, personnel policy, accounting with the use of accounting and financial programs and marketing activity of the company in the market economy. Berlin is an ideal place for vocational training for economists as it occupies a special place on the economic map of Germany and is a major centre for financial services and trade in the country and in Europe.The company responsible for organizing the internship for freight forwarders is another German partner - Das Team des EUROPA-DIREKT e.V. from Dresden.Agreed dates registered are:Group I - 03.06.2017 - 03.31.2017Group II - 03.05.2018 - 03.30.2018EUROPA -DIREKT works with companies in the field of freight forwarding and logistics including Deutsche Post, DHL, DACHSER, the logistics centre Volkswagen - Zentrum Dresden and the Media-Logistik GmbH company, which allows for effective implementation of the program of apprenticeships for freight forwarders.ADC College, based in London, will hold 4-week work placements for IT specialists in London's IT businesses in the following dates:Group I - 27.02.2017 - 24.03.2017Group II - 26.02.2018 - 23.03.2018The multiculturalism of London will contribute to the shaping of attitudes of openness, understanding and tolerance. These are very important features, useful both in life and in work, in the era of globalization of the European economy.The cooperation between Zespół Szkół Nr 10 im. Stanisława Staszica and ADC College has been one of the lasting results of previous projects implemented jointly under the Leonardo da Vinci and Erasmus + programs.Partners will make every effort to ensure that the project objectives are realized with the highest quality.The main objectives of the project are:- Improving the quality and attractiveness of vocational education;- Expansion of international cooperation in the implementation of best forms of internship; - Acquiring practical professional skills on European level;- The improvement of social and organizational skills;- Use of the latest information and communication technologies in the educational process;- Improving the professional command of foreign languages: German and English;- Increasing the mobility of students and their teachers;- Development of tolerance towards cultural, ethnic and religious diversity;- Increasing employment opportunities on the European labor market.Before leaving for an internship, the participants in the project can count on the linguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation. Each intern, after the successful completion of the internship, will receive a certificate from the foreign partner of the project and the Europass Mobility document in both Polish and English, which significantly helps to find a satisfying job, not only in Poland but also on the European labor market. Another attractive feature of the participants' future resumes will be the references from companies in which the students will work. The basis for completing the internship will be the students' evaluation obtained on the clearly determined criteria based on the European Credit Transfer System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET). This system will be part of promoting future graduates of our school with the use of the effects of learning abroad for further education and professional development.
Europejskie staże drogą do sukcesu zawodowego

„European professional practice way to career success”. The project aims is to improve the social and professional competences and efficiency of learning process through implementation actions of measures aimed at improving the ability of students for future employment. The project is aimed at students who are learning at Zespół Szkół Odzieżowych (Clotching School) designing (6 people), hairdressing (6 people) and  information technology and graphic design (4 people).The proposed actions in the project are the result of the analysis of the needs of the school, students and the labor market. The main action are professional practices in a partner of UK which will take place in hair salons, tailoring company and information technology and graphic design company.In the context of ongoing professional practice students will become familiar with the new technologies used in companies and the organization of work. Students will have the chance to work in the actual conditions of the labor market. What is more, through everyday contact students will be able to break down the linguistic and cultural barriers what in the future help them to get work in Europe.The foreign students’  practice allow acquire them valuable experience. This will motivate them to learn the profession and foreign language. Realization of professional practice provide also feedback to school staff whether the school educates modern and according to the needs of the modern European labor market.Before the professional practice students will be prepared in communication in the field of  linguistic . Students will have meetings on the  preparation of the cultural , meetings with their parents, teaching staff and project participants.The project will be promoted at school newspaper, school website, facebook and school celebrations. All the actions will be monitored and analyzed in order to achieve high results which will affect positively on the  level of school work.

The participants of the project entitled: "Kashubian Cuisine open to Europe" will be the third-year students of  technical college  technician in food and catering services (15 people) of the District School No. 1 in Kościerzyna. They will take four-week work experience in different institutions of catering industry in Harrow and London, in the UK. The project also provides weekly mobility of teaching staff in catering vocational training (6 people).The main objective of the project is to increase, through participation in a foreign internship,  mobility of people who are at the stage of initial vocational training ( students of technical college) and the experience exchange in the field of vocational training. Professional training in  institutions identified by the project partner will enable participants to acquire the practical skills needed in the profession, getting familiar with British catering standards. Participation in the project will also facilitate the introduction of customer service techniques, methods of preparing the hall, with the preparation of dishes-made on the basis of the various components, based on the tradition of British cuisine. Thanks to participation in the project students will improve their professional skills in organizing the catering business, entrepreneurship, creativity, ability to communicate in a foreign language and the ability to work in an international team. Teachers will increase their competence in the field of transfer of European standards in vocational training to the local ground. All participants will also expand the knowledge of British culture. At the end of the internship the students will receive the Europass Mobility, an assessment of the internship issued by the employers, and all participants will receive a certificate of participation in mobility exhibited by the ADC College.
EUROPEJSKIE DOŚWIADCZENIE ZAWODOWE INSPIRACJĄ DO AKTYWNOŚCI NA RYNKU PRACY

"European Vocational Experience as Inspiration of Activity on Job Market Project" will be realized within 2 years with participation of 88 students and 10 staff members of ZSSChiO.Students of nutrition and gastronomy, hotel trade industry, waiting service, hairdressing as well as vocational school (hairdresser and cook) will take part in 2 and 4-week working practice/professional training in England, Germany and Italy.Members of school staff (head teacher, practical education manager) teachers of gastronomical  services, and school job advisor will also participate, going to Germany and Italy within one-week job-shadowing scheme. The main goal of the project is increasing participants mobility, improving their professional, language, social, personal skills as well as their chance for employment on local and European job market.During practice the students will find out about organization and conditions of working abroad and after their return they will use their observations and experiences in their future careers. The additional advantage is acquiring some extra-curricular skills (carving, bartending, nail and hairstyling, opportunity to gain funds for starting their own businesses in Poland and countries of practice). Beneficiaries will master language skills with focus on professional vocabulary, will find out about culture, eating habits and cuisine of England, Italy and Germany.Their stay will allow for development of social and interpersonal skills, and create an open attitude and intercultural sensitivity as well as adaptation abilities during work and stay abroad. The participants will be mostly students who have never been or worked abroad.The project assumes realization of ECVET system, activities planned with partners determine heading towards coordination between EU countries within accepting competences of European Achievement Transfer System in Vocational Training and Education. Future beneficiaries will take part in preparation program (language, vocational classes at school and at work, culture, enterprising classes, new internet technology classes). 2 and 4-week practices and training will take place in Rimini (Sistema Turismo), Lipsk (Vitalis GmbH), Dresden (SBG Dresden) and in London, (ADC College). Workplaces and types of working stations will be adjusted to the program of practice and participants’ needs. During the traineeship the students will learn a foreign language intensely and will enhance their vocational skills. The students will be participating in cultural events, parties, going on trips, organized by both the partners and the teachers from Poland taking care of them. The project participants will share experiences and get to know new people. After their return to Poland, they will prepare suitable materials to share their experiences and feelings with the school community and the school partners. They will make use of their people experiences to promote and disseminate the project.The participation in the project will improve the motivation to learn not only among the project participants but also among other students in ZSSCHiO .The knowledge acquired both in Poland (preparatory training) and abroad (the traineeship) as well as experience and evaluation of the project will be valuable during the participation in competitions in their fields of study and student’s further education. The significant growth of language and vocational skills will improve the students’ school-leaving exam results, enhance their employment opportunities and encourage them to invest in personal development. The participants will receive Europass certificates and other certificates confirming the completion of the traineeship, which will give the school the European character. The participation of some teachers in job-shadowing will result in the enhancement of the language and vocational skills.They will have an opportunity to know the methods of teaching vocational subjects and profession commonly used abroad, find out how the traineeships are organized and how the students’ professional development is planned in the receiving country. As a result, the teachers will implement good solutions in ZSSCHiO and in the region.The experience gained by the teaching staff will contribute to increased competences, higher quality of education in ZSSCHiO and better cooperation with the employers and partners. It will also help plan similar activities in the future.The project will contribute to the improvement of  the image of ZSSCHiO  and its care about the students’ vocational education. It will increase the attractiveness of the educational offer in ZSSCHiO. The implementation of the project will have a positive influence not only on its beneficiaries but it also will raise the standard of educational services at European level in the region.

The name of the project is "Practice make perfect" and it will be conducted by Zespół Szkół Ekonomiczno-Handlowych im. Komisji Edukacji Narodowej in Żnin. This school is a little but well recognized secondary vocational school in a powiat town. Most of our students have to commute to school from little towns and villages. Many of them face financial problems as well as with getting to school by public transport. In spite of those they are very active not only at school but also in working for charity. They cooperate eagerly with other students and the teachers. A great example of their work is - voluteers helping the disabled children, annual christmas charity foundrising event "Pomóż biedniejszym od siebie" or counting an annual tax rate for citizens.Taking part in this mobility is the only chance to work in multicultural environment and to develop their proffesional skills. The aim of the project is to improve  the standards and quality of vocational education and to support the proffesional development of our students. We would like to, thanks to gained by students experience, to make them more attractive as future employees on local and European job market. We would like to focus on three areas:- preparation: merithorical and language preparation, questionaires defining the needs and expectations of participants and finding the group of students who will participate in the project;- project running: students work in various companies cooperating with ADC College, mentor's support and monitoring;- evaluation and follow up: while running the project the questionaires to evaluate the project, presenting the results of the proejct on the school website, local newspapers, radio and sharing the good practices with other beneficiaries of Erasmus + programme.The main way of work to our students will be learing by doing which is expected to lead to the improvements of formal school learning. We are going to us European tools such as: Europass-CV, Europass-Mobility and ECVET.The participation in the project is to our students the only chance to find a good job and make them attractive on local and European labour market.
Europejskie praktyki zawodowe- szansa na rozwój osobisty i podniesienie umiejętności naszych uczniów.

European vocational traineeship- a chance for self-development and increasing skills of our students.The project offers the increase of employment chances and the development of careers of our graduates on the local and regional market. It is aimed at enhancing the sense of initiative and enterprise among the youth, enhancing their self-confidence and independence as well as improving their language skills. The project is also an opportunity for increasing their multicultural awareness and gives them equal opportunity. It familiarises them with the job market and allows them to gain abilities and commonly accepted certificates.Two organisations are included in the project- ADC College from Great Britain (a professional development and language tuition organisation which has long experience of successfully developing and executing international mobility programmes in partnership with educational institutions from all across Europe. It was awarded the mark of ‘Best Practice’ by the German and Polish national agencies) and from Poland- Zespół Szkół nr 1, Szczecinek (Vocational and General Studies Schools Complex no. 1 in Szczecinek).Recipients' group. This is a group consisting of 24 students from three forms of technical college specializing in economics, computer science and advertising, and two teachers. Our students will be divided into two groups. Each group will go to London and serve vocational training in local companies depending on their specialisation.Thanks to this project, our school will increase its ability to take action on European level. We will gain valuable experience and appeal. Moreover, we will strengthen cooperation with foreign partners.

The objectives of ‘The importance of experience 2’ project are consistent with the goals of Erasmus+, namely:- supporting students in gathering competences (knowledge, skills and attitudes) in order to broaden their possibilities of personal development and increasing the opportunities of employment on the European labour market,- increasing the knowledge of English language among students,- increasing the level of knowledge and acquaintance with cultures of other countries, activating participation in social and professional life,- increasing the attractiveness of youth education, creating activities and programmes which meet labour’s market needs, it will mean innovative teaching of better quality.The project assumes students apprenticeships trip to hotels, restaurants and travel agencies  in the UK and Spain. There will be two groups of 10 students taken from 2nd and 3rd classes from the following profiles of study: nutrition and catering service technician, waiter service technician, hospitality services and tourism services profiles. The implementation of the apprenticeships, in reputed hotel, catering and tourism facilities of the British capital as well as in Salamance, Spain, will enrich and enhance the attractiveness of the vocational education process. That will significantly increase the mobility and competence of our graduates as well in Szczecin as on the regional and European labour market. Our region is open for business. What is more, the wide range of English-speaking companies and the proximity of the coastal towns offers a wide range of jobs in catering, tourism and hospitality. The biggest problem of our graduates is the language barrier. The implementation of the apprenticeship at foreign employers will enable our graduates to start work on the European market under the same conditions and with the skills that EU countries graduates. The vocational training in the United Kingdom and in Spain is not only a great adventure for young people, but also an event that will bring tangible results in the future. Furthermore, the Europass as well as Mobility and EC VET documents will confirm their skills and foreign training in English language to the future employers what will significantly raise their value as skilled workers on the domestic and foreign labour market. Such social and professional experience will influence all students’ future life.Duration of the project is planned for a period of 18 months which is from the 1-st June 2016 to 30-th November 2017:in July 2017 - a trip the two groups of beneficiaries (10 students taken from 2nd  and 3rd classes of nutrition and catering service technician, waiter service technician,  hospitality services and tourist services profiles).The project participants act in accordance with with the following requirements:- get know the reality of work in European conditions, including using a technologically developed equipment and modern software used in the hospitality and tourism,- improving the professional competence of catering, hospitality and tourism,- developing language skills mainly in the field of vocational English,- broadening culture knowledge.Implementation of the project will bring long-term benefits both for the students and for the school:- improving the quality of both vocational and language training,- increase the competitiveness of our school on the educational market,- broadening opportunities of international vocational training,- easier career start for students who graduated.For the city and the commune:- increasing the attractiveness of vocational education in the area,- excellent region promotion,- gaining the skilled, qualified employees, which will result in increasing the quality of services in the catering, hotel and tourism  industry.The expected results of the project:- acquiring the useful skills and work experience in the catering, hospitality and tourism,- learning new technologies that are not available during the school learning and in the national employers,- more efficient customer service of the hotel, tourist agency and restaurants according to the European standards,- improvement of communication in English and vocational English language,- enhancement of students’ learning motivation.Expected outcomes of the project:- to obtain the work experience and professional competence at work in catering, hospitality and tourism in England and Spain.
European road  to a dream profession

The project entitled „European road to a dream profession,” bringing to fruition by Zespół Szkół no. 3 in  Wadowice, lasts 12 months and assumes arranged mobility:1) in Budapest, in collaboration with 2 hosting organisations -  for 20 vocational students who are being educated in the profession of advertising management technicians -  14 days 2) in London, in collaboration with ADC College- for 16 vocational students who are being educated in the professions: 8 students of hospitality management technicians, 8 students of trading technicians- 14 days   The main objectives of the project are to develop innovative and high quality vocational learning tools, as well as to  improve professional skills and competencies in accordance to students’ future professions. 36 students from our school will stand the chance to improve communication in English and socio-cultural behavioural skills. Taking this opportunity will provide them with required adaptation in an international environment for work and life. The project responds to the training need of students in the target group, gaining work experience, qualifying, developing the trade language, and improving learners’ position on the labour market. Apprentices will undertake traineeships abroad and work on different positions in hotel trade companies, advertising trade companies, and trade industries in the English-speaking environment.Gained skills will increase the employability of graduates on Polish as well as on the European labour market, acquired knowledge will help in taking up students’ first works, setting up and managing their own businesses. Students will be able to exploit technology effectively by critical and confident use of digital competence in the trade business as well as by the usage of new computer programs that are essential in advertising and in hotel services. Language and civic competencies will facilitate future business cooperation and contacts with European specialists, sales representatives and customers. Students’ high self- esteem and the awareness of possessing European experience will bring long-term effects.The acquisition of new, innovative and practical knowledge, as well as work-related skills, that will improve employability of our school graduates on the labour market, is the awaited result of the project. The improvement of the foreign language competence in the field of the hotel trade, advertising and trading, especially vocational vocabulary and its practical usage, will benefit students’ working life. Participants will receive Europass Mobility and ECVET certificates confirming knowledge and accomplishments gained during the project.
Młodzi konkurencyjni i mobilni na krajowym i europejskim rynku pracy

The aim of the project 'Młodzi konkurencyjni i mobilni na krajowym i europejskim rynku pracy' prepared by Zespol Szkol im. ks. J. Tischnera in Dobczyce near Cracow in Poland is to acquire by the participants additional occupational competence by developing their knowledge and skills in IT, electronics and catering and use them in practice in a real work environment. They will find out about modern, innovative technologies and develop their language competence using English in communication. Three groups of students from IT, electronics (one group - 25 students) and catering (two groups - 20 and 23 students) from Zespol Szkol im. ks. Jozefa Tischnera in Dobczyce  will be sent for a four-week apprenticeship in companies to London organized by ADC College. IT and electronics students will have apprenticeship in the following companies: Brightbox Marketing, Chiswick Computer, Computer Aid International, Covent Garden Dragon Hall Trust, Finchley Computer Center, hitech Computer Repairs, KF Computers and Imaging. Catering students in Cafe Rive Gauche, Cleveland Hotel, Crowne Plaza London the City, Holiday Inn Bloomsbury, InterContinental London Park Lane, Marriot Hotel Maida Vale, Renaissance Hotel Heathrow, Travelodge Tower Bridge. The apprenticeship will be held from 14.11.2016 to 09.12.2016. Sixty eight students at the age of 17-18 and six teachers will take part in the project. Participation in the project increases occupational and language competence of the students and their chances on a job market. They will also develop social and individual skills, it wil enhance their self-esteem, confidence, responsibility, ability to work in a team. The acquired skills will be confirmed by Europass Mobility and ECVET. The European added value connected with realization of apprenticeship abroad involves a possibility to get to know technologies and work methods that the students cannot observe in their own country. They will find out about organization and discipline in a workplace abroad, will establish occupational contacts, improve their language competence and learn English jargon connected with their occupation. International job experience will enrich their CV and will hep them to adapt to wider - domestic and european - job market. It will also increase their sense of European Union membership and will create conditions for their personal development during meeting an international challenge. The apprenticeship abroad is a valuable experience which will enable them to become fully independent, self-confident, open and competitive, on the contemporary job market, individuals. The students come from Dobczyce or nearby rural areas with the high unemployment rate. The project intends to increase knowledge and to develop skills in reference to the needs of a job market, promotes vocational training in the real job environment which will result in greater attractiveness of participants among employers and will increase their employability. Moreover, the project is connected with the school needs stated in the School European Development Plan and quality plan. Our school is planning to develop contacts and cooperation with partner organisations from other European Union countries which will lead to internationalisation of vocational training and exchange of experiences and good practices with partner organisations. In the long term it will improve not only the quality of vocational training but also foreign languages competence and knowledge of cultures and culture differences in European Union countries. Participation in the mobility will motivate students to learn and extend their knowledge. What is more, the project will foster to adjust vocational training to the needs of local, regional and national job markets as well as will enhance the region development by providing vocational training in trades where there are shortages.
Zagraniczna praktyka szansą na rozwój osobisty i zawodowy

The project "Zagraniczna praktyka szansą na rozwój osobisty i zawodowy" is  prepared by Centrum Kształcenia Ustawicznego im. Jana Matejki in Cracow in Poland with the aim to increase occupational competence of the participants from IT and administration in the real working environment in the companies in London. The participants will also develope their language competence, especially in using occupational language, will acquire new experience and business contacts during their work in an international team in a company, which organization and functioning differs from that in Poland. The project will help the participants to prepare to their future job and will increase their chances for finding work. The participants will receive Europass Mobility and ECVET documents. Taking part in the project will also foster personal development of students, building their entrepreneurial skills in a professional environment, competitiveness, independence, openess and ability to deal with problems in a different environment. It will also facilitate to establish the sense of belonging to wider, economically and culturally diverse community - European Union. The IT students will attend apprenticeship in the following companies in Lodon: Brightbox Marketing, Chiswick Computer, Click Communications Ventures, Computer Aid International, Covent Garden Dragon Hall Trust, Egress Software Technologies, Finchley Computer Center, Hitech Computer Repairs, IT Fix, KF Computers and Imaging, the administration students in: A2Z Accessories, Citydeal estates, Ascend, CCLS English school, Insurance claim accommodation, Leyton library, Light project International, Quintex, Sense advertising marketing, Travel Matters. The apprenticeship will be held from 06.03.2017 to 17.03.2017 and organized by ADC College from London. The participants will be 20 students from second term of IT Technical College and second and third term of Administration College and two teachers. They will also develop social and individual skills,will enhance their self-esteem, confidence, responsibility, ability to work in a team. The sending institution will make new partnership with ADC College which will be used to future mobility projects or partnership projects. Promotion of the results of the project will ehance motivation of students and teachers to develop their language competence and extend their knowledge of other European Union countries, will increase the quality of work in the institution and its cometitiveness in the local community - the district, the city and the whole region. Participation in the project will contribute to development of understanding intercultural differences and opening the participant’s mind to other cultures  and different lifestyles in contemporary Europe. Sharing and exchanging experiences and good practice as well as acquiring new skills will bring long term benefits not only participants of the project but also the institution, other students and teachers and the local community.
Nowe kompetencje i umiejętności warunkiem dobrego startu zawodowego na europejskim rynku pracy

The aim of the project named "New Skills and Competences as the Condition of a Good Start at the European Labour Market" ias acquiring valuable experience, increasing linguistic skills, profesionall competences and development of social competences by the participants of the project. We would like to create innovative approach to learning processes so as to prepare next generations to find themselves in rapidly changing labour market. What is more, we would like to enable the participants to know profeassional encironment, organization and culture of work in other countries as well as improvement of vocational and linguistic skills based on modern standards of hotel, hairdressing, IT, logistics, desktop publishing and economic branches in the EU countries.175 partcipants are going to take part in the project - 155 students and 20 teachers and directors. There are planned 8 mobilities to Germany (WBS TRAINING AG in Dresden, VFBQ in Bad Freienwalde), Austria (Pension Imbachhorn in Fusch) and Great Britain (ADC College in London). The mobilities will be internships and vocational courses.All the mobilities will be preceded by cultural, linguistic and pedagogical courses. In order to increase linguiatic competences lessons of German and English will be organized.The internships annd  courses will be performed by experienced institutions offering vocational trainings of high quality. It will assure our participants' pleasure and reaching the aims of the project.The participants will increase their skills and gain new knowledge and skills which will be confirmed by Europass - Mobility certificate. It will influence on the increase of the chance to find work at the EUropean labour market. The project will act a the local, natiional and international levels.
Europejska mobilność zawodowa szansą na lepszy start

The project entitled "European job mobility as a chance for a better start" prepared by Zespół Szkół Ponadgimnazjalnych Nr 2 (Complex of Secondary Schools No. 2) in Rydułtowy includes the implementation of two-week internships for 64 students from our school as a part of their monthly internship. The project provides the opportunity to take part in the internship in a foreign country for students from every specialization in our school. The project includes four activities - trips of groups of sixteen students and two tutors to the three countries of the European Union:GThe project duration is 24 monthsduring which 64 students from our school are going to hold two- week internships, which will  be the part of their monthly  vocational internships.We would like to provide the opportunity to take part in the internship in the foreign country for all students  regardless of their specialization (profession).The project involves  4 mobilities of sixteen-student groups and two tutors to the three countries of the European Union:Italy (Rimini)- 1st  mobility in the profession of merchant technician- 6 students and in the profession of of nutrition and gastronomy services- 10 students.Great Britain( Portsmouth)- 2nd  mobility in the profession of phototechnician- 16 students.Great Britain (Portsmouth) - 3rd mobility in the profession of phototechnician – 8 students and nutrition and gastronomy services- 8 students.Great Brinain ( Portsmouth)- 4th mobility in the profession of logistician.The participants are the present students of  1st and 2nd forms of technical school who are going to hold the interships being students of the 3rd form in the school year 2016/2017.The interships will be held in shops, hotels ,restaurants, photo laboratories and logistic deparments of different companies in Portsmouth. Wich group will be supervised by two tutors.The internships will be held in shops, hotels and restaurants throughout London and Rimini as well as photo studios and advertising agencies in Malaga. Each group will travel with two tutors. The project responds to the educational needs of the country and is connected with the need to increase the level of effectiveness of vocational training, to gain new skills and experience in order to adapt to the requirements of Polish and European labor market. Moreover, it allows to develop knowledge of foreign languages used in the specific professional sectors.The project responds to the needs of students and the needs of the local labor market. The economic situation in the region leads to gradual changing of the industrial sector into the services sector, which increases the demand for skilled, experienced workers who speak foreign languages in these specific sectors. And that is the place where the internship of catering and trade services students fits in.. Due to the rapid development of modern technologies and development in the European trends in the photo industry, 24 students who are educated in the profession of a phototechnician will take part in the IT and photo services internship.The objectives of the project:- increase in the competitiveness and usefulness of the participants on the labor market,- increase in the level of key competencies as well as acquiring new professional and language skills, which will be supported by the Europass certificate, and hence increase their chances of employment on the local and European labor market,- to obtain better academic performance in learning vocational subjects and foreign languages in comparison with the year preceding the internship,- increase in the self-esteem of participants,- to sensitize participants to the cultural diversity of Europe,- to use and develop skills in foreign languages: English, Italian,- to create the possibility of travelling abroad, also for socially, family and financially disadvantaged students, thus to gain more confidence and acquire new professional skills,- increase in the European dimension of vocational training in our school.Expected results:- 64 students who will gains skills and experience abroad, which will be confirmed by the Europass Mobility document,- increase in language skills (English, Italian) and professional competence,- improvement in communication and organizational skills of the participants,- familiarizing with the labor market in Italy and England, the principles of operation of companies, businesses and restaurants in the catering, commercial and photo sectors,- exchange of experience between teachers of our school and the organizations, companies and establishments where the internship will take place,- increase in the level of independence and self-esteem of participants- students' better academic performance and increase in the motivation as far as studying vocational subjects and languages are concerned- development of international cooperation of the institution.

I) pupils mobilities:
- a first group of students from the profession health and wellness sciences (18)will go for 2 weeks on internship in the London area.
-a  second group of students from the professional disciplines ' hair stylist ' (7) and ' care ' (4) is 3 weeks on internship in London these students stay in host families.
A large part (+ 65%) of our school population consists of GOK-pupils. These are so-called ' disadvantaged ' students.
We want to offer these students the opportunity to gain international experience in order to raise their chances on the labour market. by offering these students the opportunity on participation in an international project, we want to prevent early school leaving

II) teachers: 
We want to acquaint teachers with the Finnish education system and offer them the opportunity to exchange experiences with colleagues. The aim is to exchange good practices and at the Finnish colleagues , to take a look in their classrooms and teach 'guest lectures' to Finnish pupils in English.
We expect that this is a win-win situation for PISO en SALPAUS

III) management and staff members: 
the planned educational reforms will require us to adjust our vision and the organisation of our school.
To do this in an appropriate and thoughtful way to, we want to raise our insight  in the education system of Finland and change thaughts with our colleagues in Salpaus (= consortium of schools in Lahti-Finland) We want tolearn about school organization, guidance of pupils and pedagogical approach of problem situations such as bullying, immigrants etc..

Of course each group will  taste the culture, habits and customs of the country in question.
This experience will raise at every level the awareness of the need for pushing the boundaries, internationalization in education, increasing mobility within Europe -for learners and trainers-and widening the vision of internationalization in general.
This project will contribute to increasing tolerance, broaden the spirits, strengthen the European ideal and to demonstrate the advantages of mobility for young people.
Καινοτόμες προσεγγίσεις διδασκαλίας και Διαχείριση ανθρώπινου δυναμικού

Teacher training is a continuous process that links basic education and training with professional activity and helps trainees acquire subject and subject pedagogic knowledge, develop skills and adopt attitudes that will enable them to use scientific and pedagogical developments in an effective way, develop an ability of reflecting on their educational practices and successfully respond to the challenges of the knowledge society.Teacher training belongs to the field of adult education and lifelong learning. For this reason, a needs assessment survey has already been conducted focusing on ways of improving the quality of education provided in our school and our school board has unanimously decided, after a meeting held on 29/01/2016 (Act No. 06),that our school teachers will participate in training courses regarding:approaches to multicultural issues in education, managment and development self and others and human resources management in education institutions. Our school project aims at improving human resourses management,  communication horizontally among trainers and verticaly among administration, trainers and trainnees,  teaching process based on innovative approaches to education, better classroom management techniques and encouraging cooperation among trainers so as to benefit learners even more.They participants are also familiar with new technologies and willing to contribute to the implementation of innovative programmes.The training process will be based on a balance between theory and practice, group and individual activities using modern technologies. The trainees will have the opportunity to share their experiences and contribute to shaping the learning process, follow the progress of different teaching methods, give presentations and participate in experiential learning activities.Through the training of teachers in innovative pedagogical methods and teaching approaches an appropriate educational environment in the classroom will be created, possible communication problems with adult learners will be avoided and the educational process will become more effective. The trainers will be able to organize their class in a better way, communicate, develop better interpersonal relations and acquire innovative educational techniques that will make their teaching more accessible to trainees. They will also gain experience and new knowledge needed for their careers. Apart from their personal and professional development, the trainees will acquire and improve their skills of approaching learners and build healthy relations based on mutual trust, respect and understanding.Our school will gain publicity, new partnerships, networking and will be equipped with trained teaching staff. Furthermore, better interpersonal relationships between trainers and trainees will be established and the educational environment in the classroom and at school generally will be improved. The trainers will be given the opportunity to share their experiences, exchange ideas and participate in the construction of a more accessible, democratic and world-oriented Europe. We expect that the experience gained will be used in the classroom and the immediate learning outcomes will prove useful so as to improve the quality of education and achieve the internationalisation of our school.
Teachers in action for Adults - learn How to teach ICT & Entrepreneurship

The  European Development Plan of Consortium aims to promote of human capabilities, in particular the capabilities of the most disadvantaged social groups, through the organisation of workshops, counselling and courses. The Consortium desires to improve adult education; promote digital skills; affirm to pivotal importance of civil society and active citizenship; create room for the sharing of cultural and social differences through European citizens of different Countries and people of the rest of the world. As part of the actions realised in the achieving of these “functional aims”, The consortium organises the Training Course “Teachers in action for Adults - learn How to teach ICT & Entrepreneurship” to improve key competences as skills like the use in training and education of adults people of ICT, and especially the Moodle platform, and how to promote and improve the entrepreneurship attitudes of adults. The Training Course is addressed to those staff and teachers who already work with adults in both, formal education (hight school and  adult organization) and other forms of training (job trainers, youth counsellors, coaches, other educators and instructors) .  Together with other important general skills and knowledges, the Training Course will focus especially on the following topics:(a) Moodle system: Moodle is a free, online Learning Management system enabling educators to create their own private website filled with dynamic courses that extend learning, anytime, anywhere. Whether you're a teacher, student or administrator, Moodle can meet your needs. The course will give to the participants a solid preparation in the use of the platform and all its features, in order to enhance their teaching and add more interactivity to their classes;(b) Social Enterprise attitude: the Training Course will raise awareness of the issues; attendants will explore the options open to them, will gain an understanding of how a successful social enterprise looks like, will look at the common mistakes and how to avoid them in the start up of a social enterprise. Main topics: 1. Entrepreneurship: basics of entrepreneurship with specific focus on social entrepreneurship; material, content and methodology 2. Eu policies and programmes for adult education and mobility; networking in a EU environment 3. Innovative and interactive teaching methods for adult learners: an overview of best practices resulting from EU projects; hands on workshop. The Course aim too to give a practical help in the planning of first steps of attendants who desire to start a social enterprise or improve the social responsibility of their corporations. The Project will involve  in total 52 participants from Italy. It will be repeated twice and will be held in London by Kairos Europe and Brusselles by IHF asbl  in the following dates:13th-17th February, 2017 (London - moodle Course); 13th-17th February, 2017 (Brusselles - Capacity Building);11th-15th , May 2017 (London - moodle course);11th-15th May 2017 (Brusselles - Capacity Building);
EQUITAM - Enhancing QUality In Teaching for Adult Migrants

Established in 2012, the Popular School Ziqqurat has become a reality in the city of Rome, representing a melting pot of cultures and a laboratory for testing forms of language teaching that try to meet the specific needs of learners and their possible learning difficulties. Through its Popular School for language teaching, the association Ziqqurat actively contributes to achieving the goals of the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in the field of education and training (ET 2020), in particular by promoting personal, social and professional fulfillment of all citizens and intercultural dialogue, with particular attention to disadvantaged groups such as migrants.The specific objective of this project is to improve the functionality of the Popular School Ziqqurat, by enhancing its operational capacity and the quality of teaching, through the introduction of effective and innovative tools and teaching methods and keeping an eye on the lifelong learning opportunities offered by the European Union.To play a leading role and become a reference school for migrants, Ziqqurat must optimize its human resources, in order to ensure that everyone can express the best of him/herself and constantly increase his/her professional skills. In addition, to acquire cutting-edge expertise and innovative teaching tools, it is necessary to put teachers in conditions to interact with foreign colleagues and for that it is important to be able to submit high quality European projects. For all this reasons, Ziqqurat has prepared a two-year plan of 18 transnational mobilities within two axes of intervention, which has been designed to meet the specific learning needs identified by the staff during the analysis phase.
SOUTHERN EUROPEAN MIGRANT DILEMMAS: BETTER INTEGRATION METHODS

A) Context/background of project; This one-week project will help all the participants gain a greater understanding of issues that affect non-EU migrants and people with disadvantaged backgrounds when integrating within European cities. Throughout the workshop, teaching and learning, panel discussions, activities, networking and sharing of ideas in relation to intercultural interactions will take place as British participants will gain a greater understanding of how the often perceived ‘UK migration dilemmas’ and not just British but European-wide issues that extend to the south of Italy.B) Objectives of your project; The objective of this workshop is to widen the understanding of British participants on the current and complex migration issues surrounding non-EU refugee and migrant communities in Mediterranean countries. Participants will be able to compare and contrast Italian methods of working with migrant methodologies against their own. In response to the various critical events affecting European countries; the focus on this workshop will not only be based on being able to communicate effectively with people of different backgrounds but gaining ‘hands-on’ practical skills of working to better the lives of integrated non-EU migrants, refugees and asylum seekers. C) Number and profile of participants; 15 participants will be selected from our pool of workers from the consortium. All the participants have expressed the need to acquire skills in discussing, learning and observing historical and current migration trends and gaining more of a greater insight into some of the issues, dilemmas and solutions that many non-EU migrants endure and will benefit from.  They have expressed the need to renovate and improve their understanding of how the often perceived ‘UK migration dilemmas’ is not just British but European-wide issues that extend to the south of Italy.D) Description of activities; Presentations on current and historical migrant trends of non-EU migrants in Mediterranean countries, 2 day visits to migrant organizations and visiting the UN-awarded Riace, Caulonia e Stigliano (3 small villages that thanks to the arrival and integration of refugees have been repopulated after the local inhabitants emigrated to the North of Italy or abroad).E) Methodology to be used in carrying out the project; Kairos Europe together with Wellfield Education and Red Ochre are the members of the national consortium. Kairos Europe is the applicant and the other two will contribute to the implementation, management, dissemination and recruitment. And ITAKA Training will be the host organization in Southern Italy providing the 7 day professional development course. All these organizations will be constantly in contact via Skype, Emails and Phone calls. The course will be delivered via classroom presentations utilizing methods such as Problem based learning, student centered approach, semi-structured face to face interviews with migrants and site visits.E) Description of results;1) The creation of a blog and a Facebook page, which will be easy to reach by everybody. 2) Establish new ways and ideas for promoting common European values, intercultural dialogue and tackle social exclusion with a focus on non-EU refugee and asylum seeking communities. 3) Acquiring new skills for training teachers, mentors, trainers in migration issues, community workers and leaders. 4) Participants will be equipped with the necessary intercultural awareness and communication skills they need to relate with people from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds (with a focus on refugees)F) Impact envisaged:Participants will have a deeper understanding of the current changes taking place in a European society (with a focus on Southern Italy) and its multiculturalism; understand and make sense of diversity, and be able to talk about it productively and meaningfully. Furthermore, they will get new ideas on how to update their  approach and  methods and help migrants/refugees in needs. It will also give the participants the confidence to develop a more international approach in their day by day work.G) Potential longer term benefits;Increase awareness and prospects of international actions. To establish new projects and partnerships in the future. Furthermore; to increase in the consortium staff  knowledge of the migrants/refugees issue across Europe  and being more confident in their job and to allow our staff  to get new knowledge in how to promote social inclusion and intercultural exchange among learners and groups they deal with coming from different backgrounds and cultures being a benefit to the next generation and migrant organizations in the future.

In the current immigration crisis we are facing problems arising from intercultural relations, clash of cultures - a new wave of xenophobia, racism and social fears that can be seen particularly in the eastern part of EU. This is a new problem that arises from strong social fears, stereotypes that need to be combat. We are witnessing events of violence involving migrants and refugees that can evolve into more dangerous phenomenon. We held in our international partnership skype meetings with ngo leaders and their youth workers who face the problems arising from intercultural clashes in their life and work. The problem has been evident enough even without our social survey which we have delivered online. Our survey among 200 youths online in each state showed very little social acceptance of diversity and a large social tolerance for racist behaviours. As FRA stated (based on their last annual report) “Barriers persist in implementing effectively EU legislation that prohibits and penalises manifestations of racism, xenophobia and ethnic discrimination. The sixth year of the economic crisis and turbulent developments in the Middle East and North Africa are raising concerns and considerations for migration and integration policies in the EU. Meanwhile, Europeans are increasingly responsive to parties and movements with xenophobic, anti-immigrant and anti-Muslim agendas. Migrants, refugees, asylum seekers and members of ethnic and religious minorities suffer manifestations of violent hatred and continuous discrimination in many areas of social life. Moreover, the increasing use of internet and social media proliferates some political rhetoric and racist hate speech.” Across the EU, members of minority ethnic groups, including migrants and refugees faced discrimination in access to key areas of social life. The internet remains a critical tool for spreading hate speech. As FRA concluded Member States are encouraged to adopt and implement policies and measures aiming at combating racism and hate crime.In order to face that problem we will provide international training event for youth workers from the partner countries. We will introduce new methods efficient in learning multiculturalism. Moreover,experienced trainers from each partner organization will share their skills in the field of multiculturalism with all other participants. We will also work on a common final publication containing the combined training methods. The youth workers have to be better prepared to address European youths, to combat social fears, face problems related to xenophobia, racism and stereotypes among youth learners. The project aims to promote intercultural dialogue and strengthen knowledge and acceptance of diversity in society. We support youth workers in developing and sharing effective methods in reaching out to marginalised young people, refugees, asylum seekers and migrants, and in preventing racism and intolerance among youth;We aim to: -support professional development of youth workers, trainers to cope better with intercultural problems, racism, xenophobia, social fears of youth learners, particularly based on the recent immigration crisis and refugees in EU.-raise youth workers' awareness, responsiveness and understanding of other cultures and countries (so they can better transfer that to the youths), enhance English language capacities of non-English participants, offer them the opportunity to build networks of international contacts, develop a sense of European citizenship and identity;-increase the capacities, attractiveness and international dimension of participating organizations so that they are able to offer activities and programmes that better respond to the current needs of the youths;By combining the set of workshops delivered by experienced in this field trainers from the partner organizations which proved high efficiency in the partner organizations, we are going to provide a high quality outcome – a combined training methodology that will be published after the event and used in the project dissemination.In this way trainers from partner organizations will lead certain training sessions, share their intercultural experience. It will increase competences of our youth workers, share mutual experience, establish a international network of youth workers involved. It will also bring further benefits for the youth workers involved: raise their ability to work in international environment, enhance English skills, allow to establish professional relationships across EU, gain basic experience in providing training sessions for international learner.The learning results of the participants will be gained thanks to their participation in the training event in Poland, Zakopane on 20-25 March 2017. The event will be attended by youth workers from UK, Poland, Italy, Czech Replubli, Macedonia, Moldova, Turkey, Spain and Georgia.

Internationale Kompetenzen für Auszubildende und Lehrer am Adolf-Kolping-Berufskolleg III

In the last 13 years we have been working on preparing our students for the challenges of working in a globalised world. Our strategy is based on five pillars:1. increase the numbers of VET mobilities2. certification and validation through ECVET instruments3. develop our school’s curriculum4. strengthen our international network and cooperations5. increase the number of staff mobilitiesWith this application we are going to increase our VET mobilities. In the academic year 2014/15 we sent about 12% of our students abroad (based on the average number of students in our vocational training programs – 86 mobilities from 745 students - see 10% strategy of the EU-agency Cologne). We are planning to increase the number of our mobilities to 20% until 2020. In order to do so we would like to send 11 students on a four week internship to London, UK, documenting this mobilities using the ECVET tools.In the future we are planning to develop our school’s curriculum in the field of Media Design on the basis of the planned London mobility.As far as staff mobilities are concerned our plan is to significantly increase the numbers of staff going abroad. Our aim is to send 10% of our staff onto staff mobilities until 2020. We consider this measure to be an important part of our human resources development. With this application we are intending to send 7 of our 72 staff abroad.The first ones to go will be two colleagues from the plumbing department, who will visit our longtime partners in Kuovola, Finland. There they will look at how the country specific guidelines for implementing the EU specifications for waste water disposal are being taught in Kuovola Region Vocational College. We also expect synergetic effects for the development of our school’s curriculum as far as European learning situations are concerned.Furthermore, we are going to send two teachers to our new partner in Prague. There they will look at how they dovetail theory and practical exercise in school and practical work. They will also try to initialize further cooperation in the field of staff mobilities.Two other Media Design teachers will visit our longtime partner at I.E.S.La Guancha. There they will participate in a jobshadowing project in order to find out out our Spanish colleagues teach the basics of audio visual media.Last but not least one colleague is going to visit our partner at I.E.S. Puerto de la Cruz where he will participate in a jobshadowing project in order to learn about how colleagues there teach in interdisciplinary settings.

The project will realize the internationalization activities as foreseen in the 2016 Ce.S.F.Or. operative plan; Ce.S.F.Or. (applicant) will realize mobility activities in the following fields: tourism and catering, communication and marketing, creative industry, cultural industry, for learners and staff; the project duration will be of 24 months. The mobility will be realized in 5 EU Countries: United Kingdom, Ireland, Spain, Portugal and France, in organizations/SME within Ce.S.F.Or. European network, and with the inclusion of new partners, in order to widen the European network as described within the goals of the internationalization strategy. The mobility activity will involve n. 50 learners and 6 accompanying persons for learners under 18 years old, and n. 5 staff. It will be realized an activity of VET learners traineeships in companies abroad, with a duration of 21 days, travel days included, for n. 40 learners and 6 accompanying persons, and an activity of VET learners traineeships in companies abroad with a duration of 92 days, travel days included, for n. 10 learners. Moreover, it will be realized an activity of staff training abroad with a duration of 7 days, travel days included, for n. 5 staff, with the aim of enhancing the language and intercultural competences of the staff involved in the mobility.
