The basic tool for this change is the new and updated school educational program, which takes into consideration these requirements and also this year there is a possibility to complete vocational education by studying at FEC - Further Education College. Herby we want to focus oneself on integration of students with special needs and of students with social feebler background. 
RNDr. Gregorková works with these students, also with their integration and Ing. Mihoková helps with the studentship.  
 We would like to concentrate on the multicultural differences within Europe by learning about them, and trying to understand and accept them.
From the perspective of the students' training the aims of our project are:
-to introduce departments of the firms and the agenda of each department to the students
-to enable students to consult with the professional workforce and with the management
-to introduce the work of the marketing department (marketing research, contact with clients, the preparation of catalogues and promotion materials, data processing, PR, the preparation and realization of meetings) to the students
- to introduce the work of the HR department (training of the employees, types of contracts and  agreements, benefits, recruiting, job interviews, the preparation of a professional CV) to students
-to introduce the work of the economic department (budgeting, bookkeeping, reporting, statistics ) to the students
- to enable students and the employees to improve their communicative competence and professional vocabulary in English
We planned our mobility’s as follows:
a/ students of the study field Business academy - bilingual studies  - 10 students travel for three weeks to London, the mobility will take place either in November/December 2018.
b/  students of the study field Business academy  - 10 students travel for three weeks to Dublin, their mobility will take place  in May/June 2019.
Duaal leren en onderwijs in de 21e eeuw, een succesverhaal voor de arbeidsmarkt

With this international internship project, we want to focus on our marketing students from Accountancy & Informatics, Office Management & Languages, Office-Sale, and Health and Welfare Sciences. Out of this group we will select 16 students who have the right motivation for a two-week foreign internship adventure in a company in London, under the guidance of the responsible tutors, and an English teacher, and in cooperation with an external partner, namely ADC College, who has the know-how, the network and the experience, which we do not have to organise this kind of project.
Depending on the department followed in our school, the students will be set to work into the following sectors: Administration / Child Care / Health & Social Care / IT & Accountancy.
Most of our students live in the outskirts of Bruges, and have a rural background. Part of them also come from families with a low standard of living, low income. Due to their home situation, their often rather mediocre school results, by the fact that, as technical and vocational students, they often feel inferior to their brothers, sisters, friends from a general school, they have low self-esteem, low motivation to study and a lack of confidence. Often they make no or a wrong study choice after their last secondary school year, and they end up on the labour market with fewer opportunities. Our students are generally not very internationally mobile, and have not been in contact with multiculturalism. When it comes to their skills in English, they think too much that they are not competent, they are afraid to use the English they have learned in school.
The departments involved in the project are technical and vocational, we dare to say that they don’t get the respect they deserve, both with parents and young people. We are looking for ways to popularise those departments.
At school we are working on internationalisation through KA2 projects, this schoolyear we have our first very successful KA1 project, and we can see a lot of enthusiasm and hope to be able to repeat this next year. We are more than ever convinced that a KA1 project, like it is running now, is the perfect tool to realise goals you can't achieve in daily education and internship organised in Belgium.
It will improve the skills in English among our students, and introduce them to a multicultural (working) environment. It will also provide our students a broader perspective on the European labour market. It will give them new work experiences and professional learning gains. They will study more and be more aware of their choices, they will also be more motivated and able to make better study choices. They will also have more job opportunities.
Our students will also acquire social skills that we cannot always realise at our school or at local internship companies: self-esteem, stress resistance, willingness to cooperate (on an international level), openness to other cultures and unknown work environments, less fear of the unknown ... And very important is the gain in self-confidence, we can confirm this thanks to our running KA1 project: thanks to the internship and the stay in host families for wo weeks, we saw our students get more and more confident, discover new talents and competences, as a trainee and as a person.
The internship is also an essential part for the result of the integrated test of the students, and thus their final report of their last secondary schoolyear.
The internship project will also provide new professional and other skills to the teachers involved in the project, we think that it will result in an implementation and teaching of the subjects much much closer and related to the daily reality, so that ‘being a student’ in these fields of study will be more attractive. We also hope that the project will have a positive impact on the charisma of these subjects for parents and new students.
The internship will take place in companies / institutions in London, students stay with host families. The monitoring and evaluation is done on a regular basis by their own teachers, by a coach from the company itself, and by a personal coach from ADC College assigned to each student.
The internship means  a new form of internationalisation for our school, and we hope that this could be a first step that will be repeated in the future, to involve other colleagues into internationalisation so that the succession is assured, and to encourage more teachers to react positively to the large Erasmus + professionalisation courses.
Versterking van competenties van lerenden door werkplekleren in een internationale context.

The project for which we are applying, is being part of a much broader project that we could appoint as “Building a stronger school together“.

We can situate our school, GO! Atheneum Merksem (general and vet-school) in an environment that has the typical characteristics of a contemporary European metropolitan context: an increasing number of children growing up in what can be called not the ideal circumstances; an increasing diversity in student population; internationalisation and globalisation and a vast technological improvement. These changes compel society and therefore also our school to search for solutions in a proactive way. GO! Atheneum Merksem wants to use this modified context as an opportunity. After much thought a new vision, the Max-method, originated in our school. A vision supported by all the stakeholders. In this name of the method is a humorous reference to our school mascot Max, but the name especially refers to something that is good: our school is ‘the max’. Max symbolises a two pillar system on which our education method is based: providing contemporary effective education with a maximal competence increasing learning effect and the enlargement of an individual care- and education policy. Through the introduction of didactical innovations, working with SMART goals, putting the focus on acquiring the European key competences and a further professionalization of the teaching staff we guarantee qualitatively high standard education with the first pillar of the 
Max-method including a lot of attention for ICT-implementation and language development.  

The second component of the Max-method sees to it that we create equal opportunities for everyone. The augmentation of social inclusion and a better preparation for future choice of study and profession provide that the social inequality and diversity won’t obstruct the development opportunities of our youngsters. We see an internationalisation policy in our school as an enforcement of the pre-existing two pillar system. Internationalisation augments the self-reliance of the learners, improves their language development, stimulates their digital competences, creates a new cultural awareness and improves their social skills.  

The long term goals of the European Union, as they were recorded in the Europe 2020 strategy, match perfectly with the previously mentioned values from our school project. The Erasmus+ programme can give a concrete completion to these goals. For these reasons we would like to integrate the project of “Core action 1- individual learning mobility” in the school structure in a sustainable way. We do this by implementing two periods of “Max goes international” in our sixth form students’ curriculum in the study fields Social Technical Sciences (STS) and Health and Welfare Sciences (HWS). These two periods are used as a preparation, an implementation and a dissemination for/of the mobility project. For further realisation of the mobility we are working together with an experienced partner organisation (ADC College in Harrow). In this application we are asking for financing for ten of our students of our sixth form in the study fields STS and HWS, who will be selected to participate in a foreign work placement in organisations that work in the sectors health and childcare In the London area during a period of ten days. The target group consists out of about fifty students, of which the majority accords to an opportunity group according the EOE-indicators (Equal Opportunity Education). The students who will not be going to London will be receiving an equivalent “home project” with a focus on guidance concerning choice of study and profession. These students also, will come in contact with internationalisation through their cooperation with a college in Rotterdam. The guidance by six teachers offers opportunities for their personal and professional development. The application for this mobility is an addition to the 2017 approved application of a similar project. The mobility project perfectly suits our long term ambition of GO! Atheneum Merksem to evolve to a school with an outspoken international profile. As European Parliament Ambassador School and by participating in several other European projects like e-Twinning, Euroscola and new Erasmus+ strategic partnerships, we are building a road to develop a sustainable internationalisation policy. This vision on internationalisation is shared by the whole school. “Team International” is ready to go. It is only waiting for a green light.
Met Erasmus op buitenlandse stage voor gelijke kansen voor iedereen

This project aims at multiple objectives:
As a secondary school with technical and vocational education, we have a wide variety of pupils.
A large number of the young people in our school have a migration background or come from poor families. We often notice that these pupils receive few incentives from home to work at school. Such a situation means that these pupils leave school prematurely without a diploma and therefore have limited opportunities on the labor market. With foreign internships we want to motivate these pupils to stay at school to be able to take part in a foreign internship.
In this way we want to stop school dropout but also encourage and motivate pupils to finish their school careers and to show them that their chances on the labor market will increase significantly.
In addition, we want to introduce participants to other people, cultures, customs, visions, etc.
Self-reliance, self-respect, respect for others as a person, but also for their opinion, tolerance. These are all aspects that we want to increase with this project.
Naturally, the internship plays a prominent role in itself. The participant learns to accept assignments from foreign people, often in a foreign language and to execute them. During the internship, the trainee concerned can know his / her own knowledge and can demonstrate it to strangers and learn new things.
In the month of March of the 2019-2020 school year, we want to send 30 students from the study programs Electricity, Machine Tools, CNC-controlled machines, Hair Care and Beauty care to Finland for an internship.
A number of these students will do an internship in companies, another part of the group will take practical lessons at our partner school Salpaus.
At the same time, we send a group of 30 pupils from the care sector to London to do work placements in nursing and care homes, cribs and kindergarten.
We also provide an extensive cultural program for both groups.
For the implementation of the project we call on partners in both countries. In Finland it is Salpaus, a school consortium in Lahti. We call on ADC in the United Kingdom, particularly in London.
Both partners assist us in finding suitable traineeships, accommodation and help with with the cultural program
Piso takes care of all bookings of flights, train rides, bus reservations, trips planned in the cultural program and the monitoring of the project.
In addition to the students, we also send teachers and staff staff to Finland.
The teachers will meet their Finnish colleagues, their teaching methods, approach, preparations, etc.
Our colleagues will carry out teaching assignments together with their Finnish colleagues. They can share experiences and gain insight into the Finnish education system and take good practice examples to their school and implement their experiences and new insights in their own lessons.
We also send 2 staff members to Finland in the field of dual learning to get acquainted with the Finnish system of dual learning. We are entering this school year in the so-called testing grounds and we do not only want to collect the Flemish experiences but we also want to look at how they organize this at our colleagues in Salpaus. In this way we want to be properly prepared and prepared when the trial period ends next year.
In the school year 2020 we want to start a partnership with Pajulahti, an Olympic training center in the town of Nastola about 150 km north-west of the capital Helsinki.
In March 2020, we want to send 25 pupils from our study program Sport under the guidance of Finnish instructors to learn typical winter sports such as cross country ski, ski jumping, ice hockey, skating just to name a few. We also plan a collaboration with the circus school of Lahti.
As management we see a lot of advantages in this project, for our students on  one hand but also for our teachers and staff staff in particular. They will acquire new insights into teaching methods and can get acquainted with good practice examples from their colleagues.
We are convinced that everyone will only believe in the added value of internationalization and that the participants will be able to experience a learning experience that will positively influence their vision of the future.

Our school GO! talent responds to the always evolving society by maintaining close relations with the business world. Organizing internships is an important tool to establish the target goals and competences in the realistic work field. We want to prepare our pupils for the international character of the business world. A profond knowledge of the English language and foreign work experience are requiered for some companies. As a graduating student is that experience one of the most interesting, motivating and challenging experience one can participate. That is why we want to give our graduating students who study ‘Trade’ the chance to fulfill an internship in London.
We co-operate with an organisation with years of experience, to guarantee the quality of this internship. The ADC College of London will help us to search for available internships. Our graduating students will be granted an internship which suits their interests, knowledge and skills. This internship abroad runs for two weeks (March- April). During internship and the whole project they will be supported by the supervisor and internship coördinator from GO! talent.
One of the main goals of this project is to emphasize the independency and defensibility of our students. They leave the well-known school and home surroundings to broaden their horizons and become acquainted with a different business culture. We try to obtain independency and respect by complementing the classical purposes with interdisciplinary terms. Through this project we hope to stimulate their entrepreneurship in professional surroundings. We also appeal to their perseverance and empathy in an intercultural environment. This internship offers them an unique opportunity to learn and develop their English speaking and writing skills, and it will not look bad on their curriculum vitae as well. In short, this experience will indisputably be an added value on all levels!

The ‘Animation, Hospitality and Hotel Internship’ programme, organised by the Hotelschool Go!TA3 Hasselt, focuses on the realisation of a foreign internship for students of the Se-n-Se year (post secondary school) Tourism and Recreation and  final-year students Hospitality and Hotel.  To prepare this internship as well as possible, we organise a number of domestic and foreign study tours, workshops and guest lectures and multilingual practice exercises. These courses are finalised by a foreign work placement in which the students’ acquired knowledge, skills and attitudes are to be applied.   

The internships for students of Tourism and Recreation are organised in collaboration with the international PALLADIUM HOTEL GROUP because of the well-developed contacts with the local management of this hotel chain and take place exclusively on the Balearen - island of Ibiza. Due to the favourable geographical location of the internship, an effective mentoring can be organised.
For the internships of our Hospitality and Hotel students, Hotelschool Go!TA3 opts for international four- or five-star hotels and restaurants in London and a collaboration with  the ADC College in London.

The Tourism internships will run from May 1 until June 23, 2019 (18 students  + 4 teachers).
The Hospitality internships will run from February 3 until  March 2, 2019 (12 students + 4 teachers).

During Tourism internships, students will be working in both day and evening entertainment and they will be involved in maintaining guest relations. This should result in a greater independence and self-confidence of the students. Since both guests and staff come from various European regions, knowledge of different languages (French, English, German, Spanish) plays a key role in the success of the internship.
During Hospitality internships, students will be working in service oriented departments of four- and five-star hotels in London and mainly focus on reception work and organising and assisting MICE activities (Meetings, Incentives, Congres, Events). They will predominantly communicate in English, although other foreign languages such as French, German and Dutch will be used due to the international character of the business. 
During Hotel internships, students will be working in the Food and Beverage departments of four- and five-star hotels and restaurants in Londen. They will work in an international framework and get to know the international cuisine.
The Students Hospitality and Hotel will be staying with host families.

Furthermore, this project fits in perfectly with the vision of internationalisation adopted by the school, in which the school invests in European projects that generate added value for the students’ education.
The knowledge and skills acquired by the students, along with the international opportunities, will expand the job market for these students and open the door to job opportunities at a global level. 

At the same time, the project is also an opportunity for the school to optimise the course curriculum.
Synergie tussen school en werk over de grenzen heen.

Synergy between school and work across borders.

De Wijnpers is a provincial secondary school with vocational, technical and artistic training and has about 700 pupils between the ages of 12 and 21. 
The school presents itself in the specific fields of biotechnology, animal, environment and horticulture, cooling and heat and also in applied visual arts and artistic education. The wine press chooses qualitative education that starts from the possibilities and talents of the pupils. 

In recent years, we have ensured that program development has resulted in a strong expansion of project activities, workplace learning, internships and opportunities for connection with the labor market. 
The intention is to let our students graduate successfully, limit the school drop-out as much as possible and offer them maximum opportunities in their future career. 

The establishment of the seventh specialization years (vocational secondary school) and the Se-n-Se years of agro and green management and graphic design (seventh years after technical and art secondary education) fit into this framework. 
The Dual Learning pilot project "school desk in the workplace" that started this school year in collaboration with the Ministry of Education and Syntra Flanders is an example of how we want to support young people in optimizing their future possibilities. 

The Wijnpers wants to profile itself more internationally oriented, multicultural and open-minded from recent policy choices and to further develop the internal school working effect from these objectives. 
As a strategic objective, we first propose that all pupils receive at least two international experiences in their study career and succeed in using functionally foreign languages. It is an ambitious goal since the school population of De Wijnpers counts a lot of socially vulnerable pupils and pupils with learning disabilities. 

The school started in September 2015 with a CLIL program, language exchange and has a long tradition of multi-day study trips to European cultural capitals and project weeks abroad. Over the past 3 school years, our Se-n-Se pupils in Poland, Spain, Great Britain, France and Italy have completed successful traineeships thanks to Erasmus +, and this has had an enormous impact on the further development of our internationalization working group within our school. .

This project proposal is situated on three levels that tie in with the major objectives of the school vision:
- a long internship of 13 weeks in Spain, Poland or Great Britain for students of the seventh year Se-n-Se (which is preceded by intensive training in the first semester)
- a short group internship of 2 weeks in Spain or Great Britain for the pupils of Dual Learning and Se-n-Se
- and finally the supervision and preparation of the internships by the teachers involved.

The purpose of the internship abroad is to provide pupils with a total experience and motivate them for further education in higher education, or to prepare them better for the labor market. We want the pupil to make the choice to participate in this project, so that we can give motivated youngsters who are bursting with talent the chance to grow across borders on their way to European maturity. It is expected that the project and the immersion in a different culture, with different habits, will lead to a significant increase in motivation, practical language skills, the learning and working qualities and choice skills of the young adults. We hope that this will significantly increase their chances in the further study or work career.
The other culture and way of working means that their talents can further explore a European unity and maturity. The basis of the acquired knowledge and skills that they gain from this experience will be able to develop further as a seed, and also give them enormous added value within their own personal and social growth.
The support for the pupil in their foreign internship by the teachers must provide a multiplier effect both in terms of professional competence and the effect on internationalization within the school team. For the school and the foreign partners, this project will function as a learning network in which knowledge, contacts and experience are exchanged. In the future, after a positive evaluation and adjustment from the quality assurance cycle, this added value can be further expanded and lead to more intensive partnerships and new projects.
With this project we hope to be able to motivate others to share this international message together, and thereby to form an ever expanding network, where learning, integration, implementation of new ideas and cooperation are central, and where qualities are transcended across borders. be shared.

Wico campus Salvator is a small-scale school in a rural area in the North of Limburg. We realise that this safe haven might imply restrictions to our students. Therefore we send sixteen students, who are in their final year of secondary school, to London for two weeks. We would like them to get acquainted with a metropolis. They will thus realise that their surroundings here are ideologically homogeneous. A two-week internship and stay in a host family will broaden their cultural and social horizon. Through integrating practical skills and theoretical knowledge in the internship, the student might be more capable to choose for a more practical or a more theoretical study in higher education. Moreover, our students will discover their own resilience and their capabilities to operate autonomously. Finally, the intense contacts with natives will have a positive impact on their communication skills and their intrinsic motivation to use a foreign language.  

Teachers will be encouraged to realise their learning objectives in a different setting. A qualitative project also implies teachers working together and combining and finetuning their goals. Through disseminating their experience at a local, national and European level new partnerships, fresh insights and innovative ideas might arise.

In her location at Newport, the school Atheneum Diksmuide, organizes the study direction 'caretaking' in the 3rd grade. After their 3rd grade, the students can also follow an additional specialization year in 'child welfare' or 'home- en elderly care'. Students who accomplish this additional year, obtain their diploma secondary education. These professional educations prepare the students to work in elderly,- child- and home care. The accent lies on practical work where students, together with their colleagues, learn how to give and provied their cartakers the best care and help they need. In this education, the students learn both how a child develops and the process of getting older. Our students get trained to observe, report and organize recreative activities for caretakers and preparing child food in combination with diet meals. They learn about first aid, healthy and balanced diets, about social legislation, health right and specific legislation for the care department. During several internships, the students get to know their future worksituation an they get in touch with the work as a caretaker in a kindergarden, as a caremother, as well as a childcarer in a nursery school and with the elderly people in care- and living center. 

Nevertheless we notice that a lot of our students come from an underprivileged environment. They lack self-confidence and have a narrow vision of the future. We notice that their parents often have very little interest and commitment towards the school. On the contrary, absenteeism and early school drop outs are at a high level.

We, as a school, would love to see that changed. The most effective way to do so is to place our students in a whole other world and to confront them with reality. With this Erasmus+ project, we would like to give our students the chance to follow an internship in the care department in a capital city such as London. This will, without any doubt, have an enormous impact on the participants because for them it is not only a foreign country, but a foreign languages as well. On many levels they will endure and realise that they are capable of so much more than they think. The extensive independance they will have to show, will give them a boost of self-development.  Our students will expand their horizon and they will realize that their is much more in life. Obviously, the job aimed competences will be offered to the students during their internship. Making a comparison between working methods, legislation and organization in the UK and in Belgium is an enrichment for our students development as a caretaker. 

Every 3rd grader whitin the deparment 'caring', can apply as a candidate to participate in this Erasmus+ project. Only 10 students get the opportunity to live and work for two weeks in London. During the internship, the students will take on a care task in a kindergarden of an elderly home. Furthermore, a mentor of the school will accompany them and give them support where needed. At the same time, our partner ADC College, will supply a lot of support and succession. On regularly basis, there will be feedback moments between the students, the internship, the mentor at ADC College and our accompanying teacher.

During a gathering with the teachers pedagogy, caring and home economics, they have made a cross-curricular assignment, linked to the competences from the professional profile of the caregiver and grafted onto the learning objectives  and provided with concrete, written criteria. The Quickstage web tool is used by the supervising teacher as well as by the student for evaluation and self-evaluation.

After their participation, the students receive a validated Europass from ADC College. This will be a vuluminous surplus vanlue in their search for a future employer. Anyhow, we will also become a lesser measurable effect: more assertive an motivated students who will be fully ready to conquer the jobmarket. This project shall be exposed through local press, open school day, social media and on our school website.

The object of our project is an internship of a fortnight's time for 36 pupils coming from three different schools. They all study the same vocational education namely care for the elderly or child care. The 36 pupils will be selected out of the three collaborating schools which are atheneum Eureka, atheneum Jan Fevijn and KTA Brugge. 

As location for the internship we have chosen London as metropolis not only to let pupils get acquainted with health care in a different language but also to learn about the diversity in culture and religion and the importance of taking these elements into account while working in health care / child care.

What we would like to achieve with this internship is that our pupils will:
- integrate what they have learned with the new skills that they will learn
- develop the ability to take initiative and take up enterpreneurship
- improve their language skills
- be able to cope on oneself and be confident enough to do it
- have a clearer vision concerning their career prospects
- develop an intercultural awareness
- participate in a society different from what they know

What we would like to achieve with this internship is that our trainee supervisors and teachers: 
- acquire extra tools that can be integrated within the school vision and its practical implementation
- coordinate the different subjects into one coherent concept benefitting the educational goals

As consortium we would like to
- add an international aspect to the school vision of every consortium member 
- be a pioneer of the Erasmus+ programm within our school community 'Impact' and stimulate other schools who are part of our school community to join us in this programm.
- support the vision of the government in adding value to vocational education and training.

As consortium we hope to achieve these goals and are convinced that this internship will be an added value to every pupil, teacher and trainee supervisor.

Under the motto “Always flying to Europe”, Gago Coutinho Secondary School intends to continue with the project “Erasmus+ Gago Coutinho” for the third consecutive year, with the aim of promoting the integration of its students in the European context.
Currently, the school has got around 1,500 students in secondary courses, which are divided in three types: Sciences and Humanities Courses for students who want to continue their studies; Vocational Courses for students who want to enter the job market; and Adult Training and Education Courses whose approach is on learning throughout life.
Bearing in mind the documents which guide the school - Educational Project, Autonomy Contract and Strategical Action Plan, the focus of this application, whose aim is students’ mobility for training in a work context, is on the improvement of the school’s results in vocational courses, which represent 34% of its students. On the other hand, in what concerns recently graduated students, it is our intention that this application contributes to facilitate the integration in the job market and to reduce youth unemployment.
In this mobility, the school aims at the courses that will mostly gain from internationalization experiences and that will be highly valued with the sharing and the involvement in the “modus operandi” of other companies working in the same sectors in other European countries.
Furthermore, this application intends to contribute for a better integration of students with less opportunities (until 30% of the mobilities) and with Special Educational Needs (until 20% of the mobilities) in order to promote a more inclusive society.
The school presents an application for students in the vocational courses in two respects: a) 16 recently graduated students of the Vocational Course in Management, Programming and Informatics Systems Technician and of the Vocational Course in Tourism Technician will be doing their internship in a work context for six or eight months, in Poland, England and Malta, under ErasmusPro; b) 66 students who are still completing their education in vocational courses will be doing their internships in European context, distributed the following way: 24 of the Vocational Course in Management, Programming and Informatics Systems Technician (6 in Italy, 6 in Germany, 6 in Ireland, 6 in Poland); 18 of the Vocational Course in Tourism Technician (6 in Italy, 6 in Malta and 6 in Hungary); 8 of the Vocational Course in Psychosocial Support Technician (4 in Italy and 4 in Malta); 8 of the Vocational Course in Healthcare Support Technician (4 in Italy and 4 in Spain); 8 of the Vocational Course in Electronics, Automation and Computers Technician (4 in Germany and 4 in Ireland).The students will be selected based on a set of common criteria, however different in their weight and relevance depending on the application, which include: language skills, grades, behaviour and compliance analysis throughout the course, in school and during the internships; students with merit and revealing initiative and creative skills,  commitment and responsibility, communicative skills, adaptation to new situations and integration in teamwork. An interview will be made in order to validate the student’s profile and interest in the participation in the project as well as the will to be involved in the activities to disseminate it.
In order to ensure the fulfillment of the aims defined for the project and the quality and management of its implementation, agreements will be signed among the different participants. The activities planned for the mobility include specific support in the area of the training in the work context. There will be an individual working plan, previously defined by the school, by the student  and by the host institution, in which there will be a detailed schedule with the description and the duration of each of the activities to perform.  On their return to Portugal, these students will have to inform the school of their experience. It is expected that these students will be able to  integrate the national and international job market more easily, due to having a richer curriculum and having developed their personal and professional skills in the scope of employability. It is expeted that the students’ success and motivation improve in every vocational course in this school and that their quality can be recognized by all the educational community and the students hope not only to acquire better skills, but also to integrate society and a more clear conscience of European demands. We believe that the integration in this project will contribute to give greater visibility to the school in relation to its community, which will make it possible to establish new partnerships and develop increasing collaboration with local institutions. The school will have a more dynamic, innovative and open to the future image, able to mobilize the Region and the Municipality with national and international acknowledgement.

SPŠ and OA (Secondary Technical School and Commercial Academy) is based in the district of Bruntal which has been dealing with one of the highest unemployment of the country for a long time. Our students often come from socially weak background,  from families which do not have money to enable their children to travel abroad. Being outside the Czech Republic could help our students to train and improve not only  language knowledge and skills, but also professional skills outside the school environment.
The main objective of the project aims at the students to gain work experience in the studying field and improve language skills. Students will start to build their basic work habits, they will strengthen their possibilities of their own mobility in the labour market, they will become more independent  and they increase their chance in the labour market.
There will be 12 project participants of 2nd and 3rd  classes SPŠ and  OA who study the branches of commercial academy and IT. The participants of short term mobiliy (2 weeks) will be accompanied by an accompanying person from the school. Two participants will take part in the mobility ErasmusPro for 3 months. All mobilities will take place in London. A preparatory visit  to London is included in the project.
Before leaving for London the students will take part in an English course which will be realized at school and taught by language teachers and also culture and professional preparation. In London the students will work in the enterprises dealing with business administration and  IT. The work placement will be arranged ahead by the receiving organization - ADC College which has its own net of companies to cooperate.  The placement will be chosen according to the participants abilities and skills. The language skills will be also practised in host families. The accommodation will be arranged by ADCollege which has also a net of hosting families.
 The two - week mobility will take place during May 2019, mobility ErasmusPro for 3 months during February/March - April/May 2019. The participants will use the gained knowledge and ability during the following study, final exam and  further education ( university) or their professional life and their first job. Their better or  new language skills will help the students have more options in the labour market, not only in their own country, but also within the international scale as well. Thanks to working experience abroad the students will get some ideas what a job outside their country is and possibly they will not be afraid to look for a job abroad.  The students obtain the wholelife experience , but also  the school get some positive impact and will profit from the project. The students and teachers in the school will be informed about the project, its development, individual activities and results. The public will be informed on a school website and  in local press.
Through the content and project targets professional competences  of both students and teachers will be increased and we will include a big group into  team work.
The participants will be evaluated by a receiving organization ADC which provides a certificate, evaluates Europass and ECVET. The school accepts the evaluation and uses it in assessment of the students.

„Getting Experience Abroad“ is a project of sending organisation Business Academy Česká Lípa. Its aim is to enhance vocational knowledge and ease the students´ transition from school to work life. The project supports the connection of the education and entrepreneurial sectors. The main aims of the project are to enhance the vocational knowledge of the students, connect theory and practice, improve vocational terminology in a foreign language and further develop socio-cultural knowledge. Other aims include the exchange of experience among project partners in the area of European co-operation, inter - curricular activities and the dissemination of information about the possibilities offered by international collaboration within the EU.
The main activities of the project are three short-term and one long-term mobility: a two-week long stay in London, a three - week long stay in Berlin, a four - week long stay in Austria and a four- month long stay in London within Erasmus Pro. The main partners in the project are Business Academy as the sending organisation, ADC College as the receiving organisation in London, BVÖ in Austria and IEEP Berlin as the receiving organisation in Berlin. The receiving institutions are well-experienced and are able to find internships in companies that fully correspond with the needs of the students and their branch of study. The number of students in London is 15, in Austria 5 and in Berlin it is 5 third and fourth grade students. The long term mobility is for one Business Academy graduate.
The participants will be chosen from all three branches of study - Business Academy, Lyceum of Economics and Public Service Activities. After they submit the application form, each student will undergo a selection process where the teachers of foreign languages and vocational subjects, class teachers, study mentors and the school headmaster will evaluate them. 
In the preparatory phase of the project the partners will sign the Memorandum of Understanding and other contracts defining their obligations within the project. They will arrange the exact date of the internships and work positions. The chosen participants will prepare for the internships, complete the necessary documents, sign Learning Agreements and Quality Commitments, take a language test and will be informed on vocational and socio-cultural issues.
The internships will take place during the given term in carefully chosen companies in London, Austria and Berlin. The accompanying person will monitor the participants during the internships in London and Berlin while helping them with any problems that might arise. The content of the internships is focused on gaining and improving vocational skills and knowledge that the students learn during their studies including: processing documents – filing, creating, checking, and processing post, administrative work with computer; working with goods, communication with customers and co-workers in a foreign language. The internships will help the students to review and expand upon knowledge concerning socio-cultural situations in the foreign countries they got during their school studies and in preparatory courses.
After the internships are completed, an evaluation and dissemination of the project results will be carried out. The project team will approve the results of the Units of Learning and evaluate the results of the questionnaires. A conference to the project will be organised for the students of Business Academy, primary schools, representatives of companies, state offices and the public. During the conference, the participants will present the content of the stays, their experience and photos taken during the stays. The participants will also be given Europass mobility containing Units of Learning. The members of the project team will present the organisational, administrative and financial details. Further dissemination will be carried out through newspaper articles, messages on school web sites, open days at school and other occasions where the school presents itself. The anticipated outcomes of the project are to see improvement in the participant´s professional competency development in their communication skills in a foreign language and contribution to completing the aims of the school and the European educational policy.

The project "Studying without borders V" is submitted by the Business School, Secondary Special School for Librarians and Further Education College Brno. The project will be implemented in cooperation with its partner ADC College from London. The presenter is an educational institution established by the South-Moravian region which realizes educational programmes in the area of secondary and tertiary education (it means further education colleges in case of tertiary education).

The target group of the project are students of the 2nd and 3rd form of the secondary special school (fields of study: business academy and business lyceum, information services) and students of the 3rd form of the further education college (fields of study: social services, information services and librarianship, economics and enterprise, foreign trade). They have acquired both sufficient professional knowledge (e. g. field of study - business academy: economics, business correspondence, IT) and communication and managerial skills. The students will attend 2 weeks of practice in London in economic and business workplaces, in libraries and organizations providing social services (in two terms, 19 students participating in each term, the 1st term in autumn 2018, the 2nd term in spring 2019). Students, mentored by the company representatives, will be working actively at these workplaces. They will learn to present their work adequately to their mentors, colleagues or customers, which will contribute to the development of their soft-skills. Students will broaden their English professional terminology. New working methods and experience gained in the foreign language environment will be exerted in the Czech Republic during students´ further studies, practice and their involvement in the working process.

The aims of the project:
• increase of students´ knowledge and practical skills in the above mentioned fields of study
• improvement of language skills, development of students´communicative, social and personal competences
• improvement of the quality of skills in the profession, using new approaches, development of informational competences
• verification of the units of learning outcomes in the ECVET frame and their integration into school curricula and practices of students in the Czech Republic
• competitive advantage at the labour market
• knowledge of life and traditions of the visited country
• using innovative methods from the visited country and their dissemination during further studies and practice of students
• obtaining new partners and new contacts for our school, exchange of examples of good practice

Dissemination:
• final report and evaluation (for the recieving partner, Department of Education of the Regional Authority, Chamber of Commerce, National Agency)
• brochure for students intending to participate in a similar mobility project
• informal dissemination via social network
• school conference for students and teachers from various fields of study
• conference for teachers, school management and staff participating in projects
• presentation during meetings of teachers and coordinators of students work placements
• report and publicizing through the school internet site, parent-teacher meetings, Doors Open Day, Fair of Secondary Schools
• publication in local press and on the internet news servers
• public seminar for teachers of other secondary business schools and for project writers from schools in different fields of study
• sharing the units of learning outcomes with partner companies abroad, presentation of the results of the practice and units of learning outcomes at conferences of employers´ associations (carried out by the intermediary organisation)
• presentation at meetings of employers in the region, bulletins, social networks (carried out by the  foreign firms where students worked) 

All above mentioned ways of dissemination ensure the target groups will exploit the gained experience and innovation in their own practice or projects. The outcomes of the project and their impact on target groups (students and teachers both from our school and schools in different fields of study, school management, coordinators of students work placements, project writers from other schools, Department of Education of the Regional Authority, intermediary organisation, foreign firms) will ensure the long-term impact of the  project.

The project "Erasmus - Foreign Internships" is based, among other things, on the still insufficient amount of foreign experience of secondary vocational education students and their teachers, as well as on the applicant's need to make the study of their fields more attractive through international practices, thus distinguishing them from the competitive secondary schools in the region.
The reasons for the implementation of the projects are mainly - the improvement of the quality of vocational education provided by the school through the acquired competencies; applying the theory to practice; enhancing students' employability on the national and European job markets and enhancing the competitiveness of the school; the ability of pupils and all other participants to apply cosmopolitan approaches to thinking and professional development of school staff involved in the project.
The project will be implemented in cooperation with the ADC College. The sending and receiving organizations are competent in the field of Erasmus + project realization and all expected activities are based on a precisely defined timetable and contractual relations of all participants. Each party is provably acquainted with the activities it must provide.
The main objective of the project is to provide students of the Business Academy, IT and Pedagogy courses with a practical work experience abroad, to achieve professional and personal development of participants during foreign work placements in London and to promote the employability of pupils in the national and European labor market. Traineeships will take place in three runs and will include pre-departure planning visits that will test the quality and suitability of businesses for long-term placements; two short-term mobility visits for 15 pupils for 2 weeks, two long-distance mobility trips for three pupils for 14 weeks, and monitoring visits to check and obtain feedback for a potential corrective action.
The main objectives are followed by the partial objectives: - getting acquainted with the working practices, methods and technologies in the host country; getting familiar with examples of good practice and innovative practices in their field in the host country; increasing language skills; using the ECVET and Europass assessment system. The specific tasks for pupils in each field correspond to the Erasmus + VET objectives and are defined through using learning outcomes  based on the profiles of pupils in each field, the National Qualifications Framework and the ECVET system, and they are defined for each field and type of mobility separately.
The target group of short-term mobilities are secondary vocational education students aged seventeen and over - senior students. The target group of long-term mobilities are only adult students, therefore they are students of higher grades, including fresh graduates.  Adult students will be selected because the internal rules of the school do not allow the stay of minors without accompanying person and the length of stay requires a certain degree of autonomy. Higher-age pupils are also selected for all kinds of mobility because of their higher professional and language readiness, their degree of autonomy and their level of responsibility. Pupils fall into the 4th EQF.
The applicant expects  the participation of students in foreign internships will not only help to strengthen their professional and language skills but will also bring enrichment to all parties - new experiences, views, opinions, approaches and solutions. We expect the students to use new working practices and experience in the Czech Republic or on the European labor market. The impact of the project should be at local, regional, national and European level. At the local level we expect a great impact on project participants, 
co-ordinators and other school pupils and teachers, including school management. At the regional level, it is mainly about the impact on the reputation and prestige of  the school and the increased interest of the applicants for education. At the national level, the implementation of the project will mainly contribute to the development of civic competences. Long-term interference is seen by the applicant mainly at European level, in strengthening the sense of European belonging, mutual understanding of cultures, the international transfer of work practices and experience, using a comparable system of recognition of ECVET learning outcomes, reinforcing the principle of internationalization and integration and a competitive capability of project participants on the European labor market.

This two-year project called "Business Internship Abroad" is aimed at 24 students (12 in each of the two cycles) who attend the second, third and fourth year of Commercial Academy,  a vocational secondary school which offers Business and Tourism Programme. The students have knowledge  of some vocational subjects; they need to apply their knowledge in real life working experience. Concerning the English language, the students are at A2-B2 levels of CEFR. They need to develop their language competence in practical communication, both formal and informal. At the same time, they need to improve their intercultural competence. 

The goal of the project is to enable students apply their language and vocational skills and knowledge during a two-week internship in various workplaces. Students will get experience in companies that focus on business, tourism and administration. Another goal is to get students acquainted with new trends in business, tourism and administration. During their internship, students will also develop their oral and written communication skills, as well as their intercultural competence. Another goal of the project is to increase the students´ competitiveness in the labour market. The output of the project is a work experience report and its presentation. Each participant will present their experience to other students and to possible future students of our school. The school will also present the results of the project through various means, mainly on the internet and in the regional media.

Next to developing professional and personal competencies of the students and teachers involved, project benefits will include completing the students´ Europass documents, deepening or establishing cooperation between our school and other organisations, or publicity of the school and Erasmus+ project.

The aim of our project is to support the attractiveness and quality of vocational education of pupils, students and staff of secondary and post- secondary nursing schools. Within the staff mobility three teachers will visit a nursing school in Norway for the purpose of mutual professional development. They would like to share their experience, gain inspiration and start long- term cooperation. Twelve pupils who are being trained for the profession of Nursing Assistant, will take part in a short -term internship in health facilities in Slovakia, Norway and England and three students who are being trained for the profession of Qualified Nurse will take part in long- term internship ErasmusPro in social and health facilities in England. The interns will provide patients´ basic health care under the mentor´s supervision. 
Content and assessment of the internship is defined by the unit of expected learning outcomes according to ECVET. In addition all participants will improve their professional and language skills.
After providing written feedback on the project experience each student will gain Europass Mobility Certificate.  
The desired impact of the project is their motivation for further study and work. We believe that experience of the internship will positively influence personal and professional life and form students´ way of looking at the society and the European Union.

Project, that we want to realize, is buildig on the successful cooperation with the Medical School in Poprad in the Slovak Republic. We want to expand international cooperation of our school with new foreign partner and we will realize internships of our students in a major European country (Great Britain). We know about the problems of youth unemployment and the difficulties with employment in European countries.
We try to realize internships, which will be included as a part of a professional practice acording to the school curriculum and from which students will receive a certificate Europass Mobility. Another goal of the project is to develop the personal aspects of students, to develop their professional skills, to learn different professional approaches abroad, and language improvement too.
Internships will be attended by a group of 16 students of the 3rd and 4th grade of a medical assistant. They  provide basic and specialized nursing care, they contribute to preventive, diagnostic, therapeutic and rehabilitative care and they work with medical documentation.
We want to realize 2 internships abroad in care organizations.  We are planing the project for one year - in autumn 2018 we will prepare the contracts and the necessary documents and selection and preparation of students will be done and we will organize 1 intership in London. In spring 2019 we will organize  2nd  intership in London, UK.
Internships will be recognized based on learning outcomes according to ECVET and students will get Europass Mobility.
After the project there will be the final evaluation and project accounting.
We will inform about the project on the school website, school report, in the press and at events organized by the school or regional organizations.

Secondary Technical School, Business Academy and Secondary Medical School, Chomutov, is the key school in the educational system of region Ústí. It is focused on education of future employees of energetic branch and engineering, building industry, economic and administrative services, integrate rescue system and safety of inhabitants (fire brigade and safety activity) and providing services in the area of health care (nurse) and social facilities. This project Open Door Education comes from developing programs of the school. The aim of this project is to improve the quality of special education and make easier the transfer into the first employment. Supra-national swop enables students to be knowledgeable in their branches and their ability to be a part of labour market; they improve quality and deepen their knowledge and skills. Nobilities have another following effect such as improvement of language ability, communication skills, obtaining or improving self-confidence. Internship should motivate participants to further development and also to pass on these experiences within people of same age, family and friends.
Selection of branches and number of students was done based on partners´ possibilities to ensure internship in a good quality, number of students in each branch, students´ evolvements into former nobilities, recommendations from teachers (particular subjects) and practice.  Just students of particular branches, for these the internship is realized, will be allowed to participate in the selection process. The selection process will be done by committee consists of class master, specific subject´s teacher and practice´s teacher if needed and foreign languages teachers. The order will be stated based on approach to branch and school, rating in key subjects (mainly specific subjects), language skills and concern of each student to be prepared for the internship not just from the knowledge but also from the language point of view. Informative meeting will take place after the selection of participants and alternative members and participants will be informed about the way of preparation for action, contract conditions and economic conditions, practical information. The legal representative must be present at the meeting in case of participants under the legal age of 18 years. 
Total of 10 internships: 
Country Great Britain (London), Germany (Weimar, Hoyerswerda), Slovakia (Trnava), Spain (Sevilla)
Internship length 14 days (10 working days): 
Specialization: Mechanic electrician, Mechanic of electrical equipment, Security system, Safety and protection of population, Technic of fire protection, Business academy, Social work, Medical assistant, Locksmith, Electrician
Number of participants: 82 (75 students of graduation courses, 7 students of vocational courses)
Number of accompanying people: 15;
Term: autumn 2018, spring 2019, autumn 2019;
Program: according to set up units ECVET
The project will be led by manager who will manage all activities and provide information on the progress in management meetings. For participants will be collectively provided accommodation, food, insurance, transportation, vocational and language training by broadcasting organizations. Monitoring will be carried out in all periods. Mentoring will be provided by accompanying person and assigned workers of receiving organizations. Publicity of the project will be ongoing through social networks, websites and regional newspapers. Evaluation of the internships will be done with the participation of social partners of the sending organization with the transfer of good practice as well as in cooperation in the Czech Republic.
In the project will be used the principles of the European Credit System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET). This system will help to ensure the quality of international mobility, transparency of qualifications and then transfer it into the cooperation between schools and companies at home and abroad. Adjusted learning units of results describe what knowledge, skills and competencies should participant during the internship learn. They will still be adjusted after final clarification of the term and the final host organization. For internship in the organization is set up a detailed program, incl. field trips.

This project will provide students an opportunity to experience informal and practical acquisition of knowledge and skills. This experience offers students a chance to greater employability in the local and European labour market also thanks to ECVET which supports greater transparency and quality of practical trainings. This project will deepen school´s international relations and provide  professional development for the employees. This project includes 18 students studying Business Academy and Economic Lyceum. It is intended for students of the third year of study, since this is the year when students go through a practical training in various enterprises. Students, aged 17-18, will take part in a three-week professional training in the field of trade and business administration in the surroundings of London, Great Britain. There they will be placed in local shops and enterprises in spring 2019. Students will get an opportunity to go abroad and employ their knowledge in an authentic setting. The main aims of this projects are acquisition of  business knowledge, applying of theoretical knowledge into practice, getting acquainted with real business communication and negotiations, comparing foreign and local trade and services, practising and improving their English language and English business correspondence, getting acquainted with culture and habits of an English-speaking country. The implementation of the project will be managed by the school as a sending organization and ADC College as an intermediary organization. The sending organization will organize selection of participants, their language and professional training, transport to the work place and monitoring of the project and internship, final evaluation and dissemination of results. The intermediary organization will ensure work placement of students, accommodation with host families, including food and transportation to/ from the place of internship, insurance, monitoring and evaluation. Apart from an official evaluation, students will participate in the presentation of their experience and results in their practical training at our school (or even on a regional level). After completing their training, students are expected to make two presentations. One focused on trade and business administration, in which they will include their expectations compared to gained experience, they will compare means of trading in a foreign country and the Czech Republic. The other presentation will concern language points, such as business communication, acquisition of new English vocabulary, and cultural points. They will present these outcomes in classes and discussions to inform and motivate other students. The school will set a permanent room called Erasmus+ Room which will be used for dissemination and evaluation of the project. The school accompanying person will evaluate the training from his/ her perspective and will present it to school management and public at special occasions such as inspections, open house days etc. The project and its realization will be published on school web pages, or in local press and media.
EuskillPro - Aktivně do Evropy - aktivně do života

The aim of the project is to follow up the previous project and enable motivated  students of the 3rd grade to learn methods and procedures of work in foreign companies in correspondence with their branch of study, improve their communication in foreign language, their self-confidence in terms of professional competences and improve their position on the job market, both in domestic and foreign companies.  Then there is a tie-in intenship of three successful graduates of our school who will have the opportunity to follow up their experience and work for three months in a London company, as a bridge between the education and successul working life. 
The students will take up their internship in companies and organizations in London. This training follows-up their compulsory practical training in the third year of study according to the School Educational Plan. The important aims of the project are  getting to know economic situation abroad, inter-cultural education, professional mprovement, education towards tolerance, independence, flexibility, independent decision-making and professional self-confidence.
The training is planned for 20 students of the third year of study programmes: IT (10 students), Social Care (6-7 students) and  Economics and Business (3-4 students) and will last for  3 weeks.  The long-term internship is for 3 months and is meant for three fresh graduates of the IT branch. 
Students will work in London in companies according to their branch of study, will work on their tasks given in the Learning Agreement and  the prepared Learning Units according to ECVET methodology  and at the end they will be tested if the have acquired the new knowledge and skills.. Social care students will work for Care Homes, Economics students for a travel agency and IT students in software companies dealing with development of educational software or computer support for companies, computer graphics, antivirus protection or a company providing repairs. 
In London there are found working people from the whole world on all positions and levels, which should influence the students´ opinions on different nations and ethnic groups.
We will cooperate with ADC College because this organization has long experience of successfully developing and executing international mobility programmes in partnership with educational institutions from all across Europe. Over the years, training and development sessions have been delivered to course participants from almost all European countries, and programmes have been continuously improved. 
During the short-term mobility, students will be supported by one language teacher and one vocational subject teacher, while the graduates will go for the internship independently. After the sucessfull testing they will get the Europass Mobility certificate which they can add to their job portfolios. All the time they will live in English families, so that they will get to know also the culture and everyday life. 
The graduates of the international work training will  master the language and will have positive experience with the work abroad which will make them more self-confident and more willing to job migration than those without this experience. They can also be prepared to work for international or global companies where English tends to be the language of communication. 
The feedback of the project will influence the life  and atmosphere of the whole school,  which has over 1200 students, by both sharing the mobility gratuates´ experience and impact on the vocational subjects curriculum based on feedback from the consultations with the companies where the mobilities will take place, according to real life requirements.

The project is submitted by Business Academy and HPS Valašské Meziříčí (further BA).

The main interest of the project is to send our students into international mobilities offering work experience abroad. This project is divided into two parts, in two destinations – Dublin (October 2018) and London (May 2019). The project will be offered to students from all of our fields of study (Business Academy, Public Administration and Information Technology). The internship will be recognized as a compulsory practice for the pupils. Thanks to the internship in an English speaking country, pupils will gain valuable experience, which will be a prerequisite for their future use in business fields and IT.
The main objective of the project is applying, improvement and verification of professional competences, skills and knowledge in work experience with an active use of professional terminology in English. 

Other objectives are qualification extension by work experience abroad, obtaining high-quality experience within real companies, improvement of key professional abilities and skills regarding the labour market, personal skills development, the extension of international dimension of education and vocational training and their synergy with the labour market, the internationalisation and innovation of education, the innovation of specialized subjects curricula to meet potential employers’ requirements and improvement in competitiveness and reputation of the school.
 
The work experience will involve 25 students of the 3rd and 4th year of all 3 fields of BA. In two weeks of practice, the students will work in various positions as: office workers, accountant assistants, graphics and IT technicians. The trainees will have a full-time job, usually from 9am to 17pm.
Tasks according to the position:
-using MS Office 
-repairing computers and another IT equipment
-web research on the Internet
- updating database and document organisation
-copying, faxing and scanning documents
-marketing
-ordering and sale of goods
-dealing with customers
-work with web pages and multimedia files
-using internal software
-sorting and storing documents into appropriate folders 
-business correspondence and accoutancy
-etc.

Our partner organization is ADC College, because after many years of collaboration, we still have good experience with them. In fact, they are responsible for the choice of high quality employers according to elaborated biographies and filled registration forms of the participants.
Before being trained, students prepare a CV and complete registration forms so that they can be then assigned to an appropriate company according to their study fields. 
 In addition, ADC will arrange accommodation in host families, transfer from the airport, local transport and insurance for the trainees during the traineeship. BA is responsible for the selection of the trainees according to the stated criteria. BA will organize preparatory courses in specialized subjects, language and cultural background and risks prevention training. BA will also arrange transportation to and from the UK.

Project and quality management will be legally ensured by the following documents – Letter of Intent and Memorandum of Understanding, contracts between BA and the partners and individual contracts between BA and the trainees (Participant Agreement, Quality Commitment and Learning Agreement including an ECVET unit of learning outcomes.

Mentoring and monitoring will be carried out by several subjects - accompanying persons, the managers and coordinators from the partner organizations and mentors at particular work places. There will be issued 2 certificates, i. e.  Europass Mobility documents and partner’s certificates. Final reports will be completed after the work experience.
 
The trainees are expected to gain new theoretical and especially practical knowledge and competences (knowledge, skills and attitudes) with respect to the labour market and further study at secondary schools or at universities. We also expect to improve the competence of accompanying persons. Longer term benefits for the students are: motivation towards further study, participation in other projects, the extension of qualification, higher chances to be admitted to universities, improvement in competitiveness at the labour market not only in our country but in the EU.

Longer term benefits for BA are: implementation of gained knowledge and experience into the curricula of specialized subjects and English followed by their innovation, improvement in work experience management in our country, increasing the competitiveness and prestige of the school, increasing number of students in subsequent years, motivating teachers to participate in projects, gaining experience in preparing and implementing other projects, internationalisation of education and raising awareness of EU programs.
Podpora odborného vzdělávání a přípravy v sektoru zdravotnických a sociálních služeb

The Secondary Medical School and the Higher Medical School in Nymburk (SZŠ / VOŠZ) prepared the Erasmus + KA Project 1 - The individual learning mobility for a period of 24 months. The start date of the project is 1.9. 2018, the end of the project is 30.8.2020.
Students.
The project includes mobilities of 12 students of the Secondary School from the programe Health Assistant, Social Activity, Assistant Dental Technician, 6 students of the Higher Technical School of the Diploma Dental Technician and Diploma Dental Hygienist and 8  Teachers. 12 Mobilities are long term-MobilityPro organised for 90 days, 6 Mobilities are prepared  for 30 days. 12 mobilities are organized as an internship in the enterprise, 6 mobilities will be organized as an internship in the organization of vocational training.
The school partners are from France (Dijon) and Spain (Sevilla), with whom we have been cooperating on a long-term basis, and two  agencies with whom we have established cooperation at a contact seminar organized by DZS Prague in November 2017, Europroyectos Erasmus Plus SL, Cordoba , Spain and ADC College, London.
The trainees will go abroad in the spring of 2019 (April-July) and in the spring of 2020 (April-July), always during the period of professional practice.
The aim of the project is to support the school's international strategies, to improve the quality of school management work, to support and development the key competences of pupils and students in the field of vocational and language education, their ability to orient themselves in practice, and to independently perform work tasks. Further support for self-confidence, self-reliance on health care, development of empathy, ability to take responsibility for work, ability to work and communicate in a multidisciplinary team, to establish contact and effectively communicate with clients and their families.
Another objective is to increase the employability of graduates in the labor market in Europe, to develop autonomy, ability to travel, live and work in another geographic and cultural environment, internationalization.
To improve the quality of VET, to precisely determine the knowledge, skills and competencies that trainees will practice, their assessment, validation and recognition are developed for each high school and higher education unit (ECVET). For long-term (3-month) mobility, 3 units of learning result are prepared, for monthly mobility of 1 JVU.
The evaluation of the JVU will be carried out by a foreign mentor, validated at the school and the results will subsequently be recognized for classification in the relevant professional subjects.
Teachers.
The project also includes 8 lecturers from dental hygiene, dental technology, nursing and nursing. Teachers will be educated in 5 day shading. Two teachers will take part in a Dijon (taking-care) internship, 2 internships in London (nursing), 2 dental hygiene teachers will shadow their colleagues in Spain (Seville), and 2 teachers will take part in a weekly internship in Granada (Dental Technology). The shadowing of teachers will be organized in the same terms as the student placements of the pupils and students, ie in spring 2019 and spring 2020.
The aim of teacher mobility is to increase their professional competence in the field of teaching methodology (introduction of ICT into teaching, new methods, techniques of work), increasing the readiness to introduce news into education and practice, transferring innovative practices into education and practice, familiarizing with the training system in countries EU, the ability to initiate changes in organization and teaching at school and in practice, addressing current issues in nursing (population aging, migration), understanding the relationship between school and out-of-school education, training and practice, promoting language competencies.
To disseminate the results of the project we will use the transfer of information of trainees through social networks, school Facebook, blogs, school website, message boards, information boards, banners will all have the logo of the project.
