In addition, presentations of the trainees will be prepared in connection with the workshops and discussions on the mobility course, the presentation of the project by the school headmaster for the founders, the directors of the health schools, and the management of the cooperating institutions. Articles will be prepared for Teacher's News, Local and Regional Press (Nymbursky diary, MF Dnes).
We will use the E-TWINNING, EPALE and GOOGLE DISK platforms to disseminate the results of the project electronically within the EU. In addition, a presentation in English will be prepared for dissemination of the results of the project and will be sent to cooperating foreign partners. An important form of promotion and dissemination of project results is the organization of a school day project.
Za odbornými kompetencemi do Londýna II

The target of this project is to complete professional competency of students, which they can acquire not just in theory but also in practical teaching of vocational subjects. In this project students acquire practical expertise and skills abroad, through internships in companies in the UK.
Placements in enterprises will be designed for students of third year of Hotel Industry and Tourism, and Economy and Services educational programmes. Internships are focused on area of hotel industry and gastronomy, administration and business, media and graphics.
Within two-week internships in area of London students will utilize their theoretical expertise in real situations, and thus gain new experience in their branch. At the same time, students will learn to work in a foreign environment of their branch and deepen their language competency and skills that will help them to assert themselves when entering the labour market.
The internships will guide students to self-reliance, higher level of responsibility, they will increase their self-confidence and will help them to develop their intercultural competency.
The project supports the use of European tools Europass – Mobility, Europass Curriculum Vitae (CV), the European Credit System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET).

"Praktyki w Londynie" (Internship in London) project is addressed to the teachers and the students of Vocational High School (ZSZ) in Aleksandrow Lodzki. The project is going to be carried out within 24 months starting from 01/10/2018 
The participants of the project are to take part in a two-week (students) and a one-week (teachers) vocational trainning  in companies and institutions in London. The project is going to be realised in cooperation with ADC College with its seat in North London. 
The anticipated dates of mobilities are spring 2019, summer 2019,  autumn 2019 and spring 2020. 
60 students of ZSZ including IT technicians, economics and retail technicians, tourism technicians and advertising technicians and 6 teachers of vocational education and trainning will take part in the project.

General target of the project:

- increasing the school's recognition in the local environment and improvement of school's performance.

Detailed targets of the project:

- increasing students' chances of finding a job in accordance with their profession by gaining work experience on the European job market,
- advancement in students' professional competence in diagnosing and maintenance of hardware and its peripherials, website design, implementation of International Accounting Standards, creating marketing products by the use of graphic programmes, goods exposition, booking programmes used in tourism,
- development of participants' communicating language skills,
- improving participants'  professional English language skills, 
- development of participants' interpersonal skills 
- increase in multicultural awerness of students (promoting open, tollerant attitude, eliminating stereotypes),
- development of students' interpersonal skills (improving team work skills and ability to adapt to new environment),
- learning the international employer requirements,
- mastering the skills desired by employers (punctuality, responsibility),
- mastering teaching methods and tools as well as improving learning techniques,
- eliminating burnout,

In order to gain the above mentioned aims, the following actions are going to be taken:
- forming top-priority skills which participants should master during the vocational training,
- evaluating participants' level of English on the basis of language competence tests,
- carrying out English lessons  and cultural workshops,
- informing participants about the EU projects' certificates (eg. Europass Mobility and Europass Language Passport),
- acknowledging students with the training programme, the mobility schedule and tools used for monitoring the students' performance during the training in London,
- introduction meetings with participants,
- mobilities in London,
- passing the information about the completed project on to the local TV, the school website and on the Internet,
- sharing project experience with other teachers from: ZSZ, local schools, Poland and Europe.

The project's actions will be taken by partners 4-5 months before the beginning of the first mobility. The process connected with training placement will be based on professional individual needs of each participant, their language test results and covering letters.
Participants will stay with English families, which will enable them to develop their interpersonal and language competences, as well as associate with British culture, customs and traditions. While looking for the participants' accommodation, ADC College will take into consideration the distance to the place of training. 
Cultural classes conducted by ZSZ teachers before the mobility will be complemented by adaptation classes organized by ADC College staff in London. 
In order to monitor the students' performance during the training, the ZSZ teachers accompanying students during the mobility will cooperate on daily basis with the students' mentors in their workplaces. Moreover, students will fill in the training documents online every day so that the vocational training teachers in Poland can also monitor their progress. Both ADC College and ZSZ staff will support all participants before and during the mobility.
The participation in the project will promote vocational education in the region and improve the quality of the school's work. 
Future graduates will gain both excellent general and vocational education as well as skills required on the demanding European job market. Thanks to the project realisation the school will set an example of sharing good practice in the local environment.
The ZSZ teachers involved in the project will get knowledge needed to upgrade the school vocational and training programme according to the latest, high-quality European standards. They will also gain skills and experience useful in applying for other projects supported by EU.
Przyszli Eurofachowcy uczą się w Malborku

“Future European professionals learn in Malbork” is a project which the Secondary Schools Complex No 3 in Malbork is going to elaborate together with the foreign business partners ADC College from London, Casa da Educacao from Lisbon and Sistema Turismo ETN group from Rimini.
Meeting the needs of its students, the Secondary Schools Complex No 3 in Malbork prepares the youth to find their own  place in demanding job market of these days. Creating friendly atmosphere, the school enables the  students to achieve a wide range of professions such as hotel management technician, tourism service technician,  logistics technician, Information Technology technician.
While teaching the school devotes attention to cultivating proper attitudes of its students. For years the school has been a leader among vocational schools that meets the needs of local job market. 
The aim of the project is to use and develop professional skills altogether with social,  personal and language skills. This way the trainees will be enabled to  gain work experience, professional awareness by finding out about opportunities and perspectives of the chosen occupation and it may enhance their chances to get desired professional skills. 
The  project  presents the idea of four- week professional apprenticeship, prepared from 15 September to 12 October 2019, for the group of forty-five students from the third technical classes in the occupations of: hotel management, tourism service, nourishment and catering, logistics, Information Technology technicians. There are also three attendant teachers who will take care of the participating students.
The school is responsible for recruitment and preparing the participants of the project to departure. The students are to take part in series of classes which are especially arranged to equip them with the appropriate  knowledge about culture, character of professions and other useful  information such as staying away from home, dealing with homesickness or adjusting to new situations. The participants will take language tests to check their language skills. Those going to Rimini in Italy will take part in a course of Italian for beginners. The planned activities will verify skills of the participants.
The participants going to Portugal will take part in a course on Portuguese language during the first week of the stay in Lisbon. 
The transit from Malbork to the destination places is ensured. The foreign Partners in the cooperation with our school will organize accommodation with full board. Appropriate places of apprenticeship will be also chosen accordingly to the aims of the project and all local transfers will be provided. Additionally, all the participants will be insured.
The quality and progressing will be observed by the Partners, attending teachers and the school. Planned accomplishment of the apprenticeship will be inspected by checking notes in the apprenticeship journals and on visits. The journals and a detailed plan will be prepared before the beginning.  The supervisors  will be responsible for marking the students’ apprenticeship time. The mark is an  integrated part of the journal and it will be the primary and essential part to complete the training.
Taking part in such project will influence personal development of the participants, increase their independence, responsibility and resourcefulness, it will increase their self-confidence and self – esteem  as well as improve their self- assessment. The participants will have the chance to accomplish the apprenticeship,  develop their passions accordingly to the educational plan, broaden professional knowledge and learn to use the skills in practice.
All the partners in agreement  with the employers will deliver a special document certifying completing the apprenticeship. Achieved competences will  be confirmed with Europass Mobility document. 
After approving the project application, the Partners will develop and implement ECVET,  for all the professions  units of learning outcomes will be created. These indicators will be marked with adjusted verification tools, a marking system will also be developed by the Partners. 
By  participating in the project the school will increase the attractiveness of vocational educating program and will improve its quality. The school will be regarded as modern and pro-European one. That will be a chance to indicate young people where new development’s  and work’ s  perspectives  after completing the school are.
The position of school in the local environment  as well as regarding  the school by the local society will also benefit.  By completing the project the school will develop even closer relationship with the press, administration units, students’  parents, local businesspeople and it will share its experience with other schools with similar educating profiles.
Patways for upskilling students in Europe

The project responds to the need that VET schools have to provide their students with the chance to increase and improve the quality of vocational training, by taking internships in European companies, and getting in contact with the single European labour market.

The success of the collaboration in the previous consortium integrated by 9 Public VET schools of the Valencian Region and promoted by the IES Ramón Esteve, the high rate of insertion of the students to the labor market (90%), the great interest and the satisfaction of the students and the coordinators who participated in the previous project, as well as the close and fluid collaboration of the VET schools involved in the consortium, have fostered the present project that it will satisfy the demands of the VET schools makes possible the collaboration with enterprises at national  and European level. The dissemination actions of the results have made possible the incorporation of 2 VET schools more.

The project integrated by 11 VET schools in Valencian Region is adressed to 77 VET students and former students who are doing the 2nd year of the cycles of intermediate level in informatics and communications, agrarian and administration; or graduates in the last year: medium-level technicians from these specialties. The project foresees 8 monthly flows (4 to Italy, 1 to Portugal, 1 to Brussels, 1 to Latvia and 3 to UK) and 2 Erasmus Pro flows of three months (1 to Italy and 1 to UK) Each VET schoolwill select 2 former students and 5 students, one of them Erasmus Pro. There are 5 flows to Italy and 3 to the UK because the profile of the partners as well as the different geographical areas of them will enable the students to carry out their work. training in different fields since companies, even if they are from the same sectors, are very different.

The main OBJECTIVE of the project is:
To allow VET students to develop, through training practices in European companies, the skills and abilities to complete, in a practical way, the skills acquired in VET to be incorporated efficiently into the  European labor market, either on account own or for others. To do this, VET students needs to develop specific tecnical skills on the specialty that they has studied, but transversal, social and intercultural skills will also be necessary to face new challenges and become active citizens with values for the future.

The main ACTIVITIES  will be carried out are:
- PREPARATION of the motilities: selection of the participants, initial evaluation of their competences, pre-departure training of participants, logistics and agreements’ tasks definition, coordination, etc.
- IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MOBILITY. Implementing the internship programs in the companies. The mobility also includes cultural activities.
- EVALUATION OF THE PARTICIPANTS. The competences that will be acquired during the stay abroad will be evaluated according to the ECVET system and will be previously set, during the initial evaluation. All the internship activities will be planned to achieve these competences and will be customized.
- MONITORING. The development of the internships will be monitored by all the tools and processes, previously agreed by the project.
- EVALUATION OF THE PROJECT. 
- DISSEMINATION. The dissemination activities will be carried out in all project’s phases. A final conference for the dissemination of the project’s results will be organized. Besides the impact on the participants, the project will benefit all partners, fostering the European cooperation and relationships between companies and educational centres.

The DISSEMINATION activities and the mobility itself will generate an IMPACT at local, regional and national level. 

The IMPACT of the project will be:
The project will improve the opportunities for VET students to be actively incorporate national or European labor market, either on their own account or as an employee, in a more effective way
The collaboration between the participating organizations will allow promoting European cooperation and internationalization and it will make it possible to bring companies closer to VET schools and it will improve too the collaboration with other VET schools, public authotities, etc. It will give participating entities a vision about most demanded professional profiles and the skills that students must learn

The project is directly linked to the 2020 strategy, the skills agenda and the European priorities  to help the EU and its Member States generate a higher level of employment, productivity ,social cohesion and development.
Staż w zagranicznym przedsiębiorstwie szansą na podniesienie kompetencji zawodowych.

The project "Placement in an enterprise abroad as a chance of better occupational and language competence" is  prepared by Centrum Kształcenia Ustawicznego im. Jana Matejki in Cracow in Poland with the aim to increase occupational competence of the participants from IT, administration and accounting in the real working environment in the companies in Dublin in Ireland. The participants will also develope their language competence, especially in using occupational language, will acquire new experience and business contacts during their work in an international team in a company, which organization and functioning differs from that in Poland. The project will help the participants to prepare for their future job and will increase their chances for finding work. The participants will receive Europass Mobility and ECVET documents. Taking part in the project will also foster personal development of students, building their entrepreneurial skills in a professional environment, competitiveness, independence, openess and ability to deal with problems in a different environment. It will also facilitate to establish the sense of belonging to a wider, economically and culturally diverse community - European Union. The IT, administration and accounting students will attend apprenticeship in the following companies in Dublin: Accountable Chartered Certified Accountants and Auditors, Alan Moore Tax Consultants, Beatrice - Translating and Interpreting Services, CitySightseeing Dublin/Dublin VisitorCentre, DJC Accounting Services Ltd, Dublin City Hotel, FMC Financial Management Consultants, O'Callaghan Head Office, The Freebird Club. The apprenticeship will be held from 14.01.2019 to 25.01.2019 and organized by ADC College from London. The participants will be 20 students from the first, second and third term of IT Technical College, Administration College and Accounting College and two teachers. They will also develop social and individual skills, will enhance their self-esteem, confidence, responsibility, ability to work in a team. The sending institution will develop the partnership with ADC College which will be used to future mobility projects or partnership projects. Promotion of the results of the project will ehance motivation of students and teachers to develop their language competence and extend their knowledge of other European Union countries, will increase the quality of work in the institution and its cometitiveness in the local community - the district, the city and the whole region. Participation in the project will contribute to development of understanding intercultural differences and opening the participant’s mind to other cultures  and different lifestyles in contemporary Europe. Sharing and exchanging experiences and good practice as well as acquiring new skills will bring long term benefits not only participants of the project but also the institution, other students and teachers and the local community. The results of the project will be promoted by a rage of dissemination activities, e.i. a formal meeting with the representatives of the local goverment, education authorities, teachers from other schools, journalists. The students will share acquired knowledge and skills with other students during meetings and on school website and Facebook. The result of the project will be also a creation of more modern, involved and professional workplace that will be open for cooperation with other organizations. The project will be evaluated at all levels of its realisation - preliminary, ongoing and final evaluation.
Staże zagraniczne inwestycją w przyszłość i sukces zawodowy uczniów

The project "Foreign internships as an investment in the future and professional success of students" is a response to the needs of students of Centrum Kształcenia Zawodowego i Ustawicznego nr 1 in Racibórz. Students are trained in the following specialties: nutrition and catering services technician, hospitality technician, building construction technician, landscape architecture technician, logistics technician and economist technician. 
There will be 38 third grade students who will take part in the project and will go in 2 groups  (I group-20 students, II group-18 students) and their 2 teachers on a 4-week vocational training to Spain and United Kingdom on the dates: 05.05–01.06.2019, and 29.09-26.10.2019. 
The length of the training results from the technical school curriculum in the 3rd grade and it is adequate to achieve the desired objectives.The Partnership Organizations are Mobility Projects from Spain and Kairos Europe from the UK, which bounded themselves to the choice of host institutions in accordance with professional profile of the participantsand the school's fields of training.
The main aim of the project is the improvement of quality of vocational education of participants, and the growth of professional personal and linguistic competences of the project participants.
The project also meets the school's needs: increasing attractiveness, gaining prestige and increasing competitiveness on the education market. A beneficial aspect of foreign internships will be the establishment of international cooperation-one of the objectives of our school's European Development Plan.
Detailed aims of the project:
-providing participants with the opportunity to improve their professional skills, gain new qualifications and skills
-the acquisition of valuable professional experience that will allow young people to become more competitive on the labor market
-comparison of ways of organizing work in the country and abroad, meeting new technologies and methods of work
-raising the level of language skills, personal development
The students will be selected through a clear and fair recruitment. 
In order to prepare for mobility, the participants will take part in:
-psychological and pedagogical preparation to help participants find themselves in a foreign culture-10 hours
And:
a) Group I:
-English course focused on vocational vocabulary-30-h
-Spanish course with elements of knowledge about history, geography, and culture of Spain-20-h
b) Group II:
-English course focused on vocational  vocabulary-50-h

The appointment of the Project Group guarantees high project implementation. Participants are provided with flight, accommodation, food, insurance and a range of cultural activities. Together with the Partner Organizations, the enterprises were selected, for each profile a traineeship program was developed, which was approved by the host organizations.
Throughout the whole project, an evaluation will be carried out which will examine the degree of achieved program objectives, identify weaknesses of the project and the collected applications will be used to improve the quality of subsequent projects.
The project will have an impact on participants, teachers, and the local environment.

The result of the foreign internship will be:
Hard results:
-The Europass Mobility document confirming the professional competence of the participant at the European level
-a certificate issued by recipient organizations for foreign practices,
-an appraisal of professional internship

Soft results: 
-raising the level of knowledge and professional competences 
-an increase in English proficiency
-shaping entrepreneurship and creativity
-increase of self-confidence, faith in your own abilities
-motivation to learn foreign languages
-knowledge of the culture and history of Spain/UK 
Project products: 
-collection of British cuisine recipes 
-instructional video-synchronous consumer service 
-instructional video-accepting complaints in the hotel 
-the description of Spanish plants
-instruction of building a house 
-multimedia presentations 
-a movie of mobility 
The project's results for the school will be: 
-improving the quality and attractiveness of vocational education 
-gaining experience by the teachers, the headmaster and accountant which will be used in the preparation of other projects.
In order to share the results of the project, dissemination activities will be carried out: 
-conference summarizing the project with a show of skills and competences acquired during the internship in the form of refreshments, multimedia presentations with information about the mobility. 
-organization of British cuisine workshops-project participants cook together with junior school students.
-at the Education Fair, Open Days, Festival of Perspectives (promotion of vocational schools), the films, presentations, photos, leaflets will be shown.
The project will contribute to adapting the participants' qualifications to European standards.

The project OPEN MIND TO INNOVATIVE SKILLS wants to give continuity to the educational paths regarding digital competences already developed by the adult schools in consortium. These paths regard in particular the introduction of ICT tools in didactics and in terms of writing skills and planning of complex European projects.

OBJCTIVES


1. Carry on the process of digital education in the field of Adult Education. In a first step we tried to innovate the didactics with digital tools (fad, an introduction of moodle, didactics supported by ICT tools etc.), now we want to take a further step: educate adults at digital education from a social perspective, at a right civic use, indeed Social Education.  


2. Enhance the skills in term of European project management. Time after time, our staff has gained more and more practical skills in managing some programs, in particular PON (the Italian National Operating Program) or in some specific action of Erasmus Program edited in Italian. However it faces some limits when it comes to more complex tools, run directly by The European Commission (such as Horizon, Rec, Interreg, ENPI etc.), which are more in line with our needs and at the same time useful to give a high impact on adults.


In particolar, this project promotes the participation of 20 staff members for 2 courses on 

“Social Education”
“Writing of European proposals in English”


To ease the participation at the trainings we will activate 5 further mobilities for teachers and members of the consortium with poor English competences to enhance their linguistic skills. The participants will take part in courses in specialized schools of English to improve their “speaking” and “listening” skills.
Re-thinking Migration: from current realities to future challenges

OPEN YOUR MIND, aims to promote the training of Young workers for the cultural enrichment of the Euro-Mediterranean youngest citizens, dismantling stereotypes that exist towards muslims, based on recognition and respect for diversity, through exchange, dialogue, and active participation in the development of audiovisual projects, which together form a plural awareness campaign, cultural and attractive content for the youth, in order to promote the building of a democratic society based on equality, tolerance and solidarity among Euro-Mediterranean peoples.

The project stems from the need seven social organizations and youth sector in Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom, Poland, Egypt and Jordan to identify new ways of doing WORKING FOR YOUTH EUROMEDITERRANEA. The new realities and cultural challenges posed by new perspectives and ways of approaching problems before we met. In this context it is that this meeting of experts from the youth arises, in order to form us into new ways of doing YOUTH CAMPAIGN to combat hate speech, seizing the opportunities of the Internet and social networks.

The meeting of thirty youth workers, look this way, promote the exchange of experiences, creativity and social innovation applied to the design of a collective awareness campaign, awareness and education with young people from Euro-Mediterranean countries.
Internationale Kompetenzen für Auszubildende am Adolf-Kolping-Berufskolleg V

With this project (International Competences for Teachers and Students in Vocational Education and Training at Adolf-Kolping-Berufskolleg V) we are following our agenda of internationalisation set in the application for the Erasmus VET Mobility Charter.

As far as aspect 1 (expansion of mobilities) is concerned we can say that we have found two new partners to consolidate and extend the number of VET mobility projects. The new partners are the I.E.S. Zaidin-Vergeles in Granada, Andalucia, Spain and the CIFP La Laboral in Gijon, Asturias, Spain. We are now cooperating with eleven vocational schools, two intermediary organisations and one NGO in six European countries as compared to nine schools in five European countries in the 2017call.

The I.E.S. Zaidin-Vergeles and the CIFP La Laboral will engage with us in a reciprocal cooperation. We are sending and receiving students from the IT sector. Both the EU-coordinators at I.E.S. Zaidin-Vergeles  and CIFP La Laboral are very experienced in both KA1 and KA2 projects and are therefore welcome partners. They both have a simliar profile as our school which enables them to find adequate internplaces for our students which can be evaluated using ECVET tools. This brings added value to our mobility projects.

We have also started to cooperate with I.E.S. Zaidin-Vergeles and the CIFP La Laboral in order to consolidate and later extend the numbers of mobilities in the IT sector. Our other partners in Spain, especially on Tenerife,  suffer from the economic crisis and find it increasingly difficult to offer suitable internships for our IT students. Many small companies in Spain and especially on Tenerife have closed over the recent years and therefore we are trying to broaden the foundation for our future IT mobilities with the help of new partners. Last year we started working with a school near Barcelona and we are going to continue that cooperation.

Aspect 2 of our agenda of internationalisation concerns the improvement of the mutual recognition of learning outcomes in Europe. We have been using ECVET Learning Agreements and ECVET assessment sheets very consistently to prepare and evaluate mobilities and we have gained positive experiences with them. The use of the ECVET toolkit also enables our partners and us to extend our student's competencies in a very target oriented fashion.

Last but not least we are encouraging our staff to go on jobshadowing projects to our manifold partners (aspect 3 of our agenda). In this project we are going to send two of our educational staff on such projects. By doing so we not only hope to cultivate our contacts but also we hope for a positive effect on our staff's teaching skills. All colleagues who go abroad are therefore obliged to disseminate their experiences at especially scheduled staffmeetings.

The submitted project in frame of the program Erasmus+ International Work Experience of the Secondary school of Commerce (Obchodná akadémia), Kukučínova 2, Trnava, Slovakia is based on the Strategy of the European internationalisation of the school. The project consists of the vocational training of the VET learners with duration of 3 weeks taking place in the host companies in Austria and in the UK. One of the significant elements within the vocational training of the learners is the interconnection between the theoretical studies and practical activity of the students in international companies. The added value is development of soft skills, ICT and language skills. Another part of the project is the VET staff training abroad which will be taking place in Cyprus and Spain. In the work experience will take part 30 students together with the accompanying persons; 15 participants in Vienna and 15 in London.
We decided to implement the vocational training also in a German speaking country as we realised the German and Austrian companies conducting their business activity in Slovakia have serious problems to find German speaking employees. It is particularly difficult to find an employee with at least the level B1 of German language skills. We have to emphasise that German and Austrian companies are very important for the Slovak economy.
As the participants are the secondary school students and they will be in a foreign environment, they will be accompanied by two accompanying persons, teachers of our school at each of the mobilities. The accompanying persons will provide for the supervision and monitoring of the participants during the preparatory stage, the journey to the destination as well as during the whole stay. The selected teachers speak English or German fluently, they have experience with the international projects, so they will be able to deal with any difficulties operatively or to solve any possible problems. The accompanying persons will participate in the monitoring in the host companies, meetings and discussions with the responsible persons, will gain the feedback from the companies and participants, and will be responsible for preparation of the respective project documentation.
The participants will gain direct experience from a longer-term stay abroad, will get to know the diversity of the European capital cities, will have the opportunity to use the foreign language in real life situations, they will experience real work in international companies, and they will have the possibility to interact with the colleagues at their workplace. Significant is also the personal and professional growth and development of soft skills. The participants will be prepared for their working career and for managing different life situations. However, the process will not be only one-sided, the partner organisations will gain interesting experience from the Slovak students, what will contribute to the development of the European dimension. 
The main aim of the VET staff training abroad - job shadowing is strengthening of the participation in mobility projects for improvement of key competences and skills of the participants and increasing the quality of the educational process at school. The need of the school is to strengthen the managerial compentences of the employees in the area of the project management, expanding and improving the entrepreneurial education, strengthening the application of soft skills in the education (synergy with vocational training in Austria and in the UK), work in the projects, use of practical activities, case studies to problem solving and decision making, development and sharing experience from the previous projects as well as emphasis on the teacher profile. Job shadowings with the duration of one week are focused on the effective and efficient project management of the EU funded projects, entrepreneurial education taught in a practical way. The participants will be actively involved before the training (self-study of materials provided in advance), during as well as after the job shadowing.
Both participants are teachers of vocational subjects using CLIL and active members of the project team.

Our involvement in Erasmus+ contributes to achieving the main goal of our school  which is the sustainable and continuous quality improvement of the educational process in compliance with the mission and key values of the school. Our vision is to become a learning school enabling learning to all its stakeholders and thus to facilitate continuous improvement for itself. We are convinced that our participation in the Erasmus+ program will contribute to making this vision true.

The project „Learning by doing vocational practice in Europe“ continues the cooperation between OA Příbram, ADC London and BBS Idar-Oberstein. Its realisation will help to implement the internationalisation strategy of our school. The project includes three activities – Short term mobility of VET learners, Mobility of staff – job shadowing and Erasmus PRO- long term mobility of VET learners.

A1 – The aim of Short term mobility of VET learners is the realisation of training in companies in Germany and the United Kingdom. The length of two weeks fully corresponds with the vocational stay in the Czech Republic. This activity will have 28 participants from the secondary vocational school and higher professional school, 22 will do their practice in the UK, 6 in Germany in the branches retailtrade, management and administration. The stays will be organised in three flows, accompanying teachers will be involved in two of them, planned for students of the secondary vocational school where the participants may be under 18. Because of this fact and security measures a group leader will accompany the students in the first week.    

A2 – A new activity for our school represents Mobility of staff – job shadowing. One teacher of vocational subject will perform job shadowing in German partner school and firms in Idar-Oberstein. One teacher of vocational subject will perform job shadowing in firms in London. The result of this activity will represent transfer of experience and gaining innovation stimuli for creating of new units of learning outcomes. The plan of OA Pribram for the time span 2017-2021 is to widen the set of units of learning outcomes especially in the branch of ICT, accounting and statistics as well as to create units of learning outcomes corresponding with a new study programme. In the frame of this project 3 new units of learning outcomes will come into existence.  

This project will last 15 monts and the activities one and two fully correspond with the internationalisation strategy of our school and mobility plan, mentioned in the application for VET charter.  Activity three was not available when applying for VET mobility Charter. 

A3 – Reacting to the call of the European commission for supporting of longer mobilities, we decided to realise Erasmus PRO - long term mobility of VET learners. The participants of this activity will be one graduate from the higher professional school. For this activity a wider unit of learning outcomes will be created to cover the whole period of this vocational stay. This participants has taken part in a two-week vocational training in London before and a long term mobility will enhance her professional and language development as well as her competitiveness in the labour market. 

This project fulfils the vision of our internationalisation strategy, especially improving the quality of educational outputs, sustainable development of cooperation with current partners and transfer of good practice examples thanks to job-shadowing and visits to partner organisations, development of professional competences of staff, using of European tolls, particularly ECVET, validation of mobility outputs and results of non-formal learning and last but not least transparency of education and dissemination of projects on local and international level. In the next calls we are planning to apply for a project with similar amount of mobilites.
